description:
El Techo is the perfect spot for a sunny day. My boyfriend and I came here at opening on a Friday and it wasn't crowded at all. The view was perfect and the wait wasn't long at all, it was the perfect time to pop in before our reso at Lolo at 5:30. Normally there's a bit of a crowd outside when waiting to ride the elevator; however, Friday at 4pm proved to be a good workaround for that. 

HH is from 4-6 and prices are amazing. The sangria and margaritas are to die for and they do $17 pitchers during HH. PS they're strong so be sure to Uber and keep the car at home! 

Overall, great service, delicious drinks, and amazing views. Will be back to try food next time we're in the area!
author: Alex Y.

description:
This is a really fun place, if a bit loud.

First off, let me just say that this place is for millennials. It's loud and cramped and just to frenetic for anyone over 30.

The food was amazing, though and the view was breathtaking. We couldn't even finish our dishes, which is a rarity.

I'll definitely go back here if I'm ever in SF again.
author: Chris B.

description:
El Techo was recommended by a local friend of ours in the Bay area. He actually took us here because he says it's a nice roof top restaurant/bar area and has delicious tapas while you enjoy the scenery.

Came here on a Sunday evening as the sun was still up and it is located in a building at the very top. The hostess are outside and you have the option of sitting at a table or stand up bar area. We definitely wanted a table and there was no wait! 
Entering the building, you would take the elevators up to the roof top which is where El Techo was. It was pretty crowded!

The menu as small but our server gave us some favorites and we ordered:

Guacomole and chips - delicious and simple
Empanada Butternut Squash - LOVED THESE, probably my favorite item
Chicharrones de Carne 1 pound - comes with beans, these chip things, tortillas, lime, and some vegetables/chiles. Delicious
Mango - very refreshing, it also comes with cucumbers and something else, and sprinkled with lime, habanero, and some spices
Fried Plantains - SO GOODDDDDD!
and Cookies w/ chocolate milk for desert - The cookies were alright but I thought it was cute that it came with chocolate milk :)
Sangria for drinks - I didn't have any of this but my friends finished it so I'm sure it was good!


Service was great, fun environment and food, nice views. Would come back!
author: Katelin N.

description:
Was only here for about 10 minutes, so I can't comment on the food as we didn't have any. 

However, if you want a view and a drink, it's hard to beat than El Techo by Lolinda's.  Just be careful if you're trying to go to the restaurant below, as they both have Lolinda's in the title. Also, saw a woman being carried out, as she had a little too much to drink. 

Overall, a great spot, but also be prepared to wait.  The line gets long if you want to go inside.
author: Benny H.

description:
ROOFTOP SPOT IN THE MISSION

Besides the fact it's one of the only rooftops in the Mission offering food to the public, it's become a must-see spot for locals and tourists alike. Located right on Mission, this Lolinda out-post is the fun, vibrant little sister. Very accessible by public transit, and kind of impossible by car (parking), but it's no matter because you should definitely enjoy a pitcher here!

This is a rooftop restaurant, but they've done an exceptional job sheltering the seating and providing ample heating. On the street, there's a narrow opening with a host stand. They only take OpenTable reservations  for Saturday and Sundays; Fridays it gets very busy, and if going with a large group, it is advisable to send a scout about an hour prior to put down a name and number. It's located on top of a residential building, so you may cross paths with tenants on the elevator ride up.

The food is of course, simply brilliant. Lolinda, for those who aren't familiar, is a wonderful very-established Argentine steak-house located in the Mission as well. El Techo is a more causal affair with the same standards of great flavor. My go-to is their Empanada de Maiz (corn empanada), and my favorite part is the lemon aioli that accompanies it. Unfortunately it's only on the evening menu, which I was bummed to find out when I went for brunch! A blessing in disguise though because I tried the Platano Maduro (fried ripe pantains) and they were delicious! They come with a side 'sour cream', topped with cotija (a Mexican cows-milk cheese) which truly upped the game. I've been here many times, and will definitely return to have a surely fun start to any night!
author: Navila H.

description:
Rooftop and Margs, doesn't get better than that. 
Love the view (if you can catch a sunny day) and it gets PACKED, so get there early.  Love their Elote corn and the Quesadilla de Pibil, the best $13 you will spend; braised pork shoulder, oaxaca cheese, and salsas. If you love your desserts or postres like me, try the Alfajores 
house-made cookies, dulce de leche, & hot chocolate for $8. Totally tasty and totally worth it.  Wash it all down with their delish Margaritas, my fave is the Paloma - tequila, grapefruit, agave, lime, soda.  You can buy by the glass or by the pitcher.   

They have happy hour Monday - Friday, 4-6pm. $4 cerveza, $5 bar bites, and $7 margaritas. 

It's one of my favorite spots in SF and a place I would like to try for brunch.  Also surrounded by loads of other awesome bars and restaurants.
author: Adrianna P.

description:
We had JUST beat out the w00 girls and after-work crowd coming off Caltrain yesterday.

Now we know what the buzz is all about. 

One of the few places where I'd come out to 'vibe' with a small group of friends; and I usually hate to use that word in the vernacular most would these days but... ViBES!

Vibe the fXck out here, it's awesome.

Clear 60s weather, a VERY Good guac and chip app and some good looking people with early-2000s background music spells a good time.

I can even disregard the poor choice in forearm tats and overhearing how everyone's Tinder dates fell through. I enjoyed myself.
author: Jason A.

description:
Enjoyed this spot!

Visited for happy hour, which is standing only.  There is a pretty decent view of the city, which was fun.  Great prices!  I had an empanada for five bucks which I would definitely get again.

Good spot for afterwork drinks or meeting up with friends. Lots of groups were sharing pitchers and it was just nice environment overall.
author: Lindsey P.

description:
El Techo is literally the only rooftop bar I've been able to find in San Francisco that actually sits OUTSIDE on a rooftop. You'd think these would be everywhere in SF but alas, no such luck. 

Anyways, I've been going through major summer rooftop withdrawals ever since I moved back from NYC so I was super excited to give El Techo a try. Not to mention, the menu itself looked delicious! 

I came with a group of four around 1 pm for a late brunch/lunch. It was fairly crowded upstairs so we had to wait around 15 minutes which wasn't bad at all. Once the hostess lets you inside you can either take the elevator or climb three flights of stairs to get to the roof. 

The view from above was pretty great -- you can see the Salesforce Tower and the Financial District from one side and if you dip to another corner, you can get a glimpse of Twin Peaks as well. 

The food itself and the drinks were good as well. The four of us shared a pitcher of sangria ($30) which was enough for each of us to have about 1 and a half cups. I also went with the Chorizo Scramble ($14) which was delicious and perfect for a brunch dish (with several generous douses of cholula). 

All in all, I'd definitely come back! I think we lucked out with the gorgeous cloud-free weather but who knows, it might be fun to see Karl (the infamous SF fog) roll in over the city as well.
author: Christine W.

description:
While visiting SF, my boyfriend and I met up with a friend who lives in town and decided to stop at El Techo for happy hour on my birthday. We got there pretty early on a Friday and there was already quite a long line. I wasn't super clear on if we were supposed to talk to the hostess or just get in line, but we stood in the line and it was moving pretty quickly.

When we got upstairs, I was a little bummed because the view was pretty obscured by the masses of people who were already up there. We were seated in the middle of the patio area but the tables nearest the edges were taller or people were standing so I couldn't get a good view. I was a little disappointed because the fog had finally burned off so I was hoping to be able to see the city. The roof has a party vibe with people ordering bottles of champagne, loud music and lots of laughter! GR people: Think Donkey patio at its peak.

The happy hour specials are really good - $4 cervezas, $7 margaritas, $18 sangria pitchers, and a bunch of small plates for $5 each. We ordered a couple pitchers of sangria, chips and guac, some empanadas, and elote (from the regular menu). The sangria was great; not overly sweet and had a nice flavor to it. The rest of the food was decent, but nothing out of this world. The servers were doing the best they could with the crowd and keeping up pretty well! I don't think I'd go back again, just because I think there are other rooftop bars in the city that would be a little quieter and less crowded, but it was a fun experience.
author: Katy C.

description:
True rating: 2.5
Here's the breakdown:

1. Yes, it's a rooftop, but when I went on a Sunday late evening they had a plastic tent up so you couldn't really enjoy the view. But I heard from a friend that they don't always have that up. Try going when it's not up, it really blurs the view and you won't enjoy it

2. Yes, there will be a wait, unless you go really late. I went at 9pm on a Sunday and though there were tables available, there were no tables available right next to the view. 

3. The food is okay. I got the Empanada de Maiz, Elote, and the Chicharrones de Carne. My vegetarian friend really enjoyed the Empanada de Maiz. However, my friend did get a minor stomach ache afterwords. It had to be the Empanada de Maiz since that is the only dish he had and I didn't. Elote (corn) was dry and not fresh. Would not recommend. The chicharrones were good and the half pound could probably feed 2 people but not 2 hungry people. There are not many vegetarian options, fyi

4. The drinks depends on what you get. The virgin Pina Colada was below average. For me, it was too sweet and lacked the genuine fruit taste. The margarita was pretty good though.

5. The service was below average. It took forever for us to get our server's attention. It felt even more prolonged since we were trying to get the server's attention but couldn't because he is occupied chatting with another co-worker while leaning against the table top that connects the kitchen and restaurant. 

I would only briefly mention this place to a friend because it's a rooftop. The service and food isn't really worth the hype. I didn't really get the see the view because of the plastic tent and that seems to be the reason why people like this place. (but hey I get it, it blocks the wind) I guess my advice is go when the tent is not up.
author: Shin L.

description: Roof top and mezcal, how can this be bad? It's not. It's fine. It's just that you're packed in like sardines on the roof and there's no view and it's so loud and close quarters that it feels like you're going to melt. You've already waited 20 minutes for a two top although you were the only one on the list. Your waitress ignores you. The drinks are watered down. The table is 9 square inches. The descriptions read so much better than they taste. The chiccarones are not chiccarones. They're carnitas. But they're delicious. And a big portion for $19. The guac on the other hand is a farce. Avoid it.
author: Jaki F.

description:
It's not often a place gets 5 stars from me, and it was hard not giving this place 5, but I would say service was very good, but maybe a hair below great, so I can't award the perfect score. The experience was a 4.9, I really loved this place even though it was just a quick lunch. 

Location, Flavorful food, Style, and Cocktails. This place gets high marks on all categories, they are located in a trendy area and atop the building giving diners an awesome view of San Fransisco. The overall experience is above average and not something you can easily compete with. Service was good and quick, I ordered a mango drink and my sister (who I was lucky to have as my tour guide) ordered the guacamole. 

The drink: mango, tequila and a touch of Tajin style chili and limón on the rim with a chunk of perfectly sweet mango inside, it was so yummy I knew I was having at least another one after the first sip. 
The guacamole: it was excellent, smaller looking portion but in the end it was a good amount for 2 ppl. 

I ordered chicharrones, they come with tortillas and were so yummy, with a splash of their table salsa (which btw is outstanding) and some guacamole in a warm tortilla, with the sun setting and a great convo with my sis, it was a perfect way to end the day (and start the night). I would no doubt want to go back and have a full lunch (I was saving some stomach space for ramen). 

Check this spot out!
author: Mike G.

description:
Great Mexican food and margaritas!! Love the rooftop, bar area, and the people! 

This was our second time coming in two nights because the first night we came too late and were only able to order drinks
We were in sf for a bachelorette party and two men who were drinking there serenaded the bride to be with maroon 5's sugar  it was a blast. Didn't hurt that they were very good looking, just could not sing 


The next night we went, we were able to order food! 
Food was delicious
The only bad thing was it was really hard to spot our waitress to order more once she thought we were finished eating.

We had chips and guac x 2, mushroom tostada x 2, pork cheek cracklings and pitchers and pitchers of margaritas they were all so good!!!
author: Helen K.

description: Sangria ($7ea) and Veggie Empanada (2 for $9) were good. Non traditional location as it's a roof top. Wasn't sure if I was going to like standing room only but it worked for the hour I was there.  Enjoyed my drinks and appetizer on a fabulous warm and sunny afternoon in SF. Overall the experience was enjoyable
author: Melissa S.

description:
Great views of the city, definitely come for brunch on a Saturday or Sunday when you aren't in a rush and enjoy the view while you can. 

The service is not the best but the food is good. They charge for chips and salsa & charge you again when you ask for a refill, in which you will bc there's like 8 chips per basket. The lady beside me ordered veggie scramble and it looked good so i got the same thing; it was $17 and it was maybe a cup of egg whites (+2) and veggies & THREE, yes 3 small potatoes. Like wth? For a $20 dish, I kinda expect more than a couple potatoes, 1 piece of toast and the 1/2 the portion than my bench mate got. Not sure if it was because I got egg whites or what but the lady beside me that got the same thing and had double the portion and I'm still trying to figure out why. Egg whites & veggies are the cheapest thing ever, maybe give a decent amount of protein and food if you want people returning. 

The views are good but not good enough to come back with the portion sizes, unfriendly service and overpriced small drinks.
author: Bethany M.

description:
El Techo is my go-to starting bar when I'm going out in the mission. The reasons being
1. Margarita pitchers  
2. A great view overlooking the mission 
3. Heat lamps are a girl's best friend 
4. Great vibes all around 

There's usually a wait outside but it never lasts long--they do a great job getting everybody in as fast as possible. They also serve food if you're hungry and it's divine!
author: Sydney G.

description:
We were searching for a rooftop bar to enjoy the beautiful weather. Thanks to Yelp, I found this place. Since we were going there for drinks we figured we could show right up. WRONG! At 530pm on a Sunday there's a wait, just to go have drinks. Luckily there were only to couples ahead of us. We waited maybe 10 minutes before heading up.

When we got upstairs we were asked if we came for drinks or dining. When we said drinks we were told to go to a standing section. There is no bar you can order from, just a bartender making drinks for the whole place. As we looked over the menu of drinks we decided on a Margarita del Techo (ocho plata, fidencio mezcal, napoleon mandarin, lime *added habanero infused tequila) & a Belafonte (aged rum, lime, pineapple, banana, cacao, ginger). The Margarita didn't seem to have the flavor there was habanero tequila added in it. The Belafonte was refreshing, but too sweet to drink the whole thing. We got some chips and salsa. I saw they looked like they were made fresh so I figured we're have way there to a win. Salsa tasted heavy on tomatoes, almost like out of a can w/ some lime juice. Not the best.

The food that I saw come out looked great. W/ a more beautiful days and temperature like Sunday, I'll def be back to enjoy it here.
author: Kevin Z.

description:
Nicole, the host, should maybe consider other options within the restaurant. 

We arrived on Friday around 5:30 for dinner and was greeted and told we would be called when our table was ready for 3. We enjoyed guac and drinks and noticed 3 tables has been sat before us. When we checked in with Nicole her response was "oh I couldn't find you". Unacceptable. I'm 6'1, hard to miss.

The food is a fusion mix. Not your traditional Mexican food. For San Fran I guess this is why works but as a lover of Mexican food I would pass.
author: Shaquita Y.

description:
5 stars for the view.
3 Star for the food, nothing special or anything super tasty, it was ok.
3 stars for the server. We didn't need to wait for the table on Friday around 5pm, however we finished our food and the waiter brought us the check, we paid it. But after 10 minutes we wanted to drink something else, and the waiter "invited us" to leave our table and move to standing and have our drink . He said the seated table its only for who consumes food. Seriously?! 

We decided to order something to snack as we didn't want to argue and keep our table, but I don't think that was the best way to approach us to leave. Because we felt unwanted. 

Besides that, it's a good place with a nice view.
author: Carol I.

description:
Went here for my birthday recently because I heard the view is amazing- which it didn't disappoint! Heard there is usually a wait but got here around 6:45pm on a Wednesday and waited maybe 20 minutes (not bad at all- probably because we came after happy hour).  We ordered a pitcher and a few tapas to share. The service was okay, it was hard to flag down the waiter towards the end because it was busy. 

The margarita pitcher was your classic margarita but felt a bit watered down in my opinion. As for the tapas- we got the Guacamole ($10): good guacamole, nothing special- a bit expensive, Ensalada de Jicama ($10): refreshing, but a bit plain and needed more stuff in it- also wish the Jicama was cut into more bite sized pieces, Tostada de Hongos ($11): my favorite! the mushrooms had a really really good flavor paired with a nice crunch, but definitely small, Quesadilla de Hongos ($12)- also enjoyed these, but nothing out of the ordinary, and the Vegetable Chuzos (3 skewers for $19): the biggest disappoint, the veggies were chewy and I had asked if it was spicy before ordering it and the waiter said no, but it definitely had a kick to them.

Overall, my experience was ok, I would come back to give brunch a try- mostly for the view though!
author: April L.

description:
It's a cute high top restaurant and bar but I wasn't too impressed by it. It's cute, hip, and definitely has quite the crowd but it was a little lacking. 

Service: 3/5
The service was thumbs down from me. Overall, they didn't seem very friendly, and pretty stuck up.
The hostess in the front was okay but wasn't the friendliest. We waited for a little bit then got seated, from where we were sitting, the sun was blinding my friend's eyes. So, we asked one of the waiters to see if we could change seats but he didn't even seem like he wanted to help us. I get it, he was busy but he straight up told us to check with the host at the front. Wow...ok, thanks a lot. I'm glad he wasn't our waiter. We got a waitress who was in charged of our area and she was sweet. She was willing to talk to the host to change our table arrangement but we didn't want him as our waiter so we stayed at our table. I'm giving the service a 3 because of our nice waitress, if it wasn't for her then this would be a 2.

Food: 3.5
It's tapas style so it won't be big portions. We ordered fried chicken, the half pound of chicharron, and the seafood cocktail. 

The fried chicken was good. It wasn't too special but was flavorful. 

The popular item of half pound chicharron was good but didn't really blow me away. I guess I had higher expectation because of the hype for it. 

Seafood cocktail was also good but it was just typical kind of good. 


It's an okay place, maybe I'll come back in a different environment.
author: Ngoc P.

description: Loved this rooftop bar/restaurant! The food is good, the drinks are even better, and the ambiance is AMAAAZZING! I came here on a Saturday night with a friend, and we were seated immediately. I had never been here before, so my expectations weren't set. Our waiter was super quick and attentive. I forgot the name of the drink I ordered, but it was sooo delicious! We started with guac and chips, and then I ordered a veggie quesadilla, which was decent. Overall, I would say this is an amazing and cute little spot. If you happen to be in SF, and looking for a good time, El Techo is the place to be. I am not too sure how parking is, as I took an Uber here, but I am sure there is parking available nearby. I will definitely be returning.
author: Alexus S.

description:
Always very delicious when i come. The view is pleasant, it can get really windy so bring a nice sized jacket. I recommend the chicharron. 
The wait was not as bad as it normally would have been, especially for a Saturday night. My 3rd time coming here, and I've enjoyed it every time.
author: Priscilla Y.

description:
Giving this place 4 stars for the view of San Francisco, so pretty, especially at night. Came here with a friend to grab drinks after having a wonderful meal in Oakland and there was a wait! Surprised? No, who wouldn't want to wait to have drinks on a rooftop bar in SF? But the wait was long, almost 40 minutes and when we got in, the elevator was stuffed with people and the bar upstairs was overly crowded with people, so for your own curiosity, yes, it is absolutely stuff in there and the air you're inhaling in is yucky.

Their drinks aren't so pricey, normal prices for the most part. Again, the view is stunning but only come if you have enough time to spend her because getting in takes long and the service takes even longer.
author: Sabrina N.

description:
To get into here you'll find one of the hostesses at the front, and you end up taking an elevator which takes you to the rooftop. The ambiance is quite nice but the tables are a little on the smaller side, especially the higher ones which makes it a little difficult if you need to put your jacket or purse down.

I ended up having the chicharrones and drinking a sin nombre. The food overall was just okay, and not all that amazing.

The most disappointing was the chicharrones, especially since all the other reviews had pointed out how great they were. Flavor-wise, they were on point, having the right balance of seasoning, and having an overall taste profile that would be good. I particularly liked the taste of the salsa and I thought the beans were well made.

The main problem though was that the chicharrones were really dry, some of them being quite hard on the outside, and rough on the inside. It felt like the ones I got had been sitting around for quite some time.

The sin nombre though was quite good. It tasted like a caipirinha, but with a more spicy mango taste, and it was overall quite enjoyable, albeit on the sweet side.

I'd come back for drinks and to look out the rooftop, but I doubt I'll be getting food the next time I'm here.
author: Tyler T.

description: Great rooftop bar, it just sucks that there is always a wait time. The food here is literally bite size you may share with one other person but not the whole table so order wisely. The margaritas here are fantastic along with the mascow mules.
author: Poonam M.

description:
This is a pretty neat place with a somewhat nice view. It's pretty popular so it gets really full and can be very loud at times.

The place offers a lot of tapas - my favorite were some of the empanadas as well as the skewers. The drinks are pretty good too. A nice place for a drink and some snacks but wouldn't necessarily come here for a meal.
author: Valeria S.

description:
I was meeting a friend for dinner in the Mission District on a Monday evening, and he asked if I wanted to get a drink at a bar nearby beforehand. I'm always up for pre-dinner drinks, and was even more ecstatic when he told me it was a rooftop bar. Alcohol + sick Cali views = heaven for a Chicago girl like me who's been experiencing nothing but cold and snow on and off for the last few months! 

I arrived a little early and there was a hostess sitting outside the building on the ground level, who told me I could go up and find a spot to drink while I waited for my friend to arrive. Once inside, I had to take an elevator to the roof, and when the doors opened I basically bolted at the sight of the gorgeous hills of Northern California. You can see for miles and miles from anywhere you stand at El Techo, but I chose a spot right on the outskirts of the space, which had the best view in the house. But maybe I'm biased, because it was *my* spot!

I'd also like to say that for such spectacular views, the drink prices aren't too shabby, either. I thought they'd be very expensive, but I ordered a sangria, which was only $7, and that was enough to get me very buzzed and ready for our dinner plans down the street. Our waitress was very attentive and brought us water, too, which was much needed. 

If you're looking for a place to grab drinks before dinner or stay for hours, El Techo is reasonably priced, has a vibrant atmosphere, and provides incredible views. Oh, I got a great Instagram picture, too. Cheers!
author: Anna K.

description:
Sweet rooftop bar in SF. Good food and drinks. Nice views of The City.

Visited on a Saturday around 3pm, and there was a short-ish queue along the sidewalk. We waited a good while, maybe about 20-25 mins before we were let through to the elevator. It's probably best to come here with a smaller party, maybe 3-4 people, so that they can accommodate you faster.

If you can stand that wait, the actual rooftop is pretty dope. Space is kind of tight: you can tell they're trying to maximize the amount people they can shove into the spot. But it has good vibes, with nice decor and fun atmosphere. There's a variety of seating, including tables with large tents providing shade, high chairs and tables, as well as standing room with high, slim communal tables and umbrellas all along the outer edges of the roof. Cool. Definitely opt to stand at the outer edges to soak in them glorious San Francisco views.

Service was attentive and friendly. We ordered a pitcher of margaritas, a perfect start for our party of three (enough for roughly 2 full glasses each), and subsequently ordered a pitcher of their La Paloma. Both were delicious and refreshing on the sunny summer day. We had to wait to order food: they didn't start food service until 4pm. All cool. We were able to order some chips, salsa, and guac to hold us over in the meantime. Chilled out with our drinks and chips for a little, then promptly ordered 2 of the Empanadas de Carne and 2 of the Empanadas de Zapallo. To our surprise, an order of empanadas came with 2 pieces, so we had 8 total, and they were a pretty good size. A little bit more than what we had in mind, but we gobbled them up nonetheless. I was expecting the meat empanada to be the winner, but the veg option was actually a little more tasty. Both came with their own unique dipping sauce for that extra yum. It can get quite pricey here, but that's to be expected.

Glad I finally got a chance to visit this popular rooftop bar. Stop by and experience it for yourself if you have the chance!
author: Roderick T.

description: One of the only rooftops in SF. Came here during happy hour - I got the margarita and tres amigos, which was a shot, sangrita and a beer combo. The place has a decent view of the city and some really great drinks and bar food specials. My friend got the fried chicken, which was pretty tasty!
author: Jen L.

description: Came here for Brunch and it was amazing. We took an elevator to the rooftop where we had breathtaking views of the city, which made the experience even more enjoyable. The food and drinks were delicious. I had their delicious huarache dish, which consists of spinach and oaxaca cheese stuffed tortilla, tomato braised beef brisket, fried eggs, pickled onion. My drink of the day was La Paloma, which has tequila, grapefruit, lime agave, soda. Will definitely be back again. I high recommend reservations though.
author: Andy H.

description:
El techo is a great place for brunch, dinner or if you just want to grab a drink post work. Plan ahead if you want to be here on a Friday or Saturday night as there's no way to avoid the long lines. The drinks and view make it worth the wait though. You go up this semi sketchy elevator to the top where you are greeted with an amazing view of the city. The outdoor heaters provide the much needed warmth on a chilly evening.

Drinks are well balanced, not too sweet and just the way I like them. I like their Hummingbird though the glass was only half full the last time I got one which was slightly disappointing. My other favorites are the belafonte and margarita.
 
I've been to both brunch and dinner and I think the dinner was much better. There is a wider selection of food and drinks that I missed. The menu is also seasonal, so make sure you check the menu before you assume your favorite appetizer is still on the menu. 

I love the fried plaintain appetizer but they no longer have that on the menu. Guacamole is good choice too, you can't go wrong with chips, guac and a drink in my opinion.
author: Preeti R.

description:
The views are what makes this place.

The food is good, chicharones are FIRE . I'd go back for that over and over.

The other food on the menu is good, not great. But satisfies the tapas experience with a great view.

The PALOMA is very good as are the other drinks on the menu. The sangria is nice and so is the hummingbird for something on the lighter side.

For the beer person, REGIA, 32oz will satisfy your tastebuds and need for water during the course of an entire meal.

Get here early so you can get a spot with a view or a table for diner.

This place gets busy!
author: Steve L.

description:
I have to admit, I am not a fan of Americanized Mexican food. I am just not (similar to my dislike of Americanized Asian food.) Why am I paying more for a less tasty taco?! The first time I went to El Techo I really disliked the place (years ago.) Everything was expensive and the food was mediocre (can I just have some farolito please.) I felt like everyone just overpaid so that they could be on a roof top with drinks (look at me!) ok sure the view was beautiful but pass!!! 

I went again recently and I had a much better experience. I don't know if it is because I am getting more hoity toity or if the food significantly improved. All of the dishes I had recently (and it was a lot from guac to empanadas to who knows what) were super good. It was also nice to be on a roof top. LOL. Ok maybe I am turning into one of those people. I still don't know if I would recommend El Techno (especially because I am getting too old for lines.) However, I think it is worth checking out probably.
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
The San Franciscan night air might be chilly, but an evening spent under the rooftop tent at El Techo will warm you right up. Overwhelmed by dinner choices, I followed the lead of my recently transplanted pals to the top of the Mission...vertically, anyway. 

You couldn't ask for a nicer setting overlooking the city, and the expansive view helps temper the claustrophobic setting. We had a fairly large group but were lucky enough to get seated at a long table without too too long of a wait. 

We decided to keep it simple and just order a bunch of shareables - pitchers of margaritas, guacamole and tostadas, and a big order of the pork chicharrones de carne that come with tortillas, escabeche, salsa, and black beans. Every single thing we tried was delicious. I tend to be a picky, unadventurous eater, but I truly enjoyed every bite. 

Due to how packed El Techo was, it did take some time between dishes and we ended up spending a couple of hours there. Service was mostly, though, and splitting our check ten or so ways was no problem. It was a bit pricy, but I think I came out somewhere around 40 bucks all said. 

There are a ton of options in SF to explore, but I wouldn't be upset by coming back for another round with El Techo.
author: Stacey L.

description:
First time in Mission, and this spot has a SPECTACULAR view of the city.  It's a rooftop restaurant and bar!

We went on a Friday night, and there was definitely a line.  The wait is contingent on the number of people/ groups in front of you.

The bar is primarily a standing bar on the periphery of the restaurant!  Didn't try the food, but a whiff of other parties' food was enough to tell me that the food is invaluable to this experience.
author: An Thien T.

description:
Stopped in for happy hour on a Friday. This place definitely gets super packed if you come later. We were seated almost immediately around 4:30 PM but minutes later, it was almost a full house, standing patrons and all! 

Definitely opt to stand if you want to make use of the rooftop view. We chose to sit and you'll be comfortable, but surrounded by other seated customers. Their tables are high-tops and there's a long bar table that lines along the rooftop for you to rest your drinks. 

We ordered the margarita off the happy hour menu and a piña colada ($10) off the regular drink menu. My piña colada was creamy, sweet and easy to drink. The margarita was stronger; still decent. 

We ordered chips and salsa ($5) and elote ($8) to go with our drinks. Both were flavorful and great, however, small portions. 

This is a great casual place for drinks if you're in the area! I can see what all the hype is about. It definitely gets crowded so come early if you can. It's not a place for people who don't like loud and crowded environments. 

Wish the portions for their snacks were bigger. It's a little pricey if you come here, which is my only complaint, similar to other reviews.
author: Kimberly G.

description:
I came here on a Friday night and there was a line (which is typical here). Luckily, my friends had arrived earlier and was able to tell the hostess to let me in early since I was a party of one. The space is pretty cool being outdoors since there aren't many rooftop bars in SF. With that said, there isn't really much of a view since it's not that high up either.

The place is busy as I made my way over to my friends at the counters. I tried some of the mixed drink that my friends had ordered a pitcher of. It was a-okay and rather on the sweet side. Cool vibe, but drinks and food are okay.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Awesome brunch spot! We had a party of five after a big birthday night and no reservations--but after a bit of a wait, we still managed to score a table right on the edge with an incredible view. 

The food and cocktails turned out to be well worth the wait! I had eggs and a spicy mango jicama salad--a tasty and refreshing pair. My friends had the chorizo, plantains, empanada and eggs Benedict, and everyone loved their food. The cocktails were perfect. No really. I used to grow my own mint to make mojitos and I can be a total snot about them, lol, but theirs were on point. 

Space is nice looking too. Lots of wood. And sky. :) Quintessentially SF.
author: Alex W.

description: Visiting San Fran and stayed in Mission. The air BnB host recommended this rooftop bar for dinner. The wait was about 30 min for a table on a Friday. There's a line based on capacity for standing room at the bar. The rooftop was packed and the view was great! They have heat lamps for the bar area. The tables are tiny but that's because the food was tiny. I think they have a happy hour so it's probably best to go them otherwise you're going to spend a pretty penny to feel full. The empanadas and elite was spot on! Come here for apps but don't expect a heavy dinner. Fun place to bring friends.
author: Anoosha A.

description:
Came in on a beautifully sunny Monday around 6, and while I didn't have to wait long for the elevator, the place was pretty much packed. Upon arrival, you will notice amazing views of the city's skyscrapers. The rooftop is well-organized and decorated nicely.

We started with a pitcher of sangria (they only have red). It was deliciously refreshing but, I figured after 2-3 glasses I would have had more of a buzz.

As for the food, we shared a few small plates- the guacamole, plantains, and vegetarian empanadas. All were excellent. A little overpriced, but high quality. I would recommend getting snacks here but not a full dinner.

Overall, a great rooftop option if you are able to grab a seat. Would recommend!
author: Roya B.

description:
I took my mom here for brunch on her birthday. This was my first time here, so I didn't realize how "hipster" this place is. This is more of a hanging-out-friends than take-your-parents-from-out-of-town to eat type of place. That was my own fault because I didn't research enough. I was just excited to try it after reading they were named one of the best brunch restaurants in the US. 

I really don't like the tables or seats here. The tables were tiny and barely had enough room for two plates and drinks. The stools were incredibly uncomfortable. It's not like the food is cheap, so I expect my seat to be at least comfortable. Is it too much to ask for some back support? And there's nowhere to place your coat. I saw some people sitting on their coats, but I noticed their sleeves were touching the floor. No thank you! I had to eat with my coat on.
 
I don't understand how this is one of the best brunch places in the country. From my one experience, the plates are a hit or miss. My mom got the huevos rancheros and they were super disappointing. If the food looks like something I can make (and I'm not a good cook), then it's not worth the money. It was basically black beans with a tostada, scrambled eggs, and a slice of avocado on top. Really?! I know they put their own spin to Mexican classics, but this didn't look like it was inspired by huevos rancheros at all. It was a boring and lazy dish. On the other hand, my huarache was fantastic. The meat was moist and tender, and I love how they mixed spinach and cheese into the tortilla. I'm confused on how one plate was super amateur and the other was amazing. 

I'm a big fan of the drinks menu and will probably come back with friends to drink. The bloody maria was a great twist to the bloody mary. No complaints in that department! You also can't beat the view from the top. Service was mediocre, though. The server could've been more attentive and maybe take off the sunglasses when helping customers? It made the service seem very impersonal.
author: Karen R.

description: The wait here was pretty long on a Sunday night but they let you go to the bar area to enjoy the views, snack on apps, and get drinks. It is very crowded though but the view is great! They also text you when your table is ready so you can go elsewhere. The tables here are extremely small and half of it is already filled by utensils, napkins, and the water jug. Our table was a high boy so I was really nervous about the glass shattering. We were only able to fit 2 of the 3 things ordered on the table. The sangria is good - just like all the reviews below me say! The carne empanadas were tasty but I didn't like the raisins in it. Their skewers are tasty and seasoned well. My favorite was the shrimp. They have a bit of heat to them! It was a bit pricey for the portion I feel.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
This is a review for the rooftop bar and the cocktails! My friend and I came here for drinks on a Friday night, and there was a fairly long line to get into the bar. Fortunately, since we were such a small party, we were admitted within 20minutes. The bar is located on the top floor of a office building-like structure. The rooftop of the restaurant is very casual with stringed lights and portable heaters. 

I ordered the paloma, a grapefruit flavored margarita, and my friend ordered a mango based cocktail. We both enjoyed the drinks, and liked how they weren't too strong, yet still sweet and delicious. I have not tried the food, but hope to do so during a future visit. I would definitely recommend this place for a girls night out!
author: Sandra S.

description:
After a visit to Lolinda, we learned that el techo was the spot to hang out so we came in last Monday. We had an amazing table, right next to the view, as the sun was setting, and Arturo was attentive and knowledgeable. He recommended us to try some mezcal and even told us how to properly taste it. 

The chicharrones were really tender and the choripan of my husband was outstanding, we combined them with the platanos maduros and had alfajores for dessert. 

When we came out we saw a line and I can totally understand why. I'll recommend this restaurant to all of my friends for their vacations in San Francisco.
author: Gina G.

description:
Great view, great drinks, and friendly service!

I was in the area and decided to stop by El Techo since the sky looked really nice that evening.  Had to wait in the line, but it didn't take too long.  And the view was worth it.

You're not that high up, but high enough above the streets for a great rooftop view.  The downtown skyline looked amazing reflecting the warm tones of the sunset.

As I was going up the elevator, one of the staff transporting a keg upstairs also joined me and wished me a good first time here.  When I got upstairs, I was a little confused on where to go, but one of the servers greeted me with a smile, handed me a menu, and told me where I could stand around.  Instead of having to walk over to the bar, a server came over and asked what she could get started for me.  I thought these gestures were nice.

I ordered the La Paloma ($10), which came with pueblo viejo tequila, grapefruit, agave, lime, and soda.  It was really good!!  Good portion and delicious taste.  I would definitely get this one again.  They also offer it in a pitcher size for $36.

And, they have heat lamps!!  Key to a rooftop bar in SF for those chilly nights!  I can't wait to bring my friends here and to try the food!
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
Came here on a weekend afternoon with my boyfriend wanting to get a bite to eat. He had never been to this place before, so I figured it would be a nice spot to relax and enjoy the view since it was a really nice day out. I had been here once before with girlfriends to grab drinks and wanted to check out their lunch menu. 

We got sat down almost immediately, which was nice as this place can get pretty busy. We ordered some sangria and some small plates, but were still hungry afterwards. We didn't want to order more food as it is highly overpriced and the amount you get is very disappointing. The best thing we had was the chips and guac. The sangria had a lot of cinnamon in it, which I wasn't a fan of. 

All-in-all this place is only somewhere to go if you have friends visiting from out of town, who want to grab a drink and have a cool view of the city. Otherwise don't waste your time. We would've had a better lunch if we went to a hole in the wall taqueria down the street.
author: Lauren P.

description:
We came here for brunch last Saturday and had a wonderful experience.  Good thing I made reservations as there was a waiting list upon our arrival for those without reservations.  Great food, margaritas, and views from their rooftop restaurant.  Ambiance is casual, and the views of SF as we dined outdoors was such a treat!  We were a party of 3 and ordered the benedictos, carnitas, veggie scramble, platanos, and a pitcher of margaritas.  All the dishes were great (margs, too!), but the carnitas were one of the best I've tried thus far (and I have eaten at a lot of Mexican restaurants ) -- crispy on the outer layer and super moist and tasty on the inside.  If you're in the Mission area, pop in on a sunny Saturday or Sunday afternoon in SF for an awesome brunch, margs, and views.  

(TIPS:  The restaurant is conveniently located near the 24th Street Bart station.  For weekend brunches, make prior reservations or put your name on their waiting list upon your arrival.  Check in with the hostess at their street level podium, then proceed to the elevator at the back after she informs you your table is ready).
author: Aileen C.

description: Great rooftop Mexican restaurant! I've never seen a place like this before. I enjoyed the ambience. It was packed! This must be where the party is on Sunday nights! The menu had a wide variety of meat dishes and the Chicharrones and chorizo on a skewer were to die for! They serve food until 10. We were seated and greeted quickly. I would come back here
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Never again! Rooftop is cool but I'm from LA and the rooftops don't compare. I'll start off by saying this place isn't authentic at all. Highly overpriced and images on yelp are not what you get in person. I was really excited to come here but disappointed about wasting my time dinning here. The service needs to be improved, you should be aware of the busy nights and stay on top of the service. Thank god I had reservations or I would of been even more upset for waiting. Ordered the chips and guacamole , best thing to order on the menu. Zucchini empanadas were also really good! The ceviche or seas food cup is a rip off, do not order this. It's not part of happy hour. Ordered the tostadas that should of came with black beans but I'm not too sure what the "spread" was, it was more like a salsa! Very yuck! Wouldn't return here, if you want good food, avoid this place. The view is nice.

**
Update: we asked the server why the cup was not like the bowl showed on yelp, he said they changed the sizing? I mean for presentation, it was ugly. Also, I didn't like the PURÉE, I think that's what you meant LOL. Appreciate the response.
author: Devin M.

description:
I really really wanted to give this place 5 stars, but four things stood out to tarnish all that is truly amazing about El Techo. First, the good... 

The rooftop area was amazing. The service was as good as it can be, considering how packed it gets. The drinks are delicious, but weak. We had chicharrones that was perfectly cooked. The tortillas are handmade and has great flavor. I loved the salsa as well. 

Now the bad... 

The guacamole was good, but was lacking jalepeno and was $10 for a very small portion. So horribly priced. The server should have warned us.  There was almost no salt on the chips. There was a pork rind served on the chicharrónes but it was flavorless. I expected much more since everything else was full of flavor. I was very disappointed to be given Cholula when I asked for hot sauce. Everything else was house made, so I expected the same out of the hot sauce.
author: Will S.

description:
Hot DAMN these beignets are good. I ordered the cornbread, which was pretty tasty - but I really didn't enjoy the chilli jam. 
But then the beignets. The Dulce de Leche. I could have drunk it from a tap. I'm just sad it's over.
author: Poppy C.

description: Great food, great service, great views. We planned a friend's bach party in the city and this was the place we chose for dinner. El Techo doesn't take any reservations, so we were a little skeptical whether we'd get in since there was a pretty long line. We spoke with the lovely hosts and pulled the, "it's our friend's bachelorette party!" card and they took us right up and hooked it up with a sweet table. Jack, our server was wonderfully attentive and had a quick wit while dealing with a bunch of giggly tipsy girls. All in all, super solid experience. Will def be back w more friends.
author: Addi A.

description:
If you want the easiest way to get into El Techo....reserve a seat for brunch. Dinner may be cool as well as happy hour on the week days, but just like you I wouldn't want to wait 2 hours or so to get seated. If you were to reserve a table online for brunch, you'll arrive 15 minutes before and be quickly seated. 

-my visit here was pretty splendid, the process of getting in was seamless and getting seated was easy, although if you want a preference of where to sit just tell the hostess/host as you check in. 

-there was a beautiful view overlooking the mission district and gawd it was nice. Unfortunately our seats were somewhat away from the view but it was no better biggie. Like I said if you want to sit closer to the view, let the hostess/host know. 

Service: 
-at first it was great, we got everything we needed, food order, water jug, alcohol, napkins, basically the whole shabang...unfortunately once our food order went thru, our server forgot about us entirely. We had to call our server down multiple times to get their attention. 

Eats: 
Ceviche 9/10
-amazing. The lime didn't take too much away, complemented shrimp well 
-generous serving of plump shrimp 
-shmaaaackin 

Carnitas 8/10 
-somewhat sweet, maybe brown sugar or so. 
-great fat to meat ratio. 
-I did not enjoy tortillas that came with it, super dense and I personally did not like the texture of it. 

El Techo is beautiful and has a menu that has something for everyone. Whether you have a first date or a 3 year anniversary or just a casual hang out this place is excellent to take a party of 2 or a party of 20 here.
author: James L.

description:
Came here this evening for a nice time out with a friend and definitely enjoyed the view the place had to offer. Since we wanted to be seated we decided to go full dinner as bar area was only standing. Once we were seated we ordered the following:

* mango- this was basically a bowl of fruits with tajin and my friend really enjoyed it as it was quite refreshing 

* carne con chicharrones - really good this was kind of like make your own taco kinda deal. This came with tortillas, beans, salsa, meat and pickled veggies. I definitely enjoyed the meat a lot here as well.

For drinks we ordered the following:

* Paloma - this was really good and my friend really enjoyed it a lot

* margarita (with a kick) - I really enjoy drinks with a kick with some jalapeño or habanero in it and so I had ordered a margarita with a little bit of that kick. The first time I ordered it it came out way to spicy than I've tasted before but the server was kind enough to bring out another one which was perfect. 

Overall, really enjoyed this experience and definitely would come back for the views!
author: Prasiddha H.

description: Amazing view, real good place to enjoy some drinks on a rooftop in SF. I had some apps: elotes (suuuper yummy with lime and feta but really tiny) and a sausage (GET THIS). The drinks were pretty good. It was suuuper crowded but it's a nice vibe where everyone is there just to enjoy themselves. The service is just ok, it was hard to flag down someone because they were so busy, but overall I would definitely recommend! Just be ready to wait a bit!
author: Jessica Z.

description:
Lovely rooftop bar right up the street from lots of other fun places. We came here on a Saturday around 4:30 and were able to find a spot in the standing room only section immediately. Super friendly servers, and delicious margaritas!

The view of the city is really great of course, and the food looked good (even though we didn't have anything). Will definitely be back!
author: Erin D.

description: Waited 30 minutes outside until finally taking an elevator up to El Techo. There are not many rooftop bars in SF, but the view here shows why there aren't many. You can get a glimpse of a few buildings, but nothing too spectacular. The moment we sat down, the server asked if we wanted chips and guac as if they were complimentary. To our surprise, it wasn't when we got our check. The drinks were sweet and seemed like I was drinking a lemonade hot dog on a stick from when we ordered the La Paloma. It was loud and could barely here my friends sitting across the table from me which is understandable on a Saturday night. We had high expectations for a rooftop bar in SF, but certainly was disappointed. It was good to experience once if you are in the Mission, but the lackluster drinks and mediocre view makes it hard for us to come back.
author: Ronald M.

description:
Came late on a Wednesday night and had a little wait. We waiting for about 10 minutes and then proceeded to the elevator. We were greeted by the host and informed her we were here for the cocktail area which is first come first served and standing only. 

It was a chilly night but the heaters were on which were just what we needed. The view was amazing and although we only got sangria which in my opinion was a bit tart for my liking it was a good end cap to our night. $30 for a pitcher for sangria filled about 5 glasses. Overall the view and atmosphere was great and I'd come back!
author: Chantal Noelle T.

description:
Yelp 100 Challenge 2018
51/100

If you're looking for a good view of the city and to enjoy some drinks -- this is the place for you!

Cons: overpriced, but it's a rooftop bar so you get a good view of the city and the food's not half bad. It can get chilly, but then again, it's sf. Pretty loud.

Pros: good view of the city. Food was pretty good! The chicharonnes de carne and the quesedilla de pibil were both packed with flavor! The meats were rlly soft. They just melt in your mouth~
author: Stacy A.

description:
We have an El Techo in DC which is good so I expected that this location is great as well. It's just so-so. We waited for a table on the rooftop and went to the bar next door to grab drinks while waiting. We got a text that our table was ready so we head back and got seated upstairs. We ordered a pitcher pf margarita for the 3 of us which later spilled because the waiter had put the pitcher on the edge of the table and people kept walking by our table and boom - it fell and glass and liquid were everywhere and it was a mess. 

Our server was nowhere near being attentive to us because the person that helped us was another server...our own server barely came back to take our orders or to make sure if we needed something else. We got guacamole which was good and chips and the chicharron. We later explained to the server that someone had spilled our margarita that we barely drank and we ordered another one. 

Check comes and we were charged for the 2 pitchers of margarita. The server told us his manager wouldn't let him take off the margarita so he took off the guac which was under $10...the margaritas was like $36.....really bad service here and don't think we'll come back here. Spencer (the server we had) need to check up on his tables and make sure they're doing alright.
author: Aggie S.

description: Stick around after brunch to try all the drinks! Right now I'm having a chilcano while playing lotteria.
author: Thomas Y.

description:
My girlfriend and I had been wanting to come here for while, so we finally made it on a Monday night. Wait was only 15-20 minutes. We were seated at a 2-top, which was "cozy" but it did the job. 

The views at this place are AMAZING, the ambiance is was nice, hipster/trendy crowd, filled with people itching to post to their insta-stories and snapchats (if that's still a a thing).

Drinks: only ordered the Belafonte, very very good.

Let's talk about the food. We ordered many items, the Chicharrones, ChorizoPan, Elote, and  Braised Pork quesadilla, and Flan. I was most excited about the chicharrones, good mixture of meat and fat but was very underwhelmed. Presentation didn't match flavor. Even with the toppings, it was very dry tasting and left my mouth dying for water. The tortillas were good though. Elote, was a bit too charred, and the quesadilla was OK. 

ChorizoPan = great bread, chimichurri was good, I just wish they cooked the chorizo a tad bit more, it was a bit soft for my liking. Was hoping for more a snap when I bite down. 

Flan = probably the best Flan I've had in awhile. Light, airy, flavorful. Would def recommend.

The service was cool, our server went on lunch but never told us, but the lady that stepped in was very sweet. She had to put in an order that the server forgot, but the food comes fast, so not a big deal.

Overall: The food fell short of my expectations but I'd come back here for drinks and the view.
author: Paolo B.

description:
Had a 24 hour layover in SF and my friend suggested we venture to El Techo. We ended up with a few pitchers throughout the evening and it was all tasty! I don't know how much it ended up being but I'd imagine it to be a bit pricey given the venue... but well worth the experience!

The outdoor area is amazing - some of it is standing, some parts have seating. Overall, I liked the vibes and would come back the next time I'm in SF!
author: Amy C.

description:
Talk about a meal with a view! If you're all about the rooftop scene or just seeing an awesome view of the city this is the place to go. El Techo is well known for both their happy hour and brunch so be sure to come early especially with a larger group! If you're doing brunch on a weekend they do take reservations 1 week in advance. 

FOOD: 

+ Bunuelos - The chocolate sauce is delicious but the beignets are so so. Nice option to start or end your meal but not something I think you NEED to get. 

+ Benedictos -  So much yes! The chorizo is the perfect addition to this classic meal option. I enjoyed that they used a biscuit in replace of the english muffin since it added more flavor and made the meal even more hearty. I only wish the potatoes were a bit crispier. 

PROS: 

+ Beautiful view of the city 
+ Heat lamps on the rooftop so you are warm even on cold days 
+ Dishes at various price ranges 
+ Decent assortment of cocktails + drinks for brunch 
+ Location in the mission & easy to get to other establishments/Valencia 

CONS: 

+ Gets packed/gets loud 
+ They don't give you an estimated time to be seated when you sign-in
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Came here after dinner around 10:15 pm and there was a "short" line outside for the bar. Put our name down for a table instead and got in about 15 mins later. It's decently crowded and the view was great but the experience lacked in general. 

We got seated at a small table (enough for two) with metal square seats with no backing. Comfy.  There's no place to put a purse since the seat had no backing so the only option (other than putting in on the ground where people have stepped and drinks/food have spilled) is holding it in ur lap.

We had one drink each and decided to leave. A pina colada and a bella fonte. The drinks were delicious so would likely come back, maybe with a group as for just two people, I didn't care to be there.
author: Archana R.

description:
Packed, and service is...eh.

I loved the drinks because I'm a sucker for tropical flavors. My friends ordered all across the cocktail menu and we all enjoyed each others as well.

Our server failed to get us our drinks and water in a timely manner. We had to remind him after around 10 minutes of waiting. Then he immediately brought them over, which makes me believed he forgot about them until the reminder?

Otherwise, it's a popular spot! The wait in line is unpredictable, so prepared to adjust your night's plans if the line looks egregious.
author: Janelle W.

description:
One of my favorite places in the city! El Techo has great food and even better cocktails. I've been here quite a few times and have never been disappointed. As far as food goes, I would recommend the pork by the pound. It is slow cooked meat that is then flash fried to add some crunch to it. 

The ambiance is also great! It is in the middle of the mission, but because it is a rooftop bar, you don't feel the loudness and business of the city. It is far enough from downtown that you can get a great view of the skyline.
author: Nepheli A.

description: Super late on my review . If you're in the sf area this a must go too. You get such a pretty View of sf. The food is amazing . Make sure to make reservations because it gets super packed
author: Stefanny B.

description:
El Techo is the shiiit (good way). Super lively rooftop restaurant in SF! My friend took me here when I went to visit her. We went on a Saturday night around 7. Luckily we only waited 20 mins before we got seated. The atmosphere is very lively and it was very busy!

The food here is AMAZING. We started off with the chips and guacamole. Delicious. Got the empanadas which were ok in my opinion. Prob would skip those. Got the quesadilla..I forgot what it was called and what was in it, but it was good! And lastly got 3 skewers: shrimp, carne and chicken. They were delicious, juicy and perfect!

Service was ok which is why I took one star off! Our server kept passing by us and we had to keep calling him over. I'd still come back next time I'm in the city though!
author: Mary X.

description:
The El Techo rooftop is nice for San Francisco. Name alone makes me smirk. The scene is well...not much to be seen. It's modest and the people seem to be even more modest. It was a weeknight, I'd be interested if it picks up pace on a weekend or at sunset. 

We came by for drinks, non-alcoholic for me. 

I had a Boylan diet cola aka: liquid carcinogens. It was unique and refreshing with hints of black licorice. No aftertaste. I have no interest in having another one, but it was a fun soft drink option.
author: Spartevan V.

description:
I first saw about El Techo from a Chase Sapphire ad on Instagram for best places in SF. Since we were going to a show in SF on Sunday, night as well stop by and try it out! Arriving at 6pm on a Sunday and find out there practically no wait is amazing. Getting off the Bart, we saw a line in the front and thought we would be waiting maybe 30 minutes but once we put our name down they stated we were first in line and the wait would be about 10 minutes. We were kinda confused but I think the people who were waiting in line were trying to get in the drinks only area and we were there for dining. 

Taking the elevator to the roof top you meet another hostess. We got seated after the first party got seated and luckily we go the view right by the glass barriers. We had a fantastic view of SF with the Bay bridge, Salesforce tower, and the rest of downtown. We even got to see the city scape change from sunset to dusk. 

We ordered the ensalada de jicama, quesadilla, half pound of chicharon, and a couple of skewers (shrimp, chicken, and carne). All were really delicious. The salad had lots of thick chunks of jicama, like the size you purchase to-go in cups at the market. Wish they diced it instead. I liked the quesadilla the best and wanted to order more but we had more food coming out. I also ordered a Techo margarita and is made with Mezcal. It tasted really smoky and I would probably not order it again. 

This is a great place to grab drinks and delicious food with a great SF view.
author: Avita S.

description:
Wow, what a find at Mission and 21st!  This restaurant was recommended to me by a long time resident of San Francisco.  He warned us to arrive before 6pm if we wanted to get a table.
He also explained that the entrance is via a freight elevator in a building next-door to the sister Argentinian restaurant.  

We located the entrance, having arrived at 5:30, by asking directions from the restaurant.  There were a few people waiting in line for the elevator, including residents of that building.  When the elevator opens up on the rooftop the view of San Francisco will take your breath away.  It gets better as the sun sets and you get to see the vista of the city and the lighted Bay Bridge.

Check in with the host for a table, we were luck to get one of the last two four tops available by just a few minutes.  One elevator later and we would have been out of luck and would have to wait.

The servers were great and explained the menu and the various styles of margaritas that were available.  You can order by the glass or, even better, by the pitcher.  We got guacamole and chips to start and then ordered 1 1/2 lb of Chicharrones for three people.  It was more than enough.

We needed a few more tortillas and a refill of guacamole to finish the beautiful plate of succulent pork, black refried beans and grilled veggies.  After two pitchers, full stomachs, and the wonderful night views, we were ready to leave.  Down the elevator and out to the street and we were greeted by a long line of patrons waiting around the block to get in.  My friend was right!

We felt so lucky to have been able to experience this venue on such a gorgeous day and night.  
I highly recommend the Chicharrones!  Service is fast, but not rushed...noise level is high...think rooftop party and the best views for a very reasonably priced restaurant.  Parking is tight...consider ride share.
author: David T.

description: The atmosphere is great. Went on a Saturday night. Services was less then desirable. Took over 20 minutes for drinks and for check at the end. I think they could use more staff. Staff is very friendly.
author: Erin G.

description:
The service was disappointing.     We were sat at a table that wobbled so much that our drinks(that took 30 min to get) spilled.    We were sitting on stools    That the jeans  got caught on.    
The elevator ride to to the roof was sardine style.   

We had to go to the hostess  to have her get our server so we could close out.     I only had chips and guacamole.  One drink.    When I asked the server for some back story on the restaurant he didn't know what to say. He just said the food is a combination of all Latin American countries.    It was a total mess.   It's over priced.    Don't do it
author: Ivette A.

description:
I arrived on a Saturday night and there was a bunch of people waiting in a line stanchion out front for the standing room area on the roof. There was also a long list of people waiting to be seated- we were told it would take at least an hour or more. This was slightly deterring, but we put our name on the list anyway and went next door to have a drink and order an appetizer. Surprisingly, within thirty minutes we received a text that our table was ready and we were quickly whisked up the elevator to a cute high top on the beautiful city rooftop.   

Though this popular spot had a long list wait list, I never felt rushed by the staff. We certainly took our time at the table enjoying our food and drinks and the service was excellent and attentive. As the sun went down it did get fairly cold, but the heat lamps did an excellent job keeping us comfortable. I had a great pina colada and I really loved the spinach tortilla quesadilla and tacos we ordered. 

You can't beat the view and the food and cocktails were fantastic. Definitely worth the wait!
author: McKenna P.

description:
I just had to review this place. So for starters it took about 40 minutes to get a table at 5 pm on a Sunday. Honestly, it was more than worth the wait.

We split the half pound of chicharrones which came with strips of pork skin, carnitas, black beans, salads, and tortillas. All of t was amazing. Super flavorful and delicious fall apart meat.

I also got the pibil (pork) quesadilla and my friend got the ground beef empanadas. The quesadilla was also amazing with tender pork, an amazing salsa, and a gooey/salty cheese. The empanadas reminded me of homemade tacos growing up with a flaky/crunchy empanada shell. All of it was some of the best Mexican food I've ever had.

Finally, the vibe was awesome. It was hopping even at 5 on a Sunday. They played great music, not quite a club vibe, but a good 80's-90's upbeat but not all pop play list, mostly good r&b stuff. The most important impressive though, was the view. El techo or "the roof" looked out over the city and it was a spectacular view where you see one of half of the city. I'd love to go back and will try every chance I get. Even if there's an hour long wait. I'd love to see the view at night.
author: Geraldo A.

description:
oh b a b y.

If I died and woke up in heaven, I'd be sipping a happy hour glass of sangria overlooking SF at 5pm on El Techo's rooftop. 

I'd recommend getting here at 4pm when happy hour starts, if possible, since the place fills up quickly afterwards. The entrance can be hard to miss, but there's a host table underneath the sign. They'll direct you towards an elevator which you'll take all the way up to the roof. There's table seating in the middle of the roof, and counter seating along the edges so you can look at the skyline. 

I recommend getting a pitcher of sangria ($18 HH) to start and ordering chips and guac ($5 HH). The empanadas de carne ($5 HH) and pollo frito ($5 HH) are also good moves to make. Empanadas are a bit over-fried, but pollo frito is cooked perfectly! Besides the regular cocktails, they have a large number of beers and spirits available.
author: Megha T.

description: Sit on the roof. Let the alcohol hit the roof, of your mouth. Get the margaritas for a classic night on the rooftop vibe. Has beautiful city views. This is a popular place for food with friends. The guacamole has the perfect lime balance. The margaritas and the view will leave you feeling fan-techo-stic (it's like fantastic, get it? )
author: Laura Beth F.

description:
This review is strictly based on the bar and location. We did not have the pleasure of trying any of their food besides the chips and salsa, which were quite tasteful. Moving on, this location is absolutely spectacular! The restaurant is on the 4th floor where you can see 360 degree views of the entire city! I would recommend to come on a hot sunny day in order to make the most out of the rooftop and views. 

The restaurant is divided into a seated dinning and standing bar area. The service for the bar was quite quick. For drinks we ordered 2 piña coladas, an el techno margarita, and wine. I have been craving  a creamy blended piña colada for so many months and the one at el techno finally fulfilled my craving! The margarita and wine were also a hit with my friends. If you are looking for a place with good drinks and amazing views, check out el techno and you won't be disappointed.
author: Karan L.

description:
Came here for happy hour on a Tuesday evening and loved it. It's a cute rooftop patio with nice views of the city. If you are just having drinks, it's standing room only along the bar. We ordered a few appetizers so they let us sit at one of the tables. Shockingly a pretty good happy hour menu, which runs until 6. Margaritas are $7 (normally $10) and the guacamole among mother appetizers is $5 (normally $10). Margaritas were strong and guac was tasty. We also had really good service. Our waiter came by right before 6 to check in and see if we wanted another drink before happy hour was over. There was no line so we were able to get in right away,  but every other time I have walked by this place there is a line. If you are planning on eating brunch/dinner here I would definitely make a reservation. 

Good spot for a sunny SF day. It can get chilly up there but they do a pretty good job of blocking off the wind and there are heat lamps as well. Not sure if I would eat dinner here since it seems a bit pricey for the food but loved the happy hour.
author: Taylor F.

description: Had to find a place for a quick brunch before I started working again and El Techo was just across the street from where I was. They got me a table right away which is amazing because I heard that it usually has a waiting list... I got the eggs benedicts with chorizo sausage and a michelada. Everything was amazing including the atmosphere! Such a beautiful rooftop with great music. It was a perfect brunch for a solo Saturday! :)
author: Daffny V.

description: Went straight from the airport to El Techo per recommendation by a friend. Was the most exciting thing on the street, tons of hype, long line. When my BF and I got up to the rooftop, I could see why....there's nothing better you can be doing with a group of friends on a Thursday night after work. Get in there early for happy hour, then stay and linger over their amazing cocktails till the sun sets. Unfortunately we didn't get to get a table but stood near the bar area. Didn't mind it though because they have HEAT LAMPS which is SO smart since it gets quite chilly and windy at night. We ordered some small bites--fried chicken, corn empanadas, torta, and guac/chips. It wasn't so much anything individually standing out (except the corn empanadas which truly were addicting) but a mix of all of them creating a fun delicious dining experience! A little pricey ($80 for the 2 of us) but a good splurge once in a while is worth it at this place!
author: Shirley S.

description:
Be prepared to wait a while if you go during high-time. In this place, they're going to cram as many people as they can. You're basically sharing the table with parties next to you. The chairs/stools are super uncomfortable. But all of this is made up for their food and view of the SF skyline.

I will say, the drinks are ok at best. The food however is amazing. They're completely small plates based. If you're going with a group of friends, just order as much variety as you can, and share! This is a place you go to eat yourself silly.
author: AGavin W.

description:
The best selling factor of this place was definitely the view! I think that the food itself was good but definitely fits on the pricier side of things. 

I can't say that for what we ordered, that it was the best by any means. Luckily we came during their happy hour which made the food more worth it in our eyes. We ordered the empanadas and pollo frito, with a pitcher of sangria. The portions were definitely more sharing platters than full meals but again we ordered from the happy hour menu. 

Honestly if you're trying to come here for the food, I would say there are other options in the area that are far better, however if you just want a good view and cocktails with friends this is a good spot
author: Mellanie P.

description:
El Techo is hands down my favorite Mexican spot in the Mission. It's definitely pricier than other spots, but it's completely worth it. I usually try to visit before it gets busy so I don't have to wait too long. I've dined here for both brunch and dinner and you must try both! 

For dinner, I always order the fried plantains and the chicharrones de carnes. You can't visit El Techo without trying the chicharrones de carnes! The meat is so tender and flavorful that I'm drooling just thinking about it. You can eat it with corn tortillas and beans or eat it on its own. You won't regret it.

For brunch, I have ordered the Benedictos which includes 
two poached eggs, jalapeno cornbread, chorizo, spinach and chile hollandaise. I've never had such an interesting combination for breakfast and it's definitely worth trying.

On top of all the amazing food, you also get an amazing view of the city. I seriously couldn't ask for more!
author: Mallory L.

description:
Came here on a Saturday afternoon and there was no wait for a table which was great. We get to the roof and are seated furthest away from the view, even though there's an open table closer to the edge. We ask to switch, no big deal, but the table was super wobbly so we had to switch a second time. 

The food was decent, but the prices were really hard for me to justify. Maybe it's because I'm from LA, but $10 guac and chips seemed a bit silly, and $46 for tequila a pitcher was just eye popping. We got the empanadas, chips and salsa, and camarones. It was all cooked well but I felt portions were small. 

The view is nice but wasn't worth the cost. Will likely not return.
author: Sam R.

description:
Great view. Food and drinks a bit on the pricey side. As long as willing to pay its worthy the view.
Can be a bit loud and crowed.
author: Sydney F.

description:
Reservations for brunch is a must. El Techo is known as one of the few rooftop spots so it's pretty popular all around. The one time I tried coming at night, there was a huuuuuge line. So brunch is the way to go! I came on a Sunday around 11:30am. The check in was very easy and we were seated right away. We were seated furthest away from the view which I didn't really mind. I saw others request to be sat at a certain table, so there's a chance you can get the perfect spot. It was a particularly windy day in the city but thanfully they had plastic covers surrounding the area. 

The brunch menu is great. Lots of different appetizers and entrees. Their drink menu is awesome. I neeeed to come back here for their cocktails. Their watermelon agua fresca was super fresh and sweet. It's a shame it came out in such a teeny water glass and it was $3. Eek. Their drinks were delicious tho, it's necessary to get. So get it.

On to food. We started off with their coctel de camaron which was a shrimp cocktail. The shrimp was sooo yummy and fresh. Highly recommend this. It was a great serving too. I regret not ordering their bunuelos. Must get this on the next visit. For my entree, I went with the huarache which is a spinach and cheese stuffed tortilla covered in brisket and egg and pickled onion. yeah. A stuffed tortilla covered in meat??? freaking amazing. I'm super picky about my eggs and these were cooked to perfection. The pickled onion really made the dish ten times better. I love pickled anything. I ordered a side of potatoes as well, not absolutely necessary because the meal will fill you up but these potatoes were delicious. Super simple roasted potatoes with olive oil and seasoning. I tried a bit of the carnitas dish and this was just as tasy. Such a big plate filled with delicious. The carnitas was more on the sweeter side.

Food and drinks were definitely 5 stars. I really loved the food. The portions were great and the prices were standard brunch prices. Where they get you is the extra stuff like apps/drinks. 

As far as service, it was a bit lackluster. Our server was pretty good in the beginning but disappeared after our food arrived. Requested water multiple times but she kept forgetting. I noticed others around us trying to get her attention too, but... the service just didn't match the food. 

All in all, this place was still bomb and one of the brunch spots you need to add on to your list when you visit the city. Happy brunchin!!!
