author: Melissa M.

description: Food here is not very good. Both the standing bar area and the main dining room have small plates only. No formal dishes. It's super loud and the tables belong in a toy house. Not a restaurant.
author: David S.

description: My friends and I came here on a Friday night to grab a drink and check out the view while we were in town visiting. The roof was extremely crowded and we stood at the bar area. The crowd wasn't exactly my cup of tea but this was such a nice view fo the city, I got over it pretty quickly. We had some margaritas, which were overly sweet and not how I like margaritas so I didn't really drink mine much. The view is totally worth it and I was nice getting one drink. If you have a seat, that's probably ideal and I hear the food is bomb.
author: Joanna V.

description:
First of all, I award El Techo the coveted "Best Guacamole" Award of 2kforever. Second of all, how do I get these guys to cater my life? Their drinks, their food, their view and their friendly staff are what I need to be surrounded by 24x7. 

If you haven't been already, what are you doing?
author: Seerat J.

description:
Happy hour: M-F from  4-6 
Their margaritas are on point! You have to get the Pollo Frito and Maíz empanadas! 
And amazing servers, April attended us and she was one of the best servers we have ever had.
author: Crystal V.

description:
I hosted a private work event at El Techo today for about 30 of my coworkers and I have to say it was one of the best events I've ever thrown! El Techo's beautiful views lend themselves but once you add in the amazing food and drink and the phenomenal service, you just can't beat it! Ana was a pleasure to work with - just the sweetest woman ever. The venue allowed us to really have fun and enjoy time! If you're looking for a venue to show off SF's beauty and a good locals spot, look no further!

Pro tip: order cupcakes from Mission Minis around the corner. People couldn't stop eating them!!
author: Tamar H.

description:
DISAPPOINTED and that about sums it up!  

When you arrive at the address, you take the elevator to the rooftop to the restaurant.  The view is beautiful but everything else is disappointing.  Most of the seats are bar top seat and table are TINY; So tiny that your water cup, a drink cup and a meal plate are a tight, tight squeeze.  The bar seats are wobbly, and someone constantly walks by behind you and kicks your chair....

We orders a mango dish, which we thought was a salad dish but it was a few sticks of mangos, cucumbers and jicama.  Something you can see selling at flea market but instead El Techo, it was a whopping $10.  We also ordered a fried plantains dish and hurtados.  Hurtados dish was fine.  Fried plantains dish was nothing memorable.  

As far as service, it was non existence, our server took our order when we arrived but never seen afterwards until we flagged her down for our check.  She never once checked on us during our entire stay.; in fact, no one at El Techo did.  We had to go and grab our own hot sauce from the bar because we could find anyone to help us.  And as I mentioned, the table top is tiny so we had to bus our own empty dishes to make room for our food.  No one came around to bus our table or check on us.  

I don't know why this place is so crowded.  It is overrated; the food is just okay and the service is terrible.   We will not be returning.
author: Leslie Y.

description:
*Disclaimer: I'm giving this place a 2 because I feel like it's the most neutral rating considering I didn't actually get to dine here... I only made it to the front door. 

I was by myself on a Saturday afternoon (Maybe 3 ish?). After hearing great things about this place I figured it'd be a great place to grab a drink and kill and hour until I met up with a friend in the area. I told the hostess outside I just wanted to grab a drink. She asked if I was planning on eating, I told her no and that I just wanted to have a drink on the patio. She said they weren't open for cocktail hour yet and were only serving food. I asked if I ordered food, if I could go in. She said no because I was by by myself and the tables were all for groups. 

I didn't argue or ask again. I just turned around and left. I guess I'm just more confused than anything. I've never experienced being declined to dine/drink alone. If certain hours are restricted for certain dining types, it should be clearly listed on a website or something. I did see different Happy Hour & Brunch hours listed, but nothing that said if you're by yourself and just want a drink, you can't go in. 

I've never felt awkward about traveling/dining/drinking alone before... but this experience definitely made understand why so many people think it would be lonely. Maybe I'll try again next time I visit and make sure I am with a group of people.
author: Savannah J.

description:
Bookmarked for the longest time. Came here for a dinner date right after work. 

Wait was not long since we get off pretty early. Got here at almost 5 and got seated right away. 

Ordered: 
Chips and guacamole: 2/5 chips didn't taste fresh
Empanadas: 3/5 good filling but babe said it looks weird 
Fish tacos: 3/5 ok but really watery and had too much of the picked onions

Overall, okay but don't think I will be back for dinner- probably for drinks.
author: Elaine C.

description:
The view at El Techo is amazing and almost worth a trip there alone since it is a rooftop restaurant! Beware though on a nice day or night there will probably be a wait. The atmosphere is busy and full of energy since they serve pretty good drinks. 

The drinks are fantastic! I have had the Michelada, Margarita del Techo, La Paloma, and tried a sip of my friends pina colada. They actually make a good Michelada which is super hard to find here in the Bay Area. 

The food we ordered was alright, definitely not the best Mexican I have had but for sure not the worst I have had. My friend and I shared the chips and guac, carnitas, and empanadas de carne. The empanadas were really quite good and served with a nice chimichurri. The carnitas were very greasy but had a good flavor especially the really crunchy bits, that came with corn tortillas and pickled vegetables. For the price the size of the guac was so-so and it was also a tiny bit browned on the top which was disappointing.

Overall, it is a fun place to grab a drink and a great view. I would definitely go back for drinks but might pass on food there.
author: Stephanie A.

description: I was in town for the week and me & my bf decided to try out El Techo rooftop bar, we ended up having appetizers which we weren't impressed on. The guacamole was OKAY, a bit too lemon-y and the "ongo (mushroom) quesadilla" was too greasy. Safe to say I wouldn't eat here again. On the other hand the drinks were good.
author: Diana B.

description:
BOMB.com!!!!  the views,
The food, the pitcher of palomas! All of it, divine. The carnitas with the big piece of chicharrón was finger lickin good! Must go back soon. Make Reservarons brunch ahead of time.
author: Claudia S.

description: Literally sitting here right now... 45 mins and still no food. I try to refrain from writing negative reviews but my friends and I came here at 6:00 PM and it's pretty busy.. but not like super long line at the door busy. Got seated, got drinks and ordered literally only two plates of food.. wow really 45-50 mins and no food? This is the worst and most mediocre over priced place in SF. Did you guys forget our order? Because literally all the tables around us, that SAT after us, got their food before us, paid and left while we didn't even have food yet! The portions are unfortunately really small reflecting its price point. I am utterly disappointed and upset and I usually don't ever get upset like this over bad customer service but this is just ridiculous. Please save your money and go somewhere else in Mission, worst SF food experience of my life.
author: Chelsea T.

description: Food was ok but could have been a bit spicyer for my liking.  Ambiance was awesome but service was ok !!!
author: Aide G.

description: The venue is GREAT!!! But, didnt really like the food.  We could've gone to a cheaper but way better food.
author: Shena L.

description: This is a fun location to meet up with some friends on a good weather day at the rooftop restaurant. They have a variety of happy hour options. The place isn't very big therefore there always is a wait period to get a table. The bar location is first co first serve. On busy times, their service isn't that great but otherwise it's good. The view of mission from the top is great as well as the drinks we have had is also fantastic so I will be going back there soon!
author: Julia J.

description:
El Techo is easy to leave a short review for; it's wonderful. 

The line was long - especially for a weeknight - but worth it. They have a beautiful rooftop with plenty of seating, not to mention panoramic views of San Francisco.

I'd recommend it as an add-on to a meal at Lolinda, or you can just come get sauced with some great scenery. What better place to do so?
author: Nic Z.

description:
I was definitely excited to come to this rooftop bar/restaurant. A lot of my friends and family have been ranting and raving about this place for a while now and I haven't had the opportunity to visit until my friend wanted to have her birthday dinner here! 

We got there about 5/530, we had to wait for a bit to get seated, but didn't take no longer than 10 minutes since we made reservations. Once they let you know that your table is ready, you take the elevator upstairs where the hostess will meet you to show you where you are sitting. Once seated, they all gave us time to look at the menu. We ordered margaritas by the pitcher. I recommend parties for more than 5 people to order the margaritas, it's easier to have your drinks right there rather than to keep ordering one drink after the other. The margaritas were tart, but they tasted really good. They were a bit strong, but that's not a bad thing :) 

As for food, I ordered the Quesadilla de Pibil. When it was brought out, it was steaming hot! It smelled so good, I was excited to eat it until I burnt my tongue a little lol. When separating the quesadilla, you can see the cheesy goodness oozing out. I think they used a corn tortilla to make the quesadilla instead of flour, and to my surprise it went well with the meat and cheese! The pork was shredded and had a bbq taste to it. I only ate half of the quesadilla, surprisingly it was very filling! The servers were very attentive and listened to your every need. Even though they were super busy, it didn't look like they were even breaking a sweat! 

As for the view, it's breath taking! To see all of the houses, stores, restaurants all stacked and staggered in all different sizes and colors. You can't resist to take some pics and selfies of the scenery. 

If you are planning to spend a special event at this establishment, do call ahead and reserve your party. Everyone in your party also has to be there when checking in. I recommend everyone to visit El Techo whenever they're in SF, to catch great vibes, food, drinks and scenery!
author: Adrianna T.

description: GUACAMOLE was SALTY AF. I literally felt sick after eating it. The sangria tastes cheap AF. Everything else my party ordered was descent. You basically pay for the environment.
author: Gena K.

description:
A great place for happy hour in the Mission.  When checking in at the top floor, we opted for sitting instead of standing when asked about what table we wanted, without realizing that the standing bars have an incredible view of the city.  Still, given that we were there for over an hour, the sitting tables were just as nice.  

The staff was friendly and attentive, and we ordered drinks as well as a few plates off of the happy hour menu.  The fried chicken thighs were delicious, and we ended up ordering two of them because they were so good!  My only complaint was that our table was pretty small, so it was a tight squeeze to fit all of the plates and drinks for the two of us on it, but it's not a huge drawback at all.
author: Kelsey P.

description:
I came here with a couple friends during their happy hour time on a weekday. The weather was nice out, and we were able to get a table right away. First off, the view is AMAZING. Seriously one of the best views of the city that I have seen from a restaurant (if not the best). 

We ordered a pitcher of sangria to share, along with several plates including the guacamole, pollo frito, empanadas, and I ordered some tostada-like dish, although I forget the exact name. 

The sangria was delicious, and the guacamole was solid. The pollo frito is essentially popcorn chicken, which I am never really a fan of, so I can't comment on that, but my friends went crazy over it (they actually finished 2 plates). My friends also shared the empanadas as they have beef which I don't eat, and they seemed to enjoy it. I did enjoy my tostada as well. 

Because we were here for happy hour, the prices were very reasonable. I would definitely consider coming back for another happy hour. Can't beat the view. Nice to have a little upscale Mexican restaurant in the Mission.
author: Penny H.

description: this place is not also a really good bar but it also has amazing food, the quesadillas we ordered were one of the best i have ever had, juicy, cheesy and crunchy
author: Maria O.

description:
An extension of Lolinda next door, El Techo is one of the few open rooftop restaurants in SF. It's located in the Mission area and drumroll...they take reservations for Brunch! Whaaaa? Unheard of really! 
I hear it's a little tough to get reservations as they fill up quickly especially for brunch hours- although when we went,  friend made them a couple of weeks in advance and we were good! She made the mistake of making our reservations then next week on out but they were still able to accommodate our party of five adults and two high chair kids without any issues.
The ambiance is really nice especially if it's a pretty day in the city as it's pretty much outdoors and offers surrounding city views. 
The food is good---but honestly not rave worthy. 
Amongst the five of us, we tried a variety of dishes. My favorites were probably the most basic things on the menu like the guacamole and salsa, the mango and jicama with lime and a Tajin type flavoring sprinkled atop and the huevos rancheros (minus the brisket for me as I don't eat beef). I have to say the huevos rancheros were fantastic. My friends on the other hand said their huarache with the brisket was not so great because of their sauce --not flavorful enough nor enough in quantity and to me, their dulce de leche pancakes disappointed the most. They tasted like plain ol' pancakes, were not fluffy and how they related them to DDL is beyond me. They were so blah which is ironic bc I was most excited about this rare menu item. 
We didn't have their cocktails but they did look pretty good. Overall, I'd definitely come back due to the convenience of making a reservation during brunch, the location as well as select menu items. Oh their service was awesome too. I'd just not order the items that we didn't care for too much.
author: Kinjal N.

description:
Finally was able to try their brunch! 

My boyfriend ordered the chorizo scramble and I ordered the benedictos. We also got chips & guac and 2 piña coladas! YUM. Is it possible to love each dish and drink just as much as the last? 

Although there was a bit of a wait (we didn't make a reservation...) it didn't feel too long! Plus, once we were seated, food was served so quickly! Service is definitely top notch!! 

I had a sampling of the chorizo scramble, and it was delicious! It's served with yummy potatoes and 2 slices of bread -- a very full plate. There's also a bit of heat, which balances out the dish and makes it filling and tasty. 

My bendictos were BOMB. At first, the portion size seemed a bit small, but I was quickly proven wrong. The food was actually really filling! The cornbread (rather than the traditional muffin) under 2 poached eggs was a nice surprise, and also offered a bit of unexpected heat. Absolutely delicious!! Who'd definitely order again, though it was a bit pricey at $14, I thought it was totally worth. Totally polished off the plate. 

The chips and guac are tasty too, and the guac tastes perfectly chunky and fresh. The don't skimp on the portion size either! 

The piña coladas are a MUST. I literally get them every time I come here. It doesn't taste too strong though it packs more of a punch than expected. Perfectly creamy and great for hot days in the city! (Or cold ones, tbh I love this drink regardless and will always order it). 

100% recommend! Stop by when you get the chance.
author: Tina T.

description: Has a nice ambience. Food and cocktails are ok. They have really good guac. But most of the time its very crowded
author: Yash T.

description:
Great outdoor bar on the rooftop! Pretty popular so there will be a line outside. Very chill vibes not super loud music so you can hear each other talk! 

Nice hipster lighting hanging above you along with heat lamps so you won't be cold!

Known for margaritas (you can also get food). But my friends all got the pina coladas!
author: Alex M.

description:
This was another spot I really wanted to check out before leaving SF, and I'm glad I did. 
Don't be fooled by the entrance or the old dingy elevator, once you get out on the top floor you will be amazed how nice it is. The place is a rooftop bar, with a nice view, great for day drinking. The food looked amazing, although we just stuck to cocktails. Don't know how many rooftop places there are here in SF but my buddy who just moved here said this is one of his new favorite spots.
author: AJ M.

description: Went with my cousin and had a great time with a good view. It is very busy but the appetizers are really good. Would bring someone here for their first visit to SF for the view, cocktails, food and the bustle.
author: Kel Y.

description: Gorgeous in the evening and pretty good drinks! I'd give 4.5 stars if I could. It can get super crowded on weekends but it was lovely on Sunday night. Really liked the Hummingbird cocktail
author: Madeline C.

description:
Gorgeous view, fun vibe, ok drink, and overpriced & ok-food. If you're looking to have drinks while enjoying a beautiful sunset at a super cute roof top place in the middle of Mission, then come to El Techo! A pitcher of sangria is $30, and pitcher of margarita is $36, you'd get maybe 6 cups out of a pitcher. El Techo is a great date spot and place to impress of town guests. However, If you're looking for Mexican food, El Techno is not your place. Food is very ordinary and extremely pricey. ($10 guac & chips, $6/skewer, $6/taco ($36 for 1 lb of meat, which makes 6 tacos)). 

You're going to have to wait (so you should come early, right when they open - 4 pm on weekdays and 11 am on weekends). On a Saturday evening around 7 pm, be ready to wait 30-45 mins.
author: Dana Z.

description: Excelente service,tasty food.,typicall plates and nice view. Price medium high .. recommended.
author: Leonardo T.

description: Great recommendation from the yelp community. I can see why you need reservations. Food was great, atmosphere was on point. Great rooftop eatery that offers cool breezes as you enjoy your meal. Cocktails were also well made, and staff super helpful.
author: Tony L.

description: I went back to have a drink with a friend and decided to get a bite too this time. I got the carne empanada and pollo fritto- the pollo fritto was so good!! Must try!
author: Diane M.

description:
First time at El Techo and I highly enjoyed it. Although the wait can be daunting and service can be delayed, the food and drinks were good! In addition, loved the rooftop view of the city and atmosphere is casual and fun. Highly recommend checking out!

The boyfriend and I shared the half pound of Chicharrones de Carne (roasted and fried chunks of pork shoulder served with house made tortillas, lime, salsa, black bean puree and escabeche). DROOL! It was tender and seasoned well, a must order!

For drinks, we ordered the Belafonte (aged rum, lime, pineapple, banana, cacao and ginger), their famous Piña Colada (el techo rum blend, coconut cream, pineapple, cinnamon and crushed ice), Margarita del Techo (ocho plata, fidencio mezcal, napoleon mandarin and lime) and La Paloma (pueblo viejo tequila, grapefruit, agave, lime and soda). The beverages were strong, some tasted better than others. My personal recommendations would be the La Paloma and the Belafonte.

Overall, a trendy and vibrant place in Mission!
author: Julia L.

description:
El Techo is a definite must try as it is one of the few rooftop bars in San Francisco. On a nice, sunny day, you should grab a friend and have brunch!

Food is average, but nothing amazing. The view, however, is fantastic! Reservations can be made on Opentable too which is nice. 

My friend liked her drink, but I did not like my sangria... I couldn't even finish it.
author: Janet H.

description:
This has become a new tradition to come to El Techo anytime we're in the city. 

From the rooftop view to the chicharrones to the margaritas, what more can a nighttime gal ask for? 

Yes, there is always a line to get in, especially if you're just grabbing drinks. There's also a waitlist to get a table to sit down and eat. If you come on the earlier end, the line for either is pretty short. But, it's worth the wait - fun vibes, beautiful view, good drinks! 

My friends and I will always get a one-pound order of chicharrones, 2 pitchers of the classic margaritas and of course, some guac and chips. 

This is definitely on the pricier end, but it's still good food for what you're paying. The food and drinks also come out quickly! The last time I was there, we had a table and ate, drank and chatted for an hour or so. The servers were attentive and checked in on us every so often, which was perfect. It didn't feel rushed and we didn't feel neglected either. 

Will definitely be back the next time we're in the city.
author: Jasmine Y.

description:
Gorgeous rooftop bar. 
The views are breathtaking and their margaritas are even better! 
Can't wait to go back
author: Aman K.

description:
Wowow! What a view! Came here for a table during Pride. Long line for the bar, but sit down only took 20 minutes. Friendly staff, great location. Quite small for big parties, so might want to reserve ahead. 

I had a group of 3 and was seated at a table closest to the view! Ordered a quesadilla which I wasn't too stoked on...maybe it was be sun getting to me or the sunburn. Haha but the skewers are so good! Drinks are delicious as well. I would definitely come here to try the other flavorful dishes.
author: Tianna N.

description:
I came with a group of 4 on a Thursday night to visit the roof top bar, and surprisingly there was a 20 minute line to get in.

We ended up ordering 3 pitchers, which is approximately 5 drinks per pitcher.

Margarita Single was a classic margarita and it tasted great. 
Margarita del Techo Single was a classic margarita with a punch and tasted much much stronger, which is probably why it costs extra. 

There are lots of heat lamps in the standing area of the roof top bar, but that night wasn't windy or chilly so it wasn't necessary.
author: Edward W.

description:
I've been to El Techo like 10 times and I can't believe I am just writing a review now!!! =O 

El Techo has got to be my favorite place to visit when I'm in the city. Great rooftop vibes here! Food is always always delicious and service is fast. Every time I dine here, I always have to order the chicharrones. Not the crispy one that you're thinking, but it's almost like a crispy pulled pork. Soo delicious. And! I always order the beignets with the DULCE DE LECHE SSAUCEEEEEE ZOMG. So crazy goood!!! 

Anyways, why the 4 stars you ask? Well, every other time I've been here, I ALWAYS MAKE RESERVATIONS. The last time I came here, I came for brunch and arrived at like 10:20AM. 40 MINUTES PRIOR TO OPENING... well the hostess saw that we were the first ones in line and seated like 5-10 parties with reservations ahead of us. Yes, I understand they had reservations, but I mean we waited another 30 minutes after 11am hit. At least alternate and let a few parties up without reservations - but 30 mins after?!? c'mon. 

Besides that situation, I learned to always just make reservations. Food is always good, reasonably priced, and such great vibes!
author: Felicia F.

description:
Amazing view of the city with filling tapas. Best for a date you wanna be a fatty with or a group of friends when you're feeling bad & boujee. 

You can't make reservations so early arrival is strongly suggested. I allow dates to take me here when I wanna squeeze one last meal out of them but I know I'm gonna ghost them after. Never had a item I didn't like. Just be patient because it gets busy. 

These are shared plates so you wanna come with another person. Also you'll feel like a loser watching so many people have fun while you stuff your face wondering if you're going to die alone.
author: Vanessa G.

description:
Came in last night for a drink with a friend and had to share my amazing experience! 

I've never ordered food here before but our waitress Jancelly recommended the pollo frito. I don't usually take recommendations but she seemed like she really knew what she was talking about so I trusted her. Which I'm so glad I did because the Pollo Frito was FIRE!!!! And by fire I mean I devoured before my friend could have any. Lol oops. We will be back again to share it..

She also recommended I try the hummingbird. It is one of the few drinks I hadn't tried before. Which I will also add was very tasty. We love this spot and will def be back. 

Cheers to trying new things and extra cheers to our server Jancelly for being so attentive and making sure we were well taken care of! Thank you!!
author: Elle V.

description:
This place is crackin'. I was particularly dazzled by their lively brunch ambiance and the open-air rooftop venue was everything. Food isn't too bad either! I wish that they would expand their entree selections though. 

If you're gonna order a main, go for the Huarache (spinach and Oaxaca cheese stuffed tortilla--don't fret, it's topped with some beef brisket and fried eggs!) I was seriously taken aback by how tasty this was. Beware, if you're not starving, you may want to share this dish; I say the portion is sufficient for two. Their Bloody Mary is savory and the guac is coo. Order the Coctel de Cameron as a side. 

Our only gripe was the slow and forgetful server. He was no doubt friendly and was slick at upselling, but I wouldn't say he was on top of things. One of us actually had to walk around the venue to tag him down for a missing drink, as it turns out that he had forgotten about it.
author: Merica S.

description:
I adore this place! 

When you first walk in , you will be thinking "where am I?! " but once you get upstairs you will fall in love !
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Amazing scenery, friendly and attentive staff + delicious food = the perfect combination. Went with my team to celebrate our recent accomplishments and had an amazing time. We went during happy hour and shared many small plate dishes (all the skewers, both empanadas, mango, plantain, corn etc). We got multiple pitchers of the regular & grape fruit margaritas.  The shrimp skewer and the vegetarian empanada really stood out for me. Definitely will be back!
author: LeVar H.

description: Loved the empanadas de carne and quesadillas de hongos! Our waitress was super friendly and attentive! Place was packed... tables are small so be prepared to listen to other people's conversations
author: Sasha T.

description: This place sucks! It's on the roof, so very cold at night. And absolutely nothing to eat, sucks is almost not existent here! Avoid!
author: Dennis Z.

description: Worst service I have ever received. Our server just straight up left for an hour. Food was okay. Quesadilla was Delicious. Chips and salad were freezing cold and the plantains mushy and not cooked well. Drinks were incredibly sugary and had no alcohol in them. I will never come back here. Don't waste your time
author: Laura P.

description:
Wonderful view and great choice of drinks! I got the Paloma and asked for it not sweet because I'm picky and it was just right. 
You have to stand in line when it's busy and the hostess is pretty pretentious but once you're upstairs, it's a pretty good experience. 
Chips and salsa are tasty!
author: Britten A.

description:
The first time I came to El Techo, I was here to meet friends on a Wednesday afternoon on the rooftop bar and was rudely told by the flamboyant African-American maitre d' to get in line like everyone else. It was my friend's birthday and I had arrived with him and we ended up just leaving. My friends even asked the manager to let us in and it was vetod real fast. Thanks for nothing. 

That weekend, I decided to give it another try because I had heard what a good ambiance, experience and good their food was. Luckily I made a reservation -- though I made one at 1 instead of 11, they handled it really well. The person at the front was a smiling brunette girl and I was up on the rooftop about 10 minutes later for brunch!

The atmosphere was by far the highlight of the meal. Cute hanging lights above a casual canopy, with wooden chairs and a view of San Francisco. Didn't make you feel like you needed to be classy or dress up to enjoy the view, a great kick-back feeling. 

Food:
Each person of my party of 3 ordered a dish and we shared everything +2 appetizers
Buenelos aka beignets ($6): 6 small donut hole-like beignets. The Dulce de leche was bombbb and they were delicious but they were so small :(( wish I could have more. 
Ensalada de Jicama ($8): decently sized, not remarkable. Probably would not order again because it was nothing special 
Carnitas ($19): Definitely pricey.... but the carnitas were really on point. Juicy, crispy, and though it didn't look like much initially, I was definitely full! 
Chorizo Scramble ($15)-the chorizo is delicious! Good quality and fresh scramble, good if you're looking for a dish with lots of different flavors. Potatoes were the highlight of the dish ;)
Benedictos ($14): what makes these bennies special is that they're served over corn bread! Not personally a fan of corn bread but my friends really liked it! 

$30/person after tax and tip and splitting the entire bill in equal thirds. Might go back to try the cocktails, maybe not for brunch.
author: Leslie T.

description: Loved this place. Really cool vibe. It might be a little difficult to get in but, once you do you won't regret it. I really liked my drink. It was original and spicy! Definitely recommend this place for a happy hour after work drink and bite to eat.
author: Glorimar A.

description:
El techno is an amazing place for brunch or dinner. You go up this semi sketchy elevator to the top where you are greeted with an amazing view of the city. Most of the seats is covered by an overhang while some seats is exposed to the sun. Beware of days where it's windy. The wind blows extra hard on  the rooftop and blows your napkins, and food, while making everything bang against each other if they aren't tied down. 

I've been too both brunch and dinner and I think the dinner was much better. There is a wider selection of food and drinks that I missed. The menu is also seasonal so make sure you check the menu before you assume your favorite appetizer is still on the menu.

For brunch make sure you get a reservation and not wait in line. It takes a while if you don't have a reservation, especially if you have a bigger party. I made a reservation for 10 four weeks in advance. We were running late that day and I called in to see what's the last time to get seated.and the person who answered the call said it was 1:40 since brunch closed at 3 pm. However, they were seating people well past 1:40. 


The drinks are always amazing! I would recommend getting the pina colada (best I have ever had) or the margaritas or even the Sangria.  They aren't too sweet but provide a good balance of flavors. 

The guacamole is always a good choice for an appetizer. I ordered the carnitas for brunch and it looked very similar to what I have would of gotten at dinner. It was just as good as I would remember. The carnitas came with tortillas, a mound of carnitas, black beans, pickled vegetables, and lime. 
I had a bite of the techo ranchero and it was a burst of flavor with the guacamole, runny egg, and carnitas!
author: Brian N.

description:
Okay, El Techo . So, I went to the restaurant a few weeks back. Met up with an old friend I hadn't seen in over 10 years. I personally had never heard of this spot. It's a newer spot in the Mission only been up for a couple years. So, El Techo is a roof top experience hence the name "El Techo". My friend selected this restaurant because I am a very pick person & she had been here before & based off her last experience she just knew I would love it. 

When you're 1st coming into the building there's a hostess downstairs at the front door that assists you. Saturday was busy so there was a small 10 minute waiting period before we were buzzed and allowed to go the elevators to get upstairs. When you finally get pass the hostess and look straight ahead at what looks to be a dead end you'll see a green wall. If you look straight &  to the left you'll see doors. Half way down the hall, before getting to those green doors, the elevator that takes you to the roof is on your left side. 

While waiting for the elevator my friend and I were having a really good conversation, as we're waiting I see this little Latino man dressed as a chef pushing a cart, I didn't pay him any attention at first, so our conversation continued. We got on the elevator letting the Latino man with the cart go first. Right before the elevator doors closed someone else that wasn't well kept got on with us. So my homegirl and I conversation continued. The elevator doors closed, I then looked to my left looking at the "chef" and what he was pushing in the cart. I was in the middle of finishing my sentence when I realized what I was looking at and said "wait, our those f*c*ing tortilla chips?" My homegirl then noticed and said "oh my gosh, yes, those are the f*c*ing chips"

So the "chef" had a cart with 3 different tiers/levels. Each tier had a big grey tub of tortilla chips in them. The 1st level had chips filled to the top with a damn dingy kitchen towel laying in the middle, whatever the towel wasn't covering was exposed to whatever germs. The 2nd level under it had the same set up. The 3rd tier (last bottom) didn't have ANYTHING at all over it  so me and my smart mouth said "oh gee, they serving us dirty chips, w/ a side of dirt particles that came off this guys Jean's, a long with the germs he just sneezed up and what ever spit particles came out of our mouths while we were talking". Then I said wait, where did he come from with these chips?

To my understanding there's a kitchen downstairs that's connected to another restaurant that's behind one of the earlier mentioned green doors.which is cool but the chips were not covered properly. There at least should have been a layer of foil or plastic wrap covering those chips. When we got to the roof, I was totally disgusted about what I had seen. Now, the cooking area is a distance from the elevator, so the chef has to do a bit of walking through, passing up seated guest to get there. So that's more germs on top of those chips, plus the dirt particles & fibers flying off everyone's pants etc. 

With this visit, I could not enjoy the food. We ordered a couple things, the skewer, & Mango. I did have some of what was on the skewer and I ate all of the fruits plus had a margarita, but I refused to have anything else. While we were having our sip, we sat and people watched, disgusted by how many people were eating these contaminated chips, wondering how often they transport them the way they do. 

I definitely won't be back to this place, EVER! Had I not seen that I would have thought this restaurant was top notch. Oh, and the roof experience isn't all that, Its very crowded they have entirely too many people crammed together at small tables and there are little bugs flying around that you have to swing your hand at from time to time to get them out the way.

Had I not seen this, I would have thought this place was awesome.
author: Kenya S.

description: The staff was great and the food was delicious and high quality. Drinks were on point. Thank you chef Alex! And team
author: Rafael N.

description:
5 stars for the heaters and the Chica de Silva cocktail. I love booze forward herbaceous semisweet cocktails, that cocktail was one of the most unique I've had in a long time! The lemongrass syrup and lemon oil really was amazing. My friends hummingbird cocktail was pretty juice like/soda/refreshing, tasted flat and like juice in my opinion. But I would come back for my cocktail! The view was pretty and the heaters made the environment pretty enjoyable.

2 stars for the service, it took us forever to be able to place our orders, but it was also late on a holiday weekend.
author: AnnaRose G.

description: Solid rooftop vibes with good drinks but not much of a view. Moderately crowded when we went on a Friday night.
author: Maggie S.

description: My group and I had a great time drinking Margaritas at El Techo! Great views of the city and our server Ester was amazing! Very hospitable and friendly even though she had a very busy section. Will definitely be back!
author: Bob A.

description: Holy smokes this place is good but laughably SanFranCinco .... bring you wallet ..... nice staff views food but be prepared to pay .... probably the most expensive Mexican food in SF
author: F J.

description:
We came here on a Friday night at 6 pm and had just missed happy hour but I heard this is one of the few roof top bars in SF, so we decided to stay. There was a line downstairs in front of the entrance and as people leave, they let you go inside to take the elevator upstairs. 

It's open seating, so once we arrived, we had to scramble to find a table. However, the view was spectacular. Along with the sunset, added heat lamps, and cocktails, I was actually pretty toasty for a spring evening. 

They offer a pitcher form for the margaritas, and we ended up with the Margarita del Techo cause I love mezcal. Even though it was a solid margarita, the mezcal was quite lacking.

We also order some appetizers - the quesadilla, guacamole, and chicharrones de carne. I guess I didn't really read the fine print because the chicharrones de carne was not your typical pork rinds, but giant chunks of pork. It was tasty and well marinated, but I really wanted chicharrones of the pork rind variety.  I really enjoyed the black beans that they had though. It was just savory enough without being plain and the color was a little bit unusual and intriguing.

Come early to this spot to meet with friends! Happy hours is 4 pm - 6 pm.
author: Karen F.

description:
El Techo, your spot is cute af, but equally expensive af. Seriously, total bill for two ppl came out to $120. Or just me bc I was treating a friend for her bday. 

Is the food and drink options legit? Yes. Is the food delish? Doubly yes. Would I come back? Only on a special occasion. I appreciate the fact that they have a vegetarian option available for nearly every meat option - not all restaurants do this. Noted. But man, the pitcher of margarita itself was $50. And the rest of the food was snackable sizes (quesadilla, empanada, guac and chips, etc). 

While I've been here before on a wkend, and totally used to the crowded environment, it was EXTRA freaking loud tonight w the Dreamforce crowd ugh. SF native here - I hate the extra 200K ppl in SF during this wk. It ruins my commute and SF dinner spots exponentially!! 

Okay, rant over. But seriously, y'all are hella loud. Not El Techo loud. But OMG IM IN A NEW CITY FOR A CONFERENCE WOO GOOD TIMES LOUD. Okay, rant really over now. My friend chose this spot for her bday. I like it. I'll be back. Maybe not during Dreamforce again. Wish your prices were more wallet friendly though. 4 stars
author: Jennifer L.

description: Super fun rooftop! Because it's SF it's pretty cold so wear a jacket...also be prepared for high prices. The food was tasty. We got almost one of every food item
author: Menana B.

description:
Great rooftop bar with a phenomenal view of SF and wonderful guacamole and margaritas. 

Since it was a Saturday evening and the place was pretty packed, we had to wait a little bit in order to get seated. (Helpful Tip from the Host: Go to the bar next door and have a quick beer while you wait ) Once we got seated and settled, we ordered margaritas and got guacamole and chips ($10) as a side and both were really delicious. Though in the pricey side, A+ to the guac for its super creamy texture and punch of lime! The margaritas were, as raced by all my friends, splendid- not too strong, sour, or sweet. It actually tasted exactly like the Margaritas they sell at Coachella (which is a good thing!) 
Anyway the ambience was casual and the fact that the bar overlooks the mission district was the best part.  
10/10 would come again
author: Yuuki O.

description:
I had high expectations for El Techo since it was recommended by so many people in my friends circle. Dropped by around 9:30 pm on a Friday night for drinks and was met with a line as expected. It seemed to be going in pretty quickly so my friend and I didn't really mind the wait. Once we got upstairs, we were informed that the bar area was getting a bit too crowded and asked if we would mind sitting at a table. We didn't mind so we we hunkered down at a quaint little table.

This is where things really started to go down. Our server, who we had to prompt multiple times for water, essentially forgot about us after our first drink order. We were trying to flag him down for subsequent orders and eventually got so frustrated that we decided to leave rather than have more drinks. He spent so much time socializing with another one of his tables and even took a shot with the people there that it took him well over 30 minutes to get us our check once we were done. 

The ambience here is great and the drinks are good, but the service was just such a turn off for me. It'll certainly take some convincing for me to visit this place again.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
Rooftop?! Yes! 5 stars! 
Food?! Meh. 3 stars. 
So, meeting in the middle you get a 4. 

Have had this on my list for some time. I'm not a regular bruncher but do enjoy it on occasion. I mostly hate it because of the crowds now that it is THE cliche thing to do. 

The menu was pretty solid. A few good vegetarian choices. Lots of random dishes with meat as well. The flavor was ok. Really lacking any spice, kick, flare. Maybe because they are used to drunk hipster bros and don't want people eating anything that'd make them throw up on the roof. I asked for any hot sauce and they had Tapatio. I dunno, something homemade would've been nice, even if I had to pay for it. 

The Bloody Maria was so so at best. Totally lacking spice and flavor as well. I'm totally one for a having a hard time stopping after one, this was an easy choice. 

The high point here is REALLY the setting. Fantastic view. Like really. On a sunny day you can see so much of the city (bring sunglasses). The two person tables may be the tiniest I have literally ever eaten on. 

Also, make a reservation for heavens sake. You're still going to wait like a sheep to get on a sketchy elevator to get seated. But at least you're guaranteed a spot. This place seemingly is filled so quick.
author: Sean M.

description:
DAMN GOOD COCKTAILS AND CHICHARRONES. 
But, it is located in San Francisco, and it is on the pricier side. It's reasonable though. Definitely reasonable. I wouldn't come here on a random notice to grab cheap Mexican food. But with friends, to introduce them to the city, or to celebrate a good feeling day, I wouldn't mind stopping by. You wait in line outside for the bar or sign up for a seated table at the hostess. Then, when it's your turn to enter, you respectfully pass through the apartment lobby into the elevator to EL TECHO (which means the roof in Spanish). It's really nice on the top. The view is wonderful. You can see a really nice city line view of Financial District. The rooftop bar is rather small though so it can feel a bit cramped. In the future, I'd probably stop by here with a reservation or something. Maybe, you could request to sit next to the edge of the roof so you get a fuller taste of the view. But I believe you can walk towards the edge to snap a picture of you and your friends real quick even if you're not sitting next to it.
Ordered the chicharrones, empanadas and two cocktails. All of which were delicious. The salsa based sauce with the chicharrones is sooo good. Definitely compliments the dish completely. Drenched my tortilla + chicharrones in it. We ordered a half pound of chicharrones which totaled to $19. If you get full easily like me, this is enough food. But perhaps, if you have a bigger appetite, I would suggest ordering the one pound. Along with the empanadas, I was stuffed. There cocktails came out so pretty looking. I was impressed with the presentation. I ordered La Paloma, and mmMmmmmMm, so good and gives you that nice buzz from the tequila. You can order it in a cup or a PITCHER. THAT'S RIGHT. A PITCHER. When you order in a pitcher, each person gets a glass with an orange in it. Definitely a great place to grab a drink with friends if you reserve ahead of time. I forgot what my boyfriend ordered, but his drink was deelish too. 
It was busy, so service was just okay. Took a while for them to get to us, and overall, they didn't seem super into entertaining us. But when the drinks, view and food are good. Then it don't mattaaaah. With the chicharrones, empanadas, and cocktails, our total amounted to $54. Not too shabbbbby. But, again, like I said, it wasn't the cheapest. But you're paying for that view man. That view.
author: Kim N.

description:
Came here on a Sunday when they reopened at 3pm. When we got here around 2:50, there was already a line like around 5 parties. Right at 3pm the hostess started letting groups go up around every 5 minutes. 

We started with chips and guacamole and a pitcher of margaritas. We wanted a side of salsa for the chips as well and got some but it came with more chips and they charged $3 even though it's not on the menu that they charge for salsa. 

Food: The guacamole was great, no complaints, but the salsa was one of the best salsas I've ever had!! Next time I would rather get chips and salsa, I feel like it goes better with margs anyways. Once 4pm hit, the kitchen reopened and we started with the veggie empanadas. They were delicious and were stuffed with sweet corn, spinach, and really good flavor. We also ordered the three skewers and got one vegetarian (for me), one meat (for my boyfriend), and one shrimp. (To split) Being a pescatarian, I actually liked the veggie skewer better, and my boyfriend did too!! The veggies were packed full of flavor! 

For dessert we got the flan with pumpkin seed brittle on top. The flan was great and so was the pumpkin seed brittle but together it didn't work for us... would rather just have them both separate, so that's how we ended up eating it. 

Service: Our service was okay. We started off with one server who was not the nicest... then when she was off, another server picked up our table and she ended up being very pleasant. 

Ambiance: The whole restaurant is outside on a patio overlooking the city! Our was amazing. We were right along the edge at a low table. This would be a cool place a night because you could probably see all of the city lights, and the patio is decorated in hanging lights as well. Very good place for a birthday party (brunch reservations can be made in advance). Or if you get there when they reopen like we did, it will probably not be too long of a wait.

Overall this place is awesome! Amazing food with a view :)
author: Hayley D.

description: My favorite place for happy hour. Great view and great sangria. The guacamole and empanadas are delicious too on the happy hour menu.
author: Diana N.

description: I've come every birthday for the last 4 years. This place never dissapoints. Service and food is ALWAYS on point. It can get busy and wait time can get looong, but the trick is to get there early, put your name down and then head down to grab a drink at the many available bars in the area while you wait.
author: Monique G.

description: Such a cool place! Such good sangria and such delicious empanadas! The view is amazing and it's a cool little rooftop bar. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Mariah R.

description: Met up with old coworkers here the other night. Feels like a secret hideaway spot. Neighborhood is sketchy, and the entryway is narrow leading to a single elevator...but then it takes you up to the rooftop bar and the ambiance instantly changes. Perfect for schmoozing with a date or friends - there are small tables scattered around and plenty of countertop standing areas where you can chat and drink cocktails while waiting to be seated. I've never had a full on meal here - mostly cocktails and a small plate or two. I really love the empanadas - so satisfying!
author: Elaine W.

description: This was by far my favorite place to eat here while visiting. The food was amazing, as well as the drinks and one of the neatest views of the city. Wait staff was attentive and friendly! Highly recommend this restaurant when you are in town. We made reservations easily, which I also recommend as it seems to be a hot spot for weekend brunch.
author: Angie F.

description:
I love rooftop bars but El Techo was nothing extraordinary to me.

Some friends and I were looking for a rooftop bar to try out in the city one evening. At first we considered 620 Jones but decided against it since we knew it would probably be packed. El Techo was still new and poppin', so we decided to all meet there for happy hour. I was first to arrive around 5:00ish and took bart there on this particular evening. El Techo is located in the Mission district and is a convenient 5 minute walk from the 24th street mission bart station. I took the elevator up and arrived to the rooftop. When I walked out, I first noticed how busy the place was around 5:00 pm! I assumed that all of the locals and people working nearby were already here. All of the large tables were taken, but I spotted a a few seats on the ledge that was closest to the corner of the rooftop. The view wasn't anything spectacular, but it was definitely decent.

I took a look at the menu and decided to try out the tostadas, chips and guacamole and a Margarita. The server greeted me when I first entered and dropped off some menus,  but it was very difficult to get her attention once I was ready to order. I waited for about 6 or 7 minutes until I was finally able to get her attention and put my order in. It seemed like they were pretty short staffed that night and they definitely could have used the help. As I waited for my food,I stayed on the lookout for a bigger table to open up. Naturally being from the east bay, I was freezing my tushy off. The winds were really whipping but the good thing about this place is that it comes equipped with heat lamps at the tables. 

My Margarita arrived and the first thing I noticed was how much ice they put in it... a little too much. I took a sip and realized that it was watered down as well. Yikes, not a good first sign. One of my friends arrived, and sat with me on the ledge for a few minutes until  a table finally opened up for us. My food still hadn't arrived, and I asked the bartender what the status was since I noticed that a group of 3 that came after me received their chips and guacamole. She said that she would check with the kitchen to see what the status was. A few minutes later, she came back with my food and apologized for the long wait. I totally understand that things can get chaotic, so I really appreciated the apology. I bit into my tostada and it was cold. I think that she might have forgotten about my order or got confused when I switched tables? 

As far as the taste goes, it was nothing special. It could have definitely used more flavor and the guac was bland and didn't taste fresh. The chips were good but tasted like they had been under a heat lamp for too long and were borderline stale. My friend also complained of her drink being watered down as well. We texted two of our other friends to
see where they were and found out that they were being held downstairs because the bouncer said that the bar was at capacity. Kind of sucked because several people kept asking us for the seats that we were holding for them. When they finally did arrive, we ended up having a fun night and made the best of it.

Would I come to El Techo again? I probably would come back to give it another try,  but I will probably wait until the summer time when the weather is warmer and once they've worked out their kinks.
author: Shayla B.

description: Awesome rooftop views paired with great Mexican food. I would recommend getting the Chicharrones de Carne, at least a pound if you're sharing! The drinks are refreshing and good, you can't go wrong with any of the options. I would highly recommend making reservations as there can be a bit of a wait, but it is absolutely worth it.
author: Diana N.

description: I've been here a few times now and the service is always great, views are beautiful, food is delicious, and best pina coladas!
author: Jasmine M.

description:
I went here with 2 friends for a night in the city and the food here was SO good! We got chips and guacamole, butternut squash empanadas, plantains, and the pork shoulder plate. Delicious, tender meat and so many wonderful flavors - I really loved it!

El Techo is a rooftop bar and restaurant , so the views were really cool. However, since it was packed with people, we really got the vibe from our servers that they wanted us to order, eat, and leave as soon as possible so others could get our table. We ordered a lot of food and a pitcher of margaritas, but we finally left after an hour once our server had visited our table at least 5 or 6 times asking us if we wanted more and then very promptly giving us the check once we stopped ordering. That part felt a little forced - we didn't plan on staying all night, but we also ordered actual food so we obviously wanted some time to enjoy it and each other's company. 

This place is a fun bar with great food, but don't expect to stay here for any significant length of time if you want some time to actually enjoy your dinner with friends.
author: Chelsey B.

description:
So tip to know, there will be a line for this place starting at 5 PM. This just screams how good it is. My first trip to San Francisco and countless people recommended this restaurant. They do take reservations, but we figured that we will wing it and just see how long to it takes to get a table. For a Friday night, under an hour and we were able to have a drink at the bar next door (Lolinda, highly recommend their cocktails). 

The restaurant is roof top and has an amazing view of the city. It has a younger hip vibe but people of all ages go here! The staff does a very good job of making sure the place does not get overcrowded. We ordered a pitcher of sangria, which was really strong. It had a weird spice to it, possibly with added cinnamon... wasn't my cup of tea, but others may enjoy. Also ordered guacamole for an appetizer. It was delicious guac, fresh avocados which is different from what I get on the east coast.

We also ordered beef empanadas (this was my favorite tapa! So juicy and perfect bread-meat ratio) and the pork quesadilla, which was out of this world. I never had a quesadilla like that before. For entrees we split 3 skewers, and also their chicharonnes de carne - which you have to order for the full experience. Anybody's first trip to SF, must add this restaurant to their list.
author: Stephanie R.

description: The rooftop view here is amazing! The food here is decent. The empanadas were tasteful yet so tiny. The pancake with berries I had was ok. The micheladas here are by far the best micheladas I've ever had! The service here is less than average and the size of the tables here are horrible/extremely tiny!
author: Marcus M.

description: 3 stars for the cool rooftop view and pretty delicious food.  But this place needs to improve its sanitary standards.  The utensils and plates were all dirty and crusty, and just felt generally grimey.  The aqua Fresca I ordered came in a cup that looked very cloudy and was sticky all over.  Sure enough 30 min after eating here I felt sick, got food poisoning and threw up violently.  I've eaten at many food trucks that felt cleaner than this place, don't think I will be back.
author: Nancy J.

description:
A change from your typical happy hour go to especially on a beautiful day. However, it's really hard to hear the person sitting across from you when you're having a conversation. I must say though the bartender made a pretty decent mojito. Overall it was a great experience. Definitely would come here again. 

Thanks Jeff. Will definitely have to check out more of your menu.
author: Nel M.

description:
The view from the rooftop bar is nice, but is covered in glass, so there's really no where to sit/stand where you can actually enjoy the view or get a good photo of it. The glass makes it seem a bit closed-in. Not to mention that it's always hella crowded.

Tapas were good, but nothing really unique. I say most people are here, not for the food, but for the scene. The staff is very friendly, maybe even overly caring. We were eating a dish and having a conversation (so the dish was being eaten slowly), and I had at least 10 different staff ask me if I was finished. I appreciate the service, but people needa calm down a bit.

ALSO: no wifi and no tv screens. We had to get creative so that we could watch March Madness games haha.
author: Vasiliy M.

description:
Five stars for the view, 3 stars for everything else! 

You simply cannot beat the city skyline view at El Techo. It's one of the most beautiful views of the San Francisco skyline in the entire Bay Area. I would highly recommend just coming for some drinks, because it doesn't get any better than getting your buzz on and basking in the sunset glow of our beautiful city. 

Everything else about the restaurant... food, prices, and service, is about a 3. I've been here multiple times and the service is pretty terrible. Customization on a specific order?--Forget about it. We simply asked for some sour cream and they had to go check with the kitchen to see if they could even do that. 

Anything you want that is not already out at the table or put in at the beginning of the order, you will likely not get. I wanted salt and pepper after my food was served--Fat chance! You want hot sauce--Sorry, sister! What you get served is what you get and it will not be changed. 

This place reaalllyyyyy does not like special requests. 

My advice--Come for drinks and stay for the view, but skip the food!
author: Liz S.

description: A vibrant rooftop experience with one of the best views in the city. If you find yourself in a line to get in, trust me, it's worth the wait. Loved the chicharrones de carne, which is great for sharing. We also enjoyed the beef empanada, veggie quesadilla, and pollo frito. Oh, and don't forget the margarita pitcher!
author: Sarah R.

description:
Updated review: minus one star for server who encouraged us to order less.

I had a great initial experience at El Techo, but after this second visit, I'm less impressed. 

Reservations: reservations for brunch are super easy to make and they follow up with you via phone to confirm-great touch.

Seating: I get that you're trying to fit as many people on the rooftop as possible, but the 2-person tables are literally the smallest. Probably can only fit 2 dishes and 2 drinks, and that's after taking away the bulky utensil container.

Service: Our server was nice, but discouraged us (and tables around us) to order food. Are you guys not a restaurant/bar? If someone wants to order extra food and try out the menu, why stop them? Your tip will be based on the total amount anyways.

Food: Good, as expected. Carnitas were a tad colder than I would have hoped. They should bring out food as soon as it's out of the kitchen instead of letting it sit there.
author: Shirley H.

description:
Really enjoyed my brunch at El Techo! The food was good, drinks were good, service was good, prices were good, and view was GREAT! 

I will definitely be returning to try happy hour/dinner, such a fun place to visit in the city!
author: Ali W.

description:
Eating outside makes all the difference sometimes when you've been couped up indoors. Also, El Techo's service and food can't be beat. Last visit was for brunch. Both of us liked our entrees. Coffee is great.

Note: the elevator is super slow. If you don't feel like the wait, take the stairs.
author: Amy O.

description: Food was Amazing, that "Feel Good, Life's Good" feeling. Drinks were ok  Having both Margaritas and Sangria. There House Special Margarita kind had a medicine taste to it not so good but got the job done. Excellent service staff, very attentive and made you feel welcomed.
author: AyJay K.

description:
Brunch is good. Our fried cheese with slaw was delicious and balanced. Chorizo and eggs were good as well. Carnitas were okay, but it came with fresh tortillas that can't be beat. The heated rooftop made a chilly foggy day fun to be out in. 

However, the service was a real drag. Our server was nice, but seemed very new and so service was painfully slow and not attentive.  It wasn't intentional, she just didn't know how to prioritize so it was difficult to order, or to ask for anything, including the check. I'm still on the fence if we will be back bc this was our first visit and it made the experience disappointing.
author: Candy C.

description:
We arrived on a Saturday evening in July to a line of 30+ people outside and thought we would have to wait a long time, but I spoke to the hostess and she put our name down and said the wait would be long enough for us to grab a drink elsewhere. We went around the corner to a wine bar and got a text that our table was ready before we could even put in an order! So, not exactly sure what that line was for. 

I love rooftops, and El Techo was just okay. Maybe it's not fair to compare it to San Diego, but I don't have an SF rooftop point of reference, and I'm just biased towards the beauty of San Diego. Sorry, original hometown. 

Food was pretty good. I avoided drinks as I was still recovering from Friday shenanigans and saving myself for the rest of the night -- aging liver problems. 

Overall, this is a cool spot. No wow factor though.
author: Anna C.

description: We went to this unusual place with my coworkers. Strangely, we had to stand in the lobby to wait for elevator. Where are the stairs? Anyway, food was great with a streak of pretentiousness. Food is especially appealing to meat lovers! Margarita was 4 out of 5 because it was too sweet, need to add some lime juice. I had to deduct one star for absence of fish tacos on the menu, the most popular item in Mission. Highly recommend!
author: Dmitri G.

description:
We came here around 10:45 to get some brunch. A line was already starting to form even though they open at 11. When they finally opened, we weren't seated right away and instead, placed on a waitlist. We were probably seated around 11:30 and when we went up to the roof, our party of three was seated at the end of the table where two large parties were already seated and not to mention, underneath the sun. This was pretty ridiculous when about 70% of the tables (most with shade) were still empty. When I asked if we could possibly be seated at a table with some sort of shade (because it was HOT), the host kind of spazzed out and gave a huge and agitated spiel about how those seats were already reserved. I mean, I guess, but by the time we finished eating and left, there were STILL seats that were being held for reservations. I don't understand why we couldn't have just sat at those reserved seats if the party wasn't expected to arrive for another hour and a half.

With that weird start of our meal aside, the food itself was pretty good. We were only able to try the brunch menu, so I'd like to return one day to try their dinner. My boyfriend and I split the Huarache and a side of papas. The huarache was good and gave a decent portion of braised beef. I liked that it came with some shredded lettuce to give you a break from all the heavy carbs and meats. But it was nothing I'd order a second time. As for the papas - I've had better.

Chips and guac were good, but not good enough for being $10. Yikes.

We also got to try the carnitas, which were great but a little dry. 

When we were done, it took a while for us to track down our waitress. We could've probably been out of there 30 min earlier if the staff was a bit more attentive, which could have opened up a spot for another party earlier.

My rating is more a 3.5 than a 3. Maybe when I try the dinner menu it'll shoot up to a 4/
author: Ellen J.

description: Got here too late to try the food but the drinks on the rooftop bar were amazing! I'm so mad I went to a different rooftop bar first---this one was way better (and not as expensive as another rooftop bar with subpar drinks). The service was also great. Hopefully when I get back to San Francisco I can come here earlier to try the food as well.
author: Barbara N.

description: One of my favorite restaurants of all time! Great food, awesome atmosphere and views. The wait is the only thing to complain about, but it's SF so you have to expect that with the best places!
author: Hannah U.

description: Had Chilaquiles for brunch this Saturday! We live right in the neighborhood so definitely frequent El Techo. I've been for both brunch & dinner. Price adds up here, and food is sometimes a hit or miss for me. Ambience (rooftop on a nice day) usually makes it up for me though. This time, we waited two hours for brunch, which definitely spoiled the mood for us a bit.
author: Maansi D.

description:
El Techo is a destination restaurant. Everything about this restaurant is special. So much so, we stayed for 4 hours! The drinks are fresh, and well crafted, especially when served with pebble ice. It's so perfect for an icy, refreshing drink without watering it down. We had the Hummingbird and Caipirinha drinks, one of which is a much smoother margarita than the traditional version. 

A HUGE shout out to our server DANIEL CHAVEZ (11051) who attended to us over the four hours, suggested the perfect drinks, and who provided the most excellent service. He was attentive, but not overbearing. And he continued his service even after presenting the bill never flinching when we started a new one. 

The drinks and vibe were so good, we stayed! 

The view is wonderful from the rooftop. And no worries about the cold and wind. They provide see-through wind screens when needed and heaters for a toasty time.

We dined on the Benedictos--the best version of eggs Benedict I've ever eaten. The eggs were consistent and impeccably cooked and the biscuits were to die for--toasty, yet moist. The dish was topped with chipotle hollandaise sauce which was light and not overbearing like some can be. For dessert, we had the Bunuelos, beignets sprinkled with powered sugar, and then we dipped them in dulce de leche--a smooth warm chocolate. The dessert is not too sweet but just right. The guacamole and stout chips are very good; however, next time I will ask for a bit of spice like jalapenos added to mine.

We had reservations and their website states that ONLY at brunch do they accept reservations. We were the first ones there and the place was crowded right away. It's a loud atmosphere no doubt charged by the several birthday parties taking place. Apparently, THIS is the place to celebrate.

Street parking is available, but it's less stressful to park at the public parking structure located at 3255 21st street. Rates are very reasonable.

I was worried that there wouldn't be a lot to do in this area, but there are unique and hip shops located on Valencia to round out the day. Some are a bit quirky, which is why we like San Francisco.

For dinner we ate pizza at Beretta's nearby (See my review on Yelp), but I could have easily gone back to El Techo though we would have probably worn out our welcome. :)

El Techo is hip. It's unique. It's a destination restaurant.
author: Deborah B.

description:
Went to El Techo for brunch this past Labor Day and was thoroughly disappointed. The crispy potatoes were cold and soggy. The portions were ok. And my Chilaquiles were a bit bland. I expected more from the food since I LOVE Lolinda (the restaurant below) and assumed the restaurant would take advantage of the amazing view.

Next time I'll only come here for drinks.
author: John L.

description: Great views of downtown to Sutro. Strong drinks (tequila!), great views, tasty small plates. Limited menu (with vegetarian options) but I really enjoyed the flavors and fresh ingredients. Fun place to meet friends, able to accommodate medium size groups, recommend reservations though.
author: Sam L.

description:
Came here for Sunday brunch- great choice. Rare sunny day in SF, sweet view of the downtown buildings, strategically placed umbrellas and heat lamps to accommodate for any weather, yummy meal (agua fresca mimosa and huerecho). 

Would recommend! But be sure to make reservations and check out Dolores park afterwards if it's a nice day
author: Carissa G.

description:
So this review is focused on the vibes, drinks, views of the city and the happy hour session. This is probably still the best rooftop bar I have been to in the city which provides great views of the city with good coverage from sun across the entire patio so you are not just sitting in the boiling heat. This place is fairly accessible by public transportation and has a ton of great eats right near it including Foreign Cinema which is what I was in the area for and figured I had 45 minutes to kill so why not the patio. This is my third time being here and I can speak to the happy hour specials they have going on and the drinks. 

There always seems to be a line here to get onto the rooftop bar so readers beware to head there early if you want to grab a slot. I showed up at around 4:45 on a Friday and was able to find a spot on the patio where we ordered more than a few margaritas to enjoy the afternoon SF sun. Was able to order the guacamole and chips as well which was solid and of course we ended up devouring all the chips. The servers were moving as quickly as possible but the entire place was hopping so it took a little longer than expected. The drinks were good although not sure it was anything really special. This place is really to chill with a large group of people with a cool/hip vibe with amazing view of the city. I would rate this a 3.5 given the food included but the atmosphere and vibe is certainly one of a kind rounding this one up to a 4 star review. 

I will definitely be back with friends/dates/etc to experience the SF skyline.
author: Dan M.

description:
Sooooo close to being 5 stars.  Maybe next time it will make the jump.

Way less crowded on Tuesday night FYI.

The Chicharrones de Carne are still amazing. 1.5 lbs feeds three people well.

I was impressed with the Empanada de Zapallo - awesome crumbly rich dough, good filling. 

The Quesadilla de Clabazas was the underwhelmer of the night - that's not to say it was bad - it just didn't have a flavor that jumped at you. 

I'll be back. For sure.
author: Sarah C.

description:
After living in San Francisco for a year now, I finally visited and ate at El Techo.

Fortunately, there was not wait time at all and no line. So we got in and sat down right away! Although we were fortunate, I do believe that it can/does get extremely busy and will have a wait time of some sort. 

There was a lot of people sat down and pretty noisy. I didn't mind that at all though, but others might. The view, although it was just about starting to rain, was spectacular! Would love to go back on a clearer night.

The service was fantastic, both being sat, getting our order in, and when we left. All around A+!

The food was also really good, small but hearty portions. I got the veggie quesadilla and although I finished my partners food he didn't want, my portion still filled me up. 

The pricing is average for mexican food. Might be just a bit expensive, but it is doable for going out for a dinner.
author: Michael T.

description:
I've been to El Techo various times for different occasions and always leave with a smile!

This place is VERY popular. If you are trying to go for happy hour show up and hour or so before so you can actually get in and enjoy it. Definitely expect a wait overtime you go whether it is just for drinks or dinner.

This place is a bit pricey so I would definitely suggest making the happy hour. The food is fairly good too. Im not too sure if it is worth the amount we always end up paying, but definitely worth it once in a while.

The service is okay. Not really their fault that the place is a bit small, always crowded, therefore don't always help you at a timely manner.

I would definitely come here with a friend, groups, to celebrate a birthday, or a pregame place!
author: Kassie E.

description: El techo is over priced for the quality. The food wasn't amazing by any means. I've never had a bad Margarita until drinking here. Yuck! The only good thing was the view.
author: Emma W.

description: A bit pricey, but hey your in The City, what did you think? The best thing to order if you are a group of friends is the CHICHARRONES de CARNE. It's a bunch of bork with some tortillas and salsa. A make-your-own trey of goodness. The food is absolutely incredible.
author: Kat D.

description:
I come here for many things: the drinks, the food, the rooftop views and vibes, the service! And I never leave disappointed. 

Everything on the menu is tasty, from the mushroom quesadilla to the chicharrones (must get, best to share between a few people). The food is on the heavier and greasier side, FYI. The drinks are stellar, my favorite being the Paloma (love me my tequila). Get a pitcher to share! Servers are attentive and friendly - it's comedic to me how everyone who works here looks like any other SF hipster dressed in normal day wear. The view is great - all around good vibes, beautiful during sunset time! And in colder weather settings, they ventilate the tables by putting plastic slips and heaters around the rooftop. 

When I find that a friend hasn't been here yet, it is one of those places I insist that he/she go to if just to overindulge on good food and drinks. Add the ambiance of the place and you've got yourself a memorable experience, best done with the right social group!
author: Liz C.

description: Made reservations for brunch on Sunday. It was such a nice day to have brunch. Food was good. Drinks were even better. Our waitress was nice and sweet. Perfect brunch spot.
author: Maly C.

description: What a cute rooftop bar in SF! Amazing views, great atmosphere and ambiance. No complaints. They have some delicious cocktails and snacks available. I didn't get to try any of the food but the drinks were tasty and service was super nice. Great place to meet with friends and catch up over drinks over a relaxing, gorgeous view. I will be back!
author: Kayla U.

description: Came for brunch with friends. It's really packed during weekends so you definitely will need to make a reservation if you don't want to wait an hour. It's nice in that it comes with a view, especially a rooftop one. Not that it peers down into anything especially breath taking. Some of the surrounding buildings in this part of the Mission can use a lot of TLC. The food is average Mexican styled fare. They do have watermelon mimosas! Unique and refreshing. Price wise, it's high. But it's SF and what you are really paying for is the view and not the food. An alright place for brunch if you don't mind how noisy it can be at times.
author: Michelle R.

description:
This was the worst possible place we could have gone for a fun night out on the town. We drove 4 hours to visit San Fran for a birthday weekend for my roommate and I was trying to find a fun rooftop restaurant or bar that we could go to. This place had gotten so many good reviews and we waiting in line for over 20 minutes so I figured it had to be gold...unfortunately I was wrong. 

The man working at the door was really nice and the hostess that greeted us at the top was extremely friendly but our server was AWFUL. I couldn't understand what the names for the items on the menu meant and so I would ask her a question about something and apparently I was just ruining her day with my curiosity. My husband didn't know what exactly he ordered because when she explained it to him she was very vague and super rude so he felt uncomfortable and just went for it. One of the cooks brought his food out asking if we had this and it didn't look like what he thought he ordered because everything seemed to come à la carte and so the guy took it back. Well our server walks up with the same plate of food puts it in front of him and says, "this actually is your food, trust me I know what I'm doing." 

Well then we waited another 10 minutes before the next plate of food arrived and then another 10 for the two others. By the time my friends received their food my husband and I were already finished and at this point our server had left for the night and said someone else would be taking care of us. 


I thought to myself, "perfect!" Maybe it'll actually be a better experience now! Unfortunately I was wrong. She barely spoke too words to us and acted as if we were such a burden for her. 

I kid you not I saw her turn around from a table with a massive fake smile and as she walked away she quickly scowled and rolled her eyes. Then she walks up to us to get the bill and my friend was holding it and says he has a question and she rips the bill out of his hand then asks what his question was. 

Seriously!? Was I at Dicks Last Resort or something? I actually think I had better service when I visited that place then El Techo. 

We left still hungry from the extremely small portions of our misguided menu ordering, pissed off because of how rude the servers were and overall not happy. As a former server I know you have bad days and people suck but there's always that one nice table that helps you get through the night and they didn't even give it a chance or care. 

Long story short: great view, good drinks, terrible, terrible service, meh food.
author: Amanda H.

description: Went here to celebrate my birthday drinks are amazing and reasonably priced. Wish they had more pitchers of the other drinks as well because they were really good.
