Food is delicious but pretty pricy for the portions they give you. The quesadilla was probably my favorite. Note it's one small quesadilla for about $10. I recommend eat somewhere else and go there for the drinks and the view. Overall I would return service was nice good drinks And good food.
author: Melisa G.

description:
Service: 3
Food: 4
Cleanliness: 4
Environment: 4
Price: 2

Comments: Ordered chips/guacamole, ceviche and a piña colada. 

Recommend: Yes
author: Rita Z.

description: The wait to get in was ridiculous for five in the afternoon.  Yes, the view is spectacular and that pretty much makes up for the average food and service.  The Belfonte cocktail, though, is a must.  Very tasty
author: Vitaly M.

description:
Came here spontaneously on a double date with our friends. So so so glad they introduced us to this spot! 

The wait: Honestly was not bad...especially for a Saturday night around 730pm. We probably waited no longer than 20 mins or so. Once you pass the first host you go through a darkish hallway into an elevator which brings you to the restaurant/bar.

The view: El techo is the first rooftop bar I've been to in SF. Let's just say the view may cause heart eyes. Something about rooftop bars that make it that much more special. 

The food: We ordered a half lb of the chicharonnes and pollo Frito. Both were amazing! The pollo frito especially surprised me with how flavorful yet crispy it was. The chicharonnes came with a side of beans and both orders came with their own salsa/sauce. Definitely worth the calories.

The drinks: We ordered a pitcher of their classic margarita and the margarita del techo. I wasnt as impressed by the drinks but the rest of my group seemed to enjoy it! They definiteky werent bad for $36/$46 a pitcher. We got a good 6-8 glasses full. 

Cant wait to come back and explore the menu further!
author: Ayla L.

description:
Overhyped. Heard so many things about El Techo, so my expectations were I admit, unreasonably high. I was pleasantly surprised that the wait was not too long, and we got window seating relatively quickly. However, the service was very subpar. It seemed very chaotic in the kitchen, and took more than thirty minutes to place our order. Our drinks came quickly, but we waited another half hour to find out that our order had accidentally been given to a different table. Slow and unorganized service, but out waiter was kind enough to give us guacamole and chips, and the braised pork tortilla on the house. We also ordered the fish tacos. Deliciously salted and crispy batter. 

I'd recommend the:

Belafonte // Which has aged rum, lime, pineapple, banana, and a pinch of cacao and ginger. 

Margarita del Techo // Ocho plata, lime, Napolean mandarin. Tastes like a classic Margarita. 

All in all, the food was good (and free) but nothing out of the ordinary. Everything comes in small plates, so expect to order multiple items. The prices are very reasonable; Much lower than most restaurants in San Francisco. That being said, it's obvious that people come here for the beautiful rooftop view, and the trendy atmosphere. A good experience overall, but excited to try out other restaurants in the Mission.
author: Arielle I.

description: Nice rooftop spot to enjoy drinks and appetizers with friends. Nice view of the city as well!
author: Meghan L.

description:
What a wonderful way to start of my long weekend and visit to SF! Came right during dinner time and waited a good while to get in but boy was it worth it!

AMBIENCE:
Beautiful rooftop view of the city! It was pretty busy so sitting at the table gave us a pretty obstructed view, but beautiful nonetheless! It was a warm night so no need for heaters, but I'm pretty sure they're available for the colder months.

FOOD:
My friend and I ordered a half pound of the "CHICHARRONES de CARNE" and also an small plate of the POLLO FRITO. The two plates were filling between the two of us and very easy to share. The pork shoulder in the chicharrones were delicious, juicy, and tender. The lime that came with it was dried out and useless though. Pollo frito was good, but I would classify it as fancy popcorn chicken.

DRINKS:
Both my friend and I ordered a Margarita del Techo each (made with mezcal). I love margaritas and these weren't bad, but I've definitely had better.

TL;DR -- Come and indulge! Expect a wait, but know it will be well worth it. I highly suggest the Chicharrones!
author: Lily N.

description:
Stumbling upon this place made my weekend in Frisco! I came up to SF from LA to hang out with my bf who is working up in North Cal. We've gone around SF already and wanted to find something new and a different part of the town. My bf found this place and decided to check it out. Realizing that it is in Mission District, sort of a Latino low-income community, it seemed sketchy at first because of all the bums, but it turned out to be pretty cool. 
This place so reminded me of LA, Echo Park area and the LA Arts District, very trendy and hipster. The view is great!
The drinks are well crafted and the food looked so delicious! It was too bad we had already eaten. The popular item there seems to be chicharrones de carne, which I personally love! They serve it with corn tortillas and salsa. We got the elote, just to try it. It was good, but could have used a little bit more Chili. 
Overall, this place is great for a date (which there were a few there), hanging out with friends. It's a super trendy place. I'm not super pro hipster, but I really liked this place! There are a few other bars nearby, so this area in general is super ideal for bar hopping. I really enjoyed this place!
If you plan to eat, just know that the kitchen doesn't open until 4pm. At least on Sunday.
From outside the place looks small. There is someone outside checking you in and directs you to take the elevator to get to the bar. Anyway, awesome place, you should check it out and at least try one drink, then judge for yourself.
author: Melissa S.

description:
Finally made out here, I've heard so many great things about the brunch and views! We got here about 30mins from them opening on Christmas Eve. There was still plenty of seating and the weather was perfect. 

We shared 3 items and my favorite was the Huarache: 
spinach and oaxaca cheese stuffed tortilla, tomato braised beef brisket, fried eggs, pickled onion. Bomb diggs!

My favorite cocktail was the Margarita del Techo. Super refreshing and gives the right amount of buzz. Next time we need to get the pitcher.

Hayley was our awesome waitress! She was always around, very friendly and easy to chat with! She even sang happy birthday to my friend!
author: Lorelyn P.

description:
So,so awesome!!! 

Views: are amazing, SF Skyline! 

Food : ohhhhh yummm! The Eggs Benedict with chorizo and jalapeno corn bread, was Spectacular!

Drinks: delicious! Mimosas with fresh squeezed orange juice! I had the Sparking Rose Malbec  ( never heard of it but It was soooo good! Dry,not fruit forward)
author: Afroditi Dionysia P.

description:
GASP, you can make reservations at El Techo?!  Double GASP, there's tons of availability!!

GF: Let's have tea time and wear floral dresses with leather straps
(How do I say no to that!? )
Me: That deserves a whole day of fun, frolicking around town causing mayhem, time of which I do not have today.  Let's just have brunch at El Techo

If you have reservations, no need to wait in line.  Check in with the host/hostess with the iPad and make your way on up the elevator to El Techo.  Good size open outdoor seating with heat lamps.  

La Paloma - Tequila, grapefruit, lime, agave, soda.  I wasn't sure how I felt about tequila but this drink, as strong as it is, was pretty good.  The sweeter ingredients overpowered the tequila but not completely masking it
Bunuelos - beignets. Soft, pillowy beignets with the right amount of sweetness from the powdered sugar
Huarache - spinach and oxaca cheese stuffed tortilla, tomato, braised beef brisket, fried eggs, pickled onion.  SO GOOD.  At first I was like, okay this one sounds the tastiest out of all the other items.  Then I was like, okay this looks bland.  And then I had my first bite and was like, this is freakin delicious.  LOVE the tortilla.  Beef Brisket was tender. 

Great, friendly staff.  Good food.  Nice atmosphere.
author: Linda N.

description:
YASSSSSS x100000. Rooftop Brunch? Who would ever say no to a rooftop brunch!? Granted yes, the view isn't amazing, but also granted, there aren't many rooftop brunches around these parts, okay. I made reservations here via open table because the wait here can get crazy bananas. Street parking was scarce per usual as expected in SF. Once we found parking, we walked into the building and found two employees who let us know to take the elevator on up to El Techo. Shelby seated us right away and took our orders. We went with a number of items that I would get again:

Bunuelos (beignets, powdered sugar, dulce de leche): definitely a must get! Yum. The hot beignts with that sweet dulce de leche, I'm in love. These came out and disappeared in minutes.

Pan de Elote (jalapeno cornbread, pepper jelly): Very okay! It was good to try, but I probably would pass on this one because it was way too dry for me. The jelly was also really tangy, it caught me by surprise! 

Huarache (spinach and oaxaca cheese stuffed tortilla, tomato, braised beef brisket, fried eggs, pickled onion): The words stuffed tortilla and brisket was all I heard and I was all over it. The brisket was extremely tender and flavorful. 

Techo Rancheros (tortilla, pork, fried eggs, salsa verde, beans, guac) - looks and sounds different than the huarache, but while eating both of them, they tasted very similar. Not sure if that's good or bad, but I mean, it was delicious regardless. May possibly prefer the Huarache only because tender soft brisket over the pork in this dish, but honestly both are awesome. The rancheros are really moody from sitting in that sauce/broth! So if you're going with a friend, just get both and share!
author: Maleah M.

description: In experienced management team and staff. They had a glitch in the system and it made the wait time 2 hours. Lady manager admitted to staff being new and said that we would be seated next but then let two groups go ahead. Really disappointed and as a Uber driver I will not recommend to any one.
author: Cc F.

description: The elevator may smell like urine but the rooftop overall is pretty cool. Drinks were good and so was the food. I'd definitely come back to this place!
author: Q L.

description:
Edit 5/3/2018:
Updating my review and score due to Jeff contacting me and resolving the issue. 
Jeff was very helpful and quick to respond once I reached out. 
.
.
.
Original review:
So this restaurant decided to change the amount it charged to my card two weeks after our visit, here is what happened:
I visited El Techo on April 15th with my family, total amount was $164.75. I paid the full amount with my card and we left the tip in cash. Two weeks later on April 23rd, I check my card statement and the full amount charged is now $192.75!! 
I don't know who decided to add $28 to my total, I have the printed receipt signed with the correct amount and can provide photos of it and my bank statement. 
I already contacted the restaurant but haven't received any response. 

Hopefully it will be a misunderstanding and not someone trying to make some extra money out of my card...
author: Armando M.

description: The food was very delicious, great carnitas and drinks (pretty strong)! We went on a Monday night and we didn't wait long before being seated and the food came out very fast! Will definitely visit again! :)
author: Alejandra N.

description: Pretty slick place to be, I have to say. Well staffed, excellent, sincere service (kind of rare at busy bars), cocktails worth enjoying that aren't fussy and happen to be a great price. Plus you have the view, which of course isn't bad! It's actually pretty superb. If you have an inkling to go, check it out, it's worth it.
author: Will H.

description:
*updated review 7/4*
S/O to the manager for really making this right. I truly appreciate when management goes out of their way and tries to be understanding! Glad to say that I'll be back to check it out again soon with my S/O. 

-------

The wait time *say 15 min or so* when the weekend night hits. There's no cover charge thankfully but you still have to wait outside before going up the elevator. NOT BAD AT ALL!

Great ambiance, you definitely see the SF skylines behind a semi-open glass windows. It gets pretty chilly at night so an outerwear is recommended even with the heaters outside in the patio. The drinks are pretty good especially their pina coladas and sangria. Pitchers start around $36 and not that big either. Overall, I need to come back and try their food especially in the day time! It's such a beautiful place to be at in the Mission.

My experience that night was really fun despite our issue with the server.  He was extremely sassy, rude, and practically talked down to my friends whenever they asked a question on his recommendation. Our drinks were taking a while so I went up to check on it *not knowing where our server went*. He didn't really take complete orders and assumed what we wanted without really asking. I decided to get some clarification/change one of the order since it still didn't come out so hey, what's the harm? I found him and he practically sassed me down. Next thing you know, some other chick is our server *what happened to him?!* I know customer service can get really hectic but it doesn't help when you have a bad 'tude and you have customer's who aren't really trying to piss you off in the first place.

Regardless, a beautiful spot to come hang out with friends/SO's.
author: Jia Qi F.

description:
What is it about rooftop bars attract the douchiest, Marina-est brunch clientele? We had a moderate 20min wait in line downstairs with gaggles of eye-rolling marketer Brads and Beckys, who were testy with each other about who came first. They're an entitled and sharp-elbowed set. El Techo can't help who it attracts, but I'll say this: the kitchen is absolutely no slouch, and for very fair prices we had one of the most excellent Latin American dinners we had in recent memory.

All highly recommended: shrimp ceviche, 3 skewers (carne/pollo/chorizo), and their famous chicharrones.

The views are as wondrous as advertised. Beware, though -- the music is loud, and the umbrella canopy kind of trashes up the atmosphere somewhat.

Come here for dinner, I'd say. The vibe is more relaxed.
author: Ken H.

description:
Downfall they don't take reservation for dinner and you can wait up to 2 hours. The view is pretty amazing and it may be worth the wait. 

Came with a group of 7 people. Rounds of Paloma Pitchers and Cava. 

Got a round of empanadas. Not impressed they are not made from scratch and lack flavor. They basically use pre made dough and salty. 

Order three skewers chicken, chorizo and steak. Chicken had really good flavor and it was smoky. Chorizo was awesome and the steak was burnt. Ordering skewers take a while since they have to be cooked longer. 

Alfajores were good and good ratio of dulce de leche. However, they fall apart too quickly. 

Prices are high but we are from Georgia.
author: Leandra D.

description: Came to Frisco for the 1st time on vacay and was recommended by a friend to check this place out. We get there at 7:45pm and both a man and a woman were taking reservations at the door for rooftop dining; I called ahead of time and they wouldnt take reservations over the phone because it was Saturday. (Be warned if your whole party is not there, they wont let you go in). They have a separate area to stand in line if you just want to go upstairs to the rooftop for drinks. Gave my name, number for party of 3 and stood outside and waited a little over 40 + minutes until they finally texted us that we can go in. When we would check to see how long it would take, we were told: "It shouldn't be long. You can go to our sister restaurant and wait until we text you. The party before you has already been seated and you are the only 3 party next in line. I'll check but its up to the lady upstairs how she decides to seat everyone". Anyways, we finally go upstairs and yes the view is great - which is literally the only reason I gave it a 3. Imho I wasnt impressed and the hype was overrated. Our server literally checked on us once the entire time we were there and mind you our bill was well over $100 between food and drinks. When a crowd of men showed up, he was more focused on flirting with the men than he was making sure his other customers were okay. Take note that this place is not somewhere to go for dinner. This is more of a Latin/South American Tapas kind of place. Their sweet plantains were good. The carne asada skewer had 3 small pieces of meat and they were all burnt. The pulled pork quesadilla was okay. Their guac was good. Now comes the worst part of my experience. Handed the server my credit card for the bill and he turned around and walked straight to the table to flirt with the guys again, meanwhile not noticing that as he grabbed the check and card and walked away - he dropped my card! Thank goodness I happened to be looking in that direction, noticed my card on the floor and grabbed it. I was so angry because he was so careless and unfocused. What if he had lost my card? Id be stuck in a new city with no money and the possibility of someone using my card. So I sat at the table and waited to see what he would do. He checked his pockets several times, looked at the floor near the register/computer, walked around by the table where he was flirting, checked around our table then after everything finally had the nerve to ask, "Excuse me, did you give me your card to pay your bill?" I said, "Yes and you dropped it on the floor". Instead of apologizing and saying 'Im so sorry I dropped your card' all he said was "Oh Thank God" grabbed the card and walked away. At this point, I felt like he didnt deserve a tip; however, I still tipped him because I know many people live off tips and we never know what someone is really going through. I just thought to myself 'Karma' and considered it as a Pay It Fwd thing. All in all, aside from the nice view of the city at night, I have nothing positive to say. Not a place I would recommend or want to go back to.
author: Isabella F.

description: It was alright. A little overpriced for what it was and didn't feel like authentic Mexi food. The wait was soooooo long...they don't take reservations or they do? Still don't know because the hosts would give elaborate answers that were super unclear. It turned me off a little. I'd probably go back with just one other person because that's when you also get dinner with a view-tables for duces or on the edge of el techo. Otherwise your large group is seated towards the main floor in a chaotic and small space. They also charged us for items that were not specified to have an up charge. Always let your guests know that your charging them for extra salsa, especially if you're gonna bring us three and charge for each one. As a whole, I would go back if there wasn't a wait, otherwise I'd go pick up take out from somewhere else and head to Dolores instead.
author: Judith H.

description:
My cousin and I went here with a guy we met on yelp. (Long story. DM if you're interested in hearing more.) It was a really fun time. We weren't that hungry because we had cheese and wine before hand. He ate a lot of the food and we all split the bill. We felt it was ok because he's a poor PhD student. This tax bill is gonna screw those folks over soon. My cousin ended up going home with him to his apartment in Berkeley. They didn't sleep together but they might get married. 

Anyway, we had the chicharrones and it was delicious.
author: Taylor O.

description:
Can you guys please open one of these in NYC? I loved chillin' on the rooftop overlooking the city with a marg and a basket of chips and guac. I just wish SF wasn't always freezing! I thought they did a pretty good job of keeping the roof warm, though. They had a number of heaters and covered a majority of the dining area with plastic. That said, I would much rather experience it open-air style on a warm summer night ...on the East Coast!

Anyway, it's a great spot. I hear it gets pretty crowded, but I imagine if you get there early you shouldn't have a problem. I was there on a Monday around 5pm (which is right smack in the middle of happy hour), and 3/4 of the tables were still available. 

My uncle and I shared the chips & guac, mango, carnitas, sweet potato flan, hot chocolate with cookies, a few margaritas and a piña colada. Drinks were awesome, guac was delicious, and carnitas were pretty good. We didn't care much for the desserts - the flan was too heavy (we didn't dig the sweet potato; made it too dense), and the alfajores-style cookies that came with the hot chocolate were too dry. The hot chocolate was yummy, though.

Overall we really enjoyed it and look forward to coming back!
author: Jeannette N.

description: Fun rooftop setting with a little view. The floor is divided into two sections: one section has a limited drinks/tapas menu and the other section gets the full restaurant menu. We started off at the drinks section where we got chips and guacamole as well. Later, we moved to the restaurant section and ordered empanadas, spiced mango slices, a pork sandwich and meat skewers. The food was good but the service was lacking on that side. It wasn't as crowded as the drinks section so not many people were servicing the restaurant side. This made it take longer to place an order, get more drinks, get the check, etc.
author: Lillian B.

description:
There is absolutely no reason for you to come to San Francisco without visiting this place. 

Margarita pitchers with good quality tequila. What else do you need?

Rooftop bar that overlooks the beautiful Mission District of San Francisco. Bring a jacket.
author: P.j. J.

description: So, came here a million times! Best experience by far from APRIL! She is like heaven sent. She was the best waitress I've ever encountered and I'm in the service industry!!!!! So so sweet. The drinks are amazing! Roof top bar, can't get better then that! Wow!!!!!
author: Cathy D.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for awhile now and it did not disappoint. 

The view is very nice, but unfortunately the spots overlooking the city were all taken. 

Highly recommend the beignets. The sauce that comes with it is so good.
author: Alex C.

description: As beautiful as the view was, the food was extremely disappointing, it was not even worth taking pictures and flaunting them. The portions looked like it was for a kids meal-everything was coated in way too much sugar. And i understand if that is how the culture of the food is made from its origin but it was too much to the point where a dish of carnitas seemed as if it was meant to be a dessert. We came on a fairly busy day so the service wasn't at its best but at least the server was friendly. I also ordered a michelada which was A1. So if i were to go back, it'd def be for the view and a michelada
author: Charlotte M.

description:
This place is a must if you are in the mission district on San Francisco. The food is awesome, chicharron tacos are on point!! Sangria was perfect! Ambiance was wonderful... everyone eating good, drinking good and enjoying the view from the roof top. 
"El Techo" 5 stars deserved
author: Joseph J.

description:
This has been one of my bookmarks for an extremely long time! And so happy we finally got the chance to come to this place! 

We arrived here about 445 on a Friday afternoon and it was already busy. When we walked up to the check in booth at floor level there was a longtime of people waiting to go upstairs. We didn't realize at first it was for El Techo, so we asked and as we walked to the end of the line all the regulars gave us smug looks...relax peeps others would like to taste your amazing deliciousness too! The line went quick and before you know it we were sent upstairs and given a table with no wait! Sweet! 

Once on El Techo we were immediately approached by a waitress who took our order. We started with the guacamole and chips, plantain chips and salsa, a jicama salad and sangria. Sangria was good, but strong as hell. One was enough! The guac, salsa and both types of chips were so tasty they didn't last long! The jicama salad was by far my favorite! FYI it's an actual salad, the vinegarette was scrumptious and the crisp jicama and cucumber was sabroso!!! We also indulged in the quesadilla pibil and the tostadas. Both were fantastic!!! Will definitely be back!
author: Erica C.

description: Awesome happy hour menu, with great views of the city. The heated lamps are a nice touch too.
author: Emily R.

description:
Popped in for some happy hour with friends. One of the few restaurants in San Francisco with a rooftop bar. This place is super popular and gets packed quick. Luckily I arrived before 5pm and was quickly seated. If you don't arrive early expect to wait 30 minutes in a line outside. 

Ordered the margarita, the blanco flight and pitcher of Sangria. The drinks were great, no quarrels there. Unfortunately I never received the guacamole I ordered. After getting the check the waitress was quick to point out she punched in the order so it wasn't her fault. At a minimum I think she could have made sure I received everything I ordered. 

From my experience you have to be pretty aggressive when you visit. I've been a few times and it's always the same. You got to raise your hand, make eye contact, do whatever is necessary to grab someone's attention. Don't expect to be waited on. On a previous visit with a large group it was the same. Funny thing, the waiters always want a generous tip for subpar service.
author: Ralph A.

description:
Food: 1/5
(1 out of 4 in our party enjoyed their food. Menu variety was seriously lacking.)

Drinks: 2/5
(At first glance, the drinks look good, but then they end up being a little alcohol and mediocre.)

Price: 1/5
(Overpriced. $20 for a few hunks of dry carnitas)

Service: 2/5
(Forgot to bring out one appetizer and when asked about it, it was brought out right before the check. forgot to bring drinks a couple times) 

Ambience: 5/5
(Does have a great view of the city and it is nice to be outside on the roof)

Overall: 2/5
(Wouldn't go back when there's so many other great brunch spots)
author: Charles C.

description: The food was good but more on the pricey side. I came here with a group of friends which I don't recommend since it's a bit small and cramped. Waited over an hour on a weekday during dinner. I would def prefer to come here for a date night instead. The rooftop view is amazing, which makes sense with the pricing of their menu.
author: Monica-Leah A.

description: El Techo was not only a great vibe & incredible view but fantastic food & service! My boyfriend and I went on a busy Saturday afternoon and we were seated in about 15 minutes. We will absolutely be going back!
author: Shannon R.

description: Super tasty!!!! We first started with A pitcher of margaritas  $36 then got the guacamole $10 we finished with the Choripan $12 and empanadas de zapallo $9 The margarita's were definitely strong (probably don't order the pitcher if your party is fewer than 3 people~ unless you wanna be drunk) . The sandwich was amazing, the chorizo sausage is a perfect combo with chimichurri. Guacamole came with freshly fried chips, had a limey taste, and the sprinkled cotija cheese on top was perfect. Lastly the empanadas were deep fried to perfection. Comes with a side of lemon aioli. The inside filling could use a bit more flavor . Over all good experience . Service a bit slow, roof top bar is standing only unless you ask for dinner as well
author: Hailey A.

description: This place is awesome!! Good music, good food, good drinks and really goood prices for a San Fran rooftop. I would recommend you get there early for seating because it gets packed, we got there at 4:30PM (opens at that time) and it was fairly packed by about 5:30 PM. The food as I mentioned is good, you need to try the Guacamole and the marrrrrgaritas!!
author: Daniel L.

description:
Came here for happy hour on a Friday night and loved it. I got here right when happy hour started and was able to be seated with one other person immediately. The hostess was nice in advising us where to sit based on whether we wanted shade or sun.  The place did get more crowded as the evening went on so it might be a little tricky to get a seat especially on a nice day. 

My boyfriend and I only ordered beers off the happy hour menu so I don't know how their margaritas or sangria are, but they looked good. My boyfriend and I split empanadas and guacamole with chips off the happy hour menu. Neither were huge, but appropriate for the pricing. I'm always happy when happy hours offer food selections as well! 

The view is awesome and I say you go check it out for yourself!
author: Alissa T.

description:
We went here on a Monday night while in town visiting a friend. I love the atmosphere, especially for happy hour! The margaritas were fantastic, and I may have had a couple too many. 
We went here for dinner, and I wouldn't go strictly for dinner again. This is more of a just happy hour place. The happy hour deals are $7 margaritas (not as much of a deal as I would like, but still very delicious) and $5 guacamole/salsa with chips. I would highly recommend this as a place to come load up on chips and tequila. I ordered a quesadilla as well, which was like $13. It was kinda small and came with no sides. If I come again, I would come for just happy hour and stick to the chips and drinks.
author: Hilary J.

description: Awesome view and the vibes are great. A little pricey for college kids but if you want a fun place to celebrate a special occasion it's a nice outdoor restaurant
author: Hana T.

description: Everything is so cool on this restaurant, drinks , we had the 1/2 pound of chicharrón and it was amazing
author: Ricardo S.

description:
This is now one of my favorite brunch spots in the city. Make sure you plan weeks in advance and get reservations because they're rather scarce and tough to come by. It's a rooftop so there's not a ton of seating but it's worth the planning. 

I ordered the huaraches and empanadas and also tried the benedictos. Everything was exceptional. 

The empanadas were rather small but were represented as such. They tasted just like the empanadas my grandma used to make. They also came with a chimichurri dipping sauce. Pure excellence. 

The huaraches are sorta like chive and onion pancakes with tomato braised brisket and two fried eggs. They threw on some lettuce and pickled onion for good measure. Pure bliss. Though I could've done without the vegetables on top. 

The view is also stunning. Great view of downtown. I'm a huge fan of this spot and to quote the terminator, I'll be back.
author: Nick D.

description: I would say the wait time to get in was well worth it. The food was sooooo good, i love carnitas. They didn't have my favorite whiskey but the server was ON POINT with recommending something similar that i never heard of. I even saved the receipt so I can order that whiskey wherever i go.
author: Jean-Luc C.

description:
El Techo means rooftop so I have learned when lounging outside at their renowned outdoor patio!

It's a happening place to be, which explains why there's a wait in line before getting into the elevator and heading up.  Got to be seated right at the front of the wonderful view of the city, away from the crowd behind me and it was pleasant while sipping on margaritas and munching away at small bites.

I love their guacamole and ceviche de pescado.  The ceviche is full of zest and it complimented well with the chips.  

They have delightful cocktails and other refreshing drinks for the lovely setting, if the weather permits! 

Good vibes here!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for months now! 
I was super excited to come and enjoy a nice rooftop dinner with a friend but I was really let down by the service. We arrived 30 minutes before the dinner menu was out and ordered chips and drinks which by the way didn't come for another 30 minutes later. 

Once our drinks came back we ordered the carnitas from the menu for both of us to share since our waiter said it served 2 people. As we waited for our food not once where we asked if we wanted any other drinks or water. Once our food came out, our waiter left right away and didn't even bother offering us plates since we where sharing the meal or even more chips. The people sitting next to us saw how poor the service was they just offered us some of there extra clean plates. At this point my friend and I just tried to enjoy the rest of our dinner and not let it ruin our night. 

I must say although the service is not the best, the food and view almost make up for it. I will probably try it out in the near future but I'm not rushing back.
author: Mavy A.

description:
Trendy and hip.  Nice views. 
Service was attentive. Food was good.

Go with the pitcher of margarita for more bang to your bucks.
author: Joel F.

description:
Sadly disappointing. It took 3 weeks to get a brunch reservation, so the actual experience was anti-climatic. Of course it's great to have brunch on a rooftop patio, but it can't be the only redeeming factor. The eggs benedict  was good and served on jalepeno corn bread, which was a nice change. The service was TERRIBLE!! After taking our order, our server was never seen again, until check time. We had to keep asking the bus boys to bring salt, hot sauce, water, etc...

So if you want a rooftop view and are willing to wait three weeks for a table, this is your place.
author: Sheila K.

description:
I assume their good rating is based on the atmosphere and rooftop view of the city because their drinks and food could use improvement. 

The carnita was tasteless. I even added on their sauces, still tasteless. Only after I drenched it in tapatio did it taste okay... the actual piece of meat was nice and fatty though. 

As for the drinks, the Maragarita pitcher and the Sangria pitcher were subpar. I enjoyed my caipirinha most of the drinks

In terms of service, our first waiter was spectacular. Super friendly and attentive to our needs. Once his shift was over, we received a new guy. I had to go hunt him down for refills every time. 

Heat lamps keep it warm on cold days and about half the seating is covered for rainy days. It gets packed, so don't be too surprised if there is a line to get in
author: Phi N.

description: the best food i have ever had in my entire life!!!!!!!!!!! I highly recommend the chicharones el carne to all visitors of this establishment.
author: Krysta L.

description: This is a hip roof top restaurant with a young crowd.   Its super casual and good for groups.Its empanadas and choripan with a Argentina feel to the menu with some Pisco in their drinks. It has incredible views of the city everywhere you look. Its cool and windy up there but they had heaters and tents up. Service was good and it was a happy environment all around. It was more on the loud side and sometimes hard to talk. But we enjoyed our food and hummingbird drinks. There is valet parking when you arrive and then go up the elevator. If your table is not ready ypu can wait at the bar in Lolinda that is down stairs and is also great. Portions more on the small size.
author: Theresa G.

description:
CALL AHEAD and make a brunch reservation on the rooftop. Plan on starting your day with scenic views of the city, watermelon mimosas, and a filling, flavorful meal.

Located in the Mission District, El Techo's menu consists of Latin American street food. As a true Texan, I love some heat in whatever I'm eating. So naturally I ordered the Vegetarian Benedictos - two poached eggs, jalapeno cornbread (Cornbread for breakfast?! Yes please), zucchini, spinach, and chile hollandaise. We all ordered different dishes and they ALL delivered. I would also recommended ordering the watermelon mimosas. When the watermelon juice is combined with champagne, there's a reaction that causes your drink to bubble over. Our waiter played a game with us: you have to try to drink as quick as possible before it spills over!
author: Em G.

description: Super packed but great place to relax and hang out with friends. My friends and I got to stand by the view and we got to see the sun set. It was beautiful and our margaritas were good and strong LOL. I would definitely come back here.
author: Nishi S.

description:
El techo is the unassuming hip upstairs neighbor to lolinda. I had heard many good reviews about this place and when my friends wanted to come here for a catch up sesh, it was definitely a cool place to be. 
I don't really drink as much as before but it seems like it would be a great place for date night as well. 

We came here on a Thursday night around 630ish, surprisingly it was more than half filled already. There are quite a few tables and there are heat lamps and covers all over the roof, the music is kind of loud so it's not that easy to carry on a conversation. My friends ordered beers and I orders the hummingbird cocktail. It was actually decent but it bites you in the butt hard. At first it tasted pretty good but the more you drink it you get drunk faster, which can either be a good or bad thing.  We ordered gucamole&chips along with the ceviche. The guacamole was standard, there wasn't anything special about it, nor did it make
Me think it was the best ever. The ceviche on the other hand, was a small portion but for $14 it seemed generous. There wasn't anything too special about it but they did go a bit heavy handed on the lime juice.

Probably wouldn't be my first choice for Mexican food but it's a decent place for drinks!

Total: $60
author: Stella J.

description:
Tonight they hit it out of the ball park!  Food, service, ambience.  Top notch.

We ordered a lot of foot for the seven of us and kept it a coming:). Margaritas, hot chocolate and dessert.  Totally yummy.

Ceviche, shrimp cocktails, veggie and pick quesadillas, 1# of pulled pork, guacamole .  Yes!  Totally awesome.

Chilly night out but pleasant on the roof.  Great twinkles night from the City too.
author: Susan C.

description: Great food and views of downtown SF! Go for the chicharrones, served with salsa, beans, tortillas and add a bit of lime. Delicious! A half a pound is enough for 2-3 to share. I also like the plantano maduro small plate, which are served with sour cream mixed with chili - again, add some lime to tie the sweet and savory flavors together. The Empanada de Carne is another good option - they have raisins which I usually don't like in empanadas, but the ones here aren't overpowering, and the chimichurri helps balance all the flavors. I'd love to try the chuzos, pollo frito, and some drinks next time (unless I opt to try Lolinda downstairs). Tip - go on a Monday night around 6 - no wait and quick service!
author: Edwina D.

description: No reservations besides for brunch, so there is usually a solid waiting time. Once you're called, you get in the elevator up to the roof to be seated and it's so pretty! The service is awesome and the food is really expensive, but good. We ordered the plantains and empanadas de maiz. Not sure if I'll be back just because of the price.
author: Alaina P.

description:
Wow what a view! I was just here last weekend with some friends and it was great. It was a little chilly but they have these tents that help keep the heat in. 
The food was yummy. I believe we had the carnitas and let me tell you. They are so good. Our server gave a thorough explanation over the entire menu on how everything is meant to share. They are all tapas style so some dishes were bigger than others. 
I also would recommend the margaritas. We all shared a pitcher between the three of us and it was plenty. 
Anyways great experience and shoutout to our server Monica! We ended up not liking the empanadas and she had no problem with taking it away and offering something else. 
She really made our experience fun and was super sweet.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: It's okay. I've eaten here and had drinks. You come here for the rooftop and drinks, not the food. There is nothing really special about their tacos or anything.
author: Monet C.

description:
Hmmm...not impressed, mostly because of the service!

We had a birthday dinner at Lolinda, which is located downstairs of this rooftop bar. I had read about it on Yelp and wanted to check it out. My mistake!

After taking the elevator up, we were met with the hostess. She handed us the drink menu and said we can find our own seat. We were pretty confused because we didn't know if we had to order the drinks from the bar or from a server. We wondered around and walked to the bar. We saw two servers chatting and one of them saw us. Then with an annoyance said, Go have a seat and someone will take your order. He got even more annoyed when my friend asked him what was one of the drinks that was sitting at the bar. Without even looking at us, he said, third one from the top and went back to chatting. 

Normally, I would have suggested my friend to leave and go somewhere else. However, it was already late so we stayed. 

After finding a spot to sit, it took the server about 20 minutes to come to us. Once he came over, my friend asked for a recommendation. His reply was, didn't you ask me about that drink at the bar? I was thinking, yes, but we are asking for a recommendation, not about the drink at the bar.

Now I'm annoyed and my friend said I will have whatever she (me) is having. We ended up getting 2 glasses of cava. Thanks for nothing!

Then it took about 15 minutes for him to come back with our drinks. When we were ready to leave, of course it took about another 15 minutes to get the bill. 

The only thing I liked about this place was the giant champagne flute they used for the cava and the heat lamps. I enjoyed their sister restaurant but this place was a fail. I will not be back!
author: Alice L.

description: This is not the place to go for dinner if you are vegetarian. the only options is a vetetable skewer and guacomole. That being said, their drinks are fabulous. The meat dishes are also pretty good. they have a small but good happy hour menu with fried chicken and guacomole
author: Diane Z.

description:
Wow. Truly impressed! (This review is for their brunch offerings.)

I had made a reservation at 11am for brunch and it seems like it was not needed as it was not crowded, but by the time our food came, the place was packed! I understood why when I sipped my cocktail and took a bite of my food.

I got the pomelo cocktail which was one of the best cocktails I've had to date. I'm a little picky about cocktails cause I don't like syrups and packaged mixes in them, just fresh ingredients and well mixed. THIS WAS EVERYTHING I DREAM OF IN A COCKTAIL. Not too sweet, perfectly mixed, and complex flavor, with all fresh ingredients. I'll be back specifically for that cocktail!

On to the food. I got the Benedict which was served on jalapeño corn bread and with and chili hollandaise. HOLY COW! I've never had such an amazing meal. The corn bread (which by the way has whole pieces of corn in it- YUM), with a layer of wilted spinach and then the perfect poached eggs with the drizzle of sauce. Perfection. They also had a few slices of sausage on the side that was very good, but I liked that it was not the center of the meal. 

I hardly ever give out 5 stars, but El Techo deserves every single one, excellent drink, excellent food, excellent service! I will absolutely be back!
author: Nisha S.

description:
This is a cute outdoor restaurant. We had a Saturday brunch here on a beautiful day. Glad we made reservations b/c the party was seated promptly. 

Service was a little slow...but when we did get around to placing our order, the food didn't take too long to come out. I was a little bummed when the server brought back 3 of our 6 dishes and said "These will be coming out family style" Hmm. Definitely prefer getting my food at the same time as everyone else but the 5 minute delay wasn't terrible.

I ordered the carintas. The chicharon that came with was super oily! I would break off a piece and my hands would be covered in oil. But other than that, the pork, beans (especially the beans!), and veggies on the side were delicious. I think I'll come back to try their dinner menu.
author: Stacey D.

description:
Dined at El Techo on my weekend trip to San Francisco and had a great time!  We were seated in 30 minutes or so which felt super fast considering waiting time in NYC is usually ridiculous. 
The environment is fun, the view is great, it was a liiiittle chilly to be at a rooftop on a February night but totally manageable.  We got a bunch of small plates to share as well as a pitcher of margarita and they were all really good!
Can't say it's the best Mexican food I've had but it was enough to satisfy my cravings :)
author: Asa L.

description: Great drinks, good vibes, amazing views of the City! Great place to come grab a drink, especially on nice warm days in SF! Took 1 star off for the slow service - had to flag someone down after waiting almost 15 minutes for someone to take our drink order.  BUT I've been here a few times & will definitely come back again...
author: Laura C.

description:
Happy birthday to me! I invited a bunch of friends to celebrate my 28th birthday for a boozy brunch and it turned out to be a huge success! 

My friends and I had two tables of 12 people each. One table was reserved weeks in advance and the other was considered a "wait list table." A couple of things to note if you plan on getting a "wait list table." This table has a strict time restriction of 1 hour. If you bask in the sun and sip your glass of sangria any longer, they'll give you the boot and say adios. 

The food is bomb.com, tastylicious, and yummy in my tummy good! The carnitas, in particular, is a must-get dish. It's packed with flavor and not to mention, cooked to perfection. My favorite part of the carnitas are the little crunchy and crispy pieces!! (currently: mouth watering) Just give me a platter of this and I'm one happy lady.  

The view is spectacular and the vibe is laid back. I want to say it's very hipster-esque and quite frankly, the quintessential 20-somethings San Franciscan brunch spot. 

Overall, a fantastic way to celebrate my day of birth!
author: Briana H.

description:
Great margaritas,  great rooftop location!
No complaints,  but not a whole lot to say because we just shared a pitcher and took off.

They have adequate heat lamps and wind blockage . Even in the chilly wind we were comfortable.
author: Heather S.

description:
Good place to take visitors for the decent view (SF doesn't have a huge selection of roof top bars) and happy hour. 

My friends and I came at around 5:30 pm yesterday on a Tuesday, and were able to get a good table without a line. 

Tip: take the elevator 5 floors up instead of the 5 flights of stairs I took. I thought I was in the wrong building at one point! 

We ordered:
-sangria pitcher ($18 HH)
-guacamole and chips (HH)
-1/2 lb carnitas
-ceviche 

Overall, the food and sangria were good, but nothing super unique. If I were to come back, I'd go for the guac and carnitas again. Service was great. Our waitress was cheerful and kept our waters and chip bowls full.
author: Corinna T.

description: Great view. The food is ok. The portions are small. It can get cold on the patio, so take a jacket with you!
author: Ari S.

description: I can't give it more than 3 stars because the chaotic wait outside on the curb stuff.  I don't get it.  The food was great.  The chicharron was excellent and the flan was amazing.  Margaritas are a little sweet for my taste but I still got tipsy.  It gets really crowded.  Service not that great either.  The young servers thinks it's cute to ignore you a time or too but do what I do and ask who you see.  Enjoy!!!
author: Pam P.

description:
I'm up-starring this review from a 3.5 to a 4 simply because it took me over a year to finally come here for a meal, and I don't want to totally admit that I didn't enjoy it as much as I had hoped.  Like some of the other reviews, it is a little overrated.  We had to make a brunch reservation like 2 weeks in advance, and that to get a table at 1:00 PM.

The ambiance is what you would expect from a casual rooftop place with pano views of the city.  We didn't get a glamorous roof-edge table but rather one that was closer to the elevator.  I felt like I was basking in the sun though because my back and leg were not covered by the shades.  At first it was OK, but after a few mimosas, I felt like I was baking.

Food/Drink wise:
-Benedictos:  Not what I was hoping.  I thought the chorizo was going to be where the Canadian bacon would've been and not on the side.  The cornbread seemed like a good idea but because it's so much more moist than an English muffin, it crumbled more than hold each bite together.  I just felt like I was trying too hard to eat this.
-Bunuelos:  Essentially equals beignets.  That is all.
-Guacamole:  Seemed like they were bottomless???  But I wasn't sure.  Regardless, it was on point.
-Mimosas with agua fresca were delicious!  I knocked by like two of them I think.

Of note, one of the people we went with had ordered the Rancheros in the vegetarian option and got his with meat.  They were nice enough to remake it and also not to charge us for it.

Service was excellent.  Everyone was great and attentive.  Our server was also personable and easy to get a hold of.
author: Reena P.

description:
Sunny Sundays in the Mission should be accompanied by Mezcal tinged margaritas, hearty modern Mexican cuisine and a view of SF that stretches for miles. Arrive early or plan ahead with a rezzie, because this place gets pumpin. 

Nosh on their guacamole accompanied by housemade chips or sample their coctel de camaron (shrimp ceviche) while you wait for your big plate of Matambre which is a 6 oz. flat iron steak with two fried eggs, potatoes and chimichurri sauce. Is there anything more perfect with steak other than chimichurri? #methinksnot

My benedictos with two soft poached eggs on jalapeno corn bread, chorizo, spinach was crowned with a chile hollandaise sauce (!!!) that's what's up amigo!

The fun music and party vibe even brought smiles on my mama's face who was stressed taking BART from the East Bay. (coz BART has gone ghetto!) But after a fantabulous brunch at El Techo's rooftop, we turned that frown upside down!
author: Janice C.

description:
Horrible place. Went there last week sat for my friends bday. Party of 7 of us. We out our names down. Waited for 1 hour. Our names got called, went upstairs and the host hugs me like she knew me and tells us to wait a few minutes on the patio  and order a drink at the bar. 5 mins later we notice she gives our table away. I got up to her and ask her if she gave our table away and she tells me we never checked in with her. Shocked I started telling her off that she told us to wait by the patio and she hugged me like she knew me.... she had no idea who I was and basically acted like I was lying.  I complain to the manager and the manager seats us and gives us a rude remark "oh when your hungry, your hungry" and gives us a smerk look and walks away.

First of all it's been over and hour of waiting and you gave our table away, then you act like I'm lying when I ask if you gave my table away, atleast own it and apologize and the manager.... no apology just a smart ass remark.... really? Never again will I eat here because the service was f@$king horrible. And then the bastards over charged us for our drinks and it took 20 minutes to get it fixed.....

GET YOUR SH!T TOGETHER. F- this place, first and last time I will eat there.
author: Keoni G.

description:
WOW! and WOW! 
Why didn't I know about this place before. A roof top restaurant to have some awesome guac, corn empanadas, ceviche, and good quesadillas. Do not order the sangria, it's yukk but the food, the ambience, the vibe is awesome. They really, I mean really need to work on their sangria, it was worse than a store bought one. If you reach there around 5, you might not have to wait for that much, else a huge line is always there to go up. Space is limited and they have to ensure it does not gets over crowded.

If it's a nice weather, you have to try out this place, they do not take reservations for drinks but for dinner, I think you can make one. I am not sure though, will have to try it out again.
The area is separated into two parts, the dinner area has tables which are reserved for dinner, and then a place for drinks which has side racks and tables and high chairs.
author: Ramyata M.

description:
Finally went to this spot and felt like a bat at the top! 
Just had happy hour specials before work because like....I work at a bar so why not. 
They have this really cool spicy sangria shot they accompany with tequila and a beer and I got to say the savor game was real. 
Awesome guac cuz trust that guac could be ruined and my, have they found the wonders of killing it! Delicious.
I'll definitely come here again when I wanna kick it in my hood baller style.
author: Hannah M.

description:
Top notch tapas, drinks, and service! What a perfect rooftop bar to spend a summer day or evening. You can see all of downtown from the roof...and that's just the view!

My margarita was excellent. Not too sour or sweet and a lot of salt (just the way I like it). I tried the Margarita del Techo (has orange) but was too sour. 

Food was hot and came very quickly. We split the chips and guacamole, empanadas de carne, fish tacos, and the pork shoulder quesadilla. The winner was the...EMPANADAS. These were packed with flavor and served with a verde chimichurri. So freaking good! Quesadilla was cooked nicely and had lots of cheese, we used our leftover guacamole on it plus the side salsa. 

Super hip and trendy rooftop bar. Will definitely be coming back this summer!
author: Shelby S.

description:
I need to cross off this place for date night recommendation. A bit loud & it's hard to talk to each other. Great cocktails but mediocre food. 

I am sorry but I can have a burrito that is as big as my face 2 blocks away at El Farlito that also tastes better than whatever we had at El Techo. 

I only recommend this place for drinks as a group & friends
author: Thao P.

description: my experience in El Techo receiving the new year was great. My boyfriend and me thank you for your attentions
author: Pao A.

description: This place is my go-to for hosting visiting friends and family. The food is always phenomenal, the sangria is delicious, and the vibe is the best! Where else can you take people to eat at a cool, totally SF restaurant with such a great view?
author: Jake V.

description: Amazing view and atmosphere. If you're out for a nice drink and "small eats" and want that lounge/bar feel this is the place. It's on the rooftop and gives an amazing view of the entire city! Beautiful!
author: Maisha R.

description: Nice views if you're not smushed into the middle. Drinks were aight, food was whatever. Don't come here expecting to eat a lot of food for the prices either. Asked the waiter if the platano plate was good and if it was a lot of food and he made it seem like it was. When we got it, it was literally 1 fried banana cut into 4 pieces, for like 12 bucks. No sides. Just a lousy sauce to go with it. Deeply saddened by this place cause I was expecting so much more. Definitely spent more money than I feel was worth it
author: Justin A.

description: Very very slow service, as a party of two we stood around for 25 minutes on a not too busy afternoon before someone took our order.
author: Nate K.

description: THE FOOD WAS FANTASTIC! I highly recommend the pork shoulder we couldn't get enough. This place is great to grab a drink with friends and look at all of San Francisco from the roof top. We'll definitely be coming back soon.
author: Christopher I.

description:
Good place, with amazing view. Expect to be a line, it has one of the best city views in SF.

Regarding the food it is just ok, I have been here on 3 different occasions and can't say anything memorable food wise
author: Edu B.

description:
If you want a nice view, tasty food, delicious dessert, and yummy drinks... this is the place to be!  On a weekday or weekend... day or night... this spot is always lively and fun!  It's the perfect place for a date or a girls night out! 

Be prepared to wait a bit!  But it's worth the wait! I'll be back soon enough ;)
author: Marissa D.

description:
I came here with a couple friends during their happy hour time on a weekday. The weather was nice out, and we were able to get a table right away. First off, the view is AMAZING. Seriously one of the best views of the city that I have seen from a restaurant (if not the best). 

We ordered a pitcher of sangria to share, along with several plates including the guacamole, pollo frito, empanadas, and I ordered some tostada-like dish, although I forget the exact name. 

The sangria was delicious, and the guacamole was solid. The pollo frito is essentially popcorn chicken, which I am never really a fan of, so I can't comment on that, but my friends went crazy over it (they actually finished 2 plates). My friends also shared the empanadas as they have beef which I don't eat, and they seemed to enjoy it. I did enjoy my tostada as well. 

Because we were here for happy hour, the prices were very reasonable. I would definitely consider coming back for another happy hour. Can't beat the view. Nice to have a little upscale Mexican restaurant in the Mission.
author: Trusha S.

description:
This is my FAVORITE restaurant in the Mission! They have the best rooftop view in the city! Plus, the food is delicious & drinks are yummy! Recommend their pitchers ;) 

Definitely plan in advance by making a reservation; they are that busy because they are that good! Great atmosphere, views, clean, service is quick & great. Love El Techo!
author: Shawnae C.

description: Delicious food and drinks! Awesome rooftop bar on a fun block. They have another restaurant below that looks awesome too! AND BEST PART- they have pitchers of margaritas! Great spot
author: Laila S.

description: The view was great for sure, but honestly the food was nothing special and overpriced for the quality this is more of a hangout spot for drinks rather than restaurant. I would've given it 3 stars as the standard norm because of the customer service and atmosphere but I saw 2 mice while I was there to.
author: John V.

description: Great rooftop spot on top of one of my favorite spots Lolinda. Nothing like that environment, definitely more relaxed. Great for the weekend, but the waits are so long so get there early. Good place for margaritas and cocktails, casual food and great views of the Mission. Not great for large groups because of the wait, but if you are willing to wait in line definitely go for the rooftop alone!
author: Carol Ann V.

description:
I brought my girls Mariela and Diana here months ago for a little happy hour, and just now able to spread the news and catch up with my reviews. We arrived when it just opened, so we were greeted and served right away. 

There was a tent up and heaters, so there was no worry about being cold on a typical overcast day. We ordered margaritas, guacamole and chips and ceviche. Everything was pretty great and at happy hour prices, we all had smiles on our faces.

Looks like it is a great place for a sunny brunch, so we will have to return. A sunny patio in SF is my favorite spot to eat.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Even though the rooftop isn't actually that high up (the building is only 5 floors maybe?) and the view isn't super amazing, El Techo is always a fun place. On a nice day, there will definitely be a long line of people on the sidewalk waiting to get in. Seating at tables is reserved for parties that are actually ordering food, otherwise bar-height seating it is. They do have heat lamps though, if it starts to get chilly outside.

My go-to drinks are the two tequila cocktails - la paloma and the margarita - which are both great and really refreshing!

The guacamole and chips make for a yummy snack but I''m actually not a huge fan of the menu. That's not to say that the food isn't tasty, but it just doesn't stand out to me that much. It seems to lie somewhere between bar food and classier Mexican.

All in all though, who doesn't love hanging out at a rooftop bar with some snacks and good drinks?? I would come here much more often as my perfect Sunday afternoon if only the wait weren't always so long..
author: Tiffany P.

description: Ok, it's not the best mexican food I've ever had but it is a scene. As a New Yorker I should've know that we needed to make a res during Saturday brunch. There was a line outside upon getting there and it look about 30 mins to get a table. I was curious as to what to expect from the outside - the front of the building is unassuming - I actually think it's on the roof of an apartment building. The space itself was larger than I thought, with amazing views of the SF skyline. The guac was decent and for my actual meal I got the chilaquiles - it was unique in that at least 70% of the dish was chips and the other 30% were basic scrambled eggs...honestly, my favorite part was the salsa on the chips. Probably wouldn't go back if I was in the neighborhood again, but once again, it's all about the scene I think.
author: Ali C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night for the first time.  My family was already awaiting with a table for us.  As we approached the entrance we where told to wait and have my family tell the host to text the guy downstairs to let us in.  Once we go in it was on a rooftop that was cool and you have views of the bay.  The food are small plates but delicious.  Yummy
The drinks were decent and the only thing I could say that chairs we sat in where stools and after a while of sitting it becomes uncomfortable.  I enjoyed this place overall and would return or recommend.
author: Tina D.

description: The Hibiscus margaritas are worth a trip alone. Fantastic tacos and even better service.
author: Heather B.

description: Quite possibly the best chicharon I've ever had in my life! This food was worth the 1.5 hours wait outside and the additional wait upstairs for our table. The shrimp skewers were also on point.
author: Jeneth D.

description:
This place is unbelievable for more than just the view. The drinks were great as was the food. I highly recommend the quesadilla de hongos. 

What really stood out was the service. The service/cost ratio was impressive. The servers really made it a point to excel at everything they were doing. It was as if they read my mind when I needed something. They would just magically be there. I have never had service this great at any location.
author: Patrick A.

description: What makes a good restaurant? I would say good food and a nice view. El Techo hits those two on the nail. Their food is so delicious. We ordered almost everything off the menu. Also, you're situated high above the street so you get a pretty nice view of the city, especially at night. I can't wait to come back.
author: Allyson L.

description:
Pretty good food (especially the chicharrones de carne) and decent drinks too, but it would all be the usual 3.5 stars if it weren't for the scene here. 

The rooftop venue offers gorgeous views of the entire city and is the real difference between make and break for this place. If you want a table, get here as early as you can; otherwise things get super packed fast. When it does so, this place quickly becomes more about the scene than it does the food. Nevertheless, just for the atmosphere alone, paired with some decent drinks and food, this is one of those places that typifies today's gentrified West Bay.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I went here today for a birthday brunch. I arrived on time while everyone else took 45 minutes to show up (yeah, guests sucked)

Someone at the table asked if I have been here before and my answer is yes, my overall review is "overpriced Mexican food served for the hyped up San Francisco brunch."

From the moment we ordered to the first bite it took nearly an hour... I ordered scrambled eggs. After attending multiple festivals and seeing how fast the roadside tents can feed hundreds of people with scramble egg burrito for breakfast, I don't understand the wait here. Anyway, food was adequate. Nothing to remember, nothing to take pride in as a chef. 

For my scrambled eggs, guacamole and tea it was ~$30

The waiter was nice and took care of our group. The view is lovely; you will be lucky to seat on the outside line of the tables so you can surrender to the beauty of San Francisco skyline.
author: Anelya S.

description:
I give this place 3 stars because it was okay not bad but not amazing. I'd definitely return if friends wanted to but given options, I might choose somewhere else. 

The city views on a nice day are fantastic! And the vibe on the patio was casual and friendly. We had a party of 8, I felt like the wait was very fair for such a large party. 

We started with a Paloma pitcher for the table. I thought they were good and the price was decent. Everyone at the table thought their food was good. Mine was a bit salty and underwhelming, to be honest. I can see why this place is so popular and maybe given a second chance I would bump this up to 4 stars but for now I think it's a solid 3.
author: Tarah P.

description:
Rooftop bar/restaurant with heat lamps. Very nice setting and the food is delicious. The service is also pretty good usually. I recommend the brisket tostada. 

But the wait on weekends is long, the food is overpriced and there is too much ice (and not enough margarita) in the pitchers of margarita considering the price.
author: Elina P.

description: Came again to have drinks with an old coworker and catch up. Definitely had much better experience this go around than my last adventure and glad I gave this spot a second chance. We ordered the pollo fritos, quesadilla de pibil, and empanadas - all the food super satisfying and delicious. Probably the best part of this location was the view, which even on an overcast night was absolutely spectacular overlooking downtown. I'd definitely recommend this spot as a great informal place to get together and grab a bite, and am almost positive I'll be back again sometime soon.
author: Travis V.

description:
Checked out El Techo for the first time about a month ago - overall, it was an OK experience.  Didn't have reservations, but the wait that weekend afternoon wasn't too bad.  It's a little confusing on how they take you in - there was a line standing out front waiting and at the same time, folks were just going up to the hostess stand.  I walked up, added my name, and they told me to come back when my whole party was there so they could "activate" my spot.  They'll text you when your table is ready and you have about 10 minutes to get back there.

You take the elevator up a few floors and end up at their rooftop restaurant.  The top is covered, so you could still eat there on rainy days.  The view was alright - you could see downtown from far away and into the tops of the other buildings closer by.  Crowd was a bit younger - 20s/30s, so it's slightly louder (probably not a place to have any quiet conversations, though a few tables to the side might not be bad).  

Menu isn't extensive for brunch/lunch - makes it easy to order, but selections are limited.  I decided on the french toast ($12), guac & chips ($7), and a sangria ($7).  I was a little disappointed that the sangria didn't come with chunks of fruit (besides an orange slice); have had much better sangria before.  The french toast was OK, not overly impressive, and I did feel it was a little pricey for what you got.  Chips and guac were OK as well.  Portion sizes were average - this is not the place where you'd have leftovers to take home.  Some of the utensils also looked a little dirty, or perhaps just not wiped off after washing.    

Service was OK.  

I'm not sure if I'd be back - perhaps just for a small appetizer or drinks.  The food wasn't compelling enough for me to crave it again (for the price point), but you're paying for the views/rooftop experience.
author: Laura C.

description:
I've hit this spot up a few times, mostly for brunch and I have to say it's totally worth it.  The view is gorgeous -- you can see the city from there.  They also have really cute hanging lights and succulent plants as decor -- it's pretty cute.  It is hard to find rooftops in SF, but this one is a good one for sure.

I definitely recommend making a reservation, as it is pretty popular. I got the "Benedictos", which is Eggs Benedict over jalapeno cornbread, spinach, and chorizo -- and it was bomb.  That cornbread is really really good, and definitely made the entire dish for me.  

I also recommend getting the "Buñuelos" -- which are dulce de leche beignets.  They are made fresh and they are super soft, warm, and delicious.  

Only negatives I can think of -- we tried to get mimosas but the orange juice is made fresh and it hadn't been made yet...so we had to wait 20 minutes or so.  Also, the menu is very limited -- not enough options for everyone.  

The service is great, the food is great, and the view is awesome -- I would recommend it, and I will definitely keep coming.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Great view, great sangria, awesome service. 
Would recommend for drinks no doubt. 
Food?, eh there surely has to be something better..
author: Bart B.

description: Came here during happy hour and I was I was happy I was able to get discounted drinks with a view of San Francisco. Staff was pretty friendly and they made sure we were doing well at all times. Parking can be difficult, luckily there is a parking garage down the street.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Cute lit' rooftop eatery. The food was....okay...sad to say, like many b area restaurants, food is lacking in flavor big time. 

i think the millenials come for the ambience...chat and mingle..dont' have many rooftop eateries in sf....super small portions,...yes kind of overpriced...even for the HH....ordered 4 small plates....guac, chicken, empanadas (veg) & (carne). Ordered 3 skewers. Spent $60 and still hungry. lol empanadas are small, 2 pcs each plate, no side salad. Guac came with alot of greasy fresh fried tortillas--didn't feel there was enuff guac for the chips, chicken (fried) bits were maybe 6 small pieces smaller than nuggets...approx .15 lb if that, with some julienned slaw....skewers were $7 each or more.....stayed less than an hour...

Flavor was lacking. All ya got to do is gently flavor with fresh peppercorn, salt, or blend up some sauce or some dried rub on the skewers and it'd be completely transformed. Fried chicken was just fried and came with a citrus chopped up red onions dipping sauce, the skewers had nothing rubbed on em, grilled and some red onions over them. Empanadas had dipping sauce. 

the place got almost 100% filled by 530pm.Felt even with "HH" menu, it's still a lit' overpriced...and the standards of food has gone down in the b area. think it's become more of an experience going out to eat. i 've gone to so many places where the food is so bland. The poster from LA is right...we have no expectations anymore lol. Perhaps it's because nobody cooks anymore.
author: Tiffany W.

description: It was like pulling teeth to be given fruit for our diabetic friend because they don't serve food between 3-4. Then once we got orange slices we asked for guacamole that we never got delivered, we were able to finish the chips and drinks that were ok and we took off. Didn't see our waiter more than twice. So avoid going there between these hours but maybe the food is ok.. didn't want to stick around to find out.
author: Bryan S.

description:
About a 30 min wait with no reservation, pretty difficult to find parking. 
The guacamole was okay. 
The chicharrones were really delicious. We ordered 1/2 lb to share, came with tortillas refried beans jalapeños and a salsa. It was enough to fill 2. Chicharrones were perfectly cooked and had a little sweet taste to them.
author: Eric M.

description:
Trendy hip rooftop tapas and bar. Awesome view of mission and SF. Friendly staff and food is pretty good. It can get loud so intimate conversations are hard. The menu is limited though but some Items I recommend include the carnitas, beef empanadas 
And the Benedicto. A dish Im not impressed is the chilaquiles. The drinks and cocktails are awesome, but don't get any dessert, you can get better sweets somewhere else.
author: Mel G.

description:
Brunch review. 

Pan de elote (cornbread) - 3/5
Bunuelos (beignets) - 3/5
Guacamole + chips - 3/5
Benedictos - 4/5
Carnitas - 4/5

Overall, "I'm a fan."
author: Mark O.

description:
For what it is, I enjoy El Techo when I can get in.  The flip side to this statement is that I find it nearly impossible to get in on certain nights of the week due to demand. I think it's more of a seasonal thing, since people in San Francisco have different definitions of cold than other parts of the continent. Usually there is a lineup outside, and it can get pretty lengthy. They'll take your number and let you know when your spot is ready (which allows you to hit up another bar while you wait).

Last time I was here was during a downpour, but they had everything protected nicely with large tents inside, and a small canopy for the walk from the elevator. It was definitely an interesting view with the rain and tent combo at night. The best time for a view is definitely when it's still light out, and you can soak up all that sun on the nice rooftop.

The food I've ordered here has all been tapas style, my favourite being the guac and chips. Can get a little expensive depending on how much you order.
author: Rajeev S.

description:
I really wanted to check out El Techo because not only do they have good happy hour deals, it's also a rooftop bar.

Rooftop.... bar! I can be pretend to be bougie once in a while. :)

I assumed that since it was raining the night we went, the bar wouldn't be open. But apparently, rooftop + rain = ain't no thing because they put up tents. Woohoo!

Happy Hours are Monday through Friday from 4pm-6pm. They have $4 cerveza, $5 bar bites, and $7 margaritas. We ordered A LOT of rounds of margaritas, sangria, flights of wine, and flights of tequila!

Besides coming back for their happy hour, I'll definitely want to come back and check out their brunch or dinner. Cheers!
author: Christine S.

description: Excellent place to eat, truly latin street food. Excellent ambiance, I highly recommend the happy hour.
author: Kaushik C.

description:
Can't even try to give it two stars because we couldn't be seated. Wanted to grab a few cocktails after we had brunch, but the hostess wouldn't allow us to be seated if we were only drinking("Our servers would prefer that you order food as well"). And we didn't have the option of sitting at the bar because the space isn't available.

My suggestion, as someone who works for a rooftop lounge, don't turn away guests who are going to come in and spend money. I know that servers can rack up a bigger bill with food, but liquor can also add up. Would have come in and spent a substantial amount.
author: Viera B.

description:
If you want an amazing view of San Francisco, a great brunch menu, delicious cocktails, and a great service then I suggest you try this place put.  They boast of being one of the top brunch spots in San Fran.  If you like tasty bunuelos, huevos rancheros, pitchest of margaritas, etc....then come thru.

I reccomend you make reservations for brunch, which is served on Saturday and Sunday.  Other days, no reservations are accepted.  You walk in and take the elevator to the PH floor.  This is the sister restaurant to Lolinda.  It's a great place to enjoy a meal among friends and is located in the heart of mission.
author: Luarnie B.

description:
It's a hot Saturday in SF, so I was, of course, expecting a wait for this rooftop eatery. I wasn't expecting 45 min when we were told 30 min for 2 people. 

Despite all the shaded tables, we were 1st seated at a table that was in direct sunlight which was roasting! We got a move to another spot (as well as the next 5 parties that were seated there). 

Our order came out quick... Suspiciously quick. We got our brunch orders (sans French toast) within three minutes of placing the order. What didn't come out was the water that we had asked for when we order as well as the French toast.

Ten minutes after finishing we had to finally flag down our server to ask for our water and French toast. She told I said she had been saving it for dessert. WTF?!?! No one had asked her to save it for our dessert. When we place the order with presume that all of the items that come out either together or shortly there after not that we would have to ask for the rest of our order.

I dishes are never cleared so we move into the place next to us which is now empty and hope that they will be eventually clear. Water rise five minutes later. Ten minutes later the French toast arrives. Without any syrup, just an empty cup with the syrup of us to go so we had to ask for that separately as well.

The drinks here were great. The food was mediocre. The service was lacking. Granted, it was a busy day, however the service did not seem to be especially rushed or frazzled so one would believe that they were able to handle this level of volume.

I wouldn't come back on my own for brunch. Just too many hurdles to get fed and get out.
author: Caleb H.

description: The food was above average; however, my server, Arturo, was the rudest person I encountered during my trip to San Francisco. I politely asked to speak to the manager, and he responded, with an extremely aggressive demeanor, "what's the problem?" He never brought the manager to my table. If you are Arturo's boss and you see this, have a word with for me because he insisted I not speak to you.
author: Trevor A.

description:
Me encanta El Techo! I must say, this place is definitely one of my new favorite spots in the city and I don't know how it took me this long to find this place. I miss rooftops from New York City, so El Techo provides that majestic view of downtown SF and the entire Bay. I must admit, it's prime real estate and they know how to cater to the hip SF crowd. 

I came here with a friend for Sunday brunch and didn't make a reservation, so tip 1, if you know you're going to come, make a reservation. Our wait was about an hour or so, but there are plenty of places to drink/eat around nearby and it is nice since they have the text message alert for you. 

FOOD: Bunuenlos. Pan de Elote. Huarache. Carnitas. The Buenuelos are like beignets, but oh my, the dipping into dulce de leche is to die for. What a way to start off brunch with the nice warm fluffy beignet and dunk that into some nice silky dulce de leche. After that, we got the pan de elote. That pepper jelly that is served with the elote itself is out of this world.
