I'd definitely pass on this next time. I ended up trading drinks with a friend and drinking his La Paloma instead. A better balance of sour and sweet.

Even though I love rooftop bars, I hate feeling like a sardine. It feels that way here. It's a little too crowded and unorganized. We were left roaming around trying to find a spot to sit. Luckily my friends found a small space along the wall.

On a nice slow day, I think I'd enjoy El Techo. Only next time, I think I'll ask for my drinks extra stiff!
author: Elena N.

description: Heard great things about El Techo and was excited to come try it out. We arrived and there was a waiting list, 5 people ahead of us. We provided our phone number and name to the hostess and were told we'd receive a text when our table was ready. We waited an hour before checking back with the hostess and she advised she no longer had our name/number on the list. I asked if it was possible that she wrote the number down incorrectly and she admitted that this could have been the case but we would have to add our name back to the bottom of the list if we wanted to continue waiting. She was kind enough to let us know that by the time she would get to our name again, the kitchen will already be closed. Bummed we had to wait so long and then had to start from the bottom of the list again.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
One of the few rooftop bars in the city, and the best part is that it's covered so you get the outdoor but don't need to freeze your butt off.

We shared the beignets, the benedict and the techo rancheros. The beignets were really good. It was slightly under cooked in the middle. Wish they cooked it through because the raw dough didn't have the nice puffy texture of the cooked dough, but with that great caramel sauce, I would dip paper napkin in it and still think it's delicious. The techo rancheros was beans with nicely braised pork and fried egg. It was fabulous. My friend and I both agreed that it was better than the benedict. The benedict was good, too, although a much smaller size than the rancheros. It has a big hunk of soft corn bread and nicely poached eggs. 

I'll definitely come back to try out the other options and also to try their cocktails. I just wish they take reservations. We only had to wait around 5 minutes before we were seated.
author: Alice W.

description: I was told not to come back to this establishment by the waitress and it was after a very calm discussion about the drink refills. We, as a group, were very taken back after a lovely dinner. I just wanted to say how upset we were after this because we did not cause any trouble and it was my friends birthday. Since the waitress does not want us back, she has just lost the company of 8 lovely women. I hope she feels better losing business for her work because before that, I was going to come back for multiple occasions. Hope you got what you wanted. Thank you for your service.
author: Leah S.

description: Horrible service, horrible experience form A to Z. The hostess at the door said we had two parties ahead of us. Guess what ? We saw about 10 parties get in ahead of us and we were just 3 people. She knew we were waiting and she just kept staring At us until I went up and was like why are all these people coming in and I still didn't get my text. She was like "oh, we texted u" she never did she lied about that and plus even so she knew we were ahead of all these people and she didn't bother to check with us or anything. No consideration whatsoever!!! We went up and service was very poor we waited again 10min before we got Any attention at all... food was average, could have better food next door with less wait. This place is totally overrated, I will not comeback here again! I work in the service industry and this is far from being close to average! Ruined my bday brunch!
author: Mona O.

description:
2 stars for the view of sf.  

We waited in line on the street and the bouncer asked us if we wanted to reserve a table so we did. The wait time to get into the restaurant was around 20 min for a Saturday night. 

We got seated and our waiter did not come by for about 30 minutes. Our waiter was a man on the bulkier side and he wasn't dressed very hip like the other servers. We ordered our drinks and food immediately. 

An hour later we had no food and a pitcher of sangria. And our waiter was missing. 

We spoke to another waiter and he told us our 1/2 pound of meat was on its way to our table. We didn't order 1/2 a pound of meat as I am vegetarian. 

The manager came around and told us we would have a complimentary item as we had been waiting for food for over an hour. 

The bill came and the complimentary item was on the tab. 

The bathroom also had shattered glass in the sink and all over the floor. I'm glad I wasn't wearing sandals. 

TL;DR: Nice view. Awful server. Nice manager. Mediocre food.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Great rooftop, delicious food and drinks, super friendly and helpful service. We've been quite a few times for just drinks and small bites but last night we decided to have dinner and it was great! Kaylin was our server and she is absolutely wonderful! If you have any doubts on food or drinks, she will definitely help you out!
author: Mirta D.

description: If you've never been to El Techo before just keep in mind that they mean it when they say, the roof. So if its chilly out make sure that you bring your jacket. They do provide heaters but if you're someone who gets cold easily (like me) it can get uncomfortable. I've been here on a few occasions visiting SF. I am sucker for a good view and this is definitely one of the best. I usually only come here for drinks and to see the city lights. This time we came for dinner. Since it was on a Saturday around 7 p.m. we did have to get on the wait list. It was fine though. There is a small bar, Laszlo, right next door. So grab a drink and chill. They sent a text once our table was ready and we were seated pretty quickly once we got upstairs. We ordered chips and guacamole to start and although I've heard complaints about the price, I rather expect to pay a little more in bigger cities so I didn't mind. Food is served tapas style and we ordered Tacos de Pescado and Pollo Frito to share. The tacos were bigger than most I've see at tapas style restaurants and we were very happy with the flavor as well. The Pollo Frito was tender and not overly fatty which can sometimes happen with chicken thighs. The salsa was good as well. Although it contained habanero it didn't strike me as being too hot.  I also ordered their sangria which is some of my favorite sangria ever. I highly recommend it. Overall it was a great dining experience, between the food, the drinks and the view of the city, what's not to enjoy?! I can't wait until my next visit, even if I'll have to wear my mittens to enjoy my chilled beverages.
author: Lyndsey B.

description:
Rooftop.
Saturday.
Summer.
Brunch.

Brunch is a big "thing" in SF now, & if you're in this city you've been doing brunch for a while.

But rooftop brunch?  
Now that's different.

I got 8 of us together.  I was worried when I woke up to a very cloudy, overcast morning.  I booked El Techo specifically so we could soak up the sun while we take in the striking rooftop view.  I almost cancelled to book elsewhere.

So glad I didn't!

The host rocked.  Our server rocked.  The weather thankfully, & gratefully, cooperated.  

We started w watermelon mimosas.  All the girls had 2 each.

And the food?  Absolutely Delicious.  

Chips & guacamole.  Their salsas.  Empanadas.  And the chicharrones?  All fantastic.

The Techo Rancheros were the winner at the table.  4 peeps ordered them.  And they all cleaned their plates.

The chicharrones de carne.  Comes w their own corn tortillas.  This was my pick, & I ordered the smallest portion (a quarter pound).  So much delectable roasted & fried pork shoulder!  It had this unforgettable brown sugar crust.  In a word, it was FABULOUS!  The monstrous chicharron crowns the dish.  It's a total showstopper.  Unlike conventional chicharrones, these are not made w pork rind.  But they're absolutely decadent; & they're somehow rich & light at the same time.  Lip smacking good.  Perfect w cocktails.

Even though my man ate about half my dish (in addition to his own), AND I plated several chunks to share w the table, I still had more than enough for me.    

The only thing remotely negative was the sticky table.  Even after I asked for it to be wiped down, it was still sticky.  As in, our plates-stuck-to-the-table-&-put-your-hands/arms/anything really-on-the-table-w-much-trepidation sticky.  It felt like someone covered it w simple syrup & let it dry.  

But, the food, atmosphere, service, & the vibe all made up for it.

It was a truly great brunch.  An SF must-do.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Best view of the Mission you can get..... LOL b/c the view of the mission is a great view?

Price: Look to spend about $15 per main dish and $8 for a cocktail. They also have small dishes (appetizers) for about $15.

Parking: Street/little lot

Service: ok.

Drinks: Pitcher of sangria was hecka watered down. 

Food:
Benedictos $14: was interesting.. recommended by the waitress. My taste buds were confused. They just didn't understand the sticky cornbread. Eggs were eggs... Just an interesting combination of flavors. 

Notes: The vibe was pretty cool, but I probably wouldn't return based upon everything else.
author: Krystle T.

description:
We came here for brunch last weekend because I've been dying to try this place and were not disappointed. I looked at the menu before coming and decided on the benedicto with chorizo because it had jalepeño corn bread. Anything with cornbread sounds awesome to me, and this dish was just that, awesome!!! The sautéed spinach was a nice touch and the chorizo was really good, which is saying something because I usually don't care for it. 

My hubby ordered the huevos rancheros, which was not as good as my dish, but I stupidly suggested we split everything and had to eat half. Poor me. Jk it was good though. Our server was nice, but a little busy so she took awhile to bring the check. Not a big deal, but my husband did have to rush to work so that he wouldn't be late. 

Anyway, I can't wait to come back and try the dinner and drink options!
author: Steph L.

description:
I've been here for drinks in the afternoon and for brunch. Unfortunately when I came for brunch it was raining so we couldn't see any views. We got the chips and guac which I didn't think were anything special. The guac was kind of plain. The brunch menu was pretty limited FYI. I got the hurache, which I enjoyed a lot. The pickled onions were spicy though and an unnecessary addition. I also got the peppermint tea which was good and not too strong. 

Overall: I don't think I would go out of my way to come back here for brunch, but I've heard the pork quesadilla at dinner is amazing.
author: Jenna G.

description:
Went after Sunday brunch at 3pm. Sat at the bar. Bartender was very nice even though he made it clear his shift was ending in 30 min and not-so-subtedly asked us if we just wanted to close our tab with him. 

Ordered a piña colada. Definitely not the best piña colada and not worth that price. The view was great and the air show was on while we were up there. Cool experience. But personally not worth the rave everyone talks about. Haven't tried the food though. One time try and that's all it'll be for me
author: Vanessa D.

description: This place is definitely trendy and the view is amazing. We ordered a few plates and the chicharones definitely stood out as a favorite. The salsas on the side were so good I would eat them alone! My biggest issue was the service. I felt like our table was an afterthought for the waiter. We were never served water, and we were left to fend for ourselves in search of napkins and utensils. Luckily, we had table neighbors that had extra utensils. I think if I return I'll just go for a drink and enjoy the atmosphere.
author: Emily M.

description:
Chicharrones y Carne, si! Omg, this dish is divine. The meat (pork shoulder) is cooked to perfection, tender, and juicy. And to add the crunch of chicharrones (fried pork rinds) to the mix, you've got a fiesta in yo mouth. Seriously, it's good and will have your taste buds dancing. This is what you come here for and sure, yes, the view, but really, just the chicharrones y carne, por favor.

The wait is no fun to get up to the rooftop where the food and fun are located but once you're up there, the space heaters and selection of drinks will keep you warm, toasty, and buzzy. And if you can steal a spot, the cityscape view really isn't too shabby either. 

It is loud and lively, so if you're looking for something intimate, this is not it. Make it in time for happy hour M-F 4p-6p. And keep the chicharrones coming.
author: Amy L.

description:
I love this place one of the best rooftop bars in SF! I would highly recommend visiting this bar/restaurant when you're in SF. On the plus side if you want higher end food the rooftop bar is connected to an Argentinian steak house called Lolinda (great food). 

For drinks I would recommend the sangria, margaritas, and they have great Mexican beer. For food you can't go wrong with the pork quesadilla/vegetarian or the 1.5 lbs of carnitas (you can construct your own soft tacos). 

Great views of the city and very social atmosphere! Check it out and you will not be disappointed.
author: Kunal T.

description: Not really my type of people here, but the food was so good and the views are amazing that it's totally worth it.
author: Hallie R.

description:
First of all, this place gets an automatic 5 stars for our amazing server Marky Mark. So sweet, attentive and helpful. 
The venue has an amazing view, the margaritas are perfect (and strong) and the happy hour prices were super reasonable. We had the pollo frito (a Marky Mark suggestion) and it was delicious. We will definitely be back.
author: Rose M.

description: Mostly excellent if you are prepared well.  The food is amazing, great tapas to share, especially the chicharones.  The staff were attentive and friendly and the food came relatively quickly.  The view is fantastic and if the weather is nice, this is a great place for rooftop dining.  If it is chilly, there are lots of heaters.  It is very loud and was difficult to hear our table for four.  They do not take reservations, so be prepared on a busy time.  Our Friday evening took nearly 90 minutes for our party of 4.  We had some drinks next door and they were kind enough to text us when the table was ready.  Great food and atmosphere, but be prepared for a wait during busy times.
author: Steven B.

description: SUCH a fun place to come for brunch on weekends during the summer time. Beautiful views and even more delicious food and drinks!
author: Sydney N.

description:
This rooftop restaurant/bar in the Mission is one of my favorites. The views, vibes, food and drink keep me coming back for more whenever I'm in the area. The crowd is what you would expect (mostly hipsters). The service is usually quite good. Go to the sides of the restaurant to see the twinkling lights of the Mission.

The lines to get in can be daunting. There is a hostess counter at the entrance to the elevator that takes you upstairs. Once you get upstairs, you grab whatever seat you can get. Probably best to come with a group of four or less, if you're wanting to eat. It's a lively, bustling environment. All the food and drinks I've had there have been reasonably priced and tasty. I suggest tapas to share. 

El Techo is a cool place to catch up with friends, meet a date, or grab a drink after a movie at the next door Alamo Drafthouse Cinema. Check it out if you're in the 'hood!
author: Wendy N.

description:
El Techo is like the touristy spot for locals--it's fairly well known by San Franciscans, loved on Thrillist, packed to the brim, and is among the most Instagramable places featuring gourmet grilled skewers and sangria on a rooftop bar over a view of Downtown SF (albeit an often foggy view).

For those like me who are not too familiar with Latin American food beyond Tex-Mex fare, I strongly suggest looking at pictures ahead of time, or else everything on the menu will sound similar and you'll spend too much time poring over the menu when you should be soaking up the view.

(+) CHUZOS (mix n match 3 skewers for $19): Pricey but recommended. El Techo is affiliated with the famous Lolinda Argentinian steakhouse for a reason. Although there are more burnt parts than my OCD-about-carcinogens self would have liked, their grilling technique is distinctly delicious: flavorful, tender, and unbelievably juicy. The only problem is the same with all skewers i.e. how difficult it can be to get them off the stick (only here it's worse because it's pricey and it would be terrible if any pieces were to fall to the ground.

(+) Camarones (white shrimp, aji amarillo glaze, salsa criolla, add $3): Price addition on top of the already pricey menu seems steep, but there will be no regrets. The charred fresh shrimp with the piquant sauce is very memorable, and the thick layer of onions and cilantro garnish makes it ever more interesting. 

(++) Pollo (chicken, red onion, aji amarillo glaze): Who knew chicken could be so juicy omg. This is magical.

(+) Vegetales (zucchini, eggplant, onion, pepper, aji amarillo, minus $1): lol minus $1. Not bad and the chopped cilantro topping adds complexity, but didn't blow me away the way the shrimp and chicken did. Though I'm not a big carnivore, I would recommend the meat options.

(++) CHICHARRONES de CARNE (roasted and fried chunks of pork-shoulder with house made tortillas, lime, salsa, escabech, half lb for $15): The fatty tender pork belly we enjoy in ramen, in roast pig form. It could have used a bigger container of the spicy salsa, but overall the tenderness and the seasoning with a big kick made this my favorite at El Techo. If I were omnivorous before, the chicarrones de carne would make me an omnomnomivore if not a carnivore. 

(-) SANGRIA (red wine, brandy, citrus, pineapple, pitcher $25): A pitcher lasts you awhile to enjoy the view, but was meh. Couldn't taste the brandy, no strong taste of infused fruit, and seemed a bit diluted; I personally prefer DIY sangria, but a cocktail pitcher completes the bar dining experience.

Pricey, crowded, and local-touristy, but definitely a bucket list necessity!
author: Edna C.

description: Always my go-to restaurant/bar when I have visitors in town. This time around, we got the guacamole, empanadas de maiz, chicharrones, and a pitcher of the margarita (I prefer the classic). The chicharrones were super tender and flavorful and the empanadas were fresh and tasty!
author: Lynn K.

description: Fantastic view! Terrible service. Wasn't very busy and it took 15 mins for two margaritas. We ordered food (2 happy hour apps, one was chips and salsa) that never came. After waiting an addition 30 mins we asked for the check and left. The friend I was with said that was his fourth time there and the service was awful every time. Margaritas were okay though and the view is great. Would be nice if they added some bar stools and improved their service
author: Mark B.

description: Make a reso if you're coming for brunch. We didn't, got there 10 minutes before they opened on a Sat morning, and still waited about 30 minutes for a table. We had the jicama salad, the carnitas, bunuelos, and the chilaquiles. Everything was good. The high was the carnitas, so good! The low was the bunuelos, they were ok, just not that memorable. It's a hip happening spot and has a beautiful view of SF since you're on the roof top.
author: Vivian L.

description: Food was amazing! Went with 5 girlfriends and ordered a number of plates. The chicarons are a must, comes with tortillas & bean. Second fav was the quesadilla with braised pork. The plátano was yummy with a spicy sauce. Empanadas were also good.
author: S R.

description:
Went around 6:30 on a Tuesday night. Had a 20 min wait. Once my boyfriend and I got up there, it was so loud we couldn't hear each other speak. The service was slow and everything was overpriced. 
Chips & guacamole was $10?!?!? And the cocktails were too pricey to even bother reading the options. 
Buuttttt the views were awesome and the food was soooo good. I had the pork quesadilla which was basically like eating pulled pork with a Mexican twist. Loved it.
author: Jackie L.

description: The 1 star is purely for my experience with the hostess trying to enter El Techo. It was a Wednesday at 5PM and I was meeting my husband and a friend on the rooftop for cocktails. They had been there a while already and told me just to come up. It was my first time at El Techo so I didn't realize there was a hostess sitting there that you had to check in with. When I walked passed her, she shouted at me to check in. I was taken aback because there were no signs or anything that say "YOU MUST CHECK IN" and normally, when you have friends at a restaurant already, you can just go straight in to meet with them. She then told me that I needed to have my husband tell the hostess on the rooftop my name and then that hostess would have to come down to her and tell her it was okay for me to go up. This seems kind of ridiculous, considering it was a Wednesday and there was plenty of space once I actually got in. I would understand if it was busy, but the hostess told me they were at capacity...which I did not believe. I was very confused and all she told me to do was stand at the nonexistent line and wait until she approves me to go in. I'm not sure if this is actually the protocol, but from my interaction with the hostess, it seemed like she was just making me do these extra things because she thought I was being rude when I walked by her and didn't check in. After 10 minutes of calling my husband, asking him to come down, I finally was "allowed" to go in. Needless to say, this put me in a very sour mood and I won't be coming back even if the views are great and the happy hour drinks are cheap. I'd rather go spend my money at a place that values their customer experience.
author: Caroline B.

description:
Finally!!! A rooftop dining and bar without the wind factor and easily affordable (happy hour!)!! The food doesn't have to be good because you could come for the experience, but it is. Its perfectly true to the Mission with their tacos, chips and guacamole, and sangrias. So come for the food, drinks, and rooftop experience!

Best for groups of 4 or less to get quick seating.
author: Regina D.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday celebration over the weekend. There had to be 15 of us and we were a LOUD group. They were able to put us in a corner booth on the roof. Most of us had to stand, but it worked out just fine because we were all drunk and able to mingle with everyone else in the group. 

Our waiter was great. He was very patient and checked up on us every once in a while. The food was quite good as well. I ordered the Pork Quesadilla and it was filling! I thought it was going to be tiny, but I actually wasn't able to finish it and I usually eat a lot! Basically, I got what I paid for. 

The bar had unique drinks as well. They didn't have Jack Daniels or Grey Goose, but that's because they support local business and after hearing that I really appreciated it! The bartender was able to give me a different type of whiskey and it still did the job, maybe even more! 

Overall, I loved the vibe, the service, and the view! I will be coming back! :)
author: Meliza M.

description:
Honestly, I am one more visit away from giving this 5-stars. So far I've been here twice (neither time for brunch) and I've seriously loved it. On any day, getting there by 530pm after the work hour has ended means there's always a line of about 20 people for the rooftop. I have never come here with the patience and the plan to wait. 

The first time we just had some of the draft beers and some appetizers at the bar. The empanadas were so tasty. Everything seems super fresh here. 

The more recent time I came, tried one of the mezcal cocktails. The bartenders are solid and the service is really nice. We sat at the bar upstairs, and he was always attentive and quick. We had the braised pork belly and ceviche. Both were absolutely delicious. The pork belly blew me away both in flavor, presentation, and portion size. Something I'd definitely see myself ordering again. The ceviche was also top notch. Fresh, flavor was spot on and again to share between two people -- it was the perfect size. 

El Techo is pretty grand inside with seating on the ground floor and huge second floor space with a nice sized bar up there, too. It's dark, sexy, and trendy. But the best part is that the food is quite awesome and the prices aren't that unreasonable for the quality and service you get. 

More pork belly in my belly please.

Also, why are there not that many rooftop bars in SF? Get on it.
author: Priti K.

description:
I came here for brunch on X-mas Eve at around noon with a couple of friends. To my surprise, it wasn't packed. The service was phenomenal and the rooftop view was exquisite. The waiter was kind and reassured me that my dish was coming soon when I began to look a bit impatient. 

For starters we ordered the beignets topped with powdered sugar and a side of dulce de leche dipping sauce. I'm not a big fan of sweets, but this sweet treat was definitely up my alley. The dulce de leche complimented to the plain beignets really well. I ordered the eggs benedict on top of jalapeño corn bread with a side of spinach and chorizo. And let me tell you, this dish was delicious, pure perfection! I finished my entire plate. Overall It was definitely a satisfying brunch, wasn't on the heavy side at all and a very pleasant experience. I would definitely recommend this place and will be coming back again in the near future.
author: Anais G.

description: 10/10 is what I would describe Alberto, our great and wonderful server. The bathrooms were very spotless and there's two!! One upstairs and one downstairs!! The downstairs one has this really cute and small sink too it was so adorable! The staff was so friendly it made me reallly appreciate the fact that they let me charge my phone since the battery was dying and we had a lot of servers come by and ask if we needed help etc. Love that these guys value their customers! The view from the roof top towards the SF Bay is beautiful which was the primary reason I wanted to see the place. They had heaters too which was very pleasant. For drink we had the Sangrias, piña coladas, Margaritas El Techo & the Paloma! All very flavorful & delicious! We unfortunately got there too late to try the food but the drink selection alone was great! Would definitely recommend :)
author: Teresa H.

description:
I was super excited to have dinner at this rooftop bar/restaurant. We didn't arrive until 9:15pm but only waited about 20 minutes for a table. If you are only there for drinks then the wait is much longer and you have to get in line outside on the sidewalk. If you go for dinner they take your name and number and text you when a table is ready. We went next door to have a drink while we waited. 

The views were pretty amazing despite the foggy night. I'm glad the restaurant has plenty of heaters because it was a typical chilly summer night. We ordered 1lb of chicharrones, quesadillas de hongo, and guacamole to share among three people. 

The chicharron and carnitas were absolutely the best I have had outside of Mexico, and my family is from Michoacan...the Mexican state famous for its carnitas. They were hot and feel apart, salty and sweet, just a plain delicacy. If you go to Techo and you don't order the chicharrones then you absolutely missed out. The handmade tortillas! MMM...amazing! The guac was actually my least favorite part. I thought it needed a little more flavor. The chips did not taste fresh either. 

Overall I loved this place. The ambiance is great for a night out for friends, although it is a little loud sometimes. I can't wait to go back for some more chicharron and carnitas!
author: Diane R.

description:
ahhhh Techo, I love to hate you and hate that I love you. Such mixed feelings about this spot.
It is hard to find a rooftop bar in San Francisco hence the often MASSIVE lines outside of El Techo on a weekend when everyone in the Mission decides to go out at the exact hour.  But, if you're lucky and passing by with no line, El Techo is worth checking out.  I have been here three times and have always enjoyed the view/drinks but have not enjoyed the service.  Although they do make sure to not overcrowd this place the service is always lacking in the cocktail/bar area of the rooftop.  It seems the servers are often overwhelmed with far too many tables that you will get ignored for a long ass time. 
So a few tips: know what you want to order right away because you never know when you'll see your server again.  Ask to cash out immediately, again, if you all of the sudden need to bounce you won't be able to find that server and cash out right away.  Order the pitcher of margarita.  On a nice day, lets the real, you're not just going to have that one marg so opt for the pitcher and this avoids needing to ask for more drinks, and more waiting. 

***Also, had an off-putting experience here this past weekend.  The server cashed us out on our card but accidentally gave us another guests credit card in our book... this makes me a bit nervous because if this card had gotten into a different persons hands they could have taken it and run but we returned it.  Makes me question the servers here and their ability to be on point/pay attention to what they are doing.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Brunch Review

Eggs benedict portion compared to the other options is sad, that aside, the chorizo sausage was really good, everything else was just a-ok

My friends loved the beignets so much that they had to order one more round 

Steak and eggs dish was underseaoned however steak was tender 

Aqua fresca (watermelon that day) - refreshing on its on, didn't marry that well with the cava and also be careful when pouring, it will erupt like a volcano if you put too much cava

Guacamole was fresh but lacked seasoning 

Overall Thoughts 

I'll stick with their dinner menu
author: Eddie W.

description:
If you love a good quality food dish this is not the place for it. Food was mediocre and not worth the price I paid for. Service was average/decent to my standard. I am a great tipper and so that I did do. Tipped great. The coffee was delicious. Margarita was bland. We ordered a pitcher and I expected a lot of fruits in it. Only had two orange wedges and ice. Honestly the best part is the rooftop vibe. Overall the food was bland and the margarita was too. Best part is being up top and my cup of joe. Beignets... Better off getting a donut and dipping it in a regular jar of dulce de leche. 

This place can do better. We should have just gone to CHA CHA CHA's... That place serves better food and tastier with great flavor. This place is too bland. Please work on good quality dishes and step up the food game flavor. Price is not worth paying for boring tasteless dishes.
author: Alessandra E.

description: This place is amazing! The food is so good and the atmosphere is fantastic. They play great music loud and the vibe is super fun.
author: NapaBunny 7.

description:
My bff and I came to El Techo for happy hour on a Friday. We arrived at 4:05 pm, and to our surprise, there was already a line for the bar! It opens at 4 pm so we thought we were early... lol. We went up the elevator and sat ourselves at one of the tall tables. For the coveted outer window seats facing downtown, you probably have to be first in line.

We started with the tequila flight ($13) and the rose flight ($11). We split both of them so it was a good amount! We also got the sangria pitcher ($18) a little bit later. We wished the sangria was sweeter!

For food, we ordered the beef empanadas ($5) and the pollo fritos ($5) from the happy hour menu. The beef empanadas were good, but nothing to write home about. Filled with a lot of beef, and came with some green sauce/oil that was yummy on top. The pollo fritos were little bites of fried chicken that were delicious!! I would get these again. It came with a pink sauce that sort of tasted and looked like a mignonette but I guess it's the "habanero salsa"--still great! We also ordered a 1/2 lb of the chicharrones ($19) and elote (3 for $9). The chicharrones could've been a meal in itself... The huge plate of pork shoulder came with tortillas, pickled veggies, black bean sauce, and salsa! The meat was really tender and tasted great as tacos! This was definitely the best thing here! The elote was just alright to me... I feel like my friend and I made it better at home. :P Plus at $9 for 3 small pieces, it's a little sad (when you can get 2 whole corn cobs for $1!!!).

Service was spotty and here and there, our waiter forgot a few things but it was pretty busy for a Friday happy hour! We had a great time here and I would love to come back! And hopefully get those outer window seats..... 8)
author: Tara A.

description:
My friend has been telling me about this place since day 1 of my visit and we finally decided to head in on my last day in the city on Memorial day for brunch. The wait was crazy long but I guess we were lucky to be second on the waitlist of 17?

Our server was attentive - forgot his name but great attitude! My friend & I over ordered but started with pina coladas (love), guac & chips (fresh guac!), 1/2 lb of chicarron de carne (recommend. comes with a fluffy tortilla, refried beans and salsa), empanadas and ceviche de camaro. Wasn't impressed with the menu/food but it's a good rooftop spot on a nice sunny day.
author: Joanne H.

description:
No reservations.
Tapas style dinner with very reasonable prices!
Tostada comes with 2 servings.
Pork sandwich comes with 2 hearty sandoozles and a vinegary/pickled onion au jus. The pork was melt in your mouth delicious.
The shrimp ceviche was generous with shrimp serving and packed a light spice punch. The tortilla chips are crunchy, thick, and homemade.
The single serving margarita wasn't too generous with the tequila portion but did taste sour/tangy.


The view is as good as it gets for SF "rooftop".
Ambiance is lively and fun.
Before the sun goes down it stays warm and sunny up there.
If you plan on staying past 7 make sure you have a (light) jacket.

Came on a Wednesday night and it was packed.

Tip: If you come for sit down dinner you don't have to wait in the gargantuan line. The line is for people waiting for drinks, apps, or happy hour only.
author: Riana C.

description:
El Techo is definitely my most frequented restaurant in San Francisco, and that is for two reasons: the rooftop and the chicharrones de carne. Its rooftop setting gives life in a way that you almost feel as if you're on vacation at an outdoor eatery in Mexico. Day or night, rain or shine, I have been here, and dining with a view of the city never gets old. On cold rainy days, they turn up the heaters and lower the tarps, so you can still get the outdoor rooftop feel while staying warm and dry. On a clear warm day it's just that much more beautiful.   

Though the cocktails are not my main reason for coming here, they never fail to satisfy me, and why not enjoy refreshing libations outdoors? I have tried various cocktails on the menu, but my favorites are El Chilcano, El Escorpion, and La Paloma, all of which are mezcal-based. The cocktails are well concocted and strong (as tequila can be) but still blended smoothly. The liquor tastes high-end enough that the subtle flavors and aromas still stand out.

A pound of the chicharrones de carne is all you really need to order here. I have ordered the sampler of skewers, empanadas, quesadillas, chips and guac, and ceviche de cameron many times, but the chicharrones de carne trumps all. If you come on a good day, that is, if they don't sell out of the chicharrones de carne and they've got all the thick meaty cuts to deliver, one will not be disappointed. The 1 lb. of chicharrones cut is huge and is seasoned with hints of sugar. The outside of the chicharrones is perfectly crisped, but contrasted with the inside being tender and juicy beyond comprehension. It really is perfect!

El Techo is just short of 5 stars due to the poor service and lack of accommodation delivered by the bottom first floor hosts and hostesses. As I have been to El Techo many times, the service upstairs (by both the waiters and hosts) is always great and they are friendly. However, the hosts downstairs, who greet you as you request a table never fail to be confusingly unhelpful, unfriendly, and on a couple of accounts condescending. For a restaurant that draws  long lines, the line management can be confusing, BUT, one would expect the line hosts to be more welcoming, personable and helpful. Nonetheless, again, the upstairs service while dining is wonderful and inviting enough for me to return and return again!
author: Jazzica D.

description: If you ever want awesome pitches of margaritas and delicious mushroom quesadillas, then this is the place for you! However, be prepared to wait on line outside and then once inside, wait for a table to eat. Our waiter didn't hear us properly and put in faux and chips for us and charged us, but never got them. When we saw the check, we asked for the chips instead of the check being fixed. Would definitely come back.... one of the best rooftop bars!
author: Samantha E.

description: Super cool spot to go during happy hour. Everyone is always friendly and attentive. Kind of bumped out that they changed the happy hour to fewer items. I have gone a few times at the beginning of happy hour and have always manage to get seat down. Overall, this place is a must to visit when you are near the mission.
author: Karen G.

description:
There aren't too many rooftop bars in San Francisco... thanks Karl!!! This place is great spot for a sunny day or a cool evening, they just roll down the sheltering sides and turn on the heaters. The entire space is outside! 

Seems like if you are going for just drinks, you may be faced with a longer wait than if you want food. The line was super long, but since we wanted to eat, we only waited 20 minutes or so, it was great! I would recommend ordering a bunch of stuff to shared, kinda tapas style and of course a pitcher of margarita!!

Even if you do have to wait, do it. The food is great, the drinks a good, the service is good and the views of the city are phenomenal!!!!!!!!
author: Sarah S.

description: The boyfriend and I were hosting some friends from Lodi. I decided to bring them here. SO happy I did! Great atmosphere, every dish was mouth watering and we definitely ordered 3-4 of half on the menu by the end of the evening. We got a couple pitchers of margaritas which was delicious! The fish tacos, butter squash empanadas, elotes are just a handful of our favorites. I highly recommend you come here not only for the tasty food and drinks but also it's on a roof top with heaters and there's always a fun lively crowd. Even if it's just drinks, go!
author: Parasto S.

description:
I could rate it 4 stars for the view and the "hype". Food-wise it's a 2 max. drink-wise it's a 4 (beside the terrible Sangria).

First, I must say that this place is OVER noisy. You can barely hear nor talk to someone seating at your table (and I am not exaggerating here. my throat was hurting after leaving the place from talking too loud).
It's a very trendy place where people are definitely here to be seen.

Our (very nice) waiter took really good care of us. We ordered the deep fried pork, 2 quesadillas, jalapeno cornbread, sausage (I can't recall the last dish my friend ordered so I won't mention about it).

Food pros:
- Sausage: good. 3 stars. 1 Simply grilled sausage, on a stick. great taste.
- Jalapeno Cornbread: (small starter or side) 4 stars. Very surprising. Sophisticated but simple. Jalapeno inside but also comes with an amazing chili jam!

Food Cons:
- deep fried pork...I didn't really get it. first it's coated with sugar. OK. But it's dry. And when you try to find the 'moisture" in it you just taste oil. but like cheap oil that has been used several times, or just cheap oil, I don't know.
- Quesadillas...ouch. Very cheap tasting thick corn tortilla. too dry, too thick. I took the mushroom one. There were not much mushrooms and under cooked veggies in it.

Cocktails: not bad, especially a HUGE plus for the Pisco punch (5 stars). A BIG minus for the sangria (1 star. bland? tasteless? guys...put real fresh fruits, wine and add a bit of brandy pls). The Bloody Maria is fun (4 stars for that one).

Total for 4: 130$ + tip = 160$.
The view is really great.
it's a 2.5 stars food wise. +0.5 for our waiter and the cocktails.
author: Sylvain B.

description: Uggggggg! Where do I start! I will give this place five stars purely off the view of the rooftop area. Now let's talk about how they're losing stars. First my bartender was rude af!! Maybe because I'm a black guy in San Francisco? Who knows... second! As I'm standing in line some privileged white girl walks right past me and tells the person who's controlling the line" can I just give you some money so I can skip this stupid line" she proceeds to hand the guy some money and he lets her in!!! Wow!!!!! All this for a restaurant / bar! And third! Once I finally did make it in, I found my glasswear to be hella dirty. I wait 10 minutes for our waiter to come back by our table before I could have the opportunity to tell him about the dirty dishes. Overall pretty cool space but the workers and the people who patron this place makes it really scummy!
author: Fred B.

description:
Phenomenal view and location plus they made sure to have out heat lamps to keep everyone warm.

Beer selection was small but provided some solid choices. Would definitely visit again!
author: Russell P.

description:
If you can figure out the convoluted line/reservation system downstairs, mad props to you.

1) If you want just drinks there will likely be a first-come-first-served line.  When in doubt, go up to the host/hostess and ask.  If you get called upstairs, but the rest of your party is not there yet, they will have to go to the back of the line.  Alternatively you can let others behind you keep going upstairs while you wait for your party to get there.  It's on a capacity basis so up to you.

2) If you want a table for "dinner" you go up to the host stand and put your name and cell phone down. If you go upstairs for cocktails, and your party isn't there yet...you just have to let the host/hostess know when everyone is there (upstairs or downstairs) and then they will prepare your dinner table.  At that point, if part of your party is downstairs, they will yell their name and pull them out of line to come upstairs.  Phew.  confusing.

You can stand in the drink line AND put your name down for dinner.

In any case, the "dinner" menu is the same menu they serve if you're having cocktails, it's just that it's on a lower seated table instead of the unreserved high tops.  Most of the reserved tables can hold up to 6, but if you get lucky and get the bench tables you can get up to 10.

Ok, drinks - big menu...sangria, tropical fruity drinks, margaritas etc.

Snack foods - guac, plantain chips, sliders etc

Dinner foods - carnitas, up to 1.5 pounds.  Yum.  A little bit fatty but still enjoyable.

Oh and of course, why everyone comes here - IT'S A ROOFTOP BAR IN THE MISSION.  There are heatlamps everywhere so never fear the SF summer chill.
author: Traci H.

description:
ARRIBA! EL TECHO IS GUAC-AMAZING.

 Make sure to make a reservation, or else, you will wait in a long line of people, and you're better than that. I made a reservation for my boyfriend and I and this dining experience was an absolute pleasure! Firstly, this place has a beautiful view of the city on a clear day. This view was aided by superbly crafted cocktails, probably my favorite in the city due to their Authentic flare and fresh tastiness. I ordered the Chilcano, which I called, 'orange juice on crack', it was TERRIFIC! My boyfriend and I both loved our dishes. I couldn't help but notice the entire menu thoughtfully incorporated Latin flare into regular breakfast staples. The eggs Benedict on jalapeño cornbread was so satisfying.

 The cherry on top of this meal, was that when I made the reservation on the phone, I noted that it would be my boyfriends birthday. Without ever saying anything at the restaurant about it being his birthday, we received an appetizing dessert and a Happy Birthday from the waitress. This was excellent customer service and a fabulous place to visit. Thanks El Techo!
instagram: @glowrae
author: Glory F.

description:
El Techo de Lolinda is one of very few rooptop dining experiences that I have come across in SF. And a successful one at that. The view is gorgeous both during day time and once the sun sets...we were lucky enough to enjoy our meal at a table closest to the edge where you can see the view perfectly and clearly. (Thank you Karl the fog for not hanging out with us.) 

5 stars for the food. The quesadilla de pibil is probably the BEST quesadilla I have ever eaten. From the braised pork to the cheese and the tortilla. I wish I could have ordered like 5 of those. But I wanted to try the Elotes (Mexican street corn on the cob). And those were delicious as well with just the perfect amount of spice. 

However, I would say 3 star service. And that might be a little generous. I understand that it is a busy restaurant that can get crowded. But I almost feel like their wait staff was short. There were more people who delivered food to the tables than there were people who actually took our orders. 

But expect my return El Techo! I have more tapas to try and hopefully I'll get to order some drinks next time.
author: Melanie B.

description: I went to this rooftop bar with friends during the week at around 4:30-5:00pm and didn't experience any wait, which was nice. The margaritas were potent but tasty, and the food was great! We really enjoyed the empanadas and guacamole. It's a really nice spot with good vibes and a nice view, but I still felt like the prices were pretty steep for the overall experience.
author: Nicole C.

description:
TL;DR - Yes its worth the wait.

I'm all about the view. Yes, the drinks are kinda pricey and there's usually an hour wait, but THAT VIEW. The bar bites are decent, but if you're really hungry, just head down to Lolinda. Easy.

Heard there is a happy hour. I'm definitely gonna check that out.
author: Crystal Z.

description: The food here was really delicious. The service was fun and friendly. I highly recommend getting the Chicharrones de Carne, it was the best I've had. And you certainly can't beat the view; this is my favorite place to eat in San Francisco.
author: Travis B.

description:
Thank the lord the group of people that I came here with had reservations! This place already had a line forming outside when I came here at around 6:30pm on a Friday night. I absolutely enjoyed my experience here! The place is located on a very beautiful rooftop overlooking the beautiful San Francisco, although you can't really see it until you stand up (or maybe i'm just short). The food here was delicious and very creative! I tried the Quesadilla de Aceiga, Quesadilla de Pibil, Skewers, Chicharrones de Carne, & Chocolate Mousse. Every dish was very unique and had its own twist. 

Qusadilla de Aceiga- consisted of kale, mushroom, & cheese with salsa verde provided on the side. I thought that the combination was very different, but it was really delicious! I would definitely order this again the next time I come here! 

Quesadilla de Pibil- consisted of braised pork & cheese, with salsa on the side. The pork in the quesadilla is so soft and tender, on top of that, the flavor were so bold. The braised pork is definitely the highlight for this dish; a great blast of flavor. 

Skewers- these skewers make the perfect snack when you're with a group. It's perfect to munch on in between meals. I found myself enjoying the shrimp skewers a lot, they were grilled to perfection! 

Chicharrones de Carne- MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE!!!! OH MY GOSH THIS STOLE THE SHOW! The way the pork looked.. The way the pork tasted better than it looked... It was amazing.. I used the tortilla and added everything on my tortilla to make the ultimate taco LOL! 

Chocolate Mousse- Very light and fluffy, MmMm! Order this if you still have more room for dessert! I was only able to eat one spoonful because I was stuffed.

Overall I would definitely come here again with reservations of course! The atmosphere here is a great place to bring a group of people, or anyone actually! The food is unique and I just love knowing that I am on a rooftop that is overlooking the beautiful city.
author: Jane N.

description: Amazing spot to see a view and cool vibe and drinks but the service is not on point! Took forever to get our drinks and guacamole and the servers seemed confused on who was who and who ordered what
author: Emily B.

description: People lie to you. They tell you that you will get a table soon. But it's not true. Unless you know the bussers at the front you will not get a seat even though you put your name down. Got a text that our table was ready and when we went up we got the same narrative as an hour and a half before "you are 3 tables ahead" Don't even bother.
author: Tali Z.

description: el techo is awesome for brunch on a sunny day. it was only 2 of us, so we made reservations on opentable (super easy) the morning of and we didn't have to wait at all. as for food, the chorizo scramble was quite good. sangria was OK but nothing to write home about. there are covered tables and heat lamps but i think the city views + experience are best for when it's nice out.
author: Connie Q.

description:
The wait line was approximately 20 minutes. You wait on the sidewalk. Upon entering you take an elevator to the rooftop. Once on the rooftop, the views are stupendous.  We only had drinks.  The appetizers looked good. They have heaters for the cooler nights. 

This is definitely a place I would frequent if I lived here. Sitting on the stools, overlooking the skyline or the hills, every direction was sweet. 

We ate downstairs at their Lolinda restaurant otherwise we would have ordered appetizers.
author: Terese C.

description:
This restaurant is on a rooftop, which was a nice view. The waitress said she gave us the best table for viewing; it was the table outside of the tarp in the corner. At first we thought, but it's night time in San Francisco, we're gonna be cold! Well actually this was thee nicest San Francisco weather I have ever experienced at night; it was perfect,it had to be somewhere between 75° and 78° F and without wind or rain. The weather made it ok but the little metal stool/chairs were freezing our butts lol

Anyway, the food; it's all street food, yes a restaurant with just street food. Everything on the menu is exactly what it is, they don't let you make substitutes; you have the option to eat exactly what you order or get a few items off the menu to create your own meal at your table. 

Foods I've tried here:
Guacamole and chips-good & fresh
Chicken skewer-delish
Plantano maduro-loved them
Pollo frito-yum

Problems/negatives:
-We had things floating in our water in the first carafe they brought to the table

-No substitutes, they have chicken, they have tortillas, but you can not order a chicken taco, it is what it is I guess

-They put my food on the same plate as someone else at my table; they handed me the plate so I started eating my food. Meanwhile we were waiting for the other plate for the other girl, we found out what happened at the end when the bill came. They then claimed it was family style so her food was on my plate too, but the waiter didn't tell us and nowhere on the menu does it say family style. Usually when a restaurant serves family style it is stated. Also, my group was of 6 people, and none of the other plates that were brought to our table were put together and called family style, so this didn't make any sense to us. And since when do you eat street food in family style anyway, I've mostly seen family style in basque or Italian restaurants, not for street food. Basically they wanted to charge me for eating the full plate they gave me, and none of us saw that as being right. So the manager came to the table, he seemed to try to justify why I should pay but then in the end he took it off my bill. So even though he took it off there was still the slight smart ass attitude at first.

 -Tip: You won't get full off the small plates so just know to order more than one if you're really hungry.
author: Lina L.

description: Food was good, great view. However the wait is quite long and you cannot make reservations for drinks and dinner. Recommend coming early, especially on the weekends
author: Brittney N.

description: This place is so fun! Situated on a rooftop near Lolinda, it's a great place to meet a friend for some food and drinks. I got the pork torta, guacamole and sangria. They have drink specials sometimes too during happy hour. The torts was so flavorful and amazing! I loved the bread used and the pork was very tender. I devoured the whole guacamole and I enjoyed that the chips were thick! You can get  a pitcher of sangria here too if you so desire. I liked it. Overall I'd come here again! Be prepared to wait in line though.
author: Natalie M.

description:
Fantastic venue.  We had 3 steaks and all were cooked perfectly. 

Well worth coming in.
author: Peter D.

description:
This is a place where you go to see and be seen! Very trendy and 'hip', I would say. I loved playing the game 'yuppie or hippster' with my friend while looking at the clientele. 
The rooftop was pretty crowded at 5 pm when we got there, but we still managed to find a seat, although not anywhere near the amazing view. Super loud and full of drunk people already. We got some guac and chips since we were feeling peckish, and it was ok. Not the best, but not the worst. The waitress was slammed so things were pretty slow. 
They have a pitcher of margaritas on their happy hour menu. A pitcher!!!! I really wanted to order it, but alas, I had an important meeting at 6 am the next day, so I had to keep it together. I asked for a regular margarita but asked if they could make it spicy. They could and it was delicious!! They also have sangria on the menu which my friend got. She said it was ok.

Overall, the experience was ok. There were just so many people up on the roof that it was difficult to carry on a conversation or really eat with people bumping into you and asking you when you'll leave your table so they can have it. Maybe if I was single this place would appeal more?
author: Monica C.

description:
This place is freaking delicious. Extra brownie points for the rooftop view! This place is perfect for date night and a night out with the girls/boys! Came here on a Tuesday afternoon and found that they have happy hour from 4-6pm! :)

I ordered the Pollo Frito from the Happy Hour menu and it came with guac and chips! Score!!

Must gets:
Pollo Frito
Chicharrones
Quesadilla
author: Gabrielle P.

description:
Was able to make a reservation here for a weekend brunch. This review is solely on the brunch option for the weekend.

First tip: make a reservation. Otherwise expect a long wait.

As one of the only rooftop establishments in SF, El Techo is definitely a place to check out to get some sunshine, people watching, and enjoy the bustling streets of the mission atop the city skyline.

With that said, all seating are high chair bar styles at El Techo with some seating on the surrounding ledge right next to the window pane. On hot days, try to get a seat under the umbrella, or you'll burn.

Overall, you would come here for the ambiance on the weekend. Great city views.

personally i found the food selection a bit mediocre. Compared to their normal menu, it's definitely downplayed. I wasn't too impressed with my meal and felt though brunch tasted "good" there are so many better options in the mission for latin inspired food.

All in all, i would definitely come back for happy hour on the weekdays as their drink selection looked bomb and their weekday menu very enticing.
author: Diane T.

description:
Update:

An El Techo rep commented on my review saying that they could make something vegan for my partner. I eventually brought her with me to El Techo. I asked the waitress if they could prepare any of the dishes vegan, and she wasn't very helpful. They eventually brought out some white rice with a side of vegetables for her, which was pretty disappointing.
author: Jade M.

description:
Feeling for a bite to eat with a skyline view of the city? El techo is the place to be. I came here for an early dinner with a friend and it's definitely a great spot to hang out and enjoy the sunset. 

First things first, if you plan on eating/sitting at a table let the servers in the front know so you can put your name down for a reservation. The line outside of the place is primarily for drinks/standing. I suggest you opt for a table as happy hour specials apply to both areas. 

Happy hour hours are 4-6pm btw! We decided to go with the Tres Amigos Pequenos which came with a shot of tequila, a mini pacifico, and a chaser for $6! whaaat?! The taste of the chaser is a bit of a shocker as it is both tangy and spicy at the same time.

For food, we ordered Guacamole w/ chips, 1 order of Empanada de carne, and 1 pound of chicaronnes de carne. All in which was a little too much for 2 ppl, but great for left overs. My personal favorite was the chicaronnes de carne which was a slightly more sweet as opposed to savory. You also get tortillas, beans, and salsa to compliment the meat.
author: Jana V.

description:
Great experience here-excellent food and service. 

Came for brunch at 11am on a Saturday for a friend's birthday. I made a reservation a few days before on Open Table and that was the only time available but it ended up working fine.

I was seated right away and let the waitress know my friend was on her way and asked for a birthday surprise. 

We ordered the ceviche to start followed by the techo rancheros, chicarrones, and the beignets--which they put a candle in for my friend's birthday. 

Our waitress was really kind as was the guy who brought out our food. We sort of ran out of room on the table so we had to set some things down on the heater but it was totally fine. 

The food was delicious! I wasn't expecting much besides the view but the food and service was exceptional too. Chicarrones really are amazing and the beignets were perfection. I also started with a cocktail recommended by the waitress which was good. Only suggestion is that they add the maduros to the brunch menu.

I'll be back for sure! Definitely get a reservation if you can. Once the sun came out, the views were some of the best in the city.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
After waiting in line outside/downstairs for about 20 mins, our party of 4 got seated for dinner on Sunday ~7pm. Food was pretty good but not AAAAMAZING. We got a bunch of different entrees and shared family style. I got pretty full, so I was happy about that but nothing really stood out to me. The drinks were alright (we shared two pitchers). Great, friendly service.

The view however is great!!!!! It's cool seeing the SF skyline from this rooftop while sippin on some dranks. I'll definitely come back for the view/atmosphere, but probably just for happy hour / drinks!
author: Annie S.

description:
Went to dinner around 7:30pm with some friends to the rooftop. View is nice (thank god for the toasty heating lamps). Considering I don't eat pork, the menu was extremely limiting, and I knew of this beforehand. There are no substitutions for any of the pork (I asked for chicken instead), which is fine. However, the price point for the meals is high, especially since these are "small plates". I ordered the Empanadas de Carne, which are the ground beef ones. The size was VERY small, and only came with two pieces for NINE BUCKS. $9 for this dish was extremely inflated and undeserving. They just tasted like ground beef, none of the raisin flavor emanated from the empanadas, and additionally, the chimichurri sauce?! Like COME ON, that sauce just tasted like oil, no taste or flavor whatsoever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I was so disappointed, waste of money. Please lower your price point for these types of dishes.

The ambience is nice, a little rowdy and loud to have a meaning conversation with people, but it's fun. Probably won't come here again for dinnertime, will try to check out the brunch setting soon. SIGH
author: Hanna M.

description: Awesome drinks, really yummy food. Especially loved their guacamole! And you just cannot beat the views! Get there early for a seat by the window!
author: Brittney F.

description: Amazing view of the City. Perfect at sunset with the light reflecting off of the downtown skyscrapers. Empanadas with a buttery crust and delicious chimichurri. Tasty Chicharron. Cold beer, good tequila. Heaters to take the chill off... What more could you ask for out of a rooftop bar?
author: Sami K.

description:
This place is pretty cool! I've been here a couple times at night for some drinks with friends.

Beware, the line can get super long and you'll have to wait outside in the cold so bring a jacket! 
The ambiance of this place is really cool, they have heaters everywhere and there's a clear tent over the rooftop so it's actually not freezing sitting up there at night. The view is beautiful so it's perfect for dates and whatnot. 
The cocktails drinks are good- it's not too pricey. Their small snacks selection was pretty small, I wish they had more options to choose from. I got the quesadilla de pibil once, which is basically a pork quesadilla. It was a pretty small portion- I don't think it was worth $11, tasty but not worth it. 
I would definitely recommend this place to lounge around at and have drinks with friends. 
I do want to come here for brunch though, so I'll come back again for that!
author: Lina T.

description: Great rooftop with an amazing view of the city. They make great margaritas. The food is mostly small plates, but it tastes great!
author: Gaurav K.

description:
I had a good experience here, but it wasn't excellent.

+'s: great margaritas, fun atmosphere, beautiful view, good service
-'s: long wait, no reservations, average food, the rooftop feels a bit boxed in by the glass walls

I waited over an hour for a table (too bad they don't take reservations at all). But, it was a Saturday night and was to be expected. It's a very popular spot! The host told me they seat a few thousand people a night and said the night I was there was slow compared to usual.

My boyfriend and I were seated at a tiny table with no separation from the party next to us. There were plenty more appealing tables for 2 with more space, so I think we were just unlucky that night. 

The atmosphere was loud and fun with some good throwback hip-hop playing. The view, as others have mentioned, is spectacular, though I must agree with other yelpers that the rooftop is much too enclosed to properly enjoy it. The glass walls are great protection from the cold SF air, but the night I was there the weather was gorgeous and it would have been so nice to have a bit more open air and clearer sight of the surroundings. 

It all seemed worth it when the margaritas arrived! We got a pitcher of the standard classic margaritas and they were delicious, surprisingly so. They were also generously strong, almost too much for two people, but the pitcher was better deal than ordering a couple of margaritas each and I have no regrets.

When remembering the food, the word that comes to mind most is "decent." The guacamole was pretty good but the chips were cold and very stale. The empanadas were also good, and the chimichurri was nice. The pork quesadilla was yummy, probably the best thing we ordered. For the wait and hype I hoped for outstanding food and what we got was good but nothing special.

Lastly, the service was attentive and very friendly.

Overall, I recommend it if you're looking for a fun time, but I would rather explore new places before going back anytime soon.
author: Sarah N.

description:
Came here with Stef C for our weekly brunch dates. We love our brunches and we decided to come here because it's got a rooftop bar. I do love the views from the rooftop, but to be honest, I have some pretty good views from my balcony at home. 

We arrived to a long line which I thought I could skip since I made a reservation, but unfortunately - the elevator line I couldn't skip.   I will admit that was not what I was expecting especially since I did make a reservation. I get not wanting to overwhelm the kitchen, but I didn't realize we couldn't walk up the steps either. I would hate to wait in super long lines - I feel like reservations should be spread out more then - instead of all at the same time. 

Regardless, I had a great time! The waiter was really good at his job - attentive, but left us alone enough we could still talk and giggle like we do during brunch. We started up with some drinks - I got the la paloma which is grapefruit juice and tequila. I do love grapefruit juice and tequila so it's the perfect drink for me. 

Stef and I split the chicharrones which was definitely not what I had expected, but really good and something we super enjoyed. It's a great dish to share - it even comes with tortillas! We also shared the benedicts and I enjoyed it! I liked the jalapeno cornbread even though Stef didn't.  

Overall, we got a great view of the city, pretty good food and drinks, just a little mishap with the elevator. 

Protip: brunch cocktails and chicharrones.
author: Nina Y.

description:
The view at this establishment is unlike any other in the mission (at least any that I've been to). When you come up the elevator, if you get past the waiting line, it can get fairly backed up as it is a hip place to visit right now. The first thing you see is the  View of downtown, just breathtaking! 
Seating is very intimate, they have space heaters, very effective, you only notice when you leave and it's freezing outside. 
The menu is a bit pricy, but understandable being a SF based business and a fairly hipster spin on Latin cuisine. If you go with a large party be ready to spend. The portions of shared could be considered more of tapas or appetizers to share. With our group of 5 it was a bit scarce. 
The chiccharron was my favorite dish out of everything we tasted, well developed flavors, great balance. The tortillas that they make here have a spice to them, pretty tasty. Ordering the skewers is a good idea to taste the different proteins on the menu. Guacamole is spot on. Margaritas are quite tasty! We even went for a second round...
Overall enjoyed the ambiance and the vibe throughout the establishment. 
Great place for a date night/day the view alone will get some brownie points.
author: Sabrina V.

description:
Wait Time: 30 Minutes for table. Bar seats available, find seats the way you would at a bar. 

Unique Factor: 4/5 - Relatively affordable food on a rooftop with views of the city! Their chicharrones de carne were juicy and tender, great for sharing or all for yourself. 

Service: Friendly, the bar section had service of a bar, with the option of ordering off the full menu.
author: Vivian Y.

description: Great Mexican fusion food with a gorgeous rooftop setting. Make sure to try the plantains and the potatoes!!! Their mimosas are pretty big too.
author: Michaela J.

description:
Simply Amazing! 
The drinks are more than great, when they enter you mouth and hit the taste buds it like a dream! 
Ya feel me bro?!! 
The food is common, but they make it UNIQUE with the ingredients and cooking style. I know, it's worth coming thru.. FOR THE CITY VIEW!
author: Tony F.

description:
The ONLY rooftop bar in SF in the mission. I LOVE this place. Came here with my younger sister when she was visiting from NYC. We came on a good day and time we got great seats by the better view of the city.

It is walking distance to a lot of great places on the mission and urban putt as well, which is where we went after. 

Our server was extremely polite, offered great service, and gave us great suggestions since it was our first experience. When you walk in they check IDs and you take the elevator (or stairs) to the top floor. There is a restroom upstairs as well.

Their happy hour menu is great and we shared a pitcher of sangria after having the "tres amigos". Sangria was great!! :)
author: Bori B.

description: Brilliant place with an astonishing view over San Francisco. They have happy hour prices so you get drinks and some small plates for a very good price. The staff is friendly and in the evening they are heating up the place so you can still sit there with a sweatshirt.
author: Madelynn W.

description:
Great brunch! The Benedict was a delicious twist and we ordered two pitchers of the Sangria.

Place is loud and energetic, way better for groups of 3-5 than for chill couples.

Called in the morning to be put on the waitlist around 9:45am for Saturday at 1pm. Got there and got a table right away. 

Call ahead, its worth it. Great friendly service, good view. Will be back!
author: Derek L.

description:
Great place especially for happy hour if you're trying to lounge and get a great view at the rooftop bar. 

HH is M-F from 4-6PM where appetizers are $5. The fried chicken is so good, but I think it's only worth getting if it's for HH (other wise it's $11 for a small plate). For the drinks, try Tres Amigos Pequeños ($6) which comes with pacifico, pueblo viejo, sangrita.

For dinner, get the chicharrones de carne. One pound is $25 and we split it between 3 people which was a good amount of food. 

Also tried the coctel de camaron, it was good, but very small for $13, would just skip that and try a quesidilla.
author: Linda D.

description:
I love this place. 

Happy hour from 4-6. 
7 dollar margaritas, regularly priced at 9
5 dollar guacamole 

Food: delicious! If you have at least two people get the 1/2 pound of carnitas for 19 dollars 

I ordered the quesadilla de cochinita pibil. It was amazing! The quesadilla was in a home made tortilla, stuffed with cheese and pork. I believe cochinita pibil is pork. 

Such a cute spot to hang out with friends!
author: Cece F.

description:
Second time I visited, and such a fun place!! The view is truly the best part about el techo- on a nice day you get the a clear skyline of the city!  

This is a popular place, so be prepared to wait a bit. Both times I came there was a line at the door (about 10-15 min long depending what time / what day it is). Service is spotty and tables are a bit hard to come by... But it's understandable considering how popular this place is. I recommend for you to bring a little patience and enjoy the ambiance and view :) the drinks are good but like most places in SF $$$! Margaritas are delicious ! 

Overall: worth a visit :)
author: Natalie F.

description: Horrible service. The servers hate their job and aren't afraid of letting it out on costumers.  Incompetent management. Filthy bathrooms. Never worth the line. Go to Jones or The Pearl if looking for a rooftop bar instead.
author: Eddy R.

description: Crazy line to get in so be prepared to stand! Fun atmosphere. The happy hour menu is great! Drank and ate and had a great time! The weather was beautiful- I would go back!!
author: Vicki K.

description:
The food and drinks were both amazing.
You get a beautiful view of SF.
There was a wait, I think it was about 15-20 mins.
Shrimp skewers were my favorite and my friends favorite as well.
We also got the shrimp ceviche, vegetable quesadilla, and the mango dish.
And we devoured everything!
Service was great, everyone was really nice.
I can't wait to go back.
author: Cristina A.

description:
I came here last night with a friend to celebrate national margarita day around 5:30 and surprisingly there was no wait and plenty of open tables. We sat near edge so we could get a good look at the views. It was the perfect time to come because we were able to catch the sunset. 

We shared a pitcher of their regular margarita, half a pound of chicharron, and a beef, chorizo, and shrimp skewer. Everything was really good, each skewer had a different flavor.  The chicharron came with pickled veggies, beans, salsa, and corn tortillas to make tacos. 

The amazing rooftop view, food, and atmosphere make El Techo a great spot to grab a few drinks with friends. Can't wait to come back to try their brunch! 

P.S. They only take reservations for brunch
author: Linz C.

description:
I've always avoided going to El Techo because the line to get upstairs is insane.  Well, I finally took the plunge and decided to do dinner with some coworkers there on a Friday night.  We arrived at 6:30pm and there was of course a line.  We literally didn't get called to our table until close to 9pm, but we were fine, as we killed time and had some small bites downstairs at restaurant, Lolinda (beautiful space!).  The view was great from the rooftop with a smart crowd of people.  The service was prompt, but a couple times we had to remind our server for drinks we ordered.  A small price to pay when you've got such a nice view from the top.  The food was tasty and seasoned well.  

I wouldn't recommend coming here to eat if you're hungry.  Plan to show up at least an hour before you think you'll be eating.  Overall a solid experience at a really cool venue.
author: Josh S.

description:
El Techo, worth the wait. 

The views are really relaxing and this place always has a well balanced food and drink's menu. Staff is friendly and helpful. I have noticed the wait for tables can be long, but this is what happens when places are no longer a "hidden" gem. 

Advice to the owners: 
Serving complimentary bubbly to the guests waiting downstairs might help.
author: O ..

description: El Techo has an awesome atmosphere, amazing food, and stellar customer service. Jorge was one of the best waiters I've ever had and was incredibly kind, courteous, fun, and made our night at El Techo
author: Jake U.

description: Had absolute amazing service here, and crazy good food. The server was the key thing though, shout out to Jorge our server.
author: Macallan S.

description: El Techo is one of my favorite places to take friends when we're in SF. It has it all. Good drinks, food, and a view from their rooftop. I've gone here for dinner once or twice and think it's better off as a place for after dinner food + drinks. The only issue here is how crowded it can get and how long you may have to wait in line. So definitely get here early before the lines form!
author: Jay R.

description:
We came at about 12:30pm on Easter Sunday. We didn't have reservations but they found room for us. When we reached the top floor, about 2/3 of the restaurant was empty, but it did get somewhat filled by the time we left an hour or two later. 

Our server took a while to pay his first visit, but once he came by he was great. Overall I really like the staff here; they're all really chill and do their job well. Very friendly and just fun.

* Benedictos (2 poached eggs, jalapeño cornbread, chorizo, spinach, chile hollandaise. $13) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-techo-de-lolinda-san-francisco-2?select=taLmhgsdo2u1tlYXvQu7yQ#taLmhgsdo2u1tlYXvQu7yQ
cross-section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-techo-de-lolinda-san-francisco-2?select=taLmhgsdo2u1tlYXvQu7yQ#LmxWq-v4V2qbB9kE71VlJA
The jalapeño cornbread was amazing! Soft, moist, gritty, and that slight tinge of spice. The chorizo--a few slices of hearty sausage, were a good savory addition. The egg whites were a little bit overcooked, but overall this was a great dish.

* Chicharrones de Carne (roasted, fried chunks of pork shoulder w/ house made tortillas, lime, salsa, escabeche. $14 half-lb) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-techo-de-lolinda-san-francisco-2?select=taLmhgsdo2u1tlYXvQu7yQ#Pd8wieOc02m1n7gSIH8vTA
This meat is fantastic! Their salsa is a thick paste and super tasty. The tortilla is super unique, very thick and spongy. I loved that perfect bite with a bit of escabeche (black bean paste), some salsa, a piece of the crunchy pork rind, and a nice juicy piece of meat. That was heaven in my mouth. Fair warning, the meat does have decent sized chunks of fat, which I easily picked around. 

* Chilcano (humani pisco, lime, passion fruit, ginger, bitters. $10) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-techo-de-lolinda-san-francisco-2?select=taLmhgsdo2u1tlYXvQu7yQ#MILhkRQqrtCc6z7MEE038w
This was exactly what I was looking for, and was a great rec from the server. Light and refreshing, super tasty (maybe too much so, I drank it too fast!). The passion fruit was the dominant flavor, and I did wish I could taste the ginger more. Still, it was like a fantastic, fresh tropical juice that happened to have liquor! 

Brunch menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-techo-de-lolinda-san-francisco-2?select=taLmhgsdo2u1tlYXvQu7yQ#RVVCKzd_wAhCHifBK56b9w

Next time I've got to try the La Paloma grapefruit cocktail. That and the Matambre (flat iron steak) looked great.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Came here with my mom and sister for food and drinks on Good Friday. I've heard the wait for a table could be lengthy, so we arrived at about 5.  It only took about 5 minutes to go in and be seated.  

It was happy hour, so we definitely took advantage of it.  We ordered flautas, chile relleno, chips and guacamole and some margaritas.  Food was tasty and the view from this roof top dining was amazing!  

It was crowded, but service was good and yes, it was a good Friday!
author: Kelly J.

description: They were able to sit us 20 minutes before our reservation and it was packed. Service was great and food was delish. Of course, will you cannot beat the scenery. I could have done without the obnoxious group behind us and the guy who couldn't sit down and talked about having been up all night. Someone give him chips or something, he needs to soak up his ongoing debauchery
author: Kelly M.

description: Great happy hour spot.  Very crowded for a weeknight but the amazing view and strong sangria probably had something to do with that.  Sangria pitcher $18 for happy hour 4-6pm
author: Dan O.

description: Really awesome location with beautiful view. Took awhile to get a table for 6 but it was a busy Saturday night. Initially got the number of people in our party wrong and I thought we would have to wait another 45 min but they were great about getting us a table quickly.  Food was delicious! Meat melts in your mouth. Love the sharing style. Bathroom situation = two only so more waiting required.
author: Doris C.

description:
I simply adore this place. Great food, fabulous view...what more could you ask for? A close friend took me here last year and I have loved it ever since. I came back a few weeks ago and took some other girlfriends who now love it as well. 

The menu is brief (bar eats and cocktails). They also serve brunch here which I heard gets busy so reservations are recommended.
