I've had the guacamole, sweet plantains, mango plate (served with slices of jicama and cucumber and drizzled with a few sprinkles of habanero...divine!), but what you HAVE to get is the chicharrones. Oh my. So amazing. The pork is fork tender and served with escabeche, corn tortillas, spicy salsa, and flavorful black beans. We ordered the 1/4 lb for the 3 of us to share but regretted not going with the next size up!

Drinks were fab too. I recommend the pina colada (served with cinnamon crushed ice. What!), Cuba libre (their version of rum and coke is the best I've had), and the mojito. Service was on point. Our waters were always refilled and the table cleaned, and we never felt rushed. We are planning on a brunch date when the weather gets a little less foggy.
author: Mel L.

description:
Awesome roof top bar to grab some drinks and appetizers! We didn't have reservations, so there was a bit of wait that afternoon! We liked this place because of the view and it was really chill! We ordered our first round of drinks and an appetizer. The drinks were okay.... We left after because it was super hot and we were seated at a spot without shades. Anyway, I'd definitely come back here and try other drinks and more food next time. 

Solid 3 STARS for the vibe and views!
author: Glenn L.

description:
This place is hard not to love.

We moved to San Francisco almost exactly a year ago and have consistently had visitors from back home ever since.  We have yet to not take any of them to El Techo.

El Techo is the gem of the Mission in my opinion. When you arrive you take the elevator up to rooftop dining and get a great view of the city - especially if you're dining in the evening [don't forget a light jacket if it's chilly!].

The food is great.  We normally get quite a few plates [almost tapas style] and divvy them up amongst the table. Highly recommend the empanadas, tostadas and always the sangria. If you have a sweet tooth after the meal, I recommend their hot chocolate - it is amazing!

This place is great if you have guests in town, great for a good brunch on a sunny day, or if you just feel like a some good food and a cool drink.
author: Katie R.

description: Poor service and mediocre food. Took 20+ minutes for any server to acknowledge us, on a Sunday night. Then the server lost our ticket and forgot to put in our order, and did nothing to compensate for her error. Will not be returning.
author: E S.

description:
Beautiful rooftop view and overall awesome place to get brunch with friends! Get reservations to avoid the long wait. It was raining when we went but it just added to the nice atmosphere. Service was friendly and attentive.

I got the Corizo Scramble ($15) which had a generous serving of eggs with chorizo, avocado, potatoes, and brioche. I really liked the dish and it didn't feel too heavy. My friend got the Techo Rancheros ($15) which she said was really good.
author: Linda X.

description:
I've been here a number of times, never for a full meal, but often for bites and beers with friends. What's good? Pretty much everything I've had. What's great? The Micheladas! Nothing like a spicy beer to kick start your Saturday afternoon.  

I've been pretty lucky with seating up on the terrace. The "in between" brunch and happy hour time is a great time to get up there. I've had a seat or standing table near the balcony every time I've been. 

What to know: It can get windy/chilly up there, #sf. There aren't any heaters, so bring layers. There are also only 2 bathrooms for the entire terrace. Be prepared to wait in line 5-10 minutes.

Enjoy the views!
author: Brittany B.

description: I like the place I just don't feel great about the staff they can't even smile my first time here and I work at an optical near by I'm very Dissatisfied about the service I got. Will I come back ? Most likely not I always see the lines but def wouldn't recommend friends here Thumbs down  there was two people whom I liked working downstairs other than that everyone is stuck up won't smile well there are better places than these in SF
author: Eve G.

description:
Awesome best place in SF I've ever been 
I always recommend to people. Food great
Customer service good.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Great views, but it's too loud, crowded here. Service is bad, and the food is mediocre.
author: John S.

description:
Brunch update: meh. 

The food isn't very good and it's overpriced. I came here with 8 of my friends yesterday and the lady at the bottom was a little rude. We had to check in with her and then check in with the guy at the top again. We ordered:

- Benedictos (14) -- two poached eggs, jalapeno cornbread, chorizo, spinach, hollandaise. It was really small and the cornbread was dry and didn't taste like jalapeno. They gave me only half a chorizo sausage.
- Chorizo Scramble (15) -- roasted vegetables, chorizo, avocado, potatoes, chipotle, brioche. Apparently the salsa was super sweet and this wasn't very good either.
- I tried some of my friend's 0.5 pound chicharrones (15) and the meat was so dry we didn't even eat half of it. And it came with a bunch of whole jalapenos that were way too spicy to eat.
- Sangria pitcher (25) -- this was pretty good.

There was an accident in the kitchen that day and our food took super long to get to us. And lastly, on the bill, they're a little sneaky... they only offered 18%, 20%, or 22% suggested tip amounts, and they were calculated AFTER tax. Tip is supposed to be calculated before tax, so that you are tipping on your actual food and not tax (i.e. tipping on the SF mandate that goes straight to the workers?). So if you use their receipt's calculations, you are tipping more than you think (15% post-tax = 17% pre-tax).

The upside was that despite it being a really cold day, the heat lamps kept us sufficiently warm during the whole meal. But all in all, I was unimpressed and probably will only come back at night.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
Was really excited about trying this place because I had heard so many great things.  All in all, maybe I had too many expectations.  

We showed up at around 7pm on Saturday night and there was a line of about 15 people waiting to get in.  We put our names on the list and went to a nearby bar to wait for the text saying we had a table - I think it took about 30 minutes or so.  

Took the elevator up, and got a table - unfortunately we were kind of squeezed into a corner next to a large party (I believe it was a birthday party), but that happens.  Our waiter was very attentive and nice.  I can imagine the rooftop bar would be a lot nicer if the weather was warmer.  For apps, we got the vegetarian empanadas butternut squash, spinach, ricotta cheese, aioli) which were very good and the jicama salad (gem lettuce, avocado, radish, lime viniagrette) which was good as a crunchy note but more of a palate cleanser.  

For entrees we shared 3 skewers - a carne, a chorizo and vegetables.  The meat was cooked to perfection.  I was not a big fan of the chorizo and the vegetarbles could have used an extra minute or so on the grill.  Overall though, the food was very food but it was incredibly loud and crowded.  Definitely a pre-clubbing spot and wasn't really the atmosphere I was looking for that night but would come back at a less busy time.
author: Kristin P.

description:
This is a great place to start your night. El techo has a really nice view of the city when it is a clear night. They have stationed heaters near your table which is really nice because it can get quite cold. I do recommend coming early because the line and wait can get pretty long.  Their service is great. Servers and hosts are super friendly and greet you with a smile. They are very attentive on refilling your drinks and making sure you got what you need to keep things rolling. Seating area is a little tight squeeze but is okay. Other than that it is a pretty chill vibe and intimate setting. 

For the drinks and food they are a bit pricey. But you can't blame them since everything in SF has gone up. I always order the chips n guac which is really good. I have also had their ceviche also bomb! Nice lemon flavor. I have also had a few other dishes that the waiters have recommended that were good as well. Their dishes are always served with fresh ingredients. The drinks are really refreshing. I usually get the margaritas or sangria. I like both of them. 

Like I mentioned above, I would def come here to start the night with drinks and tapas. Everyone I have brought here loves it.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: Logistics to give out tables are the worse... they make you wait 45 min in line and then another 30 to 60 min to get a table. Then, when they manage to give a table, the weather is cold and they have no heater in this particular table they offered. Now taking more time to figure out another table. I am just gonna go get some food somewhere else.
author: Marcus F.

description: If I could give this place 6 stars I would. I know I know someone is gonna complain about the LINE someone is gonna say over rated. But if you have not been here you need to go! Drink are to kill for, if Al(Berto) is behind the bar you will be there for a while because his drinks are the iSH. Jeff who is one of the managers there is also an amazing dude and always welcomes you and makes you want to keep coming back. The food...you can literally close your eyes point anywhere on the menu and order that and even if you have no idea what it is you will love it...
author: Roberto M.

description: Awesome views, delicious drinks, and pork shoulder that is out of this world.
author: Tucker N.

description: I am madly in love with the buñuelos, the pan de elote and plantano maduro. You know that lyric from Lady Gaga "I want your love and I want your disease, I would absolutely be willing to become diabetic for these sweets.
author: Vickie C.

description:
Love this place's rooftop setting and laid back vibe, like its food okay.

Have eaten dinner here on a few occasions, gotten drinks on more than a few, and had brunch here recently. When I've eaten here, group's priority is usually drinks and food is secondary, but last time for brunch, we were food focused. I ordered the benedict, and I liked how much spice the jalapano cornbread added to the dish, but overall it didn't stand out in my mind as a great brunch dish - was a little expensive for the amount of food I got.

Will continue to come to this place for the view and fun atmosphere, but not particularly for the food.
author: Sarah B.

description: Finally got the chance to check out their brunch yesterday. We had a reservation so we didn't have to wait at all even though it was a Saturday at 1. I loved that they had heaters because sunny in SF does not equal warm. Our waiter was amazing and gave us his recommendations. I got the huaraches, it was different than I was expecting but really good. The brisket was heavenly. We split a pitcher of the Paloma which was also really good. Happy hour still might take the cake, but their brunch was a close second.
author: Sara T.

description: I love this restaurant and the views! I usually get their Quesadilla De Pebil..it's to die for!! This restaurant is a bit pricey, if you can get in time for their happy hour then it's totally worth it. It gets pretty packed so don't be surprised if you have to wait 30-45 minutes to get in.
author: Karen K.

description: Honestly one of my favorite places in the city. Great view of the city!! Great music(really sets the mood for a fun day/night)!! Amazing service!! The drinks are perfectly strong =) This restaurant is pretty diverse in many senses. You can come here for a nice dinner and relax, or to start the day off with fun day drinking to 90's music. Never had a bad experience here. Overall I love this place and would definitely recommend to anyone!
author: Faofizah S.

description:
My coworker told me this place was overhyped. I ended up getting to go there recently and I can say that it is indeed overhyped and the quality of the food is not good enough to match the price they charge for.

3/5 - For the view, it is unique but it's not high.
2/5 - For the food 
2/5 - For Drinks. It was $31 for a tiny pitcher of Margarita. Lot's of places with larger pitchers of Margarita, that are cheaper.

Overall, not worth it.
author: Derrick C.

description: Loved El Techo! I have never been to a rooftop bar but this one has a nice view of the city :) We ordered guacamole and chips, platanos, the quesadilla, and mango platter all of which were devoured in seconds. They were light and refreshing, high qual small plates that went great with our sangria pitcher. My favorite drink was the Hummingbird Cocktail which had Pisco in it (south American brandy, this one was Peruvian). I drank lots of Pisco mixed drinks  when I visited Chile and this took me back for a few seconds! We will be back. Also a shoutout to Danny who wasn't our server but still provided us great service in giving recommendations, taking photos, and he was fun
author: Bijal P.

description:
"Do we want another pitcher or are we moving on to shots?" And just like that, I fell in love with El Techo and our sassy server. The view here is no secret. It's pretty amazing, especially if you get a table on the periphery of the restaurant. Speaking of, it's tiny, making the booze-to-person ratio super high. We ended up foregoing the shots in hopes of not being too hammered to enjoy some time in the park, but we did get two pitchers of the La Paloma between three of us. Sufficient and we were still responsible enough to find our way to the park.

With bellies half full of tequila we dove into the following: guacamole (you really can't f--- that up), ceviche = YAS; it was heavy on the lime which I lurrrrvvvv, the techo rancheros, and (my fav) the matambre, which we got mainly because it had chimichurri. I will eat anything with chimichurri on it. ANYTHING. But this had a perfectly medium rare flat iron covered with chimichurri and fried eggs. I have my cholesterol in check so I didn't care about all the animal fats in there. Oh, there are also baby potatoes there that roll around in and soak up said animal fats--it made my newly atherosclerosed heart sing!
author: Christina D.

description:
Had a 7 hour layover in San Francisco and was able to catch up with some friends. I asked my friend how he knew about this place and he goes, "Someone took me here on a date once.. the date was bad, but the restaurant and food was amazing so this is where I take anyone that visits now." 

Located in the Mission District on the rooftop of an unassuming building. The views of the city are amazing and on this day, the weather was perfect for watermelon mimosas and a Mexican style brunch. 

Craving some meat, I got the Chicharrones de Carne (1/2 a pound) that's basically fried pork shoulder, a nice serving of chicharrones with salsa, beans, and tortillas. The pork shoulder was delicious. Perfectly seasoned and extremely filling. I would definitely share this next time. Also ordered Ceviche which was good as well, good chunks of shrimp.

Service was ok, we did not wait for a table because my friend was already there sipping on her mimosas. Remember to check in at the booth in front of the building before heading up the elevator, the host was kind of rude.. so I guess service can be a hit or a miss, but the location, ambiance, food, and drinks make up for the "just ok" service the time I visited.

Would recommend for dates, catch-ups with friends, or a lovely day outside in San Francisco.
author: Julian T.

description: Best spot in the city on a nice sunny day during happy hour...easily the best view you'll get in the dirty mission. Lots of great vibes and energy. The prices are debatable, but the food is always good. Sometimes the service can be a bit thin due to the large rush hour crowds, but if you are patient and have good company El Techo is always a nice place to be.
author: Christy C.

description: It was alright. It gets soooo packed and you'll basically be sharing the same air as the people around you. Also, service is super slow. Servers are not attentive, although I don't really blame them since this place is clearly really understaffed. The servers are constantly running around and it's literally impossible to flag anyone down. Now onto the food. We ordered the Fish Tacos ($14), Chicharrones de Carne ($19/half pound), and Pina Colada (~$10). The Pina Colada was underwhelming and filled with ice but it wasn't blended. It's basically a liquid drink with ice, but the Pina Coladas I'm used to having are blended. The tacos were good, but it only came with 2....making each taco $7. A $7 taco must be the best taco I've ever had....but it wasn't. The best thing we ordered was the Chicharrones de Carne by far. The pork was very tender and flavorful, and we loved making the little wraps. Yum! Other than that, the lack of attentiveness, compactness, and lackluster food means I probably will not return.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Still love this place-- I feel like the lines have gotten significantly warmer as summer is back on its way again :)

I tried the chicharrones for the first time the other day and was pretty excited about this one. Highly recommend! I've also since tried out happy hour on a Friday and that was definitely fun (still busy) but the margaritas are good and clumping around the space heaters on the roof and watching the lights of the city flicker on was pretty neat.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
Even though we have pretty much ordered every item on their menu, we always seem to order their Chicharrones! It's probably the best in town! It come with q small side of a very tasty salsa, black beans and pickled carrots. We usually order the 1 and a half pound and take the remainder home. M
Service is always great and their atmosphere is casual. Try and make a reservation in advance or there's usually a very long line downstairs specially over the weekends.
author: Ghazal P.

description:
Great views of the city. The plastic tarp cover shield you from the wind. The food was okay.

If there's a wait downstairs, I wouldn't try it. It's good but not THAT good.

The super bowl was in town on another occasion I was here and got to see some fireworks :) Very pleasant experience.

Come here for the views, stay for the drinks. Have a little food if you're hungry. Wouldn't come here with the specific purpose of dining.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Let me explain the 3-stars.

Prior to November 2016: My boyfriend + friends LOVED this place. We dreamed of their chicken flautas with their BOMB green salsa. The fried chicken. The plantains with black beans. Everything [was] delicious because of the range in food for non-red meat eaters. 

November 2016: Total disappointment + hence the 3 stars. They removed ALL of our favorite (IMO) dishes. ALL of them. Not sure if it was temporary, but when we asked the waiter what happened to all the chicken + the other vegetarian dishes he said "Yeah...we removed them. We no longer offer chicken dishes." We tried some of their new items, but we weren't pleased. Most likely because of our dissapointment.

As person who doesn't eat pork nor beef, we were so disappointed that we aren't planning on returning here again for a while...Customer service, ambience (especially on a hot summer day) and everything else are great. If you're a big on pork meat, this is a great spot for you. 



UPDATE: Looks like they've added the plantains + fried chicken back on their menu. TECHO, please add your flautas back!
author: Rosa D.

description:
The view of the place is amazing. The restaurant is on the 3rd floor I believe, it's on a roof top, covered, and you get an lovely view of the city! Came here for brunch on a Saturday and this place gets busy! Started off with a pitcher of margaritas. 

CHICHARRONES de CARNE: pork shoulder server with tortilla, salsa, lime, and escabech. We only did half a pound and it was still a lot. The pork was so soft, this could be a meal for someone. 

Benedictos $14 - two poached eggs, jalapeno cornbread, chorizo, spinach, chile hollandaise. Jalapeño corn bread is to die for. I couldn't stop eating the corn bread. 

The other dish we got was Stuffed French toast: stuffed with dulce de luche, banana, syrup. Everything was sweet and I loved it. 

Great service, view, drinks, foods!
author: Cecilia P.

description:
3.5*. Went to El Techo to grab some a light dinner and drinks with friends. It is a great place to take friends and visitors as you get a great view of the skyline - believe its the only rooftop in the Mission. The service is good and staff is attentive. Food is good, though there is tastier and better valued food around the area, but you are paying for the ambiance and atmosphere which is worth it depending on the situation.

The ceviche and the winter melon quesadilla were my favorite tapas! They also have a huge selection of drinks from beer to margaritas to sangrias which will suit any company you are with. Some people are concerned about feeling cold as it is outdoors - despite the colder temperatures, I was able to wear a tank and still feel warm with their outdoor heaters. Overall a solid, fun and one of a kind place to spend your evening!
author: Alice T.

description:
TIP: call in and make a reservation if you want to avoid waiting for ages. I went for Sunday brunch with my friend, and arriving just after 11am (when it first opens), was told that the wait would be 45 min to an hour already. 

Once finally seated, we were a little bummed there was no elote on the brunch menu. It must be a dinner only thing? The rooftop is only partially covered by tents, so if you're not shaded it was pretty warm in the sun.

WHAT WE GOT: Chorizo Scramble for me, Benedictos for my friend. 
I would definitely recommend the chorizo scramble. It's extra delicious with a pina colada! The benedictos were only alright. The eggs weren't runny...which is what makes El Techo only 4 stars in my eyes. DAT JALAPENO CORNBREAD THO. Delish!
author: Justine H.

description: Went for happy hour before going to urban putt. We got there right before the crowd hit which was perfect since we got a fabulous view. We got the chips and guacamole, the little chicken nuggets (I forget the actual name) and the AMAZING sangria. I can't wait to go back again.
author: GIna K.

description: Came here for my birthday and the staff was rude. Our waitress was rude and had a stank face the whole time like she did not want to help us. Then when we asked if they could cut the cake that we brought, the guy said they were going to charge us per person. Sounded like they thought we would change our mind because they were going to charge us. Overall horrible experience for overpriced food.
author: Vanessa R.

description: Boyfriend and I ended up here randomly by picking the first thing that popped up on Yelp and were blown away at the awesome service and great food!!! Our server, Daniel C recommended all the best options and we were not disappointed with any of them. The plantains are a must!! We also go the carne and shrimp skewers, super juicy. A pitcher of a mixed drink will be solid for a party of 2-4. We finished one between two of us. This place is very popular so I'm glad we ended up here on a Tuesday. If you want to avoid a long wait, visit on an evening earlier in the week.
author: Aryana D.

description:
When my friend suggest we go here for a girls brunch, I all caps'd YES, via group text so loud that I may have sounded a bit crazy.

But, after being able to try a Lolinda appetizer during a catered event, which was amazing, I knew I had to come here given the chance.

It was a perfect sunny SF day, while it was much too warm for heat lamps, the agua fresca mimosa, shrimp ceviche, and empanadas were absolutely perfect. Really, I am currently starving and this is all I can think about!

While I'm not crazy about the price of everything, I'd still give it a go for some super delicious food with a view!
author: Leslie L.

description:
Review for 3 people, Thursday light dinner, 7p.

Food:
- 1/2 pound build your own tacos platter - came with nice salsa (tasted more of a mole than tomato based salsa), a bean purée, tortillas (about 5 total). Fun plate to share.
- plantains - soooooo good! 3 small "Popsicles" of beautifully browned plantains with sweet crema! My favourite dish!
- ceviche - came with a basket of chips. So-so. Not outstanding as other places, but glad they had it as an option on the menu. 

Drinks:
- pina colada - not too sweet, drinkable (on the rocks), felt like I was on the beach (thanks to the paper umbrella)! Would get it again. 

Repeat business?: would definitely be back

Tips for next time: get there before 7p for a table; gets crowded.
author: Mary H.

description:
I've been processing this experience for the past few days and have decided to share my terrible experience at El Techo. 

My friends and partner, all who are Cis-females, and I all went to El Techo for brunch this past weekend. I identify as a trans man and while I am quite passing I also understand that there are those who feel Asian men are more effeminate looking. 

When our server came to our table he said "Hello Ladies!" I was a bit taken aback by this and said "Aw c'mon man."  Our conversation then preceded as follows:

Server: "What?" 
Me: "Well there are three ladies and..." 
Server: "Are you a guy?" 
Me: "Yes." 
Server: *sighs* "Hey guys." 

No apology. Nothing but attitude and disrespect. Not to mention that he spent more time playing around with the other staff than actually serving our table. It took him over 20 minutes just to bring us water and my friend had to request this TWICE. I honestly wish the experience could have been better as I was looking forward to the meal but the service left such a bad taste in my mouth that I didn't even have time to enjoy the food. 

This is not a place I will be returning to.
author: Ashley G.

description:
Came for an early dinner. The wait list for the rooftop seated dining was pretty short, yay!  

We were greeted by a beautiful day and a not so crowded environment, super brownie points. 

Upon reaching the roof, we asked the hostess politely if we (table for 2) could be seated looking outwards to the city skyline, we even offered to be seated anywhere in the meantime, and were flexible to move if anything opened up... She smirked and said once seated "she could absolutely not move us". The upsetting part about this was that the seated area (which we had just been called up to be seated) was less than 50% full. *shrugs*..... We took what we were given. We were squished into a end table that had a large party already seated. The next table over was a two person table yet we were not seated there. 

We ordered drinks.... Then some food. We were not done ordering when my sister and her boyfriend called that they wanted to join. I called over the hostess to ask if we could get a bigger table, or just take over the STILL EMPTY table next to us. She smirked and said no and Walked away. 

We were absolutely shocked. We had already raked up a tab of at least $175 and we were asking two have two more hungry people join.... It just didn't make sense. We love el Techo and were so disappointed with this visit. So many empty tables and we were squished by the kitchen just feet away from the bathroom and on some random parties table. I didn't get her name but it was a dirty blond/brown haired girl with glasses. After so many visits to el Techo she is the ONLY complaint I have.
author: Jackie Z.

description:
Fantastic place, love the rooftop bar, and highly recommend arriving between 4-6p, to take advantage of the happy hour drinks. 

I got there with 10 mins to spare of happy hour, ordered a pitcher of sangria and waited for my friend. You have to pay for your tab before you get seated, which is strange, should be able to take the tab to the table. 

We ordered 3 skewers, (veggie, chicken and carne) , chile relleno, annnnd had to order the brisket quesedillas. 

SO delicious!!!! there was NO one thing bad about the entire meal, loved having the city as the backdrop and everything was delicious. Out of all 3, I highly recommend getting the BBQ skewers because it is heavenly, and the chile relleno filling is sublime. Brisket quesedillas were great, but mostly to tie us over. But no regrets at all!!! 

It is a bit louder than most places but not windy or super sunny, there's windows that surround the entire rooftop. Highly recommend!
author: Sandra L.

description: This place is perfect for breakfast before a day of sightseeing. Food is filling without being too heavy and is incredibly delicious. They have Absolutely phenomenal empanadas and drinks. Went to a birthday brunch for a friend here and service was impeccable for a party of ten. Prompt and friendly waitresses brought all our food out within a few minutes, an incredible feat considering the size of our party and the fact that we came here during a brunch rush. The one negative is that it's quite boisterous and hard to hold a conversation due to the noise. I wasn't really bothered by this though because it helped reinforce the friendly outdoor atmosphere. Food is also quite affordable and our party of 10 ended up with a bill under $250.
author: Linnea M.

description:
Rooftop views with amazing food.

Brunch always tastes better when there's a view, and El Techo De Lolinda didn't disappoint (although it probably would've been just as good without it). You can make reservations here, and we didn't waste any time once we arrived. The sun was a little strong that afternoon, and the servers were kind enough to seat us in the shade. We promptly decided on the benedictos and pork shoulder. When they were served, we knew we made the right decision.

The eggs were the perfect fusion, an American favorite with a Mexican twist. Instead of an English muffin, it was served on a thick slice of cornbread. The jalapeño hollandaise paired amazingly, and in combination with the juicy chorizo, it was exactly what what wanted. Everything just crumbled in our mouths. The pork shoulder was also so yummy, with a spread that was equally appealing. The meat was perfectly seasoned. The crisp of the skin, the moistness of the meat, the combination of sweet and salty: it was heaven. The other element that I thought was critical were the pickled veggies. I would definitely come back just to have some more pork!
author: Ben W.

description: Love the view and the vibe of this place!! Drinks are pretty strong and the service is great! The only thing I wish the menu had more options But the roof top makes it totally worth it
author: Shanna R.

description:
My husband and I love Mexican food and this place had such amazing flavors with an incredible rooftop view of the city. We ordered:
Mojitos - good and sweet creepers (you know the one's that you don't feel you're drinking until you're already buzzed).
Avocado- I recommend, I just wish their chips weren't as hard.
Ceviche - they didn't skimp on the shrimp and fish, really good.
 1/2 lb of chicharonnes - these were my husband and I's favorite dish that we ordered, it was sweet and savory with great flavor. (We will definitely return for these bad boys).
Quesadilla de Pibil- my other favorite dish, it was cheesy and filling and so delicious.
Flautas - I would not order them the next time we come, they we're just "aiite". 
Alfajores with chocolate milk - the Mexican chocolate milk was so decadent when accompanying the delectable dulce de leche cookies. This tied up the entire Mexican experience. 

We will definitely return, such a fun place to bring friends or out of town guests. They will love the dishes and the pretty view.
author: Joy N.

description:
I came here last month.. Great date night spot!  The rooftop is so nice.. especially because that day was a beautiful one.

The carnitas was sooo yummy and tender, but they should portion the side better.  We ran out so quick! we got a pound and a pitcher of the el techo margarita.  The service could have been a little bit better.  We asked for water multiple times and when we asked for more tortillas it took about 20 min... which didnt really make sense, and our waitress was irritated when we asked about them. Also, they dont have rice. Id check it out again and try more stuff on the menu.
author: Regina B.

description: Great place and cheap, courteous service. Definitely one of my favs in the city! Nice environment and great place to meet with friends.
author: Carolina L.

description: Definitely will return for the rooftop bar experience!  Love the spectacular sunny view of the City and the very yummy margarita with various fabulous appetizers. I'm not giving this place a perfect five because of its location, where parking is extremely difficult and a very long line for using the bathroom!   Overall, El Techo rocks!
author: Ivory B.

description:
I was brought here on a little last-night-in-SF-date, and I think I must have looked like a hangry demon woman walking in, because I hadn't eaten in 8 hours and was pretty close to eating my own arm off if I didn't get fed soon. I was the nut hitting the UP button for the elevator to the rooftop about 16 times in a row, hoping the 16th time would make it arrive sooner. The rooftop itself is really cute, but I think my quick slippery slope into Hangry Mode outweighed my appreciation for how cute it was for a sweet minute (or 10)...

Our waiter was superbly calm and cool, and somehow my crazy eyes and "I'm super hungry, what should I order? I haven't eaten since 1pm, just for some context on my hunger..." rambling (at the speed of lightning a la Six from that show Blossom) didn't faze him and send him running straight across the city with a cartoonish smoke trail following him in his path.

After we speed ordered the Ceviche de Camaron, Empanada de Carne, Quesadilla de Pibil, Choripan (chorizo in a baguette, with an egg on top, what?! YES), and three Chuzos/skewers, came the realization that you should probably never order in your hungriest state. My eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach, but everything was finger-licking delicious, with a gorgeous view of the city to boot. The rooftop is quaint and chill, with lights strung across and heat lamps for those chillier nights, and probably has the best view of the Mission you can find. 

Needless to say, no waiters or patrons were harmed by the force we call Hangry Mode (much like Hulk Mode, but far more dangerous) during my dining experience or in the writing of this review;).
author: Ellie W.

description: Went here on a freezing cold monday evening to meet a friend for dinner and drinks. I was a little apprehencive about the rooftop outdoor seating. But turns out they have the toastiest heaters. The servers were very quick and polite. We ordered a Chardonnay and a beer(the IPA draft). Both were really good. The chard was nice and cold, just how I like it. We then got the plantain chips, the mango, the chile relleno and the butternut squash quesadilla. Everything was on point. I love the concept of small plates. A special mention for the mango! It was so fresh and delicious! Overall great experience!
author: Ashmita V.

description: Stellar view of the city from a distance. Not even fair how good the guac is...
author: Antigone S.

description:
El Techo is an amazing spot. You can come for a beautiful view of the city during daylight, sunset, or night. Rest assured, you won't be the only ones. It can be crowded, but the experience is well worth it. Bring someone you enjoy so you can kill the wait with some conversation. 

The chips and guacamole are always a safe go-to. They give you plenty of guac so don't be dainty with your dips. I've also had their Quesadilla De Acelga, which is filled with generous amounts of cheese, with just the right amount of kale and mushrooms. 

Drinks are always nice. I feel like the view and heaters make you feel warm enough inside, but if you're feeling like a little more (assuming you are since you're at a rooftop bar) you should try the Pina Colada or the Palmetto, depending on your mood. The Pina Coladas help if your on the receiving end of a break up conversation... 
But if that does happen, come back to redeem this place. You'll be glad you did!
author: Sarah B.

description:
I always wonder why people are waiting in line outside this place.

Now I know. Gorgeous view, delicious food, romantic ambiance, and friendly service.

I found the pollo fritos and quesadilla con pibil to be really yummy. The dulce de leche was super delicious as well. The only minus is they don't have coffee.

This is definitely my new favorite go-to place in the Mission!
author: Novalina N.

description: One if my favorite place ever, plus first date with my boyfriend was there. I always want to go. Cocktails are great and food super tasty. The location is a plus super nice. Love their guac. Unfortunately the waiting time to get sit  is always pretty long.
author: Cristina C.

description: Great views! Pretty sick rooftop. The drinks were strong and the guac was good. Only thing that really knocked off a star was that everything was STICKY. The chairs, table and just everything we touched was sticky. It was weird.
author: Erica G.

description: View is great and the Pollo Frito was awesome! I was worried about the wait but I went at 4:30pm on a Wednesday and there was no wait at all. It was also during happy hour so it was soo worth it!
author: Judy K.

description: So I ordered La Paloma and asked if they used squirt and got a 'down the nose' look (not pretentious just playful); a swanky ass rooftop bar tho and the drinks was very tasty and worth $10
author: Asa C.

description: We love this place! Everytime we visit SF we make sure to go and have their chicharrones and delicious cocktails not to mentioned the view and atmosphere is pretty cool
author: Gis D.

description: Definitely check out the Empanada and enjoy the rooftop deck! Great service and food.
author: Eric H.

description:
I came here after reading an article about their pina coladas in the newspaper and finding out they had some pretty nice views of the city.  I made sure to come while the weather was still warm, though I came on a rare almost unbearably warm day in San Francisco.  Luckily, while there are bar tops for two out in the sun, they do have plenty of tables with umbrellas which provide shade.  

First of all, if you have a brunch reservation right at opening, you have to form a line on the sidewalk before they let you up.  Then you can either take the elevator which might take awhile to come, or you can walk up several flights of stairs to the rooftop.  Take your pick :p  Once there, you check in at the host stand and then are seated.  The tables with chairs that are not quite suited for hanging purses on have hooks under the table that you can use.  FYI tables are pushed together quite closely; luckily no one was seated next to us until much later.  

As for the food, I had the chorizo scramble and split an order of beignets for dessert.  I did not like the food at all!  Just did not taste good to me.  I did, though, like my pina colada.  So if anything, come here for drinks and the view, and I'm guessing their small bites which seem to be popular.  Eat a meal before or after coming here!  My sister liked her eggs benedict though, so maybe I just didn't order the right thing.  

Three stars for my pina colada and the view, plus their service which wasn't bad.
author: Carnita M.

description:
Went here on a Monday evening. 

Pros: excellent view of the city (& of mission). Chorizo empanadas - amazing and even the dough tasted homemade. Staff was nice. Moderately/upper priced. Mostly covered, too, in case it rains (as it has been lately!). 

Cons: food was a little greasy for my preference (but still delicious). 

I'd come back for the view & as a "starter" place for your evening. 

Plus who doesn't like a rooftop bar in the city?
author: Rob M.

description:
Definitely a fan of views, let alone city skyline views and El Techo couldn't be in a better setting. 

We were a group of 8, no reservations- no problem. We went in New Years day (may I add after brunch) and had no problem being seated. We couldn't have asked for a better scenario.

The only reason its a 4/5 is due to us ordering Carnitas for the group and as we all have our own taste for how we'd like our meat, it was not as crisp and savory as we'd like and that may be possibly because I'm use to moms style of cooking. 

We'll definitely be back!
author: Julian G.

description: Stopped by the first time at El Techo, had heard some great things about it so I had to check it out. I ordered their Sangria which was delicious and my friend ordered an IPA beer. For dinner I ordered the Torta de Pibil and OMG it was soooo good! It had so much delicious flavor. Only thing that wasn't as good as I had hoped was the service our waiter kept disappearing over and over so we had to keep tracking him down for assistance. Other than that great restaurant not to mention the view was just gorgeous. The music and atmosphere were perfect as well.
author: Estefany V.

description:
I absolutely love El Techo. The food is AHHHMAZING & the drinks are strong. 

Jeremy is such an enthusiastic server and absolutely hilarious. He sets just the right vibe for any night, girls night to date night. Five stars! 

But literally he's the best (GIVE HIM A RAISE) he works so well under pressure and a busy environment. 

Some patrons that sat next to us gave him such an attitude and he remained completely composed. He's great!
author: Christina S.

description:
Came by for a drink, it has a nice view of the mission (ha ha). The service was beyond horrible, but the place was really busy. They didn't want us going to the bar. Overall it was pretty annoying here, but the drinks were tasty and inexpensive. This is my dilemma.

Oh yeah it closes early, maybe it deserves 1 star.
author: Jonah K.

description: Loved the view!!! Nice open space and very chill place to have a drink and some appetizers
author: Rosita S.

description:
Love this place!

Cocktails are pricey but beer is comparatively priced as to other places in the neighborhood. (Not sure about wine, haven't ever ordered it here.) The food is very well priced for an SF restaurant, particularly since the quality and taste is so good. Keep in mind - these are mostly small plates so it's best if you go with  friends and order several dishes.

There is usually a long wait but if you get there before 6 PM on a weekday (or make a reservation on the weekends - you can only make a reservation for Saturday and Sunday brunch) you'll be fine. As with most restaurants in SF, they won't seat you until your entire party has arrived.


Advice:

1) The host/hostess will ask you if you're there for drinks and appetizers or just for dinner. Tell them you'll take whatever is fastest. The servers don't care as the drinks are more expensive than the food (just don't be a dick - if you're in the dinner section at least order a small plate, like the guacamole and chips. You'll be happy you did :) The cocktail/apps section is self seating, so good luck with that if they're busy.

2) If you've invited several friends, just saw you're alone and go to the cocktail/apps section, as you'll get a seat faster and can save seats for your friends once you're there (you can still have a full menu in this section if you want dinner). 

3) If you really want to come here and there is a long wait that you can't avoid, just put your name on the list and they'll text you when your table is ready. You can grab drinks next door at Foreign Cinema or at the bar across the street that provides free comedy acts (not sure of the name, sorry) while you wait.
author: Ashley M.

description: The rooftop view is great, but the restaurant is okay. We waited in line, before we realized the line was for the bar (I think?) as when went up to talk to the host he told us we could go up immediately to the restaurant. We ordered salsa and chips, Chicharrones de Carnes (1 lb), a quesadilla, 3 skewers (chicken, beef, shrimp), and a margarita pitcher. It was really loud, crowded and cold, which is a given to some extent since it's a rooftop. Everything was kind of underwhelming and overpriced. $5 for a tiny amount of salsa and chips? We asked for a refill of chips and never got it. The quesadilla was ok, but it was literally a 1 person sized quesadilla. For $13 dollars, that's ridiculous - not worth it, and I can make it for way cheaper. The skewers were okay as well. The only thing that might be worth eating is the Chicharrones de Carnes. Great flavour, but for $32 for 1 lb they don't give you enough. The service was not very attentive, but they look understaffed. Overall it was just okay.
author: Rebecca H.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE! Rooftop dining is really nice, it can get cold but definitely worth the awesome views. Food is amazing! Drinks are amazing! You gotta come!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
The first time I came here was on Labor Day weekend a few years ago after a boozy brunch in the area. It was a balmy September day, and once I saw the view, I felt like I was in LA. This is the only place in SF that I know of that can give the real "rooftop bar experience" that our friends to the south have mastered so well.

The food is great - small plates are perfect for sharing, as are the pitchers of margaritas and sangria. Happy hour is prime time; people start lining up right at 5 to catch that sunset.

Whenever I have friends visiting from out of town, I make sure to mention this place as a destination.
author: Kelsey S.

description: Omg! This place is just amazing. The view is great ! And they make the best margarita I ever had !!! You really need to try it !
author: Daniela A.

description: Amazing views, ambience and food is outstanding!! Didn't expect from outside that I would have the best chicharrones ever!! Moist, tender and great flavor. The roof top is the best! Would definitely come back again!
author: Marcus S.

description: Food was okay. View amazing but the night I went a few of the staff that I talked to smelled like they've been drinking during shift. That is unsafe and illegal . Lucky they don't get shut down.
author: Jj C.

description: Came here today for happy hour! Our waiter blew us off the entire time! Service suck ass!! Food was decent and drinks need work!! Would come back if the above was fixed.
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description:
Yesterday was such a beautiful day to hang out in the city! It was warm out, and the view was amazing. It was really crowded and really loud, but you have to remember this is a rooftop "bar". Lots of people hanging out with their friends and family came out yesterday. 

We came at the perfect time. There was no wait, and we were seated immediately! We came 10 minutes before 4 pm, which is when they start serving food.  Having not eaten anything all day, we ordered a ton of food for just the two of us: 

Food: 
Ceviche 
Chicken Thighs 
Empanadas
Elote 

All of the food was really delicious! I had to check with my cousin to make sure I wasn't dreaming. I haven't been back home too long so my taste buds have been a bit off. I wasn't sure if I was just excited to have Mexican food, or if it was truly bomb? It was definitely bomb. 

The elote was a little bit more spicy than I've tasted, but it was still yummy.
As far as the empanadas, they were good, but I still think my aunt's homemade Pilipino empandas with cream cheese inside beats El Techo's.  I am biased... 

Dessert: 
Mexican Cookies & Hot Chocolate 
Leche Flan 

The cookies were super sweet, but oh so good! It was smothered with dulce de leche in the middle. The leche flan was also yummy, but I think my other aunt's flan is the best I've had ever. I prefer Pilipino leche flan over Mexican flan. Pilipino leche flan is much sweeter, which is probably why it's super good! 

The food is good, the ambiance is fun (if it's warm out or if you're under a heater on a cold day), and the views are amazing. Make sure to bring a sweater or something to layer! It gets cold in the city.  

We knocked off one star because the service is SLOW! It was so slow!! I had to say that twice. We ordered a sangria, and the server forgot about it. He came back, and told us it was on him because he forgot and because it was so freakin slow! 

Despite the slow service, I would come back here. It's a fun place to hang out with your peeps! With good food in the sun. Why not?
author: Jenn R.

description:
came here on a sunday night around 9pm with friends. we ordered a pitcher of sangria. my oh my, maybe i havent had enough sangria in my life at 23 but this one was awesome. nice &fruity yet with a good kick! love!!

food: all the plates we tried; quesadilla, skewers, chicken w/jalapeños& the corn. my skewers were delish and well prepared i was so disapointed they ran out of maduros though :( i love platanos maduros!! the corn had thee tiniest of niblets that i finished in like 1-3 bites lmao but still good.

overall: i would definitely come back. the atmosphere was loud but enjoyable, its rooftop and they have a small menu but still a good variety. id ld looove to come back for breakfast/brunch.
author: Debbie L.

description: I'm writing this while I'm really buzzed, borderline drunk but I really needed to let everyone know that we had the greatest server ever, Markie. He was awesome and sparked up conversation with us and he was so much fun! The food was absolutely amazing and the weather was clear so we had an awesome view. I've been to El Techo many times and this was the best experience here ever.
author: Cindy F.

description: Amazing food and amazing view of the city!!! The reason I'm giving it 4 stars and not 5 is because for dinner you can't make reservations. My girlfriends and I (there were 3 of us total) put our names on the list to eat at el techo at 7:30 and we were only told how many parties of our size (3) were ahead of us (4). They couldn't give us a time estimate, just a party count. We ended up waiting 1 hour & 15 minutes until we finally got the text saying our table was ready. Other than them not being able to give a wait-time estimate, the workers, food and view were great. We, as a collective, got a margarita, piña colada, modelo, chips+guac, 2 quesadillas de pibil, the tostadas del alambre (w/o the onions and cabbage) and alfajores for dessert. Total came out to ~$72, before tip. Everything was so delicious. Defintely recommend!
author: Sabrina M.

description: After our bad experience and posting this Yelp review, the manager and owner reached out to us to make things right. I appreciate their efforts and generosity. We plan to dine here again and we're optimistic that it'll be just as great as our first time there!
author: Aimee I.

description:
To be honest, when I first heard "rooftop bar" and "in the Mission" I was pretty skeptical. But after coming here and trying the food / margaritas, I was sold. The food is amazing, the drinks are amazing (would highly recommend the margarita pitchers), and it has an upbeat, lively, young vibe.

Tip #1: The location is next to Lolinda - there's a little door leading into an apartment building. Even though it's outdoors, it has a covered area and plenty of heat lamps, so it doesn't get cold. 

Tip #2: No reservations, and the line can get pretty long, especially on weekend evenings.  I would definitely recommend going on off hours to avoid the wait!
author: Sarah W.

description: The view from this place is the main reason I come. it is beautiful, even on a rainy day! The margaritas are pretty good, can't give five stars because I think they are a little pricey. The food is good too! Definitely worth coming to check it out. I recommend coming during brunch.
author: Makenzi B.

description:
LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT IT!!!!
the environment
the food
the margarita
the view

BUT EXPECT TO WAIT TO BE SEATED ON A FRIDAY/ SATURDAY NIGHT, luckily they text/call you when your table is ready so you dont have to just stand outside!!!!
author: Cynthia C.

description:
A favorite Mission hang out spot with delicious drinks and food. The view ain't too shabby either ;)
The wait here on a nice day in SF is horribly long but is worth it. Recommend coming here with a bunch of friends (they have long tables) or with a date (beautiful skyline sunset).
I've tried the CHICHARRONES de CARNE and CHUZOS (skewered meat). Yum yum yum!
author: Angela D.

description:
When the weather is nice in SF, everyone flocks to one of the few trendy outdoor spaces. By 5:45pm on Friday, there was a long line on Mission to get into El Techo de Lolinda. I almost wanted to turn away but I also really wanted a margarita. 

The upstairs area is super cute and full of tables. El Techo is the type of place I'd bring out-of-town guests to; kind of like how I feel about Perch in LA.

The Happy Hour prices are fairly attractive but we weren't able to take advantage of it because we spent too much time in line downstairs. Instead, I ordered a regularly priced La Paloma margarita. In my El Techo experiences, I would say that the food and drinks are a-ok (no standouts) but the vibe and view are fun. El Techo is very representative of the gentrification (I know, that's a dirty word) of the Mission.
author: Yi Z.

description:
to be real and fair, came here out of hype, however I did expect a lot more than what I experienced here. 
Wait time was actually decent for a Sunday brunch in sf and prior to getting queued we were asked if "sun was ok" we said yes as we didn't think it'd be that bad to sit in a non shaded area. 
When we get seated they put us all the way in the back facing mission st with our backs to the main dinning area and directly under probably the hottest day in sf of course. 
There are plenty of slightly better seats without shade but not directly under the sun and it was v odd that my friend and I (2 of probably the only 5 brown ppl there at the time) got sat in an otherwise empty seating area. We were the only folks at the window bar. Maybe they thought our hues were better suited for the worst seats available  
It was incredibly uncomfortable to even enjoy the overpriced mediocre Mexican food as the sun was burning my skin and I was sweating most of the time. What I got most out of this experience was an awful sunburn :/ 
The staff was overall friendly and service was quick so there's 3 stars for that.
author: Bee H.

description:
I was really excited to try this place out for a Thursday happy hour. Ever since I've moved to SF, I've heard from so many people to grab drinks at El Techo's rooftop bar for views of the city. I was also warned about the insanely long lines to get in, but I had a friend from out of town visiting and thought it would be great to check it out with her.

We got there at around 6:30 on a Thursday night and the happy hour crowd was already well on their way and beat us to the line. We waited about 35 minutes which I GUESS wasn't too bad. We took an elevator upstairs and were greeted with a lackluster view of the city. Not necessarily El Techo's fault, of course, but I wasn't very impressed considering how everyone said that it was a rooftop must. It was crowded with a pretty diverse crowd, which is always good, and the space was filled with high and low tables (high if you're grabbing drinks and apps; low if you're sitting down to eat) and heat lamps everywhere (thank goodness!). We got a table fairly quickly under the tent, right by one of those very necessary heat lamps. 

It took a waiter about 15 minutes to get to us (womp womp) and maybe another 10 minutes just to get water. I get that the place was crowded but we watched as tables surrounding us got service even though they arrived after us. Sigh. The three of us ordered a pitcher of red sangria, guacamole, esquite (yellow corn, spicy crema, cilantro) and the Quesadilla de Pibil (braised pork shoulder, oaxaca cheese and salsa). This was plenty of food and drinks for our group. The sangria was okay (the best sangria I've had in SF so far is down the street at Cha Cha Cha's) and I liked the esquite for sure. But the rest of the food matched the view in its inspiration. The quesadilla was dry but I guess we were so hungry that we devoured it any way. 

I've had better food but I'm glad I at least gave El Techo a try. I may return just to try more drinks but where are all of the rooftop bars like in NYC and LA? Dear San Francisco- can you fix this pretty please??
author: Monica T.

description: Beautiful views of the city and a great place to take visitors for a drink or stop by after an afternoon in Dolores.
author: Ellie J.

description: The food was amazingggggg. Get the plantains! They were to die for!!! We also got the pollo frito and quesadilla de pibil. The view is awesome and service was great! Definitely coming back!
author: Ruby S.

description:
Let me preface by saying the drinks (namely the Pina Colada) and the views at this place are 5 stars, but I'm dropping it down due to the John Lennon character who greeted us at the bottom. We get it, you need a reservation. But we're not trying to break into the Oscars bud. 

Now let's get back to the basics: all tables are located outside on the open-air rooftop with a gorgeous view of the city. Here are my 'must order' items off the menu:

Chicharrones de Carne (roasted and fried chunks of pork-shoulder and serve it with house made tortillas, lime, salsa, and escabech. Pro-tip: if you get the guacamole you can add it to your chicharrones tacos :)

Quesadilla de Pibil (braised pork shoulder, oaxaca cheese, salsas). Out of the hundreds (maybe thousands) of quesadillas I've tried, this ranks among the best. The oaxaca cheese contributes a nice, creamy texture with just the right amount of flavor.

Pina Colada. This drink is off the chain. Served in a large glass, tall and refreshing. It has just the right amount of alcohol added in!

Next time I need to try out the happy hour (M-F 4-6)!
author: Nicole W.

description: El Techo is one of the only rooftop bars in SF, and as far as I know, the only rooftop bar in the mission. The drinks and food are reasonably priced, a by pricey, but the view is great. The only downside is that El Techo almost always has a line, a line that moves really slow. So be willing to wait. But once you are up on the roof, it is all worth it.
author: Ross S.

description:
5 stars for the view!  Made me feel like I was back in Chicago at a lovely rooftop brunch place :)

The food was not as delicious, though. We split the jicama salad and the quesadilla with kale and mushroom.  Both were mediocre, especially the salad.  Big chunks of jicama and lettuce (ever thought of cutting it up so it is easier?)  The presentation was okay, too.  

Would maybe return to have a drink here but not for the food.
author: Monica J.

description: Brunch at El-techo was underwhelming. Was a nice day to be outside. I remember dinner being better though.
author: Hiromi M.

description: Hard to get in after 7pm but worth the battle. Great food a cocktails along w a SF mission view that's second to none. #LetsGoooooo
author: Eduardo S.

description:
There's a lack of rooftop bars/restaurants in San Francisco. This happens to be one of the only few, hence why their prices seem a bit ridiculous for what they have to offer in return. I've been to El Techo twice and I can say I've gotten a good sense of what this place is all about. Keeping it short and simple because I don't have much to say.

Food: Meh. Expensive plates with small portions (as expected). The food was alright as far as taste, nothing to rave about. Overpriced, but yet again they are one of the few rooftop places in the city, hence they can charge you whatever they want for their food and drinks.Their drinks are pretty good, I think I'd go back here solely for their drinks.

Service: Pretty darn slow. You would think they would hire more servers since this place is almost always packed, but no, they have one server working half of the restaurant. Come on management, give these servers a break. Servers seem nice enough though!

Atmosphere: It's a rooftop bar so yeah I was looking forward to that. You get a mediocre view of the Mission, it almost doesn't feel like you're on a rooftop. Their fixtures (tables/chairs) seem worn out and outdated, I don't think it's for décor purposes. They could definitely benefit from a makeover. The crowd is definitely a younger crowd from early 20s to late 30s I'd say. So yeah, it's always pretty loud, hipstery and vibey.
author: Stefany Z.

description: Absolutely love these views!  Food was amazing, we tried pulled pork, tacos, ceviche and esquite.  We were able to get a large table for 9 ppl without a wait and the amazing rooftop vibes were totally worth it!
author: Kimberly L.

description: Great view! We came for dinner on a sunday late afternoon didn't have to wait too long for a table -  The food and drinks were good- Service was great. Our waitress was friendly. We had the 1/2 carnitas, ceviche and mango salad.  The ceviche and mango salad were both great but just wasn't impressed with either plate. The carnitas were tender and delicious not oily at all.  And for the drinks we had the techo margarita and sangria, both delicious and not too sweet.  Would love to come back for brunch.
author: Abby C.

description: We came here for brunch on a Saturday and loved it! I got the vegetarian benedicto which was amazing- poached eggs, spinach, and vegetables (zucchini and onions) over jalapeño cornbread in a hollandaise sauce. The drinks are great as well, my friends loved their bloody Mary's and I enjoyed my fresh squeezed orange juice. Definitely worth making a reservation for a weekend because the ambiance is super cute and view is to die for.
author: Megan R.

description: Drinks and service are great! View is incredible. My best friend is amazing, I love my friendship with her and she got bangs
author: Katrin M.

description:
Came back in September last year and decide to review it to keep the place in my Yelp log.

I was here with a friend for a late birthday celebration, and she definitely did not disappoint when she surprised me with this place. My first ever rooftop experience, and it was great! Regrets for not choosing the counter space along the edges for a better view, but overall a very nice vibe.

I decided to go heavy with the Matambre since I'm a big eater, while my friend opted for quesadillas.  Both were yummy- the Matambre was very filling, the steak was juicy, and the potatoes nicely seasoned! The quesadillas had a good cheese flavor that wasn't weak. We didn't get any drinks since we wanted to save our stomach (and wallet) for the rest of what my friend had planned, but I will definitely go for some next time!
author: Sherry Y.

description:
Rooftop Brunchin' Session!

I came here for brunch with my girls and their coworkers (6 people total) around 11am. Unfortunately we didn't make reservations but since we were the first ones there, we got seated very quickly. It was a nice day but still pretty windy so we asked one of the workers if it was possible to drop the plastic "wind blocker" for a little while until the sun came out because it kept blowing beignet powder into my friends hair and on their clothes, but unfortunately, that didn't happen because she told us the sun would come out and it would be warmer (but not true). 

The chicarron was mouth watering. SO YUMMY! It reminded me of lechon. We also got the french toast and it was below our expectation and that might have been due to the baguette. It made the "french toast" aspect of it very chewy and harder than the usual french toast we were used to. Also, our mimosa had too much cava versus agua fresca (it was 85% cava and 15% agua fresca).

Overall, this is a good place for small plates and bunch with friends because of the great view, just downside is the wind, so make sure you make reservations to avoid getting beignet powder into your hair and on your clothes if you get seated on the table we got placed at. The service is pretty quick though and the food (aside from our expectation of the french toast) was delish.
author: Eva O.

description:
I really love this place! Warning - get here early because the line gets LONG. We rolled in on a Friday around 4:30 and were able to go right up the elevator to the rooftop. I'm sure the view must be even better at night, but it was still breathtaking during the day. 

Drinks are good too! We got 2 Chilcanos and 2 Caipirinhas, and the sweet platanos appetizer. Caipirinhas are usually my go-to drink, but the chilcano was soo good here! It's passion fruit juice with pisco and bitters and I loved it! 

The platanos were delicious, served on skewers with lime and fresh cheese on the side. Would love to try more of their food next time I come back!
author: Stephanie F.

description: The food was pretty boring didn't have any flavor at all. I would never ever come back here ever! The only reason I gave two stars was because of the sort decent services. The dessert was just as boring and was not a tres leche by an means.
author: Lindsay T.

description: The food is amazing especially the carnitas and empanadas. This is Mexican food with a touch of culinary touch focusing on flavors in their meats. My only suggestion is rethinking the sangria. It was terrible. Other than that of course I'd come back especially with the view of the city.
author: Leticia H.

description:
My wife and I were in San Francisco and this place was recommended to us.  The ambiance was really nice and live.  They have a great big location plus a roof-top that is suppose to be awesome.  Unfortunately, you have to get there pretty early to make it into the roof-top area.  By the time we got there, it was a 30-45 minute wait to get into the roof-top area.  

Our waiter was a little snobby and short with us, which was a bummer.  The place is so nice that you want to have a great experience to enjoy the whole establishment.  

Nevertheless, I gave it a 4-star, because I do believe it is a really nice place and would recommend it.  Hopefully you don't get the same waitress I did.
author: David C.

description:
One of the few rooftop bars in SF with a spectacular view when the sun is shining and there is no "Karl the Fog". The odd thing is that the bar shares the building with an apartment.

Right next to Foreign Cinema (also a great place to go to, see my review LOL), you'll see a tiny line on the sidewalk waiting to go to the rooftop bar of Techo de Lolinda. By 6pm, the line is damn near at the end of the block. Walk in the apartment building and take a hot, small elevator to "PH". You are greeted by a hostess and a loud atmosphere. 

Hostess will ask if you are having dinner or cocktails and small plates. If you choose dinner, you're seated at a table, if you choose cocktails then you're at the high tables. We chose dinner and got a lovely table by the bar. We ordered 2 pitchers of sangria ($18) before happy hour ended (6pm). Later, we ordered the mushroom and kale quesadilla and the half pound chicharones. Both very delicious dishes. The meat was unbelievably tender and the quesadilla was perfectly cheesy. 

Overall, the rooftop has plenty of seating but gets packed as soon as 5pm hits. The view is beautiful when the weather is right. The service is very prompt and proper. The food is good. So why only 4 stars? Because in my opinion, the place is way too hyped for what it actually is. Take away the view and the fact that it's a rooftop bar, this place would be pretty mediocre. I wouldn't wait in line just for the food, that's for sure. Also, I'm pretty sure there are plenty of other places with equally as good, if not better, happy hour.
author: Jenna T.

description:
Came here with 7 of my gfs solely for drinks after my birthday dinner at Lolinda. There seems to always be a line to get up when you get there but they are fairly organized. The line goes by fast, we were upstairs in less than 15 minutes. Although they were busy, we didn't have trouble finding a table to seat all of us. El Techo is a rooftop bar that offers food and drinks. Its open seating and the server comes to take your order. I wish i had gotten the name of our server because she was very attentive. She even played along and recorded a mannequin challenge for my gfs and i. 

We ordered 2 pitchers of margarita (one of each kind). The margarita del techo hit stronger than the regular margarita. The price is a little bit higher than what I'm used to paying for for a pitcher but i guess with the view it comes with, it wasn't so bad. also love how there are heat lamps all over. I brought a light jacket and was still feeling warm in 60 degree weather. or could it have been the alcohol hitting....

Will definitely be back soon!
author: Kristel S.

description: Another legit after work hangout.  The Chicharrones alone is the star of the show, the pork is so tender, but the exterior was caramelized/crispy in the best possible way it's hard to describe.  Wash it down with a glass of their Margarita and you're golden.  The atmosphere on the rooftop is superb with amazing view of the city and the servers are on top of their game.  This place rocks!
author: Jen M.

description: The only good thing about this place is the view. The food is nothing special and overpriced. We ordered ceviche, chips and guacamole, chili mangoes, and three cocktails. The music is way too loud for conversation. The service was excellent though.
author: Ha D.

description:
In the past, I've dropped by for some tapas and drinks in the evening and the carne skewers were definitely memorable. But since I just had weekend brunch with some friends, I'll write about the latest visit. We did some family style items and ended up sharing a bunch of our individual brunch items. 

Must try:
- Chicarrones de carne: who doesn't love chunks of succulent + flavorful pork shoulder? Top it with the lime and salsa and it's a party in your mouth. Some pieces were definitely more fatty than others, but that can be easily removed if you're watching your fat intake. 
- Quesadilla de pibil: braised pork shoulder quesadilla with oaxaca cheese. I'd order this again in a heartbeat. The tortilla is super thick, soft yet crunchy on the exterior, super cheesy and the pork shoulder is to die for.
- Techo rancheros: I wish i actually ordered this instead of the matambre. The pork used in this dish might be the same as the quesadilla de pibil. But whatever it is, El Techo does pork right. 
 

Meh/Standard:
- Guacamole: the guac itself is pretty standard in flavor. The chips are extra crunchy and salty. It's a good starter for the table.
- La Paloma: most of our table had their fair share in this grapefruit cocktail. I really can't justify spending $34 on a pitcher. Everyone seemed to like it though

Pass:
- Matambre: grilled skirt steak, eggs, potatoes, chimichurri, and sliced brioche. All of which were mediocre at best. I was really looking forward to some flavorful medium rare (chef's recommendation) skirt steak. Instead, I got a half medium rare/half well done piece of meat. The beef was barely seasoned. It tasted like someone just threw a piece of steak on a grill for a few minutes. The charred taste was almost off putting. I had to drown it in some left over salsa off other dishes. Potatoes were drowning in grease and were poorly seasoned. I'll have to take a hard pass on this in the future.

Given that we had a party of 8+, the customer service was really great. They let us split the bill with however many cards we wanted. Our waitress was super patient with us and our needs and accomodating to our complaints about it being too hot. They rolled up one plastic covering for us to give us some fresh air.

TLDR: during brunch hours, get the chicarrones + guac for the table to share. Order the techos racheros for yourself.

Pro tip:
If you're just trying to turn up for brunch, you better pregame on walk over from Dolores. Otherwise, get ready drop some serious cash on dranks.
author: Jessica L.

description: Great brunch place! I recommend making a reservation several weeks in advance.  The drinks are really good and the views even better.  I'm a coffee snob and was very impressed with their drip coffee.
author: Cindy H.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here for dinner, and there was a reason why he took me here - THE VIEW of Downtown SF. A must everytime I come visit him is a view, and he definitely gave me one to enjoy with my meal. Try to go on a day where it isn't overcast and you'll see what I am talking about. 

The line gets crowded, so try to arrive there early. Outdoor, roof top type seating, so bundle up on cold days, One dish that is AWESOME and a must try is the Carnitas. It can be a bit pricey, but it is well worth ordering for the first time trying it. Ordering appetizers and this as the main dish can fit between two people, depending on whether you get drinks to make you full or not. In my opinion, service was decent the two times I went, but could be better. Overall, a good experience in my opinion and I will definitely be back.
author: Chazmine D.

description:
If you're new to the city, looking for "trendy" or trending spots, and don't really care about quality, def check this place out. But if you're from the area, you already know to steer clear.

The view is alright, but it's obstructed and you don't really get to enjoy it. The drinks were decent although they didn't come out until the meal was finished. The food itself was subpar (especially if you know real Mexican food in the area). My bad for assuming $14 for tacos meant 3 or more. Price point was terrible for two small tacos with less than 3 oz of fish total. And the service? Nonexistent is how I would describe. Friendly host and front door staff but the actual servers were very hard to flag down, rude, and although they seemed to be everywhere, they seemed to be socializing amongst each other more than tending to business. The crowd? Typical new wave "hipsters". One with a hole down his shirt, obnoxious and yelling our entire visit.

I thought this place would be worth a shot, but I wouldn't come here again if someone paid me to.
author: Alessandra Z.

description:
The service was so poor. The waitress failed to bring plates to our table. Wait too much and the sangria pitcher was half-water. 
After her error she offered deserts to everyone (4 people) and then afterwards reduced the offer to only one. 

Only the view saved the night.
author: Rachid R.

description: Great view of the city and nice atmosphere but I was a bit confused by the tortilla. It was practically mushy! Maybe that's the way it's supposed to be here but I didn't like it. Service was fine. The next table to us we're eating a plate of $15 rabbit food that I'm glad we didn't order.
author: Garner K.

description: El Techo was such a fun place and definitely worth the wait! Amazing food, drinks, atmosphere, and customer service! Our waitress Colby was so helpful and nice!
author: Sarah W.

description: We did have to wait an hour to get in on a weekday night, but overall I'd say it was worth it!  Gorgeous views of the city at night.  High enough up to see the whole skyline light up.  Service was pretty slow, but the place was packed. And they were good about not letting people in unless they could find them good seats when they got up.  For the views, good drinks, great ambiance/atmosphere, pretty friendly service, I'd say it's worth the wait.
author: Lisa O.

description:
Went with a couple friends for dinner last night. We got the margaritas which were honestly probably some of the best I've ever had. We also got the 1.5 lbs of carnitas which were delicious and came with black beans and vegetables, along with some really outrageous homemade tortillas. It was a ton of food and even after my friends (two 20-something boys who can eat a lot) and I (having just gotten there from soul cycle) had eaten all we wanted there was still some food. I believe the 1.5lbs was $32 which was overall a pretty good deal. 

The food was awesome and the drinks were good. The view of downtown was also really cool! While it was definitely a typically chilly SF evening the heat lamps in the outdoor patio kept us warm. I would absolutely go back!
author: Maia R.

description:
Gracias Senor, may I have another!

A favorite rooftop brunch spot, right on Mission Street. Suck it Valencia, Mission Street still has the best offerings for my taste and I can actually get a reservation. Say no to wasting life on some hip list.

The pineapple mimosa is so dang good, OJ ain't bad but hellz yea gimme dat Jugo de Piña, Por Fa. Its loaded with fresh pineapple pulp floating on sweet juice and a healthy infusion of bubbly.

Ahhh what a fine afternoon.

Add a splash of sunshine to the rooftop patio. A gorgeous view of downtown. Polite servers making sure I got what I need......mmmmmmm Mimosas........You....You got what I neeeed......but you say he's just a friend.....uh you say he's just a friend.......oh baby uuuuuuuuuu....got what I neeeeeeeed......but you say he's just a friend.....you say he's just a friend.....

A few more shmimoshas please. 

Ya leaning yet?

Soak it all up with some serious eats, chicharones, huevos rancheros with pork, shrimp ceviche, chorizo n eggs, empanadas, or choripan. Yea some serious plates and I'm not talking dainty portions. Techo will have you passed smooth out by the time you get home.

Don't forget to send it off with some Mother FUC-ing Buñuelos. AKA Beignets, AKA Donahs Donahs.

Grassy A$$, Por la mañana.
author: R J.

description: We had a great attentive service on a not too busy Monday night. Food was fresh, hot and tasty. The tortillas, salsas and chorizo tasted like they were made in-house. It's a rooftop bar and restaurant so expect small tables.
author: Ivory S.

description: One of the few places in SF that is on a rooftop/ has a view of the city! And the food is incredibly authentic. The chicharrones are worth it and are SO GOOD. The only ones that match its flavor are found in Mexico City! Skewers are very tasty too. Service was great and also very lively atmosphere here.
author: Y W.

description: Great happy hour roof deck on a sunny SF day. Arrive before 4:30pm for a shorter wait in line and your friends need to arrive when you do or then you go upstairs and if they come later, then they need to wait in line. Service is friendly and relatively quick. Margaritas are delicious. Love the energy of this place. No hooks for purses though - that's my only gripe. And I don't mind the line really- it moved fast and it wasn't crazy crowded on the roof as a result. The bouncer is cool and friendly too- which is a plus.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Randomly craving tapas while driving through SF. My friend recommended this place, as she had been before and loved it. I ended up loving it, too! Loved the rooftop dining. The food came out in a timely fashion. Drinks were ok, but the food and atmosphere didn't let me focus on that.

For food, we ordered chicken/potato empanadas, quesadilla de pibil, flautas, and elote. Everything was sooo yummy and flavorful! Definitely will come back another time I'm in SF.
author: Francesca D.

description:
I'm sitting outside on the sidewalk next door to the massive line for this place so I felt inclined to review it...
