Go for the view. Order two drinks for yourself at once because the service is so freaking slow that your buzz is lost by the time you get around to the first sip of drink number two.
The food is great. 
Get there early to avoid a super long wait.
It's not as good as it was when it was Medjool. Tables now- you can't roam free. 
Learn how to pronounce- it is called "el te chhhh oh"  not like a tech company
Please.
author: Gillian K.

description:
This place is always worth the wait! On a beautiful summer evening, you'll feel great with a cocktail in your hand, warmed up by the heat lamps, SF wind blowing in your hair. I really wish a lot more restaurants could follow suite and open up their rooftops in the city.

The pina colada was really really good. Not too sweet and has the tropical taste you would expect, lots of fruity flavor. Food is always good here and are bigger portioned than you would expect. I've had the quesadilla, ceviche, guac, and chorizo here. 

The food is good but you just want to come for the experience.
author: Sally C.

description:
Got the Paloma and the chips & guac. Both were delicious!

Kinda pricey but since it's a hot spot being a rooftop bar and all that it makes sense. 

Waited in line for quite some time even though we got there at 4:30pm on a Saturday.
author: Alice C.

description: The food was delicious services was good a little pricy but worth it! They have heaters so it was not too cold on a winter night
author: Melody C.

description:
This place has become one of my favorite spots in SF after only 1 visit.

How can you go wrong with a rooftop bar that makes some amazing drinks and a great view of SF?

The food here is good too.  I recommend the Chicharrones de Carne, which is a slow roasted and fried pork shoulder.  It is served with tortillas (which are thick corn tortillas), lime, salsa, and escabech (aka a black bean paste).  

And to help wash that down, I recommend their Margaritas.  I love margaritas, and theirs was amazing.  I also liked how the waiter asked if we wanted salted rims or not (extra brownie points in my book for that because I really dislike a salted rim on my margaritas!)

They have a glass wall up that surrounds the bar, which helps prevent the area from the wind and cold.  As well as they have the eating area in a tent with clear plastic sides (which allow you to still see the city from your seat and can be rolled up when it does get warm).  The tents are also equipped with outdoor space heaters for when it does get cold.

I definitely recommend everyone to try this place out!
author: Rose Z.

description:
It was not hard to get reservations on Thursday afternoon for two people for Saturday morning at 11:15.  Arrived 11:15, waited on Mission Street for five minutes before getting sent up in the elevator. 

Carnitas and eggs benedict were tasty.  Beignets came with caramel dipping sauce.  With no drinks, tax and tip, bill came out to $55.  Worth a rare visit for the panoramic views of the city.

Wear sunscreen.
author: Mandy H.

description:
Perfect place for HH with friends on a beautiful San Francisco day!
My friend and I shared a pitcher of margaritas, the flautas, and the 1/2 lb of chicharrones. 

The good:
house margaritas - delicious and standard
peloma - grapefruit margarita - light and refreshing!
chilcano - drink with pisco, i think this was my favorite. nice and tropical

Chicharrones - AMAZING. the 1/2 lb came with 4 mini tortillas and was the perfect amount of food. The pork was delicious and tender, the chicharrones were crispy and fresh... and the tortillas amazing!

Will be back
author: Michelle L.

description: Good environment. Take an elevator and find yourself at El Techo located on the rooftop overlooking San Fransisco. The food was great and came out quick for how busy it was. Ordered the chicharrones de carne and would recommend it! Also the Piña Colada
author: Nicholas H.

description: My wife and I are from FL and we really tried to enjoy this place after multiple recommendations.  Our waiter was Chadd. To say he had attitude is an understatement. Ive never ever had a worst experience in a restaurant or bar in my life. My wife and I are tequila drinkers and were told this was a tequila bar. When I ordered Anejo, they delivered silver.  It can be an honest mistake and we very politely brought it to Chadd's attention.  Chadd literally laughed in our face, rolled his eyes several times and mocked us to other staff. In all my years I've never more disrespected. Eventually he proceeded to bring us the bottle that he says the tequila was poured from. He held the bottle next to my glass and held them side-by-side. It was extremely obvious that the glass they had poured me was clear in color and the bottle was dark as an anejo should be. Chadd had a poor attitude and made fun of us as he proceeded around the rooftop. We asked for a manager to alert them to the problem in a very polite way. Management tried to appease us with a free shot, but didn't really seem to care much about Chadd's horrible attitude.  Don't go here!!! Or at least make sure you don't get this waiter who ruined the entire experience for us while on vacation.
author: Shane A.

description:
Revisited yesterday for happy hour and I was thoroughly impressed. Our sever was on-point with everything from taking our orders promptly to filling our half empty sangria glasses. 

The view is fantastic, especially around sunset. 

It can get extremely crowded and busy -- try to get a table even if you start out at the bar. 

Chips and guacamole: 3 stars. While I appreciated the huge chunks of avocado, it was quite bland. The chips and guac both needed (a lot) more salt.

Choripan: 5 stars. This is the most underrated dish here. I guess people just don't know what this is. It's a freaking hot dog on crack, yo. As soon as I saw it on the menu, it threw me back to when I was backpacking in Argentina. Choripan was eaten at least once a day. The chorizo is soooo flavorful and the baguette toasted to perfection. Each bite was a little piece of buenos aires dancing in my mouth! Loved the pickled veggies on the side!! 

Chicharrones de carne: 4.5 stars. Delicious, but there were too many sweet notes. The meat pieces were sweet and the bean dip was sweet, too. Both delicious though, but they do get too sweet after a while. 

Sangria: 4 stars. Enjoyed it. It was refreshing on a hot day.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Been here several times and haven't done a review.  Came back here last night as we bar hop along Mission.  We had 11 people in a group so we waited in line to go up the rooftop.  

The view from the rooftop was beautiful especially during a nice weather in SF.. Tonight there was no fog!! You can see the whole city far and wide from above! 

I got the Chilcano -very refreshing and tropical, it's one of my favorite.  Also ordered 1 lb of chicharronnes ..AMMMAAAZZZIIINNNGG!! pork was so tender! You gotta try it! It comes in 1/2 or 1lb! 

It's always a great experience whenever I come here! Service and atmosphere is always good!
author: Junaline G.

description:
My best friend recommended this spot for my b'day dinner with friends and I'm so glad it was the spot I picked for the festivities! 

It's a rooftop bar/restaurant, so there's seating areas, as well as a casual bar area. We came on a Saturday evening and luckily one of my friends was able to get there early and put our name down for a party of 10 folks. This was around 6PM. As people trickled in, we chilled at the bar area and snagged a table. By the time we were seated around 7:35PM, everyone was there and in a good mood since we had some drinks and snacks.

Ambiance: We lucked out on great day, so it was a nice evening on the rooftop. It's nice because the cityscape really becomes the beautiful backdrop for the dinner. If it gets a little chilly, you could always hover towards the heat lamps. 

Service: The host was on point (Guy with the rainbow hair)! He made sure to check in with us and update us on the availability of the table, which we really appreciated. The food service was a bit hectic, since it was really busy and we had a big party. Don't be surprised if a "Did your order this?" occurs.

Food: DELICIOUS! Had a chance to try a lot of the appetizers and mains and the highlights are as follows:

1. Chicharrones de Carne: BOMB! My favorite of the night. Shared the 1/2 pound with a friend. The meat is cooked to perfection and it comes with tortillas and fixins so you can make little tacos. The combination of the sweet salsa, beans, and chicharrones (Make sure to crumble it in the taco) was a party in my mouth!

2. Alfajores: Great dessert to tend the night. Not too sweet and it is paired with a hot chocolate to wash down.

3. Drinks were delicious. Jack Foley and Chilcano were my top picks from the one I tried.


Overall, I had a great experience and my friends enjoyed it also! Despite having to wait a bit for our table, it was easily resolved with drinks and good company. I suggest...COME EARLY. I'll be back for the Chicharrones de Carne..FOR SURE!
author: Vincent L.

description:
This place is awesome and it has a great view of the city. Be warned, it does get a bit chilly if you're not seated in a heated section. 

I came here after work for dinner and drinks with a friend. The line was quite long and I believe it took me close to 45 minutes to actually get a table for 2. Once we got our table, the servers were great about getting menus and drinks in our hands. 

We ordered a few things to eat with our drinks and everything we had was just so amazing. You won't be disappointed!
author: Bik H.

description: El Techo is a fun rootop spot above Lolinda located in the Mission District of San Francisco.  The atmosphere is lively and fun especially on a beautiful city day.  The Jalapeño Cornbread was delicious and the Pork was spectacular.  Drizzled in the amazing Salsa with the perfect amount of flavors, the Pork dish was my favorite.  All paired nicely with the Rose Cava and Pineapple Sangria.  The service was excellent, punctual and very friendly.  Aside from the minimal table size to accommodate the large plates, I would definitely return to El Techo.
author: Lan N.

description:
8-10-17
After dining in El Techo I came out disappointed at how the service was in general. At first, the waitress was nice and helpful in getting our orders but when it was time to get the check, we tipped what we thought was fair. The waitress then came back to ask if the service was good pointing at the receipt gesturing why didn't we pay her the exact amount recommended and my friend said it was okay because it was honestly just "okay", the sunglasses olive long shirt wearing girl again gestured towards the receipt and again we said it was good/okay. She left the table unhappy and in just seconds a blonde black and white stripe shirt wearing girl rushed to the table and took the water along with the glasses we were just sipping on without saying a word (keep in mind I was still not finished with my drink). By this time we just felt an uncomfortable experience because of what had happened. As a customer I didn't expect customer service to question us over and over again on what we had tipped as if "making us" tip them what they wanted us to tip them. The food was good and the atmosphere was different which is what we were looking for, but the customer service of the two waitresses was not worth going again. They require etiquette and training on customer service
author: Mayra L.

description: Finally a bar that I can relate to. After living on the east coast most of my life, I had begun to suspect that California just didn't have the same type of bar scene. El Techo has saved the day! Super hip cool vibe. Rooftop bar. Killer city views. Strong ass house margaritas. Awesome waitresses. Ceviche is off the charts. Mango salad is spicy. Yummy quesadilla. Basically my favorite bar I've found in 3 years of living here. As soon as I recover from last nights hangover, I am totally ready for happy hour.
author: Karen G.

description:
Cool place to start your night. Drinks were pretty spot on - make sure to get a pitcher! Although there was a long wait for the drinks, we still had a good time with the view of the city and all. Once you feel your drink, call an uber and have em take you up the street to go bar hopping! 

PS. Good luck finding a seat!
author: Erika D.

description:
I teeter tottered between three and four stars for ten minutes before I finally decided that they deserve three because of the way things started.

It started out rough, I'm not gonna lie. The hostess wanted to sit us at a TINY table for two, about 2'x2', when there were at least ten 4-tops open. I'm 6'6 and it was about forty minutes to closing, no way that those tables were all needed for larger parties. My friend asked if we could have a bigger table and she actually told us no, that they're reserved for larger groups. We sat down at the tiny one, and I looked like a bodybuilder in a kindergartener's schooldesk. Finally, we asked another hostess for a larger table, and she was immediately accommodating. 

Honestly, it took me about 10 minutes to shake off my irritation at this. I grew up in my family's restaurant, and that's just piss-poor customer service and PR, that. When it's slow and you can accommodate a reasonable request, you just do. Especially one as simple as seating someone two feet south of where you had intended. But I digress.

The setting was beautiful, the view spectacular. The food was tasty, I don't know that I was completely blown away. The prices were a bit high, but you're paying for the aforementioned setting and view, I get that.

All-in-all, things ended on a good note. I'm not sure that this place would become a regular haunt... but I'd bring out-of-town guests here for the view alone.
author: Sean B.

description: This place never disappoints. Was an amazing day yesterday so I decided to take my girlfriend here just in time to catch the sunset. Guacamole and sangria was excellent! Definitely coming back!
author: Rodney D.

description: Obviously the view is killer, service was great. I just could not care for the food. The portions were not at as big as I expected. My wife would come back so I told her to come back with her friends.
author: Joel H.

description: Such a great place for a bite and some drinks! The dinner menu is small but everything we tried was delicious- get the carnitas..that pork needs to be eaten!! I ended up there for dinner without a reservation and managed to snag a table without much of a wait. The place was abuzz even on a Sunday night. It's very casual, quaint, hipster, and the wait staff is super nice and fun!
author: N K.

description: Pretty chill place with an incredible view. It is a little overrated to say the least, you have to wait a while to get in. The staff is super friendly and the food is decent, but the prices are a little steep.
author: Marysela M.

description: Came on a Thursday for their happy hour. The bar is in the roof top and the scenery is excellent, you can enjoy the view of the city. They have a great variety of drinks and meals. I tried the chorizo, steak and veggie chuzos, they were amazing! Specially the chorizo one. To drink I had a piña colada, it was good but don't know if I would order it again. On the other hand the staff is very friendly and welcoming, definitely recommend this place!
author: Cynthia A.

description: Crazy long lines and they don't take reservations but best view in the Mission if you can get a table. Best for groups. Also highly recommend the sangria pitcher!
author: Caitlyn S.

description: great place for a quick drink and snack! rooftop is so lovely, and service was quick! even on a busy saturday. thank you guys for the good service and experience!
author: Alicia B.

description:
I went with my husband to El Techo on Halloween (Monday night). 

We thought we could beat the costume-filled chaos-- and because of the rain we did just that. 

Surprisingly, this roof-top bar was quite enchanting on a cold rainy night. We were enclosed in clear-plastic tents and warmed by the surrounding heat lamps. My husband and I shared the 1/2 lb of carnitas, esquite, and tostadas. All absolutely delicious. 

Food was great, but service was even better! Our cat-costumed server, Stephanie, really exceeded our expectations. She gave great recommendations, and went above and beyond in accommodating us. Great energy, fun vibes, and a new favorite rainy-day tapas spot!
author: Victoria G.

description:
Gorgeous spot! I loved the view from the rooftop. Amazing food and drinks, especially the chicarones. 

I don't give it 5 stars because the wait was so long and the seats were not comfortable and I was basically sitting in my neighbor's lap while we ate. I'd have enjoyed some elbow room to fully enjoy my tacos :)
author: Nina M.

description:
Place has a nice ambiance which is a rooftop. Food was okay. Ordered Carnitas but why did it have sugar sprinkled? Just ruined it. The guacamole, wasn't to die for! I don't think we even finished it. The salsa is good though. The cocktails here are good but I still prefer Lolinda any given day. 

The ambiance is what makes it. The food is just okay. Need to come back to try something different.
author: ARIeL P.

description:
I went here with a group from work for a team dinner.   We got there around 6pm on Wednesday and there was plenty of seating and a great view of downtown SF.  Being a work event, we went crazy and ordered a lot of items and stuffed ourselves silly!  Some were great, some were good, and some were meh.

We started with the guacamole, plantain chips, and chicharrones.  The guacamole was fresh, nicely seasoned, and creamy and went perfectly with the side of tortilla chips  The plantains were very bland, but the avocado-tomatillo salsa's spicy and lime flavor were great.  And I don't dine on swine, but my co-workers said the chicharrones were delicious.

Next, we ordered a round of empanadas, shrimp ceviche, and elotes.  While the empandas were hot and fresh, the braised beef was flavorless. The toppings on the elotes were good, but the corn wasn't sweet and was just kind of there.  But the star of the evening was the shrimp ceviche; big pieces of shrimp and just an overall big flavor from the lime and onion.

We were starting to get full, but had to try the chuzo skewers.  We ordered a variety, and they were delicious.  The standouts were the pollo (marinated chicken, red onion, aji amarillo) and the camarones (white shrimp, aii amarillo glaze, salsa criolla).

Lastly, we each ordered a dessert.  Everybody else ordered a grandizados snow cone, but I went for the Alfajores with hot chocolate.  The alfajores were delicate and slightly sweet, they were really good.

The stars of the evening were the shrimp ceviche, the chicken skewer, and the shrimp skewers.  Without those 3 items, this probably would have been a 2 or 3 star review.
author: Nadeem A.

description:
El Techo de Lolinda is located in the Mission on a rooftop with a great view of SF. A couple blocks away from the 24th Street BART Station. To get to the rooftop, you need to go through a hallway and take the elevator up to the roof. When we arrived, the place was crazy packed, crowded, and loud. The place isn't too big, but has plenty of tables. My friend had booked reservations for our party of 7 about two weeks in advance for a birthday brunch. The day we went, it was pretty windy in SF, but so glad there were heat lamps to keep us warm! We started off with a pitcher of margaritas. And since we were a big group, we decided to ordered two of each small plates just to try a little bit of everything. 

Food- 
CHIPS AND GUACAMOLE - Guacamole was delicious and tasted very fresh!

CEVICHE - Very generous amount of shrimp! Comes with a side of chips. 

EMPANADAS - One of my favorite small plates. The empanada had ground beef, potatoes, egg, raisins, and chimichurri. Super delicious!  

QUESADILLA DE PIBIL - Includes braised pork shoulder. Super cheesy! Unfortunately, this dish was not too memorable in my opinion. 

BENEDICTOS - Two poached eggs on jalapeno cornbread with chorizo. Perfect combination. Loved the runny yolk on the cornbread.  

ONE & A HALF POUND CHICHARRONES DE CARNE - Huge fried chunks of pork-shoulder!! SO DELICIOUS. Crispy on the outside. Tender and juicy with each bite. Tortillas, salsa, and black bean paste (aka escabech) came along with the chicharrones. Tortillas were thick and soft. Made a small taco with the salsa, escabech, and the chicharrones, and it was very tasty and flavorful! Definitely recommend ordering this dish!
author: Philana C.

description:
Amazing food and the rooftop location is so awesome! Their tostada's so good! 
The staff was super friendly and helpful.
Only had problems with the wait list/getting in to meet our party. 
Overall I loved this place
author: Melissa S.

description:
I had my birthday dinner here on 3-19-16. I had a interesting experience. I'll first start off by saying the food is amazing. The view from the roof top is a great ambiance, especially if you are seated near the edge of the restaurant or just come in for tapas and cocktails in the very small "lounge" area.

This place is super crowed and after speaking to staff and other patrons it is always crowed. The wait for a table is ridiculous. They don't take reservations. This place is okay for a very small party or couples. DO NOT HAVE A LARGE PARTY HERE!!!!! 

I was told I had to wait for my entire party to get there..so my lovely but not so punctual friends trickled in an hour or so after I told them to get there so they wouldn't hold a table for me. A very sweet staff member was kind of enough to speak to the manager and got us a table after an hour. *He Was A Saint* I was so greatful for him!

BUT...I was told my friends had to wait in line to come up..and then my friend found out I had to give names to the hostess and the downstairs hostess could let them up and wouldn't have to wait in the long line! ****why wasn't I told that from the start?!?!?!**** They wouldn't let me give all the names at once. I had to keep getting up to give names every 15 minutes! I couldn't sit and enjoy my party! 

Then the manager asked me if we were ordering dinner...
Ummmm we spent over $300.00 combined and he expected us to order what????? I was so upset! At the end ... he wouldn't let my last guest up...although we had been there since 4 and spent plenty of money!

I should had planned this better but I was told the day before they could accommodate me and my large party of 18. I have no clue who in spoke to but I would only come back for the food ..during the week...with the hopes it wasn't too crowed!
author: Heidi R J.

description: My number one spot to take people in the city - and everyone always loves it. The food is great, the drinks are great, and the atmosphere is great - including a killer view. I've only been in the day time though so I'm not sure if it would be warm at night. I can imagine they likely have heaters everywhere as its rooftop seating.
author: Bryce B.

description: Really fun rooftop bar with good drinks and solid appetizers. I've tried to go back a few times but the line has always been too long, but I get why. Fun spot for drinks and snacks with friends.
author: Amjad S.

description:
Had a great time here Saturday 4th of July. After reading several reviews I was prepared to wait a good 30 minutes for a table but I was pleasantly surprised when my BF and I only waited 3 minutes for an elevator to head upstairs! Already a good sign.

We ordered the pitcher of red sangria; that's the ONLY negative I encountered. It was a smooth sangria but in no means the best I've ever had. 

Ceviche as our appetizer. Taste was good. I expected a little more (quantity) for the price but it was decent. Served with chips, nothing to write home about. 

Now, the half pound of chicharrones is a whoooole other story!! From the freshly made tortillas, which I wish I knew how they're made because they're not grandma's regular tortillas. There's something else to it. The chicharrones were pure heaven! The flavor, the tenderness, the quantity, all spectacular. I'm almost glad this restaurant is located in SF and I'm in Fairfield because if not, I'd be going there weekly! Haha. We highly enjoyed this plate. See my pic! 

Then, the greatness continued...our waiter (which I'm sorry I forgot his name) recommended us a mixed rum drink with Modelo beer topping it off. But he described it so fantastically that he convinced us to try it. All I remember is him saying its a version of "a naughty 45 year old woman with a high slit dress..."  Omg he was too funny. 

Overall, this place is pretty great. The high top table we sat at was a little on the smaller side but the guys walking around pick up unused plates very efficiently so I wasn't overwhelmed really. And I won't discount another start for this but there were only two bathroom stalls! A little disappointing for such a popular place. Regardless, Can't wait to come back when it's warmer and try some more food and drinks.
author: Sherly M.

description: I couldn't of dreamt a better Benedict! I got the chorizo sausage benedictos and it was unique & tasty AF. Loved the service, loved the view, loved the food, loved the drinks! Heads up this place stays pretty packed & is on the louder side.
author: Jaine D.

description: Wasn't too thrilled with this place. It's very shady when you first walk in downstairs, the hallways smelt like weed, and it seemed very dingy and dirty. Not exactly the type of walk way you'd wanna see before you're going to sit down and eat. You end up taking an elevator upstairs to an outside area. It was cold out so it was all covered in clear plastic tents with heaters which was good. We were seated and the waitress was very nice. Was also willing to change one of my friends orders for something else cuz she didn't like it. She ended up taking money off the bill at the end which was good, so no complaints about the service. I only ordered the platano maduro and the elotos- which was ok. Nothing special.
author: Danielle M.

description: The food is good but not worth the wait and poor service. We were given an estimate of an hour wait but ended up waiting for two hours. The person who was at the door was rude and unhelpful. The waiter took our order and delivered the food and then was nowhere to be seen. We had to wait for ridiculous amount of time just to get our check in order to get out of there.
author: Supriya S.

description:
I love everything about this place except one thing - the line and line management. I understand that there is limited space - after all, this is basically the only rooftop bar in the city - but having people line up outside like a nightclub is always annoying. It's also especially annoying when you finally get to head upstairs and it turns out there's plenty of space and open tables with standing room only. 

Anyway, there's great views of the city, awesome margaritas, decent service (depends on what time of day you go I think), good food and generally a good time to be had at El Techo. If you're lucky to not have to wait too long in line, it's definitely worth checking out!
author: Amy Y.

description:
Overrated and watered-down expensive drinks 

The line was long, over 45 min to get into a bar at around 7pm on a Friday night.

I don't get how this place gets 4 stars average in a town as high standard as ours. There is nothing to write home about. Drinks are ok, $13 on average and too much ice (watered-down). There are a lot of 20s something "tech crowd". 

I would not recommend not go back.
author: Tracy L.

description:
Can I go back there.. like NOW? The drinks are yummy and the views are breathtaking on a clear day. I haven't been here at night, but I'm sure it's the same amazing-ness. 
For starters, they only let up some people at a time. At first I was annoyed at this, LOL but when I got up there, I understood why, there is limited seats. We were luckily able to snag some seats with a view as someone was leaving. We wanted to order food, and were told the bar closes in 10 minutes so we got chicharones and guac & chips. 
We got our drinks, La Poloma, super yummy and totally different that a margarita. We got the guac & chips next. The guac was super chunky, I perfer my guac a bit more mashed up but the chips were loaded with salt. 
The waiter forgot to put in our order for chicharones but brought us out free shots, so win-win!
author: Sarika S.

description:
I don't understand the name of this place or what part of the city I was actually in. I don't understand much about you, San Francisco. Like how did Danny Tanner raise a family here? It doesn't seem realistic and I demand that my sitcoms be realistic.

The food here is very good. The noise level is high, mostly due to the fact that you've got these plastic drape things that keep everyone's annoying voices bouncing in and back at you. We were lucky enough to have our table just outside of the plastic. The downside there is...it's colder. But I'd rather be cold than unable to hear the person next to me.

Again, the food was good. The noise was good, if you like lots of noise. The views were good, if you like buildings. The views were atrocious if you like corn fields.
author: Mike A.

description:
Roof top brunch on this fine Sunday! 
Bloody Mary's - not the best... 
Coffee - it's ok 
Empanadas de carne- ground beef with chimichurri sauce, it's small but tasty! The chimi could be better, the greens can stick to your teeth (not so cute)! 
1/2 lb chicharrone de carne - delicious, soft, melts in your mouth pork! Giant pork grind chip, tasty salsa for some freshness, skipped the beans (typical Asian), and fresh corn tortilla!!! So goooood!
author: Christina T.

description:
Rooftop bar!  

Same setup as Medjool except they've added tarps, you know for those windy and cold SF summer nights. 180 degree views of the city can be found here. It was surprisingly crowded for a Monday night, with big groups being the norm. Pretty casual and comfortable spot. Kinda reminded me of a smaller 620 Jones. 

The drinks and menu are a little different from Lolinda but still Latin inspired. Cocktails are in the $8-11 range with all the classics; margaritas, mojitos, pina coladas, and caipirinhas. I had the Chilcano - pisco, lime, passion fruit, ginger, soda, and bitters. It goes down like Kool-Aid, they should sell it in pitchers. 

One thing they should do is have more beer inspired cocktails. I love me some Michelada's 

* To get here, it's a few doors down from Lolinda and you take an elevator up. 

3.5 but rounding up since it's great for groups and the waitstaff was so friendly.
author: Earl G.

description:
They opened their brunch time for Labor Day which was awesome. We got here and the place wasn't crowded even though we made reservations and we were able to pick a table close to the edge with the skyline view-- though we were melting underneath the sun. In retrospect, try to request for a table close enough to the skyline but underneath their canopy/umbrella especially on a hot summer's day. 

It was totally worth roasting in the sun because the food was exceptionally delicious. My boyfriend grew up in Mexico and is a tough critic when it comes to Mexican/Latin American style food-- and he was highly impressed with every single plate we had: the guacamole, the ceviche, the chicharrones de carne, and the quesadilla with Oaxacan cheese and pork. Loved the margarita as well. Plus, our waiter and servers were entertaining and very accommodating. We kept requesting pitchers just full of ice to cool us off... They wouldn't let us down. 

Oh, and the view? Photogenic as usual.
author: Janelle S.

description: Sunny weather brunch at this nice rooftop bar. We arrived at 11:20ish. Was told we had to wait and it took only around 15 minutes. Probably because we told them we were willing to sit on the sun(spoiler alert: this is a bad decision) I ordered Benedicto and my friend got Chorizo scramble. We had Coctel de Camaro for share. And us both got piña colada. Didn't try Chorizo and nothin to comment here. Benedicto was wonderful. This is first time I tried egg Benedict with cornbread beneath it. It goes sooo well with the hollandaise and the poached egg. Only downside is I didn't taste anything jalapeño about it. Thought it could have been more spicy. Piña colada was a little bit too sweet. My Friend's piña colada actually had a fly in it but waiter swiftly helped us got another one. The biggest downside of this brunch is the fact that we actually got arranged to sit on the sun and it was proved to be a decision in a sunny with around 27 degree. Throughout the whole lunch we were sweating like cray cray, so remember not to make same mistake as us if you don't want to turn a nice rooftop brunch into a rooftop sauna.
author: Mofy M.

description: Yes, of course you know by now, that this place has a rooftop, with some pretty killer views of the city skyline. It definitely has that going for it. As far the brunch, it was awesome the first time I went a few months ago. I had ordered the eggs benedict, which are served on a jalapeno corn bread. Yum! When I went again recently, I opted for the same dish, but the corn bread was burnt! Ah well, can't win them all...
author: Evelyn K.

description:
I've ordered the Techo Rancheros twice on two separate occasions. This dish is simple yet flavorful (beans, pork, a tostada, eggs, avocado, green salsa and cheese). I think I'd say the texture reminds me of Mexican chilaquiles. Love Love Love this dish!! :D 

A note regarding waiting times- Go earlier if at all possible :D ..On the first occasion I visited I arrived around 1 ish on a Sunday and found myself waiting for quite a while. Most recently I visited this place on a Saturday at 11 am and found myself seated quite fast.
author: Brac C.

description:
The roof up here is a dream... stellar view, stellar cocktails. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit here on a Sunday night, when it wasn't that crowded. I'm sure it can get to be too much on a weekend night, although brunch sounds like a superb alternative.

I would steer clear of an entire dinner here because it's really pricey. Cocktails and appetizers seem like the way to go!
author: Kerry G.

description:
Things I enjoyed:
- The foods were wonderful and drinks got me suitably sugar high/ slightly buzzed
- The view
- The staff are super friendly!
- Hella dudes buy you drinks while you wait for-freaking-ever for your friends to get up the elevator
- Everyone is having a super fun time :D

Things I decidedly did not enjoy:
- The line (at 6pm?) paaaaalaese
- Totes bro-land/ meat-marketing thing going on... it had a strange resemblance to what Lime used to be (if you know what I mean, then you know what I mean)
author: Kate M.

description: Love this place! Such a chill spot in the city. Great drinks/ food/ atmosphere. Little pricey on the drinks but what can ya expect in the city! ;) only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the hostess at front door ... when waiting to get in... was very rude and unprofessional. Yes I'll admit my friend was a bit to deal with because she had been drinking, but the lady treated us poorly and unfairly, letting others cut us in line. We almost left & didn't go inside but glad we did! Wish they had a better hostess tho. Gotta keep it friendly and professional people! Specially when we're all out trying to have a good time with our friend from out of the country!
author: Kristen B.

description:
HAYLEY is the coolest chick ever! 

She seriously was the best server. Her suggestions were on point. Our food was incredible. Tonight happened to be very gloomy but we still had a pleasant experience in the roof top. 

Get this girl a raise! 

But in all seriously this place was awesome. 

Thank you, Hayley!
author: Kimbro S.

description:
Waited nearly 2 hours but it was totally fine since I was with good company and they allow you to chill at the bar down at Lolinda (food and drinks are also awesome there). 

As soon I as I received a text that my table was ready we took an elevator up to the roof and it was one of the coolest dining areas I've ever been to! But really, the best part was the food. We ordered flautas, empanadas and our ultimate favorite: Chicarrones de Carne! Get it! Must get!
author: Victoria K.

description:
**I really love this place so I'm going to give it 4 stars, but I have to write about this one particular server that was SUPER rude.

I came here with my bf on 1/5/17 at around 9:00PM. The host was super nice and seated us right away. Our server's name was Jeremy, he was wearing a long sleeved gray shirt and black hat. Everything was going well and he seemed okay until my bf asked for a new glass. Jeremy then said, "Why, what's wrong with it" which really surprised me because the way he asked was almost defiant and very rude. Besides, I don't understand why he wouldn't just give my bf a new water glass. My bf said "It's dirty" to which our server replied, "Where?" At this point I felt super uncomfortable and upset. Why was this guy trying to argue with my bf about something as simple as a dirty water glass? Jeremy then explained that it's not actually dirty there are just lots of scratches from the way the glasses are stacked and demonstrated by getting glasses and stacking like we were stupid...He then took one of the glasses he was demonstrating with and said "Here you can just have this. There's no scratches" and walked away. After that whole thing my bf and I were just staring at each other like wtf just happened...

The rest of the time he didn't check up on us once but checked up on the table right next to us 2-3 times (tables are super close to so he definitely could have asked if we were doing okay!!) He only asked if we wanted anymore food when we were clearly done and wanted the check and when he gave us the check he didn't say thank you or anything. He really killed the mood and was unnecessarily rude and argumentative.

ANYWAYS, I do love the food here I'm just pretty sad about this last experience. The quesadilla with pork is SOOOOO good! The pork shoulder or whatever it is that comes by 1/2 lb or 1lb is amazing too. 

Cute, trendy spot with yummy food and perfect for a date night!
author: Jazzmin B.

description:
Like so many other reviewers - order the chicharron! It's amazing! For two people, the 1 lb was perfect. We also ordered the elote was great. The views fantastic. We came around 7:30 and after waiting in line on the steets we ended up at the penthouse around 8 when the sun was setting and the clouds very pink. It was just beautiful!

I'm not giving el techo 5 stars because it's REALLY loud! Like super loud. Not the romantic rooftop place I thought it was be. :( sad panda.

The wait for the bar area is on the street. However, you can order food at the bar. Even though the host will ask you if we are there for drinks or dinner, making it seem that food can only be ordered when sitting at the shorter table but that's not true. 

If you want dinner at the shorter tables then you go up to the street level host and tell him/her to put your name down for dinner and then wait for them to text you. If you wait in line that's for the "drinks" part which again you can order food too but it may be trickier to find a good table to fit your party.

I still think it's a great place to enjoy a great dinner and drinks. Piña colada is very sweet. It's good. Not strong at all. My favorite kind of alcoholic drink :)
author: Angela K.

description:
i didnt know this little roof top bar existed in the heart of mission. Upon coming up here, you're greeted by a cute little view of the neighborhood and A LOT of hipsters.

The drinks are a little on the expensive side, about 10-15 dollars per. besides the view, nothing really stood out about this place. the service is extremely slow, so beware.
author: Andy H.

description:
Everything about this place is amazing! From the view of the city, to the delicious food. We had brunch and were very pleased... Next time we will be having dinner at El Techo. 

Oh we will be coming back! Absolutely amazing!
author: Angel B.

description:
Had an amazing night that ended with a great dinner here with a few friends. We probably ordered half of the things on the dinner menu and only wished our bellies were bigger to continue the feast. 
My friends ordered a few drinks.
We ordered:
- Chicharrones de Carne (half pound was perfect for 3 people) FAVORITE. DO IT. ORDER!
- Empanada de Carne (yummmm)
- Ceviche de Camaron
- Platano Maduro (Really liked these- sweet :) )
- And some chicken things (they were aite)

Anyway. Even though it was a little hazy out, seeing the whole city while you feast and chat with friends makes it all better. The heater and stringed lights were on after sunset to maintain a comfortable place to eat! Perfect place to sit and drink, or have a dinner. Great service!

-It did take a little long to get seats, but it was all worth it. Would come again, and order everything :)
author: Lisa L.

description: Asked for a water during the last call for alcohol. Got told off and said "talk to your server." Honestly I was having a great time, do not tell your customers off like that. Asking for something basic like water is not that intensive as a request. 0/5 stars.
author: Kai D.

description: One of the few rooftop + outdoor places in the city. I have frequented this venue from the time it was Medjool. On a nice day, it's a fantastic place to be. If it's cold and windy (hello san francisco) it could be a little difficult to enjoy a cocktail. They menu has a good variety and I would highly recommend it as a Happy Hour spot on a warm SF day.
author: Tarun P.

description: We love this place! They have a beautiful view of the city and great food! Their brunch is the best. They have a lot of gluten free options. Our server's partner is celiac so he assured me the kitchen would be extra careful. I highly recommend coming here!
author: Jillian M.

description:
I was looking for a Latin restaurant for lunch for myself & my husband on a Saturday afternoon. Not all the good restaurants in SF are open for lunch so I was pleased El Techo was. I had been to the old Medjool before it became El Techo & remember the views were quite nice. I was able to make an easy reservation via Yelp for the two of us. Finding El Techo was sort of weird from the street as it's been a few years since I had been. Once we found our way, we had to wait with a group to get up the elevator. It's painfully slow to get up. Once up top, we were seated promptly & lucky for us the weather was perfect. El Techo also has heaters for chilly days. The decor is colorful & atmosphere is vibrant, casual, & fun. Pretty much exactly what I was hoping for. Our server came over straightaway & took our drink orders while we decided on food (service started off fairly good at least). 

I went for the La Paloma which is a grapefruit margarita - refreshingly delicious! I could definitely sit on that roof for a few hours & sip those babies. Their menu consisted of so many tasty items that we couldn't resist ordering a few items. I started with the ceviche & hubs had Chicarrones de Carne. Both packed immense flavor. We both loved that the chicarrones weren't your typical cracklin style, but showcased the flavorful pork & tortillas. The tortillas are out of this world, by the way. Super fresh. For our mains, hubs had the Benedictos & I had the Quesadilla de Pabil. The Benedictos jalapeno cornbread & chorizo went beautifully with poached eggs. The quesadilla was quite filling & loaded with more tasty pork. I decided to end our meal with one last cocktail - the Margarita del Techo. It was kind of a letdown after the flavorful La Paloma. 

In the end, we were both more than satisfied with the delicious flavors of the food & drinks. I felt service seemed to slip after a while & not sure how we got lost in the shuffle of tables, but somehow we did. That's really my only complaint. The views are lovely & can see myself coming back for a fun brunch or date night.
author: Elena F.

description: El techno has awesome ambiance.  The cuisine is very hipster, but it's always superb.  The roof deck is a great way to spend the afternoon with a cocktail in hand.  I definitely recommend this place.
author: Kristin R.

description:
I wanted to host en event at el techo for 25 people but ended up canceling.  I requested for an additional 30 minutes to the allotted 2 1/2 hours provided for events.  I was willing to pay an extra fee or order more drinks to get the additional time, but El Techo was unable to accommodate my request. When I was booking the event I had no problem agreeing to all the costs I really wanted it to be a great party, but when you ask the event coordinator about extending the party for an extra 30 minutes and she tells you it's not  possible and that they are strict and we will get kicked out.   Then I will book my event elsewhere. If my party stayed for an additional 30 minutes the revenue generated from my event is greater then the cost of me canceling. The event was also going to take place on a Tuesday, I am sure it's not a super busy night. Your policy does not make sense. 
A bird in the hand is better then two in the bush!
author: Ana K.

description: This is San Francisco! Love the atmosphere and the FOOD!!! Even though it was raining, it still felt like a party was about to happen. A party in your mouth. Get the frickin beignets. And like everything else. Drinks are bomb, staff and service were friendly and great. Just go when it's dry out. Alcohol and rooftop seating when it's wet is a no go. Still enjoyed it very much!
author: Arianne M.

description:
Views were great. Atmosphere was very casual. We got to the restaurant around 4pm and there was no wait time. Once we left around 7:30 there was a huge line to get in. Felt like the food was nothing to memorable. We ordered the guac and chips. The guac definitely needed salt(none on table). The two quesadillas were average. We then decided to leave  for a restaurant with more menu options. 

4 stars because cocktails were so good. And the server was very attentive.
author: Jean D.

description:
I recently moved from San Francisco to Los Angeles and was so excited to finally try this place. I heard so much about it, but wow, it was such a disappointment. Luckily we didn't have to wait long (about 15 minutes) at 4pm on a Saturday, but I heard it can get really crowded. The view at the top is nice, but I'm convinced that the rooftop view is the only reason that people go there.      
 
We ordered the pitcher of sangria first, and it was watery. We then ordered a pitcher of margarita, and they were really strong, so that was definitely worth the money. However, it tasted like straight up tequila so my friends didn't even want to drink it, but hey, more for me!                 
 
Okay let me get to the food and service. Sooooo disappointing. All of it. We ordered guacamole and chips, and the table next to us got all 5 dishes that they ordered before we even got our guacamole and chips. I had to remind the waitress about 2 different times and even asked two other waiters. I understand that they are busy, but how is it that the people next to us received their food first and arrived about 20 minutes after us???
 
The guacamole was dry on the top, so it was definitely sitting out. The ceviche tasted like shrimps that were frozen from Costco, thawed, and then mixed with some lime juice, onions, and cilantro. The elotes were the only thing that were pretty good here. The flautas were ok. We asked the waitress for the pork quesadilla with steak instead (since my friend doesn't eat pork) and she said sure. She then came back 10 minutes later to confirm our order. I repeated loud and clear STEAK quesadilla as I was already pretty fed up with the slow service. Of course she brings out a pork quesadilla....?!?!?!?! She then explained to me that she didn't understand what we were asking and that they can't make it with steak. I told her that I don't really care about the reasoning, she just needs to take the quesadilla back and take it off of our bill.
 
Just a note: she was a nice waitress so I don't want to bad mouth her, I'm just explaining that the service here was terrible. Also, the food is forgettable. The view is nice and the drinks are strong so I would suggest that you just go to the other restaurants that are authentic and delicious down the street and come to this place for a drink if you want to try this place out (but expect to wait a while for the drinks). I, however, won't be back.
author: Marian S.

description:
My favorite tapas spot in the city. I've been here maybe 5 or 6 times and I alway leave full and happy! El Techo is a great place to come with friends for some drinks and food to share. I love their margaritas (both the class and the del Techo). The other drinks I've tried are pretty sweet (Paloma and Chilcano), but their margaritas are perfect for me. The food and drinks are pretty pricey, I came once with another friend of mine and we each order a pitcher of one type of margarita (oops) and spent about $90 just on the drinks alone. 

-Margarita del Techo: really smokey and really strong. I'm a huge fan, but a pitcher of this is significantly more expensive than the classic margarita. 
- Guacamole: SO GOOD. I've had my fair share of guac, but El Techo's is just thick and creamy and delicious
- Chicharrones de Carne: must try - I get it every single time. They usually don't give you enough tortillas, but you can ask for more for free!
- Empanadas: yum but really oily. The chimichurri sauce it comes with is good too.
- Pollo Fritos: fried chicken bites. Everyone I come with always really loves this, but it's not on my list of favorites for El Techo. The salsa it comes with is really great though. 

I especially love the atmosphere and the see through canopy and heaters to protect you from the SF cold. I wouldn't come here for the view, because you're kind of just looking at the roofs of other buildings in the mission. Sorry, wallet - I will definitely be back many more times in the future.

TIP: if there's a long line downstairs, tell the host you're there for dinner. Sometimes they will seat you immediately because the bar section and sitting/dinner section are separated.
author: Estelle C.

description: empanadas are really good here, but they only serve two little pastries. bloody Mary is mix just right. very is very nice at night. brunch stops serving at 3pm.
author: Raquel K.

description: I love this place!!! Great for dinner or even just appetizers and drinks! The carnitas are good, is recommend getting that to eat! Drinks are strong but not overwhelming. Plus, there is an amazing view!!!
author: Tiffany A.

description:
This place is just awesome. It might be one of my favorite places in the city. I would give this place 5 stars, but sometimes they have bad service.
The view from this awesome rooftop is off the hook.
Their pork plate is perfect for sharing, great guacamole, and yummy ceviche. 

It is a nice place for a date if your don't mind a little louder atmosphere. 

It is a little cold but that's an SF problem ;)
author: Jad A.

description:
Nomz, really good Mexican food + cool vibes = really good combo. We weren't seated on the famous rooftop :( if anyone knows how to get seats up there, please help me out haha.

It's small plates so definitely great for sharing :)

We ordered:
Ceviche: Must get! So perfectly made and full of flavor, exactly what a ceviche should taste like.
Empanadas: Forgot which one it was, but it was the one without any meat and it was a little dry but still good. Wouldn't get this again though probably.
Quesadilla de Pibil: The braised pork shoulder is soooooooooooo tender and juicy. Definitely the star of the night.

Also, I ordered two margaritas, like an idiot, not knowing that these aren't those frozen ones that taste just like lemonade, but taste like straight up tequila...which was painful to finish.

It was a little on the pricier side, but nothing too outrageous, and the service + ambiance + food was all worth the price :) Definitely recommend for a special occasion or for a night out with friends!
author: Jingxi Z.

description: Great brunch spot, it actually takes reservations!! The rooftop had gorgeous views and a canopy to protect us fair weathered SF folk. The food is typical brunch with a Mexican twist and the mimosas are classic! This place is an SF staple that everyone should visit.
author: MacKenzie B.

description: Came here with a reservation on a Saturday morning. The brunch menu is small but very delicious. I got the veggie scramble and my friend got the brisket egg dish. The ambience is amazing and perfect for a warm day in the city. I don't come across too many rooftops in the city so this place is usually my go to for spring days. I also love the fact that I can make a reservation for brunch which is not that common in sf. Will be back for more mimosas :)
author: Sandra S.

description: I did like it. We went for a little get away for the day, and came early to be sure we got a seat. Just talked and enjoyed each other.
author: Mikka W.

description:
Great place with a great view of the city. The food is good. We had Tostadas de alambre and torta de pibil. Both dishes were excellent. Sangria was also good, but not great. Limon has a better sangria. 
The only negative thing was that the service was pretty slow
author: Sophie N.

description:
Met a friend I haven't seen in a while up for brunch. We ordered a pitcher of la Paloma, Techo Rancheros (tortilla, pork, fried eggs, salsa verde, beans), and beignets with a dulce de leche sauce. The roof top view is beautiful and the food is delicious. When our neighbors received their food we quickly regretted not ordering the Carnitas. =(

Tip: Reserve a table online at OpenTable or you'll have to wait awhile for a table.
author: J. A.

description:
Great place for a night out in the mission. Not only do they have great drinks, but the food was amazing as well. 

I came here on a Saturday night to celebrate a friend's birthday. We didn't have a reservation so the wait was actually very long. 2+ hours! Granted we did show up on a busy night with a rather large party. Their bar area was heated so fortunately, we were still able to have a great time while waiting for a table. 

I ordered the Paloma to sip on and it was delicious! Definitely recommend it to all the ladies who have a sweet tooth and love tequila. The sangria was great for sharing in a large party.

As for food, do not miss out on the chicharrones (the pork was so tender and juicy)! The quesadilla was delicious as well. 

I will be back for sure! However, I'll definitely avoid visiting in a large group or on a Saturday night....
author: Kristi L.

description: LOVED the view and the entire experience. We hit it just at the right time just as the sun set. I would recommend making a reservation since the line was long. The tostadas and the plantains were delicious. The chips were just how I like them. The drinks were also quite good. I got the hummingbird and a margarita. Both were strong but not overly so.
author: Sabrina P.

description: Waited in line on the sidewalk behind a chain link post (instead of velvet rope) across from the entrance only to get into an elevator to get into this rooftop bar. Typical hipster hangout so of course it was cool for only a second before everyone found out about it.
author: Son T.

description:
This is a must see place if you want to experience the bar experience in San Francisco! The house sangria and margaritas are unreal and the view of the downtown skyline will leave you feeling very good. The braised pork shoulder, guac, and chicharones are great!!
Gets a bit busy for happy hour but the bar is open seating if you can snag a seat.
author: Drew A.

description: I've been to El Techo twice and think the food and atmosphere are great. But I had a not so great experience last weekend that is still bothering me. Our waiter actually made fun of us for not drinking alcohol when we were there Friday night - he made a crack about us being on our way to bible study?!?!. We went along with the joke to not embarrass him, but it went on throughout dinner, and we couldn't believe he didn't let up. Not good.
author: Linda M.

description:
Good food and drinks! We ordered a pitcher of la Paloma, corn, mangoes, guacamole & chips, and tostadas. 
 
Paloma-not too sweet, it was pretty good
Guac & chips-fresh guacamole but chips tasted stale 
Tostadas-delicious as well! We came in a group of 3 girls and it was nice of them to let us know that the order of tostadas comes in 2 so that we can order an additional one.

Customer service was the best! Brandee was so sweet to us and gave us really good recommendations! When you're trying to just chill with your girlfriends, having a nice server like Brandee makes it even better.
author: Becky M.

description: This place is amazing. The food and drinks are on point, and the service is exceptional. So accommodating and intuitive. Our host was thoughtful enough to re seat us and our server Jeremy was the best. Jeremy - I am so excited for you and your future and if I had a business I would hire you to help me run it. The management here is doing something right that's for sure.
author: Zoë W.

description:
Great food but they don't start serving lunch until 4pm. Opening till 3pm is breakfast and 3-4pm is just drinks and chips. 
The set up is fine but may not be convenient if you're vegetarian or don't like eggs too much (as that is what most of their breakfast meals consist of) 
Otherwise, great vibes with lots of people and a beautiful view!
author: Puneet S.

description:
Food was really good, great for sharing with a large party. Drinks and food were also relatively cheap, compared to everything else in SF; we got away with about $44 per person for lots of sangria and cocktails, plus enough food to fill everyone.

That said, we had a party of 7, and while that obviously means we will wait a bit longer, it was a two hour wait on a Saturday at 7:30. Long wait expected, but that was pretty slow, and they didn't seem to want to push two tables of 4 together.

Overall great, but probably not recommended for large parties that want to eat.
author: Riley P.

description:
This is significant because I don't usually eat Mexican food - 4 stars great ambience for young and trendy lifestyle in a vibrant neighborhood. Modern Mexican inspired American breakfast and casual food served on an open roof top

People are probably here for the novelty and ambience - located in a noisy part of the heart of mission, on the top of an old building, this restaurant enclosed the roof top with transparent wind breakers so restaurant goers can catch a view of the city (in mister chilly SF this can be tough). There's almost always a line and the place is jam packed with young trendy restaurant goers sipping drinks made from the "shack" "beach bar". 

Serves modern Mexican American breakfast comfort food : egg Benedict, toast with a twist - guacamole, chorizo, tortilla chips. Lots of alcohol options and cocktails with agave and champaign alike. 

Got the chorizo egg Benedict, portion is significant. Friend got pork belly with crispy pork skin (a few delicacies present in the dishes), it was rich and meaty, quite delightful. For me though, too rich if I consume the whole thing. I like light, or spicy not so much buttery except in fish. But at this trendy bar and open space, people want rich savory food to go with a romantic conversation or weekend hangout.
author: Dilys S.

description:
I went to El Techo for a belated birthday dinner with my brother and we had a pretty nice time.  We showed up around 8:15 on a Tuesday and we got a table right away.  They sat us in a pub style table and were happy to move us to a regular (lower to the ground) table when we asked.  

The menu is very not super descriptively written, so we had a hard time figuring out what we wanted.  The server didn't seem particularly interested in conversing with us too much, so we didn't ask many questions.  We were surprised that about 3 out of about 6 or 7 of the small plate options had raisins in them.  Neither of us find raisins particularly appealing in Latin food so we were kind of at a loss.  We ended up ordering the Flautas (which had raisins) but we did not taste a single raisin in them, if there were  any, they were so few and hidden that they really shouldn't be in the description.  My brother really like the green tomatillo sauce on the flautas, I found it to be too sweet.  The Pibil quesadilla was pretty good, I don't usually like quesadillas so the fact that I enjoyed this one says a lot, my brother loved it.  The guac is super good, but it is a really small portion, you get a small handful of (really good, homemade) chips and about 1/3 cup of guac.  It's not enough for two to really get a satisfying helping.  

In fact, that is the case with ALL of the dishes.  The flautas comes with two very small flautas, each one is about 3 bites.  The Quesadilla is two small wedges.  I don't know how on earth you would come here with a group; you would have to order 5 of everything.  It's just way too expensive for the portions.  I guess you are paying for the atmosphere too.  We got two regular margaritas, they were mostly ice and a little on the bitter side, $9 for about 3 swigs of margarita.  The flan was OK, the passion fruit jelly is a little overpowering and the flan can't stand up to it.  

Our bill was like $60, before tip, for two tiny dishes, a tiny cup of guac, two drinks and one small dessert.  I'm not saying that this is unbelievably pricey, but in order to get enough to eat, we would have had to order double the food. I understand the small plates thing.  The problem is not the smallness of the plates, it's the price of said plates.  It should be noted that the reason we didn't order more was because nothing else really shouted out to me.  The ceviche sounded good but I'm not paying $14 for two spoons full of ceviche that is more than likely not going to be as good as what they make at most taquerias.  I was confused about what the chicharrons were going to be.  It's described as chunks of fried pork, so they are not traditional chicharrons, but were they just going to come as a plate of meat chunks?  Eat em like popcorn?  And it's $15 for half a pound.  I'm sorry, I'm not a butcher, is half a pound a lot of chicharrons?  Cuz $15?? Really?  

I heard that they have an amazing artichoke dish, but it wasn't on the menu.  Maybe I'll check this place out again in the summer.  But be prepared to break the bank.  

Shout out to the super friendly host who not only offered to take our picture, but even guided us to what he thought was the best view to take a picture in front of.  Thanks host!
author: Emma H.

description:
The wait usually isn't so bad, considering how popular this place is. You cant beat the view on a clear day/evening. They sometimes let it get really really crowded up there-to the point where it's not even worth it.


I went back 2 weeks ago for brunch and gave my cousin one of the plantains that came with my meal. He tried to order a side for himself and the waitress told him that wouldn't be possible. But...you have them? They're here? You can't throw some on a plate to make your customer happy? I understand it's not a side on the menu, but i feel like that would have been a super easy way to go above and beyond for the customer. Super bummer because they're SOOO good! ):

Overall, the food and drinks are good, and this is a fun place to grab a pitcher of palomas with friends.
author: Katie B.

description:
Eight of us enjoyed plenty of delicious drinks and food for a reasonable $28/person (with tip!). 

Some highlights:
- Gorgeous views
- Great happy hour deals ($5 chips & guacamole, $18 pitcher of sangria, etc.) 
- Strong, tasty margarita-mix-free margaritas 
- We split a variety of small plates, none of which seemed all that small: patacón (green plantain patty with black beans and queso fresco), empanada de carne (ground beef), quesadilla de acelga (kale, mushrooms...), quesadilla de pibil (pork), pollo frito...

We all agreed that we'd return and would also love to check out Lolinda downstairs. They do accept reservations for 20 or more and for Saturday/Sunday brunch. A few blocks from 24th/Mission BART.
author: Emily J.

description:
Solid food and prices matched with spotty service. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat/drink here but if you're in the area, it's a good choice especially to impress out of towners. Brunch is also surprisingly family friendly (albeit noisy).

The views are decent but honestly, coming from NY where the gorgeous skyline is what draws crowds to wait on crazy rooftop lines and pay for overpriced food/drinks, El Techo doesn't really do much for me.
author: Alyssa Y.

description: First time here.Booked reservation online(reservation gets you past front door,to hostess upstairs,and promptly seated).It did take about 10 minutes for waitress to come take our order,but its Sunday brunch time,popular place,and busy..be patient.Enjoy the rooftop bar with excellent views of mission st and San Fransisco.Great atmosphere,food and margaritas.I had the carnitas,it was bangin!Servers were attentive and friendly.It is somewhat pricey,but we loved it and will be back.
author: Brian P.

description:
We were searching for a restaurant to eat in SF, and all the Uber drivers up until yesterday had given us bad recommendations.  Well, it turned out that the one driver we had that was actually not from SF gave us the best recommendation.  Lol.

We arrived at 5:00 and there was already a line out the door (just for drinks).  We made a dinner reservation and were told that there were 4 parties ahead of us.  In NY that usually means a decent amount of waiting time in a small restaurant.  However, much to our surprise we were called to the front fifteen minutes later.  

The restaurant is on the rooftop and is packed with with a 20s/30s crowd.  The prices are cheap and the food is delicious!  Service can be kinda slow but then again this is compared to the service we receive in NY so I can't really be a fair judge of that.  

All in all, the waitstaff was friendly, the food was great, the views of the city were great, and the prices were good.  I'd definitely come back!
author: Nicole P.

description: Excellent service. Amazing views. Delicious food and great cocktails! Can't stop thinking about their Piña Coladas and Shrimp ceviche!
author: Maryann P.

description:
I thought just the financial district had places like this but was I surprised with El Techo de Lolinda! It's all about the rooftop bar ambiance and young professionals.

I came across this place via a Yelp search as I was looking for drink places in the Mission District.  This district seems to be a little seedy, but it can be argued that it adds that much character to the area. 

The restaurant/bar is located upstairs in which only 1 elevator goes up and down.  There may have been a staircase, but we were instructed to take the elevators.  The outdoor seating and glass windows facing out to the city is spectacular.  

Why I deduct 1 star is the service and the hours of service.  There's no formal bar service area, so you can't just go up and order a few drinks.  You have to be serviced by a waitress/waiter.  I found that kind of annoying because you're basically competing with those who are there for a dinner.  Also the closing hours is too early! Last call was at 10pm, and they close at 11pm.  Yes, it was a weekday but most happening bars/restaurants I know of in a major city close at midnight at least.

The drinks are moderately priced just like any other bar but definitely not too expensive.
author: Todd N.

description:
El Techo is the kind of place you see in indie movies about young professionals falling in love or trying to figure out their place in the world (think the kind of personas you saw in 500 days of Summer). This rooftop bar located in Mission offers a stunning view of San Francisco decked off with a classy atmosphere and delicate string lights.

I came here with my friends for National Margarita Week. There are two seating areas (one for just drinks and one for food+ drinks). Tip: If you opt for just drinks you might find yourself standing, especially if the bar is already full. 

The drinks tend to be more expensive than most the food here (it ranges about $11-$12 for a drink). Their Happy Hour is from 4pm - 6pm and offer great deals ($4 for a beer!). We ordered a pitcher of Margaritas (around $30) and between three people were able to have about 2 glasses each. The margaritas were strong and deliciously lime-y. We also ordered guacamole and chips ($5 during happy hour). I was satisfied with both the food and service here.

Tip: If you're planning on coming here later in the night, be prepared for a wait! The bar tends to start filling up closer to 5pm. 

Overall, I had a good time at El Techo. If anything, come here for the view and experience.
author: Naveena S.

description: 5 stars for ambiance, quality, taste, and cocktails!! I had the pork carnitas. They were a perfect blend of sticky, porky, salty, goodness. The tortillas tasted homemade and I loved the the fact that the beans were topped with cotija cheese instead of queso fresco. The watermelon mimosas are worth going for alone. The micheladas are extremely spicy. I'm sure they can adjust if you prefer it mild. Eat and drink here . Your welcome.
author: Betty V.

description:
Excellent food and beautiful view of the city. We tried several tapas including empanadas, quesadillas and a wonderful shrimp dish. We got the cookie and hot cocoa dessert which was wonderful. 
We waited in their bar on ground level and have a great tequila drink. Recommend highly!
author: Terry E.

description: I love this spot.  Margaritas and ceviche is always a good choice.  It's located on the second floor with an amazing view of the city.  Love going here on Sunday evenings when in the city.
author: Seema S.

description: Not worth the wait. Limited and expensive menu for mediocre food. And not much of a view, especially when huge standing parties are blocking anyone from seeing anything.
author: Natasha K.

description: Had the best dinner here. The food was fantastic. Our server Grace was so fun and had great insight on the dishes. And our bartender Ignacio made some delicious drinks. Top it off - we had a warm, sunny happy hour. Couldn't ask for a better dining experience.
author: Caroline D.

description:
The food and view was amazing. Markey advised us perfectly and probably served us the best sangria I've ever had in San Francisco !
Great spot ! Mucho buene!
author: Léa B.

description:
Saw this place when I was walking around the mission. It's a really cute rooftop bar. You wait in line at the bottom and take the elevators up. There's not a lot of signage so could be easy to miss. I came here during cinco de mayo so it was pretty busy and we waited about 45 min. They also don't take reservations. When we finally got in it was just for the bar area, you have to put your name on the dinner wait list if you want a table.

Food was really good. The pork quesadilla is a must try. Also the plantains are really good. It's a really cute, fun place to grab a drink at night with friends. Great ambiance and good views. However, drinks were not that tasty.
author: Tanya Y.

description:
Awesome place to chill: Views, Heatlamps, Drinks, yeah yeah yeah.... but have you had their empanadas tho?! They are on the smaller side so i always ask for 2 orders. DO IT!! The fried chicken with habanero sauce also stood out and the patacon plate which gives you plantain, beans and cheese. Trust me its awesome. Also the guac here is really good. Last but not least (definitely not least) the sangria (and I'm not even a wine person)  Get you all those things I listed above and a pitcher of sangria and it will be an awesome introduction to the various things they offer.

I can't say much about the cocktails here because I usually just get the sangria. However friends have all said good things about the different cocktails they've had. I'm usually too busy stuffing my face with the delicious empanadas and fried chicken
author: Thielson D.

description:
As a visitor from New York for the Dream Force convention, I was familiar with the feeling of being skeptical towards waiting in line to eat. But I had to see what all the hype was about.
I checked in with the host and was sent upstairs within 15 minutes (which I found fast for SF). 

We made our way up the elevator onto one of the only roof tops I found out in SF.
The view and vibe immediately won me over. All around one of my favorite spots in SF. My water cup was always filled and the (cute) server was diligent with refills on my drinks (loved their Paloma but also made me a great moscow mule!). 

We had guac, ceviche, and some quesadillas- we loved all. Great service, delicious food, perfect drinks, and great music playing. 


Definitely coming back to this spot next year.
author: Tj V.

description: Definitely worth checking out! Was a little leery at first after being told to wait outside before being allowed to proceed to the elevator that takes you up to the rooftop dining. Once there I was pleasantly surprised, great view of the SF skyline. Our table shared several dishes, especially loved the CHICHARRONES de Carne - a must have dish. The quesadilla de pibil was also tasty. Only disappointment was a bit slow wait staff, our server seemed a bit overworked, would definitely go back and hope for a bit better service.
author: Karina B.

description:
I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE this rooftop haven. 

My girlfriend and I always get our usual:
- A pitcher of their Margarita de El Techo (Mezcal tequila is delicious)
- Their scrumptious empanadas
- 1/2 lbs Chicharones

These are the perfect pairings. Man, I'm salivating just thinking of my expereince. mmmMmmm

So lucky I don't live or work by this place or else I'll be a biggin.
author: L S.

description: I love it here , this is one of my favorite spots to eat in the city . Anything off the menu is worth it ! Try it all , I did  I have never been dissatisfied . Let's not forget the amazing view up there ! 5 stars all the way
author: Hershey R.

description:
While the wait to get in is a bit tiring, the margaritas are WELL worth it!!
Initially we had a large party of 8 and they stuck us in a back corner table by the bathrooms that wasn't shaded from the wind.

However, when we saw a table open up we asked and the staff was more than happy to relocate us.

Try the pitchers of scrumptious margaritas and enjoy the view from one of San Francisco's few rooftop bars.
author: Taylor O.

description:
I've come here a few times for happy hour and it's always a good time. Highly suggest getting there at 4:30 on a nice, sunny day because this place--not surprisingly--gets crowded really quickly & then you'll have to wait outside in the line. 

The rooftop has sweeping views of the city from the Mission. They also have heated lamps for when it gets a little cooler in the evening, which is awesome. 

But the margaritas, sangria, and cocktails are legit. I've only had the chips and guacamole which are pretty decent.
author: Juan T. K.

description:
Last Friday, a few of us girls went to El Techo for my BFF's birthday - we had a casual dinner prior to going out. We went to El Techo based on recommendation after not being able to secure a reservation at Foreign Cinema. 

Two of us got to El Techo around 8pm and put our name on the list. We were #15 on the list and they do not quote wait times here since it can vary. We figured it would take awhile being so far down the list so we went to Lolinda's bar to get a drink. When we got to the bar and ordered our drink, our table at El Techo was ready - only 10 minutes later! I was surprised and caught off guard since I didn't expect it to be so quick.

When we got to the rooftop, I was instantly in love with the environment, vibe, and views. This place is definitely a great place to meet with friends over drinks and small bites. It can get pretty loud though, so you will probably find yourself talking loudly.

Overall, I thought the Food and Drinks were just okay - a few items were good, but nothing was outstanding to me. We tried their Ceviche de Camaron, Empanada de Carne, Flautas, Chile Relleno, and Quesadilla de Pibil. The only item that stood out to me was the Chile Relleno - this was delicious and apparently the first night it had been on the menu. The pork in the quesadilla was delicious, however, the quesadilla as a whole was ok - could've used more cheese and flavor. Our server highly recommended the Chicharrones, but since we were going out afterwards, we were trying to keep it more simple with the small plates. 

For drinks, we shared their sangria, which was good, but not great. Cha Cha Cha definitely wins in the sangria category in the city.

Overall, super fun place to go with friends and I would come back for the views alone. Maybe next time I'll try Brunch or come just for drinks and a few items. But for dinner, I'd rather go somewhere else for a full and delicious meal.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
If you want a nice spot to take someone from out of town for dinner and drinks this is the spot. It has a nice view of the city which is rare to find in San Francisco along with great food and pitchers of margarita/sangria. They don't take reservations except for brunch on the weekends between 11-3 pm. 

This is a tapas bar so we normally just order and share among the table. I recommend ordering their Chicharrones, Empanadas de Pollo , Guacamole and chips, Pollo Frito and the skewers - the only thing I'm not a big fan of is their Ceviche. The food comes out fairly quickly and they have great customer service!

If you want to grab just drinks you can ask to go straight to the bar, and for dinner you ask to put your name on the list and they'll text you when your tables ready. I recommend grabbing some cheap drinks across the street at Doc's Clock.
author: Karen C.

description: Love the ambience and rooftop vibe. Great for brunch gathering. Simple but flavorful dishes & awesome drinks. Try the Paloma & bloody Maria! Oh & mimosa with agua Fresca.
author: Mao X.

description:
I go to San Francisco often to visit a good friend who lives in the city. We have gone to El Techo together two times now and I can't wait to go back! El Techo is located in the Mission which is nice little walk from her house. When you get there it looks just like a regular building and you have to take an elevator up. Once you are up top you have the BEST view of the city and an amazing place to grab some food and drinks! 

Favorite food items:
CHICHARRONES de CARNE (roasted and fried chunks of pork-shoulder with house made tortillas, lime, salsa, escabech) and Quesadilla de Pibil (braised pork shoulder, oaxaca cheese, salsas).

Favorite drink:
La Paloma  (tequila, grapefruit, agave, lime, soda)

All are sooooooooo good (I could go for it right now!)

If you are ever in the Mission or any part of SF for that matter, try and make a quick stop here!!! You won't regret it!
author: Alexis P.
