description: Food was sub par. Even for American Mexican, it had no taste or flavor at all. Drinks were acceptable but nothing to write home about. Great views of the city and good atmosphere though.
author: Megan C.

description:
This is my second time coming here. The first time was amazing and so today I went for brunch and it really wasn't what I remembered. 

I had the corn bread and it was really really dry, same with the French toast. 

Our server was really unfriendly too.... Smile it's Saturday!!
author: Mercedes C.

description:
This is a really nice place to get drinks, the view is perfect and you don't need to worry about the cold weather of San Francisco they do have patio heaters which makes it really warm. The food here is Delish! I would say the wait time is not too crazy however it's better if you have a reservation. 
Finding parking it's always crazy in the city, but there is a parking lot around the corner from El Techo which is very convenient.
author: Ere L.

description:
Service really terrible: we had a friend running late and she had to wait alone for more than half an hour. We had an open chair at our table for her but the receptionist wouldn't let her go up.
On top of that, I got charged more tip on my credit card that I actually put.. It is the first time it happened to me.
The view is great for sure (which is the only reason for the second star), snacks are decent, but it was overall a big deception for everyone of us.
author: Pierre M.

description: FOOD: 1.5lb carne, 2 mango side plates to add on top of our tacos.  Fried plantane for dessert. That was perfect for 4 people. DRINK: margaritas are nice and strong. Total PRICE: ~$150.  LOCATION: The restaurant was above a night club and then above an apartment building roof top. Good vibes, good views the food...yum the carne was cooked two ways: sweet and crispy was my favorite. FAIL: food poisoning for 2 days after eating here hopefully it doesn't last any longer... Seriously so far 3/4 of us are food poisoned.
author: Grody F.

description:
Where to begin? The location of this place is amazing; on a rooftop, with an incredible view, in the Mission, meaning on a nice day, it's the perfect place to grab some sun and some brunch. 

Our table ordered a bunch of food, all which was delicious from sight and smell, but the Chicharrones de Carne took the cake. This was hands down the best thing I have eaten in a while. The delicious salsa and beans on the side, plus the homemade tortillas was a party in your mouth. I ordered a couple of eggs on the side and some guac which really made the dish magical. 

If you go to El Techo, you must order the Chicarrones!
author: Jane F.

description:
By far my favorite place in SF! I have visited here countless times, it's one of my favorite places to take out of towners. They always love the city view, good food and margaritas. I've had quality service time and time again here. I usually go for dinner, but I've done the brunch and it's amazing as well. They take reservations for brunch between 11-12 on weekends. 

If you go for dinner after about 7 on the weekends, plan to put your name down and go next door for drinks for about 1-1/2 hrs. 

My favorites on the menu are the ceviche, mango salad and chicharrones. Oh, and the food is always SUPER fast.
author: Jenna B.

description:
What a view and service. Can't say enough about Felix. We are tourists trying to keep it un-touristy and Felux helped us with just that. 

We loved the guac and elotes best off the menu. The margs are perfect. So fresh, not too sweet. #perfection

Happy hour can't be missed. Many deals to be had.
author: Mandi G.

description:
My dining mate and I came here for a special date night a few months ago. Without a reservation the wait is a bit long but I had errands to do so we walked around and did them and came back just in time. It was a really gorgeous SF summer night and everyone had the same idea: ROOFTOP BAR!

We started with a pitcher of their house sangria which was nice and light for the night. We ordered the Quesadilla de Pibil and I asked that they add the kale and mushrooms to this. It was delish! I have a soft spot for ooey gooey cheese and this definitely satisfied my taste buds! We also ordered a few skewers of the chorizo and camerones. All of which were great and flavorful. Of course we were sinful and eating with our eyes so we had an order of the half pound chicarones de carne. THIS. IS. DELICIOUS. We definitely had left overs and over ordered, but I have NO REGRETS!

I will have to come here next time with a bigger party to maybe try more tapas, but it was definitely a nice date night spot. The tables are soo small and you're basically trying not to bump elbows with your neighbors. Basically, you should give up wanting to get up mid meal because your chair is probably bunched up against someone else's too. (So pee beforehand while you're waiting!) Perhaps this close knit space gave it the Spanish feel which I didn't mind too much. The service is quick and will help you unload empty dishes from your teeeny tiny table. I can't wait for summer to come back again!
author: Crystal V.

description: Make a reservation in advance or you'll wait an hour or more. Who waits in lines??? Food is very good. I'd go back but I'd choose an earlier less busy time or a non weekend day. The noise level is deafening, no really. You thinks it's going to be loud and then you get to the rooftop and it's 10 times louder than you think. Sometimes very slow service, our server really shouldn't have been in the food service business. She was more of a social butterfly. 2nd round of drinks never came. Took her at least 20 mins to take our order. Once the food arrived it was amazingly yummy.
author: SFCAFOX S.

description:
Great food, beer.  Bloody Maria was a little small and bland for the price.  Great view!  
Definitely Try This Spot.............
author: CraigsBay209 ..

description: Bomb drinks. Superb service. Beautiful view. Me like! Buuuuuut the elevator smells like barf. It needs to be cleaned bad.
author: Suzy Z.

description:
This place is cool. We used to go there more often when they opened but less now because it became so popular that there is a huge line almost everyday. They have a good cocktail selection. I wouldn't recommend the pina colada though, that has more coconut milk that alcohol... But otherwise I always liked my drinks there and food is good too!
Awesome 360 view !
author: Marion P.

description: I have visited El Techo twice in the past year or so. The first time was for a birthday brunch and the second time was for dinner. Everything I have had has been excellent. The fixed brunch menu appears super basic on paper, but the flavours and quality are crazy good. Brunch highlights: guac, ceviche, buñuelos and some type of egg scramble. Dinner highlights: guac, chicharrones, shrimp/steak/veggie skewers. This place is busy for a reason. Will be back.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Love this local rooftop - it's always in the mix when my husband and I are thinking about potential happy hour or brunch locations.  We've been several times now, and each time we leave very satisfied. 

Our favorite food items that we've tried thus far are the pulled pork quesadilla (holy cow, delicious - tortillas are out of this world!), the guacamole, and the ceviche (so well balanced, the seafood is not too rubbery or chalky tasting like some ceviches can be, and the perfect amount of heat.  

Be prepared to wait for a table if it's a nice day out.  Particularly during Sat/Sun brunch or at HH time on the weekend.  The wait usually isn't so bad if you go on a more overcast day - don't be turned away if it's a bit "icky" outside because they have heat lamps and umbrellas for days in which the weather is not cooperating.

Love this place, and will definitely be back!
author: Rachael S.

description:
2nd visit to the rooftop for Sunday brunch. This place has a great vibe. Food is tasty and service is friendly and attentive. Aldo was above expectations today. 
Love the city views from up here. Really adds to the dining experience. Beautiful day. You can see forever. 
Sangria is delightful.
author: Kim K.

description: Best tortillas I have ever had, so soft.  Best carnitas, so soft.  2 awesome waitresses that were super attentive (because I know yelpers love their service).  2 hour wait, and worth every second on a sunny day like yesterday.  Protip, put your name down and drink at lolinda.  Don't tell them you own a restaurant.... Doesn't help
author: Choladeva C.

description: Food was great. Drinks were great. Location/views were awesome. One of my favorite places in the Mission.
author: Mike S.

description: Food and service  horrible, over priced and not organized at all. We were here for over an hour they could not get our order right after telling them over and over again.
author: Alishea M.

description:
We got there and a friend was in line waiting so we stood with them. One of the bouncer came up and told us very nicely that the other patrons in line were complaining, so I told him, "no problem, we'll head to the back." We left no incident and I didn't think anything of the incident. The bouncer later found us in line and waited and chatted with us. He felt bad and then expedited our service upstairs. HE DID NOT HAVE TO DO THAT, THIS MAN WENT THE EXTRA MILE. 

Outside of the outstanding service, the bar itself was really cool. Rooftop with plexiglass walls to keep out the wind. Heaters as well. Mind you, this was a cold SF night, yet we all felt very warm. Great views, the waitress was really nice and the drinks tasted great!

This is definitely a bar I will come back to and a bar I recommend to all my friends!
author: Nick M.

description: The view is really, really nice. The food is decent. It's so trendy. So, so trendy. The line is usually very long, they don't accept reservations, and the staff treats you like it's your privilege to be there. Personally, I'm skipping the view (and the wait, and the mediocre service, and the hoards of loud hipsters), and opting for better food elsewhere. But maybe I'm just a bitter old man.
author: Francis L.

description:
Came here for the first time for happy hour last Thursday and sat at the small plates and cocktails area and boy was it a good time with friends! It helped that it was a really nice day and the weather was just perfect for being out on a rooftop in San Francisco. 

The FOOD & drinks were so flavorful (we had the empanadas de carne, guacamole, and pollo fritos) --all very delicious but the chicken had to be my favorite! The sangria pitcher was also really yummy and is enough for maybe 2 rounds of small-sized glasses for 3 girlfriends. We had 3 pitchers in total & it complimented our food and conversations quite nicely I must say! 

The STAFF was friendly and super helpful from grabbing extra chairs for my friends and making sure we weren't low on food or drinks. 

And the VIBE was just great! Really great energy! I was able to catch up with close friends without distractions and everyone else seemed to be enjoying themselves and having a good time as well.

The place gets packed real quick so if happy hour is from 4-6pm, try and be there right on time or a little earlier since it is a first come, first served basis. You won't be disappointed!
author: Bezaleel B.

description: Chicharrones, empanadas, jicama salad, guacamole !!! Everything was delicious, fresh, and cooked to perfection. Will definitely return!
author: Kimia M.

description:
El Techo provides a beautiful space and atmosphere to hang out with friends and gaze over the beautiful city of San Francisco. So in terms of atmosphere and location it gets 5 stars.  I came here on my birthday and we definitely all enjoyed watching the sun set over the bay. 

The drinks are also good and though a little on the sweet side, they offer a wide variety for just about anyone's pallet.  Their drinks are a bit strong which is always a good thing in my books! 

Now, why the three stars you may ask? THE FOOD is not up to par with any other aspects of the restaurant.  It is extremely overpriced and not tasty or authentic.  I keep reading all these great reviews about the carnitas but we paid 30 dollars for sugar coated pork.  Real carnitas, coming from a Mexican, lean on the saltier side with sweet undertones but that's not what I got here.  Their beans were also not cooked thoroughly and tasted a bit sweet as well.  

All in all,  come here for the drinks and atmosphere but don't expect the best meal of your life.
author: Michael B.

description: I didnt realize this was separate from Lolinda. When I arrived at Lolinda, there was a line to get up to the roof for El Techo. After dinner, we took the elevator upstairs and wow, what a view. Such a pleasant surprised to come up to this rooftop which is somewhat sheltered with glass and umbrellas so it isnt too cold. The heat lamps were on and we had a fantastic time drinking and chatting at this very unique place.
author: Ravenous T.

description: Always good drinks & cool environment. The ceviche I had the other night was soooo good.
author: Marie C.

description:
- TIP:  Get there when doors open for Happy Hour and reward yourself with a great view of the city.

- CON:  Margaritas are just fine.

- BOTTOM LINE:  Great view.  Mediocre everything else.
author: Russ W.

description: Went on a cloudy lazy Sunday afternoon, wish it were more sunny to enjoy the view, but also there was no crazy line which was nice. Got the pina colada which was not a smoothie consistency at all which you usually expect, but you can taste the rum. Decent. Shared a half pound of the chiccarones de carne, These are delicious the first few bites. Definitely get to share, if you eat more than 2 tortillas worth the flavors get a bit tired. Also got the shrimp ceviche which tasted better than it looked. But this also got tiring to eat after awhile. Definitely makes sense to come with group and share little bites. Not huge meals. Fun atmosphere.
author: Vivian D.

description: I've been here a couple of times and usually it's a great experience. This time around was not what I'd expect from El Techo. The host greeted us and immediately told us we'd have to step to the side to finish our coffees that we were sipping on while we had been waiting down stairs. I asked if I could put it to the side so it wouldn't go to waste, he responded rudely and would not allow it. I asked again if he could just allow us to put the drinks aside and the host acted as though I had brought in a picnic basket full of food. He proceeded to seat us on the bar seating when we had a party of four and there was open tables that were a better option. He lacked professionalism all around and gave poor customer service.
author: Cisco M.

description:
Came here for brunch. We were a group of six and made sure we had a reservation. This place gets busy!

The rating is mainly for the view, the good service and a great location (close to Bart stations). Drinks were also good. The food was just ok...I had the huarache - the brisket was a little too fatty. Others in the group were also split about how much they liked their food.

Overall I'd definitely come here again, but maybe just indulge in an appetizer or two.
author: S J.

description: The food was delicious. I enjoyed their quesadillas, sweet plantains, the pork meat was good (I don't normally eat pork). The drinks were even better... The view was amazing too...
author: Gabriel G.

description:
I.
Want.
To.
Be.
Cool.
So.
I.
Eat.
Here.

Rooftop.
So.
Cool.

Expensive.
So.
Cool.

Crowded.
So.
Cool.

Noisy.
So.
Cool.

After.
Waiting.
Forever.
SO.
EFFING.
COOL.
author: Rob C.

description:
This is my new favorite place in SF. It's great that you can make a reservation for brunch and it's not super packed like other popular places.

For the 3 of us, we got a half pound of chicharrones with a side of guac, ceviche and steak & eggs. The chicharrones are just sublime and perfectly tender. I also loved the flavorful steak that came with delicious bread. Ceviche was not a standout for me though.

We had the chilcano cocktail, which was great. I really liked this place for its friendly and fast service, fantastic food and the rooftop brunch ambiance!
author: Melissa C.

description: Besttttt View and Mexican food on a brunch date everrrr!!!! They have such a great price and really tasty taco  just blow your mind on how good the meat is. The price is cheaper than expected. Remember to go on the sunny day for drinks and food
author: Thuy H.

description:
Oh yeah.  This is classic Mission on a gorgeous afternoon no better place to be.  The roof views the panoply of the Mission with faint traffic and street sounds floating up endearingly to you while you sip cocktails and munch on this huge platter of decently priced grill meat.

Excellent see and be seen hipster meets tunnel and bridge crowd both gaping at each other.  Each  more outraged by the other.  

My date, a nice man from a fly over state sat bemused as we quietly chewed our Argentinian street food and enjoyed the free entertainment.

There is always a queue so bring a fully charged phone while you wait to manage your ADD.
author: S P.

description: Edgar!!!!! Such amazing service and so attentive. Drinks great, atmosphere amazing. Mango apps were a must. Get more than one!
author: Morgan G.

description:
I have to say that this place disappointed immensely. Right from the beginning when we got seated, we were the only table without a heat lamp and it was freezing. Once we started ordering our food, things went further downhill: 

1) Chips and guacamole: Chips were very stale and old
2) Skewers: Order 2 each of shrimp, chicken and chorizo: Shrimp was so bad that no one even ate it. The others were mediocre at best
3) Ordered Panna Cotta and it tasted like cough syrup
4) Ordered a few more things that were also mediocre

Highly disappointing as we spent more than $200 between 3 of us and left really sad about the meal.
author: shweta v.

description:
Such a cute place! The restaurant is on a roof overlooking the beautiful city of SF. Came here on a Sunday for brunch with a group of 7 to celebrate a bday. It's not too far from 24th st bart station so you can def avoid driving in the busy SF streets. Our server seemed very busy but managed to give us terrific service! He checked up on us often and gave us great food/drink recommendations. 

For food we ordered small plates to share. Two of whichever small plate should be perfect for a group of 5 or more. We ordered two ceviches, two quesadillas, two empanadas, one order of the Benedict and 1.5 lbs of the chicharrones. The ceviche was  delicious with a generous amount of shrimp and a zesty flavor. I do wish it had more of a spicy flavor. The empanadas were also very tasty with a chimicurri-like dipping sauce. The quesadillas were also very tasty, super cheeesy!!!! They braised short rib inside was delicious!! The Benedict was also really good. The poached eggs sat on top of a cornbread accompanied by a chorizo sausage. It was bomb!!! I would definitely order that again for myself haha. Lastly the chicharrones were the star of the show. They came with tortillas, a bean purée and salsa which made for the perfect little taco. Delicious!!

We also ordered a pitcher of margaritas super yummy! I ordered a piña colada on the side which was also great but I will say it kinda took a whole to come out. I would definitely recommend this place! I can't wait to come back!!
author: Jessica B.

description:
Worst service I have ever experienced. Including the fact our waiter had the most appalling reaction to someone on another table in the venue having a seizure! To anyone planning on going to this place - skip it! Rooftop isn't worth being treated like rubbish. 

The waiter we had acted like a diva and didn't seem like he wanted to be there, any requests we made were received with a cold stare and perhaps even an expression of annoyance. 

First of all we waited about 10-15 minutes to be asked if we wanted drinks. Server took our order and although my friends drink arrived a few minutes later, they forgot mine and another 15 mins goes by before it arrives

Food arrives and we have no silverware, we try to get our waiters attention. 10 minutes go by, food is cold and we finally have silverware. We explained to our waiter that the food is now cold and he said no it isn't and walks away... 

He comes back about 15 minutes later and asks if we want another drink. We say no, just the check please 

Check arrives. I put my card in it and place the little folder on the table. Waiter comes over and stands the folder up again and walks away. I let him know we are ready to pay and he says he needs a card. My card was placed in the check folder, which when he put it back up again the card fell out. We find the card on the floor and he proceeds to process the payment.

Meanwhile someone at another table behind us starts to have a seizure and the waiter just stands there and stares while others look for a spoon and ask for someone to call an ambulance. People ask him to call an ambulance including myself and he does nothing. Thankfully the person having a seizure was fine and he left with his friends. 

This was the worse experience at a restaurant bar I have had in my life so far. 

It seems like a place that's trying too hard to be cool as well. Should just be a relaxed environment with friendly people. 

Owners. Sort it out!!
author: Haifa B.

description: I loveeee their rooftop views. It can get crowded here, so be prepared for a 20 minute wait or so. Great vibes! The service was good, from the host, to the server to the food runner/buser. However, it can be verrrrrry slow. Took us about 15 minutes to flag someone down to take our order and another 15 for our check on a few occasions. The only thing I don't like is how small their menu is. A few more options would be nice!
author: Rebecca J.

description:
Awesome view!
Shrimp ceviche- mediocre
Shrimp skewers- bombbbbbb
Attentive & friendly waitstaff!
author: Tina H.

description:
Just wanted to congratulate you on being included in cnn.com's slide show of the world's best rooftop restaurants.

http://www.cnn.com/2016/06/21/foodanddrink/gallery/best-sky-high-restaurants/?iid=ob_article_footer_expansion
author: Dean L.

description:
Great place if you want to go for brunch, happy hour and dinner. The food is decent but the drinks seemed to be watered down.

Obviously the view is amazing, you can't beat looking towards the SF skyline while enjoying your meal. 

My favorites are the chicharrones de carne and the quesadilla.

The service was great, and it busy fast so be prepared to wait or be early!
author: mia e.

description:
The food here is amazing!!! I cannot stop thinking about the chicharones. Someone please bring me some right now. Also their guacamole is to die for! Perfect green color with the right amount of lime in there! It was perfection. I would definitely come back for their food. 

Service was great. Everyone was really nice. Only thing I didn't really like was how loud the place was. Like it was so loud I couldn't even hear myself think, but what do you expect you're at a rooftop?!! Lol definitely not a place to be all romantic with someone.

But really tho try their food! It's amazing!
author: JG I.

description: I can see how this would definitely be a fun place to go once it's warmer. For the winter there's heaters on the deck and it's mostly covered with vinyl (is that what the clear plastic tarps are called)? Either way, friendly staff, very trendy well dressed group dining out and patio-style seating. Loved the Choripan order -- it's chorizo on a baguette, with chimichurri and red onion. Perfect amount of spicy and warm. We also ordered some of their cocktails served hot. Didn't feel super alcoholic, but still tasty. A little pricey, but probably worth a visit for an occasion.
author: Chrissy B.

description:
On Sunday, 8/31/14, my girlfriend and I ate at El Techo de Lolinda for brunch. 

Atmopshere/Decor:

I really like the layout of El Techo de Lolinda. It's rooftop dining. The views are amazing. There were plenty of tables to accommodate a party of two or even large groups. There was a bar area where you could see the bartender cranking out drinks. You can also see the kitchen located near the restrooms. 

Food:

We started off with some Guacamole (cotija, tortilla chips.) The Guacamole was really good. The avocados tasted fresh. The tortilla chips were decent. We also ordered the half pound of CHICHARRONES de CARNE (roasted and fried chunks of pork-shoulder with house made tortillas, lime, salsa, escabech.) The Chicharrones de Carne were some of the best carnitas I've ever had. They had that nice crispy texture but at the same time the pork was tender and succulent! The pork tasted very fresh. The tortillas, black bean puree and salsa were very good as well. The beans had a nice texture and unique flavor. 

Service: 

Our waiter Luis was very nice and attentive throughout our brunch. 


Overall:

This place was very crowded for brunch on a Sunday. I could definitely see it getting super crowded during the evening. El Techo de Lolinda is a happening upbeat roof top dining restaurant that serves delicious carnitas. If you want a restaurant that has amazing views, good service and delicious food, El Techo de Lolinda is the place for you!
author: David R.

description:
Shitty ass security/bouncer service. Oh, I cannot forget his sidekick, who was also part of the nonsense. Where do I begin? Oh right.

We got there around 9pm, asked if there was a cover. Cool, no cover charge just need to wait in line. There were about 6 people ahead of us. Okay...waited for 15 minutes. People who were ahead of us asked what's taking so long? Bouncer: it's full capacity, we are waiting for some people to leave so we can let you in. Okay, understandable.. 5 minutes later, group of people left, that group went inside. We waited another 10 minutes and between that 10 minutes, it was bullshit. 

To the girl who walked up to the bouncer and the sidekick of his, yes, you. Don't think we all didn't see what you were trying to do. So what if you are their friend or a regular or whatever you whispered to them, get your a... in line! Where's the manager when you need him/her? Where is the surveillance camera? To the sidekick guy, I wished your boss heard you say 'just this once, next time get in line' to that girl. Whoosh, she was in without waiting. After another 5 minutes, a couple walks up to the sidekick and bouncer, as if they knew them too, but had no reservations and wanted to get in! Finally it knocked some sense to them and told them to wait in line. We were still upset either way.

Already almost 9:45pm, what the hell is this? A club? LA? Oh right, bs. Sorry, El Techo de Lolinda. Thanks to your bouncer and his sidekick, you just lost a group of business.  

How was the view, service and drinks? we wouldn't know since we never made it in.

Note: If you are desperate to try this place, make sure to make a reservation. Maybe that will save an hour of your time.
author: Jennifer H.

description: If only it wasn't raining... This rooftop restaurant would have had amazing views overlooking the city! It's enclosed but still accommodating on a rainy day. The menu options are pretty traditional Latin food but with a nice twist. Everyone at the table was satisfied with their meals!
author: Krystal T.

description:
Rooftop bars/restaurants aren't really a thing in SF with the fog...maybe that is what makes El Techno memorable. I love everything about this place: the view, food, ambiance, and dranks. 

Usually there's a wait before you can go up, but it's not too long (at least from my experiences). And yes, there's a second wait when you get to the top. But! You can hang out at the bar while waiting for a table. Their bar is FFA, so you can grab a drink and look at the city skyline before eating. It's really not bad at all (especially considering that their drinks are pretty good)! 

Food...get the fried chicken. Perfectly crispy and moist! Squeeze some lime on it and you are good to go. I love that they also serve the chicken with jalapeño. Get the chicharrones de carne...the pork shoulder is really tender and flavorful! They serve it with tortillas and salsa, so I made little tacos. I suggest sharing plates rather than getting your own stuff - think tapas style. 

When the sun sets, I feel like El Techno is alive with cute lights and chitter chatter. Intimate fun setting with delicious food & drinks, so if you're thinking of a date night....El Techno is where you wanna be.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
The stars is mainly for the atmosphere of the restaurant and the manager. The manager deserves 5 stars, but our experience really deserves just 1.

I understand there may have been miscommunication coming into dinner, but it's not right to treat customers the way that we were treated. The birthday girl called in the night before to ask if she can reserve a table for 18. They told her sorry they don't take reservations, but we can get seated when the whole party arrives together. The next day, my other friend arrived early to put our name down, but the hostess told them that the biggest table they had for us was a table for 12. This part may have been our fault for agreeing to that table, but when the birthday girl came to clarify that we actually have 18, the hostess gave us the same option only. Our table of 18 were waiting at the bar for 2 hours just to get seated somewhere. When the table was ready we got brought to the table of 12. I asked them if we could also take the empty table across/next to us, so that it would accommodate the whole party, and she said no sorry your friend told us 12. I was so mad because the whole 2 hours they knew that we actually had 18 not 12 anymore, so why not accommodate us or just tell us sorry we can't seat your whole party anymore, so we don't have wait 2 hours for no table... They tried to give us a table of 12 and just leave the rest of our party at the bar with no other options. If the hostess is going to tell us that that's the biggest table they have, then why didn't they tell us that when we called the night before to make reservations. Spoke to the manager, and he helped us right away. So easy!! We got the table next to us just like that.  

Also, coming in I gave the birthday cake to the hostess and said "Can I give this cake to you, it's for lauren,"  and she said, "What do you want me to do with this?" In a way that sounded like why are you giving me this.... I really wanted to say, what do you mean?!?! Have you never given a cake to a restaurant yourself before or do you guys not get cakes from other parties?! I asked if she can put it in the fridge and she said unfortunately we don't have a fridge for your cake, but I guess we can put it in the back office. Yes... whatever... PLUS we got charged a $15 cake cutting fee. If they have a cake cutting fee then obviously the hostess should have KNOWN what to do when I handed her a cake. So ridiculous... 

We definitely made a mistake in coming here with such a big party, but we were already there.. They don't have to be like that. The manager and two servers at our table were great. The drinks and atmosphere is nice for a small group if that's what you guys are looking for.
author: Brittany L.

description: The ambiance and service by my host was great! Very attentive and the wait to get seated on a Wednesday night around 5pm was less than 10 minutes! Always refilled my table with chips and guacamole. Me and my friend didn't get the food so this review is mainly on drinks. The margarita was watered down and just tasted like salt water yuck! Their infamous Chilcano was also a let down too. I would go back here to see the killer view again and try their food.
author: Roseanne V.

description:
This place is a great place to hangout on a warm summer night. Even if it's not warm there are tons of heat lamps to keep you warm. 

We bought two pitchers of margaritas, regular and Mezcal. I would recommend the Mezcal only because it has this beautiful smokey flavor that isn't too overpowering. I also found the regular one to be a little too sweet which is rare because I love sweet drinks. 1 pitcher serves about 4-5 people hence why we got two! Oh and they drinks are not weak!

This place was super packed starting at about 930 pm. There was no place to sit and even standing room was hard to come by, but we managed. We had a group of 5 which made it difficult but patience is key! We eventually got a spot to post up at. 

The view is beautiful. I don't know if I would say the same during the day but at night it was nice to see the city lit up. 

We had already eaten before we came but I was told by my friends that the food is good! So definitely check it out. There is a seating area for dinner on the roof as well. 

Definitely a great place to hang out with friends, drink, and take in the city.
author: Eva C.

description:
Solid place for a good view of the city, conveniently located only a few blocks from 2 Bart stations, and exceptional customer service. 

Lolinda downstairs serves the formal sit down places while El Techo is more tapas. The food is ok, nothing memorable. You could order 4-5 dishes to share between 4 people. I highly recommend 1-1.5 lbs of the  lb of chicharonnes for a party of 4 for the most bang for your buck. The guacamole was not that great. I would not recommend the choripan as was pretty dry.

The ceviche was solid 4 stars.
author: Vy T.

description: Wow the first time I came here for drinks it was great.  However, I went back yesterday late afternoon for drinks and food on the rooftop with a couple friends and the hostess was SO RUDE.  I literally can't believe how rude she was, I won't be going back here......EVER.
author: Sarah S.

description:
How can I not knowing this place til now?  

The environment is so nice up in San Francisco!  You can have nice view with friends and some drinks.  Perfect spot to end the day.
author: Brandy C.

description: Had the empanadas, shrimp ceviche, chips and guacamole, pork skin, and skewers. So good, plenty of food, really happy with the service and view as well. BUT I have to take off a star for the pina colada; it was the worst drink that I have ever had, way too sweet and it wasn't completely blended so it was more liquid than slushy, really disappointing. I would've rather drank grape cough syrup. I love pina coladas and get them any chance I can, but that was so bad that I won't be getting another one anytime soon.
author: Joe P.

description:
My friend and I wanted to try some place new to eat on a Saturday night.  We ended up at El Techo de Lolinda!  We went up an elevator to a rooftop area overlooking the city.  There was a bit of fog covering the landscape, and the weather was actually pretty cold.  The ceiling heaters didn't really reach where we were sitting, so it was quite chilly while we were waiting for our food and during our dinner.

We weren't able to find a waiter very quickly, but once we ordered...the food came out relatively fast.  We ordered:

1. The guacamole ($7).  The guacamole had a hint of lime and had feta cheese sprinkled over it.  It was very thick and very good.  I would definitely order this if you come.

2. Ceviche de Camaron ($13).  Shrimp, lime, tomatoes, avocado, onions, cilantro, and cucumber.  I really liked the avocado and the shrimp together.  One of the reasons why I gave this restaurant three stars is because I got a stomachache after this dinner, and I think I got it from the ceviche.

3. Elote ($5).  The corn on the cob with sour cream, chili, and lime was really good.  It came with three small corns on a stick (a little too small), but it was still delicious.

4. Pollo Skewer ($7). The chicken skewer came with chicken and red onions.  I'm not sure if the skewers are worth $7 each.  There wasn't too much meat on the stick, and it was alright.

5. Chorizo Skewer ($7).  I liked the chorizo more than the chicken skewer.  I liked how when you bit into the chorizo, there was a little 'snap' due to the crisp (like any good sausage).

6. Alfajores ($6). House-made cookies and hot chocolate.  The hot chocolate was very thick and very chocolate-y.  The cookies looked like macarons.  Short-bread and caramel filling.  I didn't like the cookies too much, but I did like the hot chocolate.

El Techo de Lolinda is a cool rooftop area/bar/tapa place to go with your friends and hang out.  It was chilly and foggy that day, so I don't think I got the full effect...but it was still cool to come out to.  Some food items were slightly overpriced for what it was, and the service was alright.
author: Courtney C.

description:
Situation:
- Sunny weekend drinks 

Pros
- Felix is a great host
- Great drinks

Cons
- It's a rough walk up when the elevator isn't working (at least they have good drinks)
author: Dipesh G.

description:
The chicharron is sooooo delicious.  I was initially on the fence about getting it, but I am glad I got it.  This dish is a MUST!  Loved the food and the rooftop view.  The coffee was surprisingly good.  

The entrance is next to the Lolinda restaurant.  Go in through the door to the left of the restaurant and take the elevator down the hall.  (Had to check in by the door).  

Service was a little disappointing (a little inattentive), but otherwise, I was a huge fan of El Techo!
author: Sumin S.

description:
Terrible service, the relatively cute white girl server w/ black hair was a b**** like most (not all) of the unfriendly insecure service industry help in this city.  Living in an expensive city making peanuts might make me mad also.  =-)

*All this place has going for it is its great rooftop view of the city, and a decent looking crowd*

WHAT TO EXPECT.   Fake Mexican food and even worse service.

The caiparihna was nothing like a real capirinha so that needs to be removed from the menu.  The michelada (mexican clamato beer drink) was ok but not  "way better" than Lolo's as I was told by the employees downstairs working the door. The salsa was terrible.   I'll be back here for the scene, people watching, hot girls, but not for the food or the weak half a** drinks.
author: C S.

description: This is my go to happy hour when entertaining guests from out of town. Great food and drinks and with a killer view.
author: Mya B.

description: The margarita pitchers were great.  I appreciated our server's recommendations and he did not lead us astray.  I will say it was SUPER loud in there and was difficult to hear.  Perhaps the atmosphere is better for large groups than for an intimate evening out.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I have fond (see: blurry) memories of this building when it used to be Medjool. 

We use to come here to drink AMFs, dance the night away and sleep in the elevator. 

Like many that have come before it, Medjool out stayed its welcome and was shut down resulting in a sigh of relief for the whole block.

Fast forward maybe 5 years? You now have el techo (no, not el techno...this isn't a rave brunch) has blossomed into a swanky tapas bar with a beautiful roof deck with panoramic views to boot. Prior to this past Sunday, I had only gone to the roof deck for drinks.... Hence the late(ish) review. Fun fact: techo = roof. Duh, right?

While reservations are highly suggested, especially on beautiful sunny mission days, we were taken to the roof to see a halfway empty (or halfway full, whatever) roof space filled with tables. The sun was beaming, but we opted for a spot in the sun to get that vitamin D.

Drinks: we ordered coffee and mimosas. Coffee was good, I'll give them that. For some odd reason, I was thinking they would serve some great high quality Cuban coffee but what I got was a little light and Folgers...ish. Not the best, but it did what it needed after 3 cups. The mimosas were a whopping $8 each and served in a fancy flute. When asked about carafe options, we were told it would come out in bottle form. Let's do the math, flute = 6 oz. @ $8. Bottle of champagne = 25 ounces. 25/6 = 4.16 x 8 = $33 for a carafe.. no thanks.

Food: We started with the chips and quac which, coming from a non-guacamole lover, was fantastic. It was chunky, flavorful and the chips were perfect. As far as entrees go, while we may have been at fault for having a hearty eggy breakfast the morning of, we showed up to brunch not necessarily wanting brunch food. Go figure. I went with the Quesadilla de Pibil which was a quesadilla (duh) with braised pork shoulder, oaxaca cheese and salsas. While it's no El Farolito super suiza, it was a nice size and decently priced. I distinctly remember it being cheesy, just wish it had more meat. The salsa was the real MVP doe. We also shared the Tostada Francesa which was baguette French toast, berry compote and cream. This was our over indulgence, our cheat meal of sorts and it kind of fell flat. IMO, too doughy and not sugary enough (and you'll never hear me say that). Maybe we had high hopes, but we expected more for some reason; It just tasted like a sponge cake with light berry sauce. It's hard not to fault them for it, but we just expected more out of it. 

Service: don't remember his name, but was wearing a black cap and had a septum piercing. Overall, fantastic. He was engaging, friendly, prompt and checked in to make sure everything was top notch. The service alone bumped a 3 star good experience to a 4 star, we will return experience.

All in all, we had a great time. You can't beat the million dollar views, especially on a nice day. We can't speak on the drinks since it's hard to mess up a mimosa, but the menu looked like it had a ton of great options with a  lot of nice beers to choose from. I'd suggest picking a few small plates to share. Oh, be sure to make reservations online.

Would I go out of my way to come back, sure, but weather permitting with the right people.
author: Ryan L.

description:
What a cute and hip gem hidden in the city! Came here with a friend for a catchup dinner and though there was a line outside we were able to get a table immediately since the line was for the cocktail bar.
You walk into this semi-dark hall to take an elevator up to the restaurant which can kind of seem scary at first, but once those elevator doors open you will be amazed. Wooden tables, small stools, plastic linings as walls, lighted candles that dec the tables...a relaxing and lovely atmosphere! 

Menu was simple--2 pages for small plates/tapas and meats/skewers. The rest was a list if drinks/wines/cocktails. I got a Pina colada (I forgot what drink my friend got but it was pretty strong) because I'm a sucker for fruity/sweet drinks. My drink was perfect-creamy, milky, not too much blended ice, good balance of sweetness/acidity. Between us, we ordered the ceviche and half pound slow roasted pork shoulder to share. It was definitely more than enough and we even had leftovers. The ceviche was chilled and fresh--a mixture of picco de gallo/salsa and freshly peeled chunks of shrimp. Paired with the crunchy tortilla chips served along, it was a perfect intro to our heavier entree to come. The entree came with warmed up tortillas, baked black beans with a sprinkle of cheese, mildly spicy salsa, big chunks of slow roasted pork shoulder, and a big piece of fried pig skin w/ some veggies to top it all off. I kind of just wrapped a little bit of everything into my tortilla and ate. The pork was super soft, moist, tender, rich and flavorful. Non of that overcooked dryness/toughness, saltiness, or too much smokiness and oiliness. The baked beans added a nice smooth texture, the salsa a nice spicy, refreshing kick to a 3-dimensional flavor, and the pig skin a nice crunch in contrast the smoothness/creaminess of everything else.

I was so full after the meal, and for the first time in a long time...didn't feel the need to order dessert to feel satisfied (though I'd be curious to try next time). Service was great--waiters were very attentive and constantly checked up on us, and minimal wait time for a table/food. Excited to come back for brunch when it's warmer since it seems the patio has a view overlooking the financial district!
author: Alvina L.

description: We gave this place a try when our niece flew in from out of town and we wanted to take her somewhere nice in the city. We were very impressed! The location is a very diverse one in the mission neighborhood of San Francisco, we took an elevator up to the roof and were greeted immediately upon stepping out of the elevator by a very friendly waitress. We were worried it was going to be a long wait to be seated but she identified a group that was sitting in the dinner area only having drinks and successfully managed to ask them politely to move to the bar area to allow space for my family. That was a huge plus in my book! We had a really nice view of San Francisco from the rooftop on a very nice warm day, and even as it got late we weren't concerned about San Francisco's typical chilly weather because they had heaters and the rooftop was designed to minimize the cold breeze in the evening. The food was absolutely delicious and  we highly enjoyed all the food we ordered. I have to say though you may enjoy the small tapas best during happy hour where you can get more bang for your buck, the sangria doubled in price right after happy hour LOL but everything was great so no complaints here. They had a good selection of music but it was slightly loud and we found ourselves nearly screaming to have a conversation :-) however it was a really really great evening and we will be coming back here more regularly especially when introducing peopleFrom out of town into the city. Most highly recommend this place!
author: Araceli G.

description:
Came to this rooftop joint for a couple drinks with some friends. The view wasn't anything spectacular :(  Drinks were a bit too sweet and not very strong.

Nonetheless, it's not super expensive and seats were pretty readily available!
author: Kristie C.

description:
I love this place! But sometimes they aren't to attentive! We waited for 30 min to sit in a table and it wasn't because the host called us it was because my friend went to complain about them not calling us and there being tables open. 
Ceviche de Cameron on point!
Guacamole (DELICIOUS)
Chicharron plate is perfect to share with a friend.
author: Danette D.

description:
Why aren't there more rooftop decks in this city? So nice to eat in the open air with an amazing view of the skyline. 

Well, partially open air... actually my one major point of criticism is that there are too many umbrellas and tents to protect diners from "the elements" and they make the roof feel more claustrophobic than it otherwise would. 

The food is great for the setting - tasty tapas to pass around the table. The ceviche was my favorite and the guac was really good as a starter. 

The mixed drinks are delicious (try the mescal-based one) but kind of expensive. Have one and then switch to beer.
author: Andrew S.

description: Love this place! My friend and I enjoyed happy hour here the other day and sat on the ledge overlooking the City. Ambiance was lively and fun! Food and service was good. We enjoyed the fried chicken which was slightly sweet and different than the usual. It was easy to eat, hot and tasty! We also shared the pork quesadilla which was so satisfying and tasty! Caipirinha was awesomely and devilishly easy to drink - potential creeper! Good stuff, fun atmosphere. We'll be back! Looking forward to trying brunch.
author: Bella L.

description:
This roof deck is straight up beautiful. SF has a dearth of good rooftop joints and El Techo is as nice as they come. There's a bit of a line but they keep it uncrowded on the inside, so once you're seated you can actually have a conversation.

Get the chircharonnes. They're more of the salvadoran hunks of pork variety as opposed to the cracklins you might be thinking of. They season it kinda sweetly and the large 1.5 lb order is good for a group of 6-8.

The cocktails are ok too, but do pork and do the view.
author: Misha T.

description: This place was so close to getting that magical 5, but the service was a little lacking. Mostly, the hostess on the floor of el techo was very rude. We came with a rather large group, and she started mumbling to the waitress how annoyed she is and that they have no where to seat us. Whose fault is that? Very rude and unprofessional, but minor in regards to the entire experience overall. The restaurant is really on a beautiful rooftop, and I will come back for brunch time to see the beautiful city skyline. The place has a great variety of drinks to choose from, I highly recommend all of them. They are potent and taste great. In regards to the food, you must get the chicharrones de carne. The pork is sweet and melts in your mouth, and comes with delicious tortillas, beans, and salsa. But the pork really is incredible, you must try it.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Ugh this place. I took my friend from Germany here on Friday so she could experience the rooftop bar. Made a joke to the door guy (seriously, a door guy at 4:30?), and he was not amused. We were then instructed to wait in line (seriously, a line at 4:30?) for about 10 minutes and then told we would have to coordinate with the host upstairs for seating arrangements. After asking to be sat in the shade - it was 100 degrees outside- the host acted like we were asking for the world and huffily showed us a new seat. To make a long story short I told our server we'd just be drinking and he wasn't thrilled either. I have never felt so unwanted somewhere. Seems like everyone who works at this place is a jerk. I had to get up and chase down our server with my card when we wanted to leave because he couldn't be bothered to come back to us and the nasty host was busy chatting with his buddies.

The saving grace of this place was the tasty margarita and the view. I will probably never be back here.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
My favorite thing about this place is of course the rooftop view with company you're with :)   I think it's sort of a hipster view of San Francisco ha (not necessarily the greatest but it feels like you're in on a hidden secret). It's still pretty even though i went on a rainy gloomy night. My four friends and I got seated at standing spot with heat lamps - the place gets so so crowded on the weekend nights that it sort of reminds me of cafe D in Berkeley.  Would recommend coming next time on a weeknight and early to avoid feeling like you're in a one step classier than college bar. 
I didn't really like the plantains or the quesadilla but the pork fajita taco things are good and perfect to share for two.
author: Kristin C.

description:
Techo ... two ways to avoid the lines.

1) Enter through Lolinda and sneak through the side door to the elevator banks upstairs
2) Don't come

All in all, this place has a nice view of the city, and if you get there early, you can avoid long lines. Otherwise, I do not believe this place is worth the wait! For one simple reason:

The service is terrible. The servers don't care that you are there. They know they are going to get good tips no matter what, so they don't feel particularly motivated to go the extra mile.

If you want to get your drink on with a view, go to Dolores park with a six pack. Cost and wait, near zero.
author: Robert F.

description:
Always a good spot on a sunny day (oxymoron in SF I know). I like their brunch the best it's just their regular menu with an egg on top. 

Good drinks, wish the chips were free. Overall great spot to enjoy a cervesa and take in the views.
author: G R.

description:
I went here for my birthday dinner this year.  We sat in the dine-in section of the roof top restaurant which was full but not super packed like the bar section of Techo so it was nice to be able to have a conversation and enjoy the beautiful sunset on a Thursday Summer evening.  We ordered margaritas to start. They are quite strong but not in your face straight alc and I would highly recommend going this route ;)

Per the yelp highlights, we ordered the Chicarron. Everything was super tasty (true confession: my pescatarian sister even sneaked a bite of the Chicarron and Chorizo skewers because it smelled THAT good).  We also ordered the veggie quesadilla and a side of guac. All the food was delicious but definitely on the heavier side. But hey- if there's ever a cheat day you should take, it's your birthday!
author: Jojo L.

description:
Great place for brunch with their rooftop setting, yummy pitchers of sangria and brunch options!

Came here and ordered their version of the Benedict (it was served on a jalapeño cornbread that I wished was a bit more solid instead of crumbly but the flavors were definitely here). My eggs were also a bit over cooked but the servers were very understanding and helped swap my eggs for perfectily runny ones.

They also came out with a new dessert (corn based pancake crepe thing) with lots of whip cream (made of sour cream and whip cream) and fresh fruit. Omg I'm drooling just thinking about this . If you get this, please place the fruit on one half of the pancake, spread the whip cream evenly on the fruit and then fold the pancake in half (so that it resembles an omelet). Trust me, you'll thank me.
author: Christina C.

description: The pork is good if ure really hungry....the atmosphere is very outdoorsy casual. Lolinda is more upscale and food is better and tastier.
author: Julia N.

description:
My bf raves about this place all the time because the food is good, the drinks are tasty, and the view is amazing. This is one of those rare rooftop bars in SF, and yes, the food is good and the drinks are tasty.

We came here with a couple friends from out of town. At first we weren't sure if we wanted to keep warm and just eat downstairs at Lolinda, but we decided to give the rooftop a shot. We made the right choice when we saw that there was a plastic partition to block the wind and heat lamps to keep us spoiled Californians nice and toasty. We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table, so we ordered a round of drinks to hold us over. My friend and I ordered margaritas (I can't remember what flavor it was, but it was delicious... Maybe it was blood orange? Is that an option?). The guys ordered their typical drinks - old fashioned.

We finally were seated at a circular table and ordered chips and guacamole, Ceviche de Camaron, Quesadilla de Acelga, chicharrones, and skewers. Everything was delicious. My favorites were probably the chiviche and skewers. 

Want a cool ambiance, beautiful city views, great drinks and delicious food? Come here! I'm sure I'll be back.
author: Leana L.

description: I loved this bar.   The staff was super attentive and helpful.  Definitely has a gorgeous view of the city with an outdoor ambiance.   There are also plenty of heaters to keep you warm so you can enjoy the daylight and night time skyline.   I ordered one of the tamales, a bit tiny for the price but it was delicious.   Would return any day.
author: Janet R.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend on a busy Friday night. First off, there is no way around the long lines since they don't take reservations. First, you must put yourself on the wait list for a table. Then, you have to stand in a looong line outside just to get IN to the restaurant/bar area. We weren't expecting this, so we were very put off and hangry at the time.

After waiting for what seems like forever, we finally get to go up the elevator to the bar area. It is absolutely beautiful up there and the ambiance is perfect. It was near 8, so the sun was going down and the crowd was lively. The view is also spectacular and it feels like a local spot. As we were waiting for our table, a hi top became available in the bar area--which is right next to the low top dining tables. If you get one of these tables, stay there. It was warmer and you could see the views better. But, to my stubbornness, we waited for a low top and soon regretted it. 

On to the food and drinks. The margaritas are delicious and not too sweet. The guacamole was good, nothing to boast about. We got the pollo frito, which is fried chicken bits with a yummy habanero salsa--delicious meal! Then we got a 1/2 lb of chicarrones de carne ($19) tender pork-shoulder and house made tortillas. This was delicious and a lot of food for two! 

All in all, it was not very great service for the price we paid (they lost our card for about 25 mins), but it was a great experience, and I would definitely go again. Ambiance takes a big weight in my personal restaurant reviews, so I gave it a 4. My boyfriend gave it a 3.

If you don't mind waiting in a line and you love nice views and lively atmosphere, it's a MUST.
author: Samantha T.

description:
This place is good to hang out with bunch of friends over drinks with the city view at night, but definitely not to enjoy food. We ordered 3 dishes here and all of them were just plain average unfortunately. 

Ceviche only has shrimp in it, no scallop, squid, or white fish. This is unheard of. 

The pork shoulder quesadilla was lacking flavor and most of all it was dry.

Empanadas were maybe the best one out of the three. But again you can easily find better ones elsewhere.

Ambience is super loud and it has a beer garden type of feel to it. Day and night difference from Lolinda downstairs. The server was nice and friendly though. Over all I would probably never come back.
author: Cartman P.

description: Went back the very next morning for Sunday brunch and our experience was even more delightful ! Our server was so attentive, we sat on the outdoor rooftop area this time- the view is awesome. Eggs benedict with a delectable jalapeno corn bread YUM! Bloody Marys and fresh juices are tasty and worth returning for again and again.
author: S J.

description:
The place is a gem in the Mission, albeit a little hard to get into, primarily since it has a long line right before dinner. 

The margaritas pitchers are great for large groups, although I wish they had freshly made options.

We like to get their combination shish kebabs--they are usually a little over cooked, but tasty nevertheless. The different plantain options are delicious as well. 

It's gets a little loud, so go with a large group and a get a big enough table for everyone. 

The view from the top and the convenient location is worth the wait.
author: Zorayr K.

description: Waited in line outside for about 30 mins to get inside. However the weather was good so we didn't mind. We then took the elevator up to the roof, where there are plenty of tables for eating and drinking. Heat lamps helped when it got a bit more chilly. I had a pina colada, which was good and very sweet, but I couldn't taste much alcohol. Prefect for light weights like myself haha. The three amigos included a bottle of beer, a shot of tequila and something sweet that are supposed to be mixed altogether. It was pretty good. The view from the bar was very nice and it's rare to find a roof top bar around the city it seems. There was no cover to get in, so it's a good deal.
author: Alice S.

description:
Pros: 

Food
The food was great, and the portions were just right. I went with my boyfriend for a "date night," and we weren't sure how much food to order. Another waiter (not ours) was really helpful-- he recommended 2-3 small plates and a half pound of the chicharrones.

We got the guacamole, elote, and flautas. The guac came with cotija in it, which isn't my favorite, and could have used a bit more of a kick. It was pretty mild. The elote, however, was fantastic. The flautas were good, but they do have potato and raisins in them, which I could have done without.

The main event though, the chicharrones, were ah-mazing! Crispy fried chunks of pork shoulder rolled in brown sugar...what's not to love?! We asked if there was any way to get the "leaner" pieces, and although our waitress hesitated at first, she said she would see what she could do. And she came through-- we had only a few really fatty pieces, which was much appreciated.

Ambience
The view at this place is phenomenal. It's on a rooftop in the Mission, and on a clear day it's a great spot to see the city. Like all good SF spots, the people watching is also not to be missed ;)

Cons:

Service
While I appreciate being able to linger over our meal and savor the food, the wait staff at ETDL borders on inattentive. Our waitress only stopped by 3 times during the entire meal-- to bring water and take our order, ask if we wanted anything else, and bring the check. The place was busy, but not that crazy-- we probably would have ordered more food if she had stopped by more than once. At one point, we considered trying to flag down someone else.

Note: ETDL doesn't take dinner reservations (brunch reservations only), but it gets CRAZY busy. So I would recommend getting there early and being prepared to walk around for a while until your table is ready. The food, however, is definitely worth a little bit of a wait.
author: Lindsay B.

description: This place seems popular, so I checked it out. In a nutshell, overpriced and overcrowded. I felt very uncomfortable and the service didn't help with that. It seemed I was an inconvenience to be helped in a timely manner. Also, the low lighting does not quite hide the issues of cleanliness.
author: Merdhin W.

description:
Super cool joint in the middle of the mission district. Not too difficult to find- doorman sitting up front asked if we're going up and we said yes and he gave us directions to take the elevators up to the top floor. 

When you get up the host pretty much let us choose a spot (it wasn't too crowded on a Saturday afternoon). We came here on a cloudy/ almost rainy day. But it's nice they have a protective clear covering over a majority of the restaurant/bar so if it were to rain it wouldn't completely ruin your meal/drinks. We decided to brave it out and sit closer to the view- we were lucky! It ended up being quite nice. 

Ordered 2 pitchers of margaritas. They were great! Strong without tasting strong- just how I like it ;) the server was great (think casual- he had own a plaid shirt and a baseball cap). 

I would have liked to try their food offerings but we had just eaten lunch, but that just means I'll be back for round 2! 

Synopsis: pretty great view of the city. You just can't complain there. Great decor and ambiance but think pretty casual, great service and drink! This place is definitely worth a try!
author: Sam L.

description: Nice rooftop restaurant with good music and ambiance. Price is also okay. Good place to come with family or friends for a evening or a night gathering.
author: Owen C.

description:
I went here for a birthday party recently and I thought it was a fantastic location! It was a bit crowded, but it added to the fun atmosphere.  The menu is mainly appetizers and small bites (compared to Lolinda's main restaurant on the ground floor).  The food items ranged from $8-$12 while drinks were more on the $10 range.

I ordered a pina colada, which was kind of like an horchata.  It had coconut creme and cinnamon.  I just had chips and guacamole, which were really good.  The rest of the table had skewers, salads, elote... and no one had any complaints.

And we had some photo ops of the skyline as the sun set.  Our waiter was nice enough to take pics for us.

I recommend getting reservations.  And if one of the members of your party arrives late, be sure to meet them downstairs or have their name on a list.  I had no trouble getting in (I just told them I was there for a party), but for some reason other people in my friend's party did.
author: Vira P.

description:
Delicious meal.

The rooftop view is pretty unique and spectacular. The prices are lower than i expected for a restaurant with such a stellar view. The heat lamp was totally sufficient for staying warm on an unusually cold day (and I am ALWAYS cold).

I started with the ensalada de jicama which was delicious and had a really nice, creamy like vinaigrette.

We then had the quesadilla de pibil which was really delicious and had great flavor. The meat was so tender and well seasoned and the tortilla was soft and tasted fresh. The accompanying salsa was great. The portion was very generous as well. 

The vegetable skewer was good but less notable. The salsa verde/chimmichurri sauce was really tasty.

This will be a new spot for me. Great food and nice spot.
author: Madeline S.

description: El techo, seems to always have a line to be seated in their beautiful rooftop Bar. I came her for a friends birthday and i thought the place was good a festive. My favorite thing at this place had to be their guacomole and chips which taste really fresh. The Sangria's were good to of course. There is nothing like being on a rooftoop eating with friends and enjoying life and the beautiful view a roof toop consist of.
author: James L.

description: This is officially my second yelp review and I would like to say that I had an amazing time at El Techo last night. Got here around 8:30pm on a Friday night no wait at all, likely due to the rain. I was concerned that it would be cold but that was not a problem at all thanks to the heating lamps and clear  "buildable walls" that still allow you to see the beautiful views of SF's skyline while blocking the wind. We had about 3 or 4 different waiters due to shift changes I assume but everyone was super attentive and friendly and never mixed up our order. Drinks and food were amazing. Belafonte was my favorite drink in comparison to Las Primas. We ordered ceviche de pescado (not spicy at all), tostadas de alambre and quesadillas al pibil per the waiters' recommendations! All equally delicious! Such a great dining experience! Thanks guys!!
author: Priscilla B.

description:
This place is amazing. Came here for a double date on a Friday night and only has to wait 45mins for a table while getting drinks. The view is incredible and the atmosphere is great.

We ordered the chicharones, fried chicken (which had brown sugar and cinnamon on it), flautas, and ceviche. Everything was incredible but the chicharones and fried chicken really stood out. I also got a piña colada which was delicious. I will definitely be back.
author: Erica C.

description:
Great place to go to on a sunny day for Sat/Sunday brunch for a couple reasons:
- bang for your buck with the Chicharrones plate; $14 for half a pound of succulent pork shoulder is more than enough for 2 ppl. 
- beautiful and tasty cocktails, in particular the passionfruit flavored "Chilcano"
- generous and fresh serving of guacamole 
- great rooftop seating with heat lamps if necessary
- and lastly, they take reservations for brunch! Unlike dinner for which you'll have to get in a long line for a table.
author: Amelia C.

description:
Finally a roof top bar in SF besides Jones.
Great crowd
Great food (I heard and smelled). Will definitely order chicharones next time
Great drinks - ordered this drink starts with a "c"  but not the caipirinha and it was super good. 
I would definitely come back here with friends for dinner. 
They don't take reservations for dinner, only for brunch. 
Lots of heat lamps so this place doesn't get cold.  
Only one stall bathroom per sex which is not a plus.  Lines could get long so be prepared or you can just get down the elevator and go to Lolindas restroom. 
Service is fast and friendly but make sure to remind your servers your order because they can forget because this place is so busy. 
The bars are only for servers that go around and get your drinks so be patient and wait for a server to come to you

See you soon El Techo.
author: Claudine V.

description: Long wait, get there before 4. Roof top view is amazing. Wear sunscreen you will burn. Food is not your Mexican grandmas cooking but tastes good.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
I love this place! This place has become one of our favorite spot for me and  friends when we want to talk and catch up. The service is very friendly and welcoming. The Bartender Carlos makes the best drinks always! 
I highly recommend this place!
author: Erin G.

description:
AB FAB!  The place is perfect in every way and I even had the pleasure of dining on the rooftop on one of our sunniest mornings we have had in a long time.  Sunday brunch is the BOMB!  Stellar service!  The view...the view...the view!  The beef empanada (small plate) was utterly sabrosa!  Yes, I had a margarita on the rocks at 11a and it was tasty perfect with a nice, high-end agave tequila.  (Hey, it was my first day off after a LONG week!) The Huevos Rancheros were deliciosa with the corn tortilla crispy (just like I like it) and the beans were large fava beans.  SUPERB!  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE FOR A SUNDAY BRUNCH. 

Favorite side story:  upon arrival at 10:45 (I didn't realize that they open right at 11a) I walked up to a nice man sitting on a stool right outside what I THOUGHT was the entry to the restaurant.  But, it was not.  He was the door guard for a marijuana dispensary and we both laughed when I said I had an 11a reservation and he politely informed me that it was right next door and opened at 11.  Had a great conversation with him about his lower back pain as I told him that hot and cold packs on his spine might work as it cured me of some pain recently. Well, aside from what they had inside the dispensary where he works which is another type of treatment for pain.  Hehe.
author: Dana J.

description:
It is directly next to Lolinda (the higher end version) and has a line outside for the bar section of this restaurant. I put in a reservation for 4 which was around a 30 minutes wait on a Tuesday. Went upstairs and it was a rooftop restaurant/bar with a beautiful view of the sky and the city. We ordered many tapa dishes, desserts and a pitcher of margarita.

Started off with a pitcher of margarita and all our cups had salt rimmed on it. The pitcher was a bit smaller than a usual pitcher size and the salt on our cups were super salty compared to usual salt I've tried haha. It tasted good but with the ice it gets watered down quickly so enjoying it slowly will result In a more diluted drink. 

Foods:
- guac and chips: guac needed a kick to it, like salsa or something spicy. It was thick and the avocado was still in large pieces. There wasn't enough chips to go with the guac, so we ordered more. 
- Platano Maduro: it was not as good as I hoped since I am a fan of plantains. It was too dry and overcooked and lacked flavor unless I dipped it in the sour cream.
- Pollo Fritos: my friends were a fan of this dish because the chicken wasn't covered in batter but had more of the chicken instead. The sauce that same with it went very well with the fried chicken and a kick of spice. 
- empanadas: came in two but they were good! The sauce was too oily so I ate without. Very crispy outside and the pork had a good flavorful. 
- elote: the corn itself was sweet but the flavoring was lacking. I wish they put some chili powder top too.
- Chicharrones de Carne: one of my favorite dishes of the night. We ordered a pound to share among four girls ($22) and the pork was delicious! A small Sweet kick to it and very soft inside. It came with tortillas, beans, and salsa to make your own taco. We used a bit of the guac from our chips and it was perfect! A must order here!

Desserts:
- alfajores: MUST ORDER!! The cookies are so delicate and delicious with the caramel in between. Took the waitress's advice to dip it in the hot cocoa and it was bomb! The hot chocolate was also unique in flavor! Different than your usual hot cocoa so order it and try this for sure!
- dulce de leche flan: very sweet with a layer of creams brûlée sugar on top and passion fruit jelly. A unique mixture with some sourness and sweetness combined but also very good with each bite and the crumbs. 

Service was a bit slow due it being very packed. Seemed to be two waiters working the whole place with two bussers. Will definitely return and take my family and bf!
author: Amanda C.

description:
On a beautiful day in the city after church, one of my friends had a wonderful idea of enjoying the weather during lunch. Someone wanted to reach for the stars and go on a rooftop, and our Mission District acclimated comrade just bookmarked El Techo the night before. 

With the combo of great service, bawm food, one of the best views of the city, and some fortunate timing on our part, this place is that top tier gewdness.

Seemed like a very popular place, so we tried to get reservations, but with our late thinking, we weren't able to. There is a designated line outside of El Techo with a very friendly doorman / front desk assistant. He said that the wait for 6 was about 45 minutes, but since we arrived around the late lunch time, where people from the opening rush were leaving, we were seating about 2 minutes after we arrived. Sah-woop! 

The menu is smaller than other places, but definitely makes up for the amazing quality of the food. the 6 of us shared a point of the chicharones, the ceviche (no avocado - I'm allergic!), one order of empanadas, the Rancheros, the benedict, and the chips with guac. For 6 people, this was just the right amount for all of us to try a bit of each dish, and feel very satisfied and full at the end of the meal. The highlights were the chicharones and the ceviche for sure. The ceviche was the perfect balance of tartness, fresh seafood, and spice, and the chicharones paired with the creamiest beans, bawm shallots, tortillas and salsa made for a perfect taco. 

All together, with tax and tip, each of us paid $16 - we robbed them of delicious food, such a steal!

The service we got was phenomenal throughout our whole meal. Everyone was amazingly hospitable and made our meal that much better. 

I'm so excited for the next time I get to go to this restaurant - hopefully will get a chance to go here in the evening with some sangria. I know that this will be one of my top suggestions of places to eat in the city from now on.
author: Kristine T.

description:
This is a great spot to start your night. It is a really cool atmosphere and great on warm, clear nights because you have a great skyline view. The drinks are definitely expensive but they are pretty good and you are paying partly for the ambiance. 

They do close pretty early, midnight, so it's not gonna get wild and crazy, but it's a great date spot. 

Also the breakfast is actually really good and the wait usually isn't as bad as a lot of places in SF.
author: Adam Z.

description: Absolutely worth the wait outside to get in ! Some of the best carnitas of all times, melt in your mouth tender juicy delicious !!! All their dishes had fantastic flavors,  chicken, beef, shrimp and vegetables, yes we had them all !! Also love their grapefruit margaritas and caiprinhas (????).  Love this place.
author: BGinLove B.

description:
Best Pina Coladas ever. Best Caiprinhas ever. Also, great quac, great view of the city, great waiters. There aren't many roof top bars in San Francisco and there probably aren't any that have really good tropical cocktails. So you probably should check this place out.

Also, it get's crowded and you might have to wait in line. So get there earlier rather than later.
author: Harmony H.

description:
El Techo de Lolinda is a nice rooftop spot to unwind after having dinner at Lolinda downstairs.  It's very casual and they have their own special drink and small bites menu.  Also how can you not enjoy the view of the SF skyline?

What's really nice is how there are many heat lamps that made the roof pretty damn warm even on a cold foggy SF night.  I actually had to take off my jacket.  Unfortunately, I wasn't able to take a nice pic of the SF skyline since it was blanketed with fog that night, which was really too bad since the sky was clear over in the Mission.

On slow nights, you can probably access the elevator from inside the restaurant, but on busy nights you would have to go back outside and line up.

Overall, it's nice spot for groups and you get a more casual vibe than being in the restaurant downstairs.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Perfect place to go when escaping the heat inland . We ordered the ceviché, pollo frito, empanadas, eloté, alfajores & flan. It's perfect bite size dishes, so if you're looking for a meal you might wanna double up on your orders or look else where. 

Each small dish was delish !  I love the alfajores, which also came with hot chocolate.  What better way to get a summer bod than stuffing your face with those suckers  

The only reason I gave 4 stars is due to the slow service. They must have been harvesting the corn & killing the chicken
 ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
author: Kathleen Y.

description: I didn't think this place was worth the wait.  My friends and I waited for about an hour before being able to go upstairs to go find a high-top table.  We had asked the server what he would recommend the 3 of us should do food-wise but we decided not to since one of my friends doesn't eat pork.  When we went to order the food, our server kinda seemed offended that we didn't take up his suggestion.  He even said to me, "did you not hear what I suggested..." and I was like "we decided on something else" and he gave me a look.  We all ordered a round of drinks, I had the piña colada and it was pretty good.  It was decently strong for the amount of foam that came with it.  My friend had the Paloma and that was pretty strong as well.  She enjoyed my piña colada so much that she ordered one for herself afterwards.  I wasn't too big of a fan about it, but then again, I'm not a huge fan of coconut to begin with.  We ordered some starters to share.  We had the corn one (elote)  which only came with 3 halves for $9, a bit pricey, but still delicious.  I had the quesadilla de pibil which was quite delicious but also pricey.  I thought the tortilla had an overpowering flavor though so it was basically like eating a tortilla with meat inside.  My group also shared the chips and guacamole.  You could tell they made the guacamole fresh because it was REALLY good.  My friends ordered the plantains and a skewer which I didn't try but it seemed like they enjoyed them.  The service was okay, he checked up on us a few times to make sure everything was okay, although it was a little difficult to track him down to grab the check.  The later it gets, the more crowded it seems.  When we were leaving, I heard a waitress tell someone that there were 25 parties in front of them (and this was at like 8:00).  I don't really understand what the hype is about this place.  It's a rooftop bar, but you can't really enjoy the view unless you get a seat near the edge (and even then, the windows are filthy).  I'm not sure I would come back unless the wait was only like 5 minutes.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Came here for happy hour with two friends. I am visiting from Philadelphia and wanted to go somewhere with great views. 

The restaurant selling point is that it is rooftop. There was a lot of seating and it greatly accommodates large groups. 

The happy hour menu is not that exhaustive but you can get a meal from it. I had the margarita, guacamole, platano majuro and pollo frito. The food was very good. I was surprised as how big the platano majuro dish was. The service was very fast. 

The views of San Francisco are very gorgeous.
