This place is worth the trip if your in the Mission District.
author: Djuan S.

description:
This place is the most colossal rip off of all time. Never in my life have I experienced more horrendous service. That may sound a hyperbole, but it's not. 

To make an incredibly long story short, I came to El Techo with a group of 7 friends. To clarify, we had all been there before, some of us over 5 times. This time we came for dinner, we ordered dinner, we ate no dinner. 

For starters, we were told when we put our names down that there were 2 groups ahead of us and it would be a 20-30 minute wait. So we went to a bar next door to kill time. 40 minutes later we checked in with the hostess who told us the 2 groups were still in front of us and it would probably be another 30-40 minutes... Frustrated and quite hungry at this point we decided to just cut our lossss get food elsewhere. As we were about to walk into another restaurant, we got a call saying our table was ready, so we turned and walked back. 

It was quite late at this point and we were worried that both the bar and kitchen would be closing soon, so we ordered immediately. We waited about 15 minutes for our drinks to arrive and with them came our apps and a plate of carnitas, a dish that we ordered 2 of... Red flag number 1. We proceeded to wait at least another 15-20 minutes at which point people that sat down after us had gotten their food. Our waitress then checked in with us and let us know that 1) the first plate of carnitas was a mistake And that we would still be getting 2 additional plates and that 2) the kitchen was now closed but we should rest assured our food would be coming out "soon". Another 20 minutes passes. 

Then, the kicker: our waitress comes up to our table and says "I'm really sorry but I forgot to put in the ticket for your entrees and they will not be coming out because the kitchen is closed." She then walked away. 

You can imagine how many jaws dropped. She let us know that they could probably bring us a few quesadillas and another pitcher of margs on the house. We sent one of my friends to go talk to her and request the entire meal be comped because this situation was utterly ridiculous. She proceeded to send the manager over to our table who tried to "reason with us". He said he'd be willing to comp 2 pitchers, the mistaken plate of carnitas, and a few of the chips and guacamole. We pushed back but eventually conceded because we were irate and starving and just wanted to get out of there. 

Utterly shocking that the manager couldn't recognize the future value he was losing by not comping our entire meal. Well, I hope they enjoyed their $74, because needless to say none of us will be returning.
author: Sophie H.

description: A group of friend visited El Techo during a long weekends visit to the city and decided to stop for brunch on our last day. This rooftop bar has everything you want when you visit San Fran, amazing food, great drinks, and an awesome view of the city. My eggs Benedict with jalapeño cornbread was exactly what I needed and went perfectly with the pitchers of sangria my table ordered. I highly recommend stopping by if you are in the area and want to eat with a view!
author: Taylor B.

description:
Great view, good drinks. Only con is tends to get TOO crowded of late. You could wait up to an our to head up, if you reach there by 8 PM on a Sat. I had been here some months ago and it wasn't nearly as cray cray. But nonetheless, this is what happens with the popular spots. Taken with a pinch of salt.
Good place to hang with your friends and city watch.
author: Shruti D.

description:
Brunch
Rooftop is awesome. Great relaxed vibe. Good service.
Guacamole: good chips and guacamole was well done.
Cocktails: Paloma and chilcano were super tasty, not too sweet.
Benedictos: wouldn't get it again. It said jalapeño cornbread but there was no jalapeño. The cornbread was tasty, not dry but I was looking forward to the jalapeño. The hollandaise was called a chili hollandaise but there was no chili. The whole dish lacked a lot of salt.

Beignets: yummy but the dulce de Leche sauce was too runny.
author: Mymy B.

description:
Loved this spot when it was Medjool - love it more now. Heat lamps and wind screens keep it cozy. And the food! Wow. 

Get there early. I arrived at 5:30 on a Friday and easily got a table for three, but by the time we left around 7:30, the place was packed. Downside? It was a very LA-ish crowd. Annoying.

I'll definitely go back for Happy Hour.
author: Kim C.

description:
I haven't done much research, but my hunch says this is probably the only rooftop brunch spot in the city, and what a rooftop it is. You have sweeping views to the north over the Mission and out into the city. (Elevators are pretty slow so go in expecting to hike up about five flights). We were there for a fairly sunny day, but the breeze can get stiff. Bring a jacket unless you want to cross your fingers for a heat lamp table.

The service wasn't exceptional, and it wasn't terrible. Honestly I was a bit caught up in the scenery to really notice. The solid food options helped as well. We started with a healthy portion of guacamole, a bloody maria (tequila) and a mimosa, which made for a great start to the meal overall. I can then vouch for the Techo Rancheros as an entree - well portioned and filling.

Maybe the food in a vacuum doesn't make me want to extoll its virtues and shout them from the rooftops, but it's hard to argue with the experience as a whole. Solid price, filling meal and amazing surroundings. Highly recommended
author: Taylor C.

description: Came for brunch. Ordered chips, guacamole, a version of beignets and (dk spelling) Huracho.  All very delicious.  Server was great. It's a little chilly up there so dress warm.
author: Patricia R.

description: Overrated in every way. The only good thing was they view. Hostess was not able to accommodate our extra person.  Drinks were ok. Very veryyyy bougey.  Waiters never checked in on us and was just an overhyped disappointment.
author: Ali M.

description: My cousin works here and I came to visit. This place  is beautiful. The service is great. And the food is amazing. One thing I recommend is getting reservations because it gets really busy at night. During the day it is not as much. I loved the ceviche and the carnitas. And the caipirinhas are great too!
author: Kristine D.

description: This place enchanted and attracted me so I cancelled my reservation at Foreign Cinema. I had their mango and jicama salad as well as rough cut guacamole and chips plus their spicy tequila drink! Yum.; Crowd was hip; waiters were very good service wise and you can see the SF skyline from the rooftop!!!
author: Kitty D.

description: Blond nose-ring Hipster hostess was rude!!! Marky and Ignacio did their best to make up for it but it wasn't enough to keep from ruining the 30th birthday party. :(
author: Tricia G.

description: simultaneously a yuppie hellhole and a reminder that it only takes 7 hours to drive up from LA. if you are a local you will be off put by a clientele that resembles amateur baseball players and chicks that treat travel as another instagram set. if you are visiting eating here would likely be the equivalent of scoping out a A&W in Tokyo
author: Walter M.

description:
This review is based solely on ambiance, service, and Sangria.

My friend and I popped up to the rooftop bar after our oyster dinner down the block at Mission St Oyster Bar. She had been before but it was my first time and it was so beautiful! Loved the soft string lighting, made the whole place glow gold. The view is also pretty epic, the whole city skyline is just a glance over your shoulder. Umbrellas, clear plastic tented walls, and heating lamps made me feel like we were inside on such a chilly night, which was my main apprehension of going - who wants to get their blown-out hair tangled up after a drink on a rooftop? Not this girl. 

The host was so nice and we had actually seen him earlier that day walking on Valencia in a black wool cape-shawl and were like "that guy is awesome!", and then we got to tell him! Funny coincidence. We were lucky enough to grab the tailend of a high table where a party offered us seats until we were able to swoop out own table. We got the red wine Sangria which was very refreshing and light. She bought, so it was even better for me! I would love to try food there, but was much too full of oysters to do so.
author: Crystal C.

description: This is not a place to be when you're in a rush. Come, enjoy the view, ask for mark (best server, he'll take care of you). Order guac and a pitcher and enjoy!! One of the only rooftop bars in the city.
author: Stephanie R.

description: This place was so good, there was a wait when we arrived but we went next door to Lolinda (which was also great) anyway the food was delish, the wait staff was kind and the atmosphere was chill. Definitely would recommend. Try the chicharron, it was spot on.
author: Karina J.

description:
I've been to El Techo twice now, and I have to say that I've thoroughly enjoyed my experience each time!

The great thing about the Mission is that there are so many wonderful restaurants that really if you're walking down the street you would be a bit surprised that a place like this exists. Let alone a rooftop bar. It's casually located next to the Foreign Cinema and as you walk up your greeted by a host/hostess on a barstool outside. The then direct you to the elevator where you take the ride up to the "penthouse" and once the doors open it's honestly (I guess literally in this sense) a breathe of fresh air. 

There are tables on the left for a sit down experience and standing tables with barstools on the right for drinks. We were seated at the tables which are underneath a tarp that they let down when it gets really cold or windy. The fantastic part about it is all the panels are see thru so you're not blocking out those at the bar. There is a really great ambiance once the sun sets and both times it's been really busy the entire time I came (around 6-10pm).

The first time we made it for happy hour and got a few pitchers of Sangria which is pretty tasty and a great deal for hh and as a starter. For starters we ordered the Patacon, Guacamole, and Ceviche. If you like plantains I would definitely get the Patacon. It came out hot with I believe mashed black brand and queso fresco. It was great, not too bland for either the plantain or the beans. It was a great combo. The guac is guac, but very good guac nonetheless! My favorite starter was probably the ceviche. It had a lot of flavour and the shrimp tasted fresh with the right balance of the avocado, lime, and radish. I recommend the ceviche and Patacon.

For "entrees" (both visits) we ordered the Elote, Quesadilla de Pibil, the mix and match skewers, and the Chicarones de Carne. Oh my god, the highlight of my entire night was that Chicarones. You would be remiss if you did not order that. It was perfectly most and fell a part once the fork touched it. It came with tortillas and mashed black beans so you kind of build it together however you want. It was amazing. If you had to order just one thing I'd recommend that. The half pound is big enough to share between two people. I liked the elote, a bit messy but hey cant complain (bring floss though lol). The quesadilla was good, it had some great flavors but at the end of the day it was the Chicarones that stole my heart. 

We managed to fit in dessert and went with the trust Alfajores which comes with hot chocolate. Both were perfect! The cookie was soft and powdery all in the right places and the hot chocolate was not too sweet with a great thick consistency so not watered down. 

I haven't been to too many rooftop bars in SF but El Techo is definitely a great time. They definitely take into consideration our bi-polar weather and the crowd is all around enjoyable. I'm sure I'll be coming back again, if not for that Chicarones!
author: Christine C.

description: Great food! And love coming here...kinda had a weird experience last time though....empty section in front of bar area, my group of 4 put together 3 small tables since there was no one in the area, we are 4 guys that usually order a lot of food...if it had been busy, of course we would not have been selfish and taken an extra table...first thing server says is "so I see a table of 4 sitting at a table for 6" which was an odd way to greet a table...so we move to another section and watch the area in front of the bar have no customers throughout our entire visit....bottom line, the food and view is amazing...just a sour note that a server made us feel unwelcome when there was literally no one sitting in the bar area....
author: John H.

description:
Three words: Roof. Top. Bar.

Very VERY cool spot, with tasty drinks and a great vibe.  We were with a group of about 8 and they were able to seat us pretty easily.  I would also suggest this as a great spot for a date!  

Romantic, hidden away, and cocktails were tasty and relatively affordable!  Highly recommend.
author: Alexandra P.

description:
Food was great. Service was shmeh.

My 2 cousins and I came on a Sunday afternoon for the first time without a reservation. We knew to expect a line so we didn't mind waiting. The host suggested we put our name down for a table so we did. We asked how long the wait would be and he said he wasn't sure probably 20-30 minutes but there were 3 parties in front of us so we had time to grab a drink somewhere and come back. He did notify us that we would get a text that allowed us 10 minutes to come back. We left to get a drink next door. We ordered our drinks. The time it took to walk next door to Foreign Cinema, get seated and order drinks probably took about 3 minutes. Two minutes after we ordered, we got a text that our table was ready. The bartender was already making our drinks so we didn't want to be rude and get up and leave but we were irritated that we were told 20-30 minutes and the text came less than 5 minutes later. Our expensive drinks came, we chugged them without getting to enjoy them and ran back to try to make it to our reservation. We got there 2 minutes after our 10 minute window so they gave up our table. We put our names on again and he said we would grab a drink and come back but we decided not to because of what had just happened. Thank God we didn't leave and GRAB A DRINK because we got a text that our table was ready 2 minutes later. 

We went up the elevator and when the doors opened we were blown away. It was a perfect Sunday afternoon and the view alone made up for the minor infraction but that didn't last long. We got seated and a server came by and dropped some Elote off at our table. He said "Elote for the ladies" dropped it off and walked away. We were really surprised because we had never been to a place that gave customers complimentary Elote when they sat down. It turns out that they don't because another waiter came by and reprimanded us. He walked up to us and said

Waiter:  Where did you come from? (very rudely)
Me: I'm sorry???
Waiter: I said where did you come from?
Me: We just got-
Waiter: Did you order that? *points to Elote*
Me: No... a waiter came by and dropped it off at our table but-
Waiter: So you would just put your hands on food that you didn't order? Who would do that?!
Me: I'm sorry we didn't know. We thought he was just giving it to us because-
Waiter: *picks up the Elote and gives it to the next table.

Had he waited we would have told him we were sorry for the miscommunication and that we thought it was complimentary but since he didn't bother to wait for our apology my cousin looked at me and said "That was rude!" He turned around and proceeded to say "That was rude?!" My cousin looked at him and said "Yeah.." to which he just walked away. Accusing your customers of PURPOSELY taking something that wasn't theirs was rude. Honestly, I wouldn't have cared had he told us that it wasn't ours but the fact that he asked me "Where I came from" like I wasn't allowed to be there and then cut me off when I tried to explain myself, really ticked me off.

I suppose to try and make up for it, he did end up giving us Elote, on the house, which we greatly appreciated. We wanted to try to let his previous attitude go because we felt like he tried to make up for it but we could tell through the rest of our stay that he didn't really like us from tending to other tables and LITERALLY looking over ours to having to flag him down to pay our check. One of our orders hadn't come to our table and it took us 20 minutes after our other food was already half eaten to even see him to let him know.

If I could give this place 5 stars on food alone I would. I'm not a fan of beans but the beans that came with the Chicharrones were killer and it may have converted me just so I can eat their beans again. The Chicharrones were amazing. When you look at the menu and try to decide between a half pound and a pound and you start to reason with yourself and tell yourself you can't eat a pound, tell yourself that your mind is lying because YOU CAN EAT A POUND. You won't regret it. It's perfectly salty with a little bit of sweetness that's really nice. We ordered another order of Elote alongside the complimentary one that we had and I could have ordered another one but I did not want to deplete their corn stash. I'm dreaming of it right now. We also got the Coctel Camarones and it was awesome and tangy just the way I like it. We ordered some pitcher of some kind of margarita that I can't remember the name of but honestly, any drink is probably good. We definitely finished every bit of everything we ate. The portions were good. The food was amazing. We loved ALMOST everything. Maybe it was just a busy day and the employees were spent but having worked in customer service for most of life in some way, shape or form, you know that how you make customers feel when they walk in and when they leave speaks volumes.
author: Jessica S.

description:
I can here on a Saturday afternoon with a group of 7. The wait I would say was about 20 minutes (no big deal).
    When we arrived to the roof like many others have shared the view was amazing. BUT oh was it crowded!. Even in our group of 7 were had to share a table with another couple that was dining and it was definitely a cramped situation the entire time we were there.
    We order a lot of different items chips & guac, pollo frito, ceviche, the carnitas plate, and the kababs of shrimp and steak. All the food tasted great. If I had to be honest however, the for the price the portions were on the smaller end. But I understand its the city, its a roof top I kinda expected it.
    Because of how cramp the location was the service left much to be desired. Our waitress I'm sure was really busy with other tables, but did not have time to check if we needed anything our bring our drinks in a timely manner. She forgot to bring one of our groups beer, and when we reminded her she said it would be on the house for the long delay. However when we got the bill we had been charged for it. (We decided not to say anything and paid).
     Im glad I came because I've always been curious but I'm not sure when Ill be back, or will try some time off peak hours.
author: Katherine R.

description:
Preeettttyyyy nice! I love this little rooftop bar.  It's actually really crowded though, so good luck finding seats. If your group is a little bigger though...I'd stay away unless you're there when it opens or something.

Price of drinks is... normal, I'd say.  I got something with passion fruit and pisco- i forgot what it was.  I wasn't expecting it to be THAT sweet, since passion fruit itself isn't really sweet, but it was really, FREAKING sweet. I mean, to me, at least. It was tasty though! 

It took a long time to get menus, then to get our drink order, then to get the check, but I can't blame them- it was really, really crowded! 

I'd still come back if i were in the area- the place is pretty cool and all the drinks looked pretty good.
author: Meena N.

description:
This is a great place to have brunch when the weather is sunny. We came here on a Saturday at 1pm and there was no wait.  This is located next to Lolinda, you take the elevator up to the roof.

I ordered the chorizo scramble and my friend ordered the huevos rancheros.  We also shared the beignets with dulce de leche dipping sauce.  As for drinks, we had 3 glasses of sangria and one coffee.

The chorizo scramble was good with just enough hot sauce to give it some kick, but not overwhelm it. The beignets were OK, but the dipping sauce is what saved it.

Bill game to $61 plus tip.
author: Angelica C.

description: I've been wanting to try this spot in the longest time and finally did. There is always and I mean always a line outside. Highly suggest going there with a smaller party. 2-4 people or less. Get seated way faster. My first time was just me and a friend. We only waited for five minutes and we went up. food was great. View was great. Loved it
author: Tee T.

description: Sunday, brunch was a hit. From the small plate, empanadas and corn bread, to the carnitas and beef brisket, it was non-stop yumminess.  I will keep coming until I have tried everything!
author: Myshell G.

description:
Came here for the first time tonight. The atmosphere is awesome. Amazing views of the city and servers are pretty chill. Definitely get there earlier (around 6) so you don't have to wait outside downstairs for a table. We had the empanadas, some pork based plate with tortillas and beans (tender pork and just yes), and some grapefruit margaritas that were bomb. Guac is also really good.

The seating area is on a rooftop, it's somewhat covered, but be prepared for wind.

Only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because of the service. Servers are chill but the actual service itself was spotty.

Overall, awesome place and will be back.
author: David M.

description: This is a great venue to hang out especially at the roof top in the shade with friends for some tapas and drinks.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Amazing bar! The service was fabulous and our waiter was amazing. The view from
The top is gorgeous and we got the margarita pitcher. In addition they had heaters all
Over that kept me very warm in December in SF. The drinks were strong me delicious. Could not have had a better experience.
author: Ashlyn B.

description:
The rooftop is back! With a vengeance. There are only a small handful of places in SF with a roof deck so I've got to give credit where credit is due.  Plus the food was amazing.

Take the separate entrance into El Techo and save time by taking the stairs.  Put your name in if there's a wait and grab a drink at the bar.  You'll be amazed by how long you can stare out into the distance at the SF skyline.  Ahhhhh - breathe in the fresh air and get ready for some GOOD GRUB.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Such a gem in the mission SF area.  Do not mistake Lolinda with El Techo de Lolinda (they are next to each other).  What you're looking for is rooftop dining.  

Pros:
Yummy food (my date and I had ceviches, chicharrones, skewers). 
Yummy drinks 
Great view
Great vibe 
Prices are reasonable
Friendly staff

Cons:
First come first serve if you go on Friday and Saturday nights
Long line
Long wait
Can be very loud
Only two co-ed bathrooms 

Though the wait was long, it was worth the dining experience.  Definitely going back for brunch for sure in the very near future.
author: Smiley R.

description:
Had a pleasant birthday brunch here with my honey.  I love the fact they take brunch reservations, and the rooftop deck is lovely on a sunny day!  

The service was good, and we enjoyed our Bloody Marias, which had a nice kick. 

The dishes were all good, though nothing was out of this word - we shared the chicharrones, benedictos (the jalapeño cornbread is great) and chimichurri potatoes.  

Overall, a solid experience.
author: Barnali D.

description: This place has a great view... But is overrated for food, drink, and service. The rooftop view gives an extra star. The tapas were fairly poor quality... Guac mediocre, chips seem stale and rewarmed. Drinks were not good... And they forgot our main course. Or they ran out of it. Either way our server told us after the kitchen closed. Although they didn't charge us for what we did not get, they did not correct the problem for us pretty much not getting our main. Not what I'd expect for a place whose line runs out the door with a 30-40 minute wait.
author: Ali H.

description:
Wow!! I found this restaurant/bar on a list of best rooftops in San Francisco.. The food was so incredible, it was even better than the views. We had the Paloma to drink based on a recommendation from the server, I am so glad we had it! I will be learning how to make it at home now. 

We also had guacamole, ceviche and the chicharron! Wow the pork rinds were so delicious! I plan to come back next time I am in town.
author: Kyla K.

description:
El Techo de Lolinda is a fantastic place to take someone when you want to show off San Francisco!

The view of the city is incredible, the margaritas are delicious, and the vibe is trendy. The food isn't bad either! =P

Specific recommendation: Ceviche de Camaron to eat, El Joven Picante to drink, and Maria's Ganache for dessert! Although the chicharrones and margarita's are great for groups!
author: Sophia A.

description:
My friend and I were in town for a fun girls weekend and we were told by another friend to try this place for brunch. This review is about BRUNCH only. And boy was it a good reccommendation! This is a rooftop restaurant that serves delicious tapas as well as larger, more filling dishes. The food is fabulous! We didn't have a reservation but got there early enough to be a walk in...we stood in line for 30 minutes and then they opened and we got seated fairly quickly. I will make reservations ahead of time next time. 

We started with the beignets...they were honestly the best I've ever had. And the sauce to dip them in was heavenly! We also ordered chips, salsa and their awesome guacamole. Fabulous! 

For my main entree, I had the vegetarian benedictos and my friend had the chorizo and egg scramble. The benedictos were poached eggs with spinach on top of amazing jalepeno cornbread and topped with a chile hollandaise.....omg yummy! The scramble was topped with a kickass salsa full of flavor and served with potatoes. I had to try one of their drinks as well so I chose the Paloma. It was a lot like a margarita but even sweeter and with grapefruit and agave. Very good. The only negative is that our waitress was extremely busy and, for awhile, forgot about us but she made up for it later on by being extra attentive.

This place has perfect views of the city and a great vibe. The decor is cute, too. I look forward to coming back again to try their dinner options! :)
author: Jill T.

description: Last night my good friend and I went for a drink at el techo. Sorry to say but we were treated like shit. No courtesy whatsoever. We came here to unwind and the server was so wound up giving us orders. I was like omg i came here to stop listening to smack from all week and catch up with a friend. Needless to say more smack from el techo.  This place may be popular but they needs good genuine workers. What happened to that?
author: Antonio C.

description: Great food, strong drinks and good ambiance! Plus a rooftop view. What more can you ask for? We went on a Tuesday night and almost had to wait about 20 minutes but they found seating for us right away, probably because it was only 2 of us. So if you're going on a Friday or Saturday get there early.
author: Raysa R.

description:
Great drinks but terrible service. I probably would not come here again. 
The happy hour food was pretty good, i highly recommend it. It is really cheap about 5 dollar a dish and the portions are huge. 
The waiters dont come often to refill your glass, nor will they check up on you. Expect 30 minute waits to get your check.
author: Stefany L.

description:
I love this place! 

Location/Atmosphere: 5/5. I love the rooftop! It's nice to be outside, but the heaters keep you from getting too cold. The view of the city is excellent. 

Service: 5/5. Everyone I've ever had here is so genuinely nice and friendly. Even when the place is very busy--timely service, and happy to give recommendations. 

Food: 5/5. I love so many things: the choripan, guacamole, empanadas, quesadillas...it's all so good. And the drinks are delicious! 

Overall: One of my favorite spots in the city :)
author: Kate T.

description: Great views and awesome margaritas in this great Mission bar! Make sure you go early to get a table - it gets really packed.
author: Carolina V.

description: Although the drizzle was around this was totally worth it to c the view. The food was awesome and priced well for the portion that i had but it was definitely a spin on flavor ..its about the taste n yes I was also full. I ordered The huarache...Such great texture too reminded me of an arepa but with cheese in the mixture. I recommend this experience , its a great complement to a visit to Mission.
author: Bree ..

description:
God, this place. Honestly, I would be singing much higher words of praise if the service wasn't so vexing. I'm not sure if it's because they under-hired their staff (in both the kitchen and on the floor), or if their refusal to turn anyone away (meaning there's a constant crowd of people standing near the heat lamps, waiting for one of the tables to open up) makes the staff just too overworked and stretched too thinly, or what, but it was frustrating, to say the least.

On a weekday night, it was a 2 hour wait, until we were able to view the menus, and despite being grumpy, everything looked outstanding. We ended up sharing everything, and got to try some truly delicious dishes:

+CEVICHE DE CAMARON: incredibly fresh, well flavored, and no skimping was done on the amount of shrimp we received in the goblet it came in

+EMPANADA DE ALAMBRE: with braised beef and pickled cabbage; splitting two between ~6 people made it hard to get a good taste for it, but the pastry was flaky, so definitely a plus

+QUESADILLA DE PIBILL: a huge, soft tortilla, stuffed with oxxaca cheese and mouth-watering braised pork shoulder (DEFINITELY try this!)

- CHICHARRONES DE CARNE: served with tortillas, a delicious green creamy sauce, and the most succulent fried pork-shoulder you can imagine

`CHORIPAN: delivered thirty minutes after we had eaten all our dishes (and all our plates had been taken away); a little bready, and in need of some kind of sauce

Honestly, I wanted to give it a higher rating, as the ambiance, food, and drinks are all outstanding, but the wait time for the simplest thing (even just ordering another drink at the table took 20+ minutes, if even) was frustrating. I'm just lucky I was in good company.
author: Claire S.

description:
This is my spot. I know, that statement makes me sound juvenile, but it's true. This is my go to spot to take out of town visitors. 

I probably find myself here once or twice a month because:
- Rooftops are awesome. Having a drink with a view of the SF skyline is great.
- No reservations needed. I've always been able to go and find some place to sit or stand in the bar section
- The general ambiance of this place is laid back. I particular enjoy coming here during the daytime on the weekends and then going to Dolores Park after
- The drinks are great here, my favorite being the Capirinha. Pitchers are also a reasonably priced option (the La Paloma is great)
- The food are more like snacks, but all really tasty. The pork quesadillas and chicharrones sandwich with an egg on top are notable standouts. 

My only complaint is I would like a wider dessert selection. Right now they only have hot chocolate and cookies (which is pretty amazing)
author: Ashwin S.

description:
Great way to spend a sunday (or any other day) with friends. One of the best tapas place I've been too. Strongly recommend the ceviche de camaron! Moreover, they serve their margaritas nice and strong - one glass and I was feeling nice and fuzzy :)

Best part - the view from the rooftop!
author: Shifali G.

description:
Foods are very good but some waitresses are very very terrible and rude. We had BD party for 9 people. While we was about to leave, a waitress hold my friend hand and said "you can't leave"!!!!!!! because he thought we didn't leave them any tips but we did leave them a tip more than 20% in cash. All in all, he should ask his co-worker before did something like that. Because we are Asian, it does not mean we are so bad in giving away the tip.

Very terrible service and rude!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Thitikan J.

description:
Horrible first (and last) experience. It's a bummer because a bunch of my friends (who were with me) raved about this place. Unfortunately, NONE of us will ever go back. 

10 of us were going to grab drinks and dinner at Techo. 5 of us went up the elevator while the other 5 went to grab some cash around the corner. We grabbed a table for the 10 of us but the host wouldn't let the rest of our party up the elevator to our table. They made them form a line on the sidewalk so that the restaurant would appear to be exclusive. They actually made our friend GIVE THEM HER ID in order for her to go up the elevator, talk to us and explain that they were downstairs in line. After 10 minutes of not letting the rest of our party into the restaurant, we paid for our drinks and went to the bar next door (Laszlo). 

Great job el Techo, you almost fooled me into thinking you were worth the hype. Instead, you just proved to be a bunch of jerks.
author: Chelsea R.

description: Hostess "Maggie" scheduled today, Sat 4/2/16, for lunch/brunch/whatever-midday shouldn't be a hostess PERIOD. Took my name and number down, said they would send a text when our table was ready. It's a good thing our group checked in AN HOUR LATER to follow up on our table and APPARENTLY the kitchen is now closed! "Maggie" had one job and she was just sitting there with her leg up like in her own living room! To top it off, we were standing RIGHT IN FRONT OF HER the entire time we waited and she didn't bother to tell us the kitchen was closing at 2:45p?! Mind you, we checked in before 2p (1:55p to be exact, according to "Maggie") yet she failed to tell me when she took my info down about the kitchen closing at a certain time. THANK YOU MAGGIE, for your oh so kind and amazing customer service! Gold star for you, especially for the added smirk on your face!
author: Angela Camille D.

description:
Come for the atmosphere and view, not the food. I love the vibe up here; everybody is chattering and having a great time. Even though some of the tables are close together, everybody is minding their own business and looking at the view. Honestly, the view isn't perfect, but I don't know of too many rooftop venues in SF.

I came here for brunch and got the matambre steak. Since the steak is sliced, they said they couldn't control for the temperature. A few pieces that were medium tasted good; many were well done and hard to chew though. The potatoes were also good, but way too salty. That Mexican coke helped everything go down though! And the mimosas taste pretty fresh indeed; not freshly squeezed (or no pulp, at least), but not bad. I also tried my friend's benedictos, and the sausages on her plate were just all right.

Service was really nice, but I think each server gets assigned to way many tables. Or they assume everyone coming for brunch is really chill and doesn't mind waiting for their check. Our waitress took quite a while to come back and again to get the check. But otherwise, nice and informative.
author: Kimberly Y.

description:
In the land of perpetual jacket weather, finding a spot with outdoor seating can be challenging. You're either hunching over a wobbly bistro set or shivering in the shade behind a dive bar. That's why discovering a rooftop patio -- in the Mission no less -- is a special kind of treasure. 

The vibe however, is undesirable. A nightclub-style queue is a permanent fixture outside this spot -- the wait is long -- and the clientele very directly reflects the growing decadence of the once-subversive Mission District. There's a reason my friends and I call this place "Douche Roof." (Because it's a rooftop bar populated by douchebags.)

But beyond that there isn't much to hate. The patio heated and offers a beautiful vista of the neighborhood in three directions. And a glass enclosure prevents too many wind-related hair disasters. Their menu is a Mexican collection of pre-dinner snacks. Try the chicharrones by the pound or their most-excellent ceviche. 

And their cocktails are quite tasty! If you're into it (and I am) tequila, mescal, and cachaça play a role in many of their libations. Solid spot, if you can get in.

Obligatory Title Pun: You'll find TECH at El Techo.

Menu Readability: Readable trifold.

Need to mention: It's one of the very few rooftop patios in San Francisco. Enjoy.

What this place teaches me about myself: Adios, Mission.
author: Vivek S.

description: such a cute location, rooftop has a great view. Drinks and food were very good
author: Lauren G.

description: Loud, noisy, but oh so fun. Had a great time with my work friends and the food is to die for. Margarita pitcher was barely enough for 5, and super strong, but super yummy . Sitting on the rooftop feels very New York-ish, the heat lamps were needed. Despite a long wait to get in, the waiter was super friendly and gave us an extra table for more space, really appreciated the gesture. I will be back.
author: Sylvia K.

description: Came here with a group of 10 for my birthday per the suggestion of my coworker. It's tricky getting such a big group up here. I had a friend come an hour beforehand to put our group of down. When we all showed up, we were allowed to go up immediately but then we had to wait on the roof for another 30 min for a table to clear up. Besides the seating issue, the experience was great. We all got the pork and it was so delicious that everyone couldn't stop talking about how good it was. The pitcher of margarita is also great for groups, but the most outstanding part was obviously the rooftop view! I will definitely be back but perhaps just for the happy hour.
author: Jasmine Y.

description:
Empanada de Carne + GUAC + Pitcher of La Paloma + Girls + Rooftop View = F.U.N.

Seriously--them empanadas though.
author: Ivy Z.

description:
It was quite an interesting experience. A few friends got there before I did and saved me a seat. However, when I got there a bit late, there was a line outside the door (you have to take an elevator to get to the roof) and there was a bouncer. He wouldn't let me in unless my friend who was already upstairs got a server to give him my name... kind of strange but I guess that's how they control capacity?

Anyway, the food was pretty good -- get the guac and the chicharrones!! It was so delicious! Didn't end up ordering any drinks, but that's fine cause it didn't seem like the servers were pushing us in any way.
author: Jessica X.

description: Definitely one of my favorite bars in the city! My girlfriends and I wanted to chill somewhere in the evening and even though the line looks long outside it moved really quickly. (This was around 10pm.) Our waitress Brandee was the absolute BEST - she was super friendly gave us really solid recommendations through the night. Coming back soon! :)
author: Carrie L.

description: Great place to go for brunch. Awesome views and they keep the area really warm. Loved the Margarita and vegetarian benedictos I ordered.
author: Amanda R.

description:
This rooftop is not worth the wait.

1/3 of the tables are next to the bathroom / kitchen. That area smells funny. 1/3 of the tables are in the middle. You won't see the view anyways, because the bar is always packed with people just standing there. 

The serving is small. Drinks were just ok. Host creates an unnecessary long line as a marketing gimmick to draw in the clueless flock.
author: Jackie C.

description: Absolutely AMAZING. Officially my favorite brunch spot in SF. The rooftop is very cute and comfy, and the food is DELICIOUS. Their tortillas are homemade and are crazy good, and the chorizo sausage is to die for. Definitely coming back here!
author: Ally M.

description: We came and there was await but they have a good system that loved people along in a smooth way. Once on the roof the view is beautiful and then the food came! We ordered a lot! Carnitas, quesadillas, ceviche, guacamole, tostadas, and few drinks! The pitchers are small but tasty! The food though- it is delicious! The tortillas are super thick and filling!Order your food and eat it family style and enjoy!!!
author: Curly H.

description: Had an amazing birthday dinner here on a Sunday night. Unfortunately, they didn't accept reservations by phone. You must check in with all members of your party present at the front. The wait was half an hour for a group of 6 and it was worth it! Great views of San Francisco and the overall vibe was lively. The main entrées are in small plates and everything was shareable. Chicharrones de carne was my favorite. The elote was served in 3 small corn cobs but nonetheless, tasty. This place is perfect to celebrate a birthday.
author: Monica M.

description:
This is one of my favorite spots in SF! Great rooftop bar and amazing food. I went to El techo for brunch and the Benedict is amazing. The staff are super friendly and was accommodating to my dietary restrictions. 

If there's a wait, they'll get your number and text you when your table is ready so you can grab a drink next door. I've also been to Lolinda, the restaurant downstairs for dinner. The food melts in your mouth. Both are great date spots.

El Techo is also great for drinks at night. It closes at midnight and you typically sit down at a table, so it's not a crazy party night spot or anything. They have yummy cocktails and heat lamps to keep you warm. Great for a classy night.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
Loved this place. 

Went on a Sunday night for cocktails & tapas on the rooftop. 

Be prepared to wait in line. Went on a Sunday so it wasn't long of a wait, especially for SF. Rooftop gets crowded QUICK so right when you get up there you better find you a spot to post up at AND A STOOL! If you're not at a group table, you gotta snatch up a stool once it's free or you're burning calories all night standing up. 

Food is awesome. Drinks are great and the staff freakin rock. Go here.
author: Leota T.

description:
Up the elevator in this "run down" part of the city opens up a roof top terrace for dining. 

The view is amazing and I'm sure even better at night. 

We had drinks here but got the salsa and guacamole which was pretty good- especially the salsa- chipotle and lime it seemed like. 

The only down side was our server- she wasn't really "here" throughout but one of the other guys was helpful. 

If you're in the hood, stop by for sure for he view.
author: eli o.

description:
All the reviews hit it. Food drinks view.... can't beat it. Tucked above mission street,  this amazing outdoor restaurant reminds me of a beach town lounge.  
I don't recommend the chichaornes, side,  but the main pork dish was amazing.
author: Sharon S.

description: Still pretty pricey, but if you swing by at happy hour (4-6pm on weekdays), you're going to get some great deals, such as their tasty beef empanadas (2 of them) for $5. I also highly recommend their chicharrones. Soo tender and flavorful, and they have just the right amount of fat so that your handmade tortilla isn't dripping in fat. The salsa that comes with it has just the right amount of spice too. It's a half pound for $15, and it's damn good. I'd come back each time for that and the view. Beware of beards and eclectic, hipster conversations though.
author: Danny C.

description:
I thoroughly enjoyed the food, the drinks and the vibe here. The reason I gave El Techo 3 stars is solely because of their service, or the lack thereof. 

It was the first time my fiancé and I came here together; I've come before with a few coworkers and loved the rooftop view. My fiancé is big on outdoor dining, so I figured this would be a perfect dinner spot. 

We got the guacamole, the ceviche, and an order of 3 skewers (carne, camarone, and pollo). The food and drinks were amazing! I would give the food 4.5 stars. However, since the service was pretty awful, I had to drop it down to 3. 

We would come here again, but will definitely have to stay hopeful for better service. Or, come here before prime time/early dinner rush in order to receive good service!
author: Patricia T.

description: Is is 1: 15pm, have not gotten into the restaurant yet, it is a rainy day and I come all wet. The guy CAMERON downstairs tells me he can not let me in because our reservation is at 1 30, I tell him I understand but If he can let me in the restaurant because I am getting wet. We start a discussion, I tell him "I am getting wet, can you let me in and wait in the restaurant". He answers "no I can't until five minutes before, you should get an umbrella to not get wet". Hope the food and attention upstairs is better...
author: Simón L.

description:
PORK, SO MUCH PORK. Yum. 

A few of us came here for dinner but my boyfriend and I were a few minutes late. We were told to wait in line even though our party had gone up and notified them we were arriving soon. Fortunately after only minutes of standing we were told to take the elevator up. We ordered some drinks as we waited to be seated; it was pretty packed so we were somewhat cramped in a corner. 

After being seated, we shared quite a number of dishes and also ordered a few pounds of pork. The food itself was so so delicious and the view of the city is of course beautiful, but my main concern was the service. We asked our waitress if the amount of pork we'd ordered would be enough (~6/7 of us would be eating it), however upon receiving our food it was clear that we hadn't ordered enough. A bit disappointing that our waitress couldn't better advise. Additionally, near the end of the night when a waiter was clearing our table he bumped a glass of wine or sangria onto one of our jackets. Understandably mistakes happen but the number of minor negatives added up just enough to rate this place a 3 instead of a 4.
author: Jamie B.

description:
I was there less than an hour ago. It was raining and it was very busy....  So, I asked the host (guy with glasses and a hood on with a silver ring on his middle finger) "are we only able to order from the menu you handed me?" He said, "no, those are just suggestions/recommendations that we have." I went back the table and asked our server (red plaid shirt with blonde hair), "can I get two Vegas bombs?" And he goes, "what!?" And I repeated my question... He was like, "oh, no. We don't do that here." I looked at him and was like, "uhh, okay..." And sat down. Then he asked, "do you want to order something else?" I responded and said, "no, cause I haven't looked at the menu yet..."

Later, as we were leaving (since we weren't being helped at a separate table from my friend's bday group), my boyfriend heard our rude (the guy in the plaid shirt) server's comment speaking to another server... "Omg! There was this girl that came up to me and tried to order a Vegas bomb!" My boyfriend heard AND saw him say this and my bf went off on him saying, "DON'T TALK ABOUT MY GIRL LIKE THAT!!!!"

Basically, the service sucks ass here and I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND this place because of their service. 

P.S. ONE STAR BECAUSE I CAN'T LEAVE RATING BLANK!!
author: Angelica V.

description:
Where isn't Adriano Paganini killing it with these days? Every one of his restaurants is packed to the gills. One of my friends from Spain was in town so we decided to go topside to see what this was all about. I think the only drawback with this popularity is that you wait a lot. There's a line to get upstairs. Then you wait some more for a table. At least on the second part you can drink while doing it. Can't really drink on the sidewalk unless you're hiding a flask or a 40 in a paper bag. Once you get up, you get the view of the city which is rare for eating establishments. Started off with a pitcher of the Techo margaritas which has some mezcal (smokey). After we were seated, our group went with:

Patacón
green plantain patty, black beans, queso fresco

Guacamole 
tortilla chips

Ceviche de Mango
mango, jicama, cucumber, lime, habanero

Ceviche de Camaron
shrimp, lime, tomato, red onion, cucumber, avocado, cilantro

Empanada de Alambre 
braised beef, pickled cabbage

Flautas de Pollo
tomato poached chicken, pickled cabbage

Elote 
corn on the cob, sour cream, chili, lime

Quesadilla de Acelga
oaxaca cheese, kale, mushrooms, salsas

Quesadilla de Pibil
braised pork shoulder, oaxaca cheese, salsas

Chicharrones de puerco y pollo

Choripan
chorizo, chimichurri, red onion

Tres Leches cake

Everything was solid. Sometimes even surprisingly good. THough I have to say I've basically eaten at every Paganini resto now and have had good experiences across the board. Drinks are also pretty tasty to boot. One downside of a hot spot is that as the night goes on, and it becomes more a drinking focus, it fills up with doucehbags. So Id say do dinner, get some drinks, then move onto a different place to finish the night.
author: Kim N.

description:
I am a big die hard fan of rooftop bars. Every place I go I always make it a point to go check out a rooftop bar.  San Francisco doesn't really have many really nice rooftop bars, if any at all.  

This used to be another restaurant, but I guess they revamped and now are even better!

The food is pretty delicious.  I think he service could be a little faster and nicer on the sunday rooftop morning.

My three favorite dishes are:

- Beef Empanadas which are small but tasty.
- Quesadilla de Pibil which hit the spot! The outside is more like a crunchy corn, the inside is nice and cheesy.
- Jicama Salad which is super refreshing and light, the jicama was delicious.
author: Michelle T.

description:
This Maggie who has one job but cant even do her job right! We got to the place and Maggie checked us in at 1:55pm without telling us that their kitchen is closing at 2:45. So we were waiting outside for an hour for nothing. It really sucks because we were outside infront of her waiting and she didnt even bother to tell or remind us that their kitchen is F9@;@:@/ close!
Thanks Maggie for wasting our time!!!
author: Ar L.

description:
The food here just isn't good. The guac is worth trying if you want something to snack on, but everything else was pretty forgettable. Considering that there are plenty of great restaurants in the area, I wouldn't eat here.

That being said, drinking and socializing here is great because it has great views of San Francisco... and plus you're on a rooftop bar, which is sadly rare in the city. The pitcher of margarita isn't super strong, but it's probably better that way. Not a bad price. Definitely a great place to start your night before getting hamm'ed at another bar in da mish / elsewhere.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Lolinda is an amazing place, for view, ambience, and food. Their drinks are nice and strong.  The picnic table seating is comfortable enough to hang out for a few hours catching up with friends. And their food is great, especially when sharing pitchers with friends and you need to line your stomach with something hearty. My friends and I were seated next to the outdoor grill station, which meant we were smelling all kinds of delicious things being cooked nearby.

Five stars for a great rooftop bar in the city!
author: Michelle E.

description:
Nice rooftop bar, with a great view of the city, and a good way to take in the fresh air. Stopped by on Sunday afternoon, and it wasn't very crowded. Great place to grab a drink and enjoy the nice weather.  While it looks simply like a bar, they also have a full kitchen.

Good service. Friendly staff. Definitely recommend this to friends!
author: Audrey C.

description: One of the best views of the SF nightlife! Wait time to get a waiter to serve you in the food area took longer than expected, but the taste of the food was worth the wait as well as the drinks!  very satisfied!
author: Chrystal D.

description: Love El Techo for the view, mezcal margaritas and guac but don't come here for brunch... Came here for brunch last weekend and it was nothing but slow and mediocre. Started with a pitcher of sangria and guac which I both recommend and ordered the rancheros which came not kidding an hour later (lost our order or gave the food to another table). The waiter apologized and gave us a second free guac on the house which I thought was weird since we already had one and then the food finally came. The Techo rancheros were pretty much a bowl of bean soup with a soggy tortilla crisp and some spicy pork hidden in the mess. There may be some brunch items on the menu that are good but don't order this one. I'd go back to El Techo in the future but not for brunch.
author: Craig P.

description:
If you like outdoor space and great view this is the spot in the heart of Mission St.
Plus great cocktails and Mexican food!!!
author: Alessandro B.

description:
The rooftop view is the best in the Mission.... only a few downtown skyscrappers can top it in this aspect. I've always had a good time here --- there's always a crowd, and expect to wait on the weekends. Good drinks, expect to pay for the view;) 

Haven't had the food here since it changed hands from the old Medjool. I do love what they've done with the place. Happy to go back on a hot date:)
author: Esther F.

description:
Friend wanted to explore The Mission and began by bringing all of us here on a hot Saturday afternoon. What a way to start off the day! I was a little sketched out when we walked into a random building and took the elevator up to the top floor. It wasn't exactly presentable downstairs, but let that be a reminder that you never judge a book by its cover. My god was upstairs nice. It's the only rooftop restaurant/bar I've been to and know of so far in San Francisco and on a warm day it is niiiice. You've got a view of the Financial District skyline as well as the hills that lead out to the ocean. Couple that with a couple late morning alcoholic beverages and you've got yourself a fantastic start to your day. 

It's definitely the view coupled with the drinks that will bring me back here though. The food wasn't particularly special. I got the ceviche de camaron and didn't find it particularly amazing. The stuff my friends got didn't elicit any desires within my soul either. 

Will I be back here? Certainly. Especially at night- I want to see the SF skyline lit up after the sun has set!
author: Philip W.

description: Awesome!!! I wasn't expecting it to be so close to Mexican authentic food, but I was seriously blown out of my mind!! My girlfriend immediately spread the word about this place after taking her first bite of the empanadas. I recommend the chicarrones! It just sucks that the prices are so high, if I was to make some chicarrones by myself, it would probably be about $20 cheaper. But hey it was well deserved after We were done there! Also location (on the roof of an apartment building) it's so cool!!! I definitely recommend!
author: Gabriel Z.

description:
This place is incredible. It was my first time having Argentinian food and let me tell you, it was life-changing. 

First off, 1 star for the view. This hip restaurant located atop a Mission district building has an amazing view of Downtown San Francisco. The glass panels, heated lamps, and string lights add to the hip vibe. 

Ok, 2 stars for food. OMG was my first reaction. We started with the chips and guac, shrimp ceviche, and pollos Fritos- all great choices however once our main entree came along this place really lived up to its highest Yelp reviews. GET THE CHICHARONNES CON CARNE (I think that's what it's called.. Idk, it's fried pork, homemade tortillas, escabech, chicharon, some BOMB salsa and beans). it's just mouth-watering I'm telling you. 

Another star for the wait staff. Totally cool. They're all pretty lively and sweet from what I've seen. 

Totally recommend this place for drinks, dinner, dates- you name it. It does get really busy though. We went on a Saturday around 5pm and waited about 30 minutes- not bad for such an in-demand restaurant. Will be back soon hopefully!
author: Camille A.

description: Five stars hardly seems like enough!  This place is amazing.  From the rooftop views of the surrounding Latin neighborhoods to the food and drink.  All was top notch.  I started with their classic marg and chips with guac and finished with their Tostadas de Alambre with pork.  My second libation of the evening was a perfect Caipirinha.  Music was one point - not to loud with magical beats.  Next time I am on San Fran, El Techo is my first stop!
author: Sarah O.

description:
Talk about setting the mood with lighting. In el techo's case is lack there of. One little tiny votive candle is not going to allow me to see my date or my food. 
Lucky for me, I came for a bday dinner. We all shared skewers, empanadas and ceviche. Man that ceviche is SO good. The meats are well cooked and juicy. 
The empanadas were nothing out of the ordinary. 
Overall this place was good. I would come back. I would try an earlier dinner and I'm sure the place is spectacular on a nice summer day. 
first come first serve, so you will be waiting. Drinks were eh for the price. And dessert I can't say except for the alfajadores with hot chocolate. Which the cookie itself is bigger than most they sell at the store and the hot chocolate tasted like something your Mexican grandma would make. :)
author: francis c.

description: How have I never heard of this place before'? I was craving chicken skewers and saw on Yelp this place had them and had a roof top restaurant overlooking the city.  When you step out on to the roof it is like a different world. The place was packed but we managed to get a seat right away and there were heat lamps outside. I started off with a margarita which was made just right, chips, plantain, pork shoulder that comes with corn tortillas and beans, corn, and my chicken skewer. My suggestion is skip the chicken skewer.. too boring! The corn and pork shoulder was amazing!!!! I want to come back and try their brunch menu! Great spot, great service, and excellent food!
author: Courtney Y.

description: Great atmosphere, amazing food, strong drinks but lackluster service. Still would recommend to try
author: Dave C.

description:
One of the best places to brunch with the SF skyline in the background. Great views, excellent food and the service is always good. 

The only downside is it can get noisy and crowded. So not ideal for serious chatting with your dining companion(s) unless you're prepared to adjust your voice to the noise levels. Also, the crowd is getting a little... "Marina" (as is most of Valencia St.) so you may have to deal with the drunk "whoo-girls" taking non-stop selfies on occasion as well.

Otherwise, bon appétit!
author: DJ P.

description: Disappointed.... have been here in the past and the chicharrones de carne plate was amazing, it made the line worth wait. Now the plate has been removed and replaced with carnitas. We were told it was the same but, no, what a disappointment. Without this plate skip the line and go to another great restaurant in SF.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Been hearing the buzz for the last couple weeks and since this is the old Medjool rooftop, I was looking forward to checking out this spot again. 

We visited last Saturday 6/1 after having dinner downstairs at Lolinda (Amazing BTW). I know they serve food, but we were there to grab a drink or two and just hang out for a bit. 

Mediocre looks, lacking drinks and a HUGE issue with their bills/POS machine...

Looks
Picture a huge tent with tables and chairs underneath it with clear drapes that surround it so it's a semi-enclosed space but you still get a view of the city. Personally I think it's a waste since the reason you go to the roof of any place is to check out the view and the sky and just feel like you're outside. This place...not so much. I get it though....it's relatively cold in the city and they're trying to make it comfortable for everyone, but overall it sort of ruins the reason for a rooftop joint. 

Drinks
Had a bottle of wine and a few cocktails. First, we tried ordering a Jack Daniels and coke. No Jack Daniels. We then tried ordering Johnnie Walker, same result. The waitress told us they don't carry mainstream alcohol.....lol what? But Lolinda does downstairs....? 

Bill
Ok so our bill came out and it included a 20% gratuity which is fine since we had 6 in our party. We went on through the night and the next morning my gf checked the bill because she sensed it was off somehow. Turns out the bill didn't add up and we were charged an extra $6 somewhere. Yea, I know it's only $6, but it looks like it's an issue with their machine because it just adds up incorrectly. If that's the case, then everyone who has been there may have been overcharged as well. Girlfriend promptly called the restaurant to let them know and the lady said, "yea we just opened so we're still working out the bugs". She gave us the manager's email and she emailed  picture of the receipt and we're awaiting a reply. 

I understand that it's somewhat new and they're still getting their act together, but even if they fix those issues it just doesn't feel like a rooftop place that I'd enjoy with views of the city. Maybe I'll try it again in a few months, but we'll see how it goes.
author: Andrew S.

description:
I came here for a company event--everything was amazing! I will definitely be back for brunch.

The rooftop bar has a great view of the city, and the restaurant has a great atmosphere. We were served family-style, so I got to try a little bit of everything, and there wasn't a single thing I had that I didn't like. Great ceviche, chicken kebabs, pork belly, yumm!
author: Dani S.

description:
The food and drinks that I've had here are pretty adequate, although they continue the distressing trend of gentrification in The Mission where yuppies come in and drive the prices of normally cheap items up because they don't know any better (and the savvy businessmen do).  So yeah, one of those almost generic "good, but not for that price" sort of places. 

The venue is superb, though.  Really great atmosphere and a wonderful view, and it would be an ideal way to spend a Sunday afternoon or something, if you had the money and calories to burn.  But the problem is that it's a pain in the ass to actually get to, and table management is pretty nonexistent.  That is, it took my group and I 10-15 minutes to wait in line to ride the elevator up.  I know that it was specifically to ride the elevator up because the person I asked said that it wasn't at capacity yet, they just needed to wait for the elevator.  What the fuck?  

Of course, even "not at capacity," it was still pretty full, and finding a place to have drinks and cocktails was pretty difficult.  We had to chickenhawk for about 10 more minutes before finding counterspace, and even then we didn't have seats, which sucked after a day of walking around the city and goddamn I just wanted a refreshing cocktail.  There was absolutely no system in place to distribute seats in an orderly way unless you were ordering meals, which would have been understandable if there hadn't been a good 10-15 minute wait to get into the damn place where they could do things like simple logistics.  But I guess the people at the front (ground?) door were too busy socializing with each other/their friends to do something about that.

That being said, the service was surprisingly fast given how unorganized the rest of it was.  Also it seems to be a gathering for obnoxious douchebags who get way too drunk and bump into your party in their reverie, but I guess it's not something I can blame the restaurant for, just in how it appeals to prospective clientele.
author: Norman S.

description:
Such an amazing random find! Was on my way to Lolinda when I was approached by the folks here to go up to the rooftop bar... Uhhh heck yes!! They share the chef at Lolinda but have their own menu and the rooftop space.

Great lay out and they thoughtfully put up plastic guards to keep the SF wind out. Little touches. The heat lamps are also nicely disguised in the tents.

Good veggie options, which is welcome since Lolinda is a little tougher for veggies. We tried out the following:
- Guac - fresh and yummy.
- Pisco Apricot Tropical - strong! But tasty.
- Chilcano - Fruity and a little weak but super tasty.
- Quesadilla de Acelga - kale and mushroom in my quesadilla? Heck yes! Awesome addition to a veggie quesadilla to make it more upscale. The tortilla is excellent!
- Patacon - Fried plantain with black beans. It was good but a little bland honestly.
- Ceviche Mango - while I love seafood ceviche, this is a great vegetarian take. It has a kick so you are forewarned.

Still have a few kinks to work out with service knowledge but bound to happen with a new place. In time, I see things being excellent.
author: Raina B.

description: Rooftop View of El Techo is fantastic! The service was impressive. Food recommendations would be the Quesadilla de Pibil and the Coctel de Camaron.
author: Taylor M.

description: Horrible.  Both my boyfriend and I got food poisoning here. The culprit was most likely the foul empanadas. Not cool. I would not recommend eating here.
author: Caitlin S.

description:
This rooftop was SOO GREAT!!! I went on a Wednesday around 5pm, it was sunny warm and so lovely. The view of the city is fantastic! Happy hour was until6, and had a pretty decent selection. The plantain party with bean dip was tasty as was the chicken thigh nuggets. Defend margarita and $4 beers. 

I will certainly be back and would highly recommend it to others!!
author: Sarah F.

description: Disappointed to learn that they are currently closed due to a kitchen fire that occurred last week.
author: Mike C.

description: A neat place if you're trying to impress guests I suppose, but it didn't impress our appetites or spirits.  Nothing kills the mood like being treated like you're interrupting the staff when showing up for your reservation.  The tapas are tasty, but as the norm goes for tapas, don't arrive hungry.  We enjoyed the beef empanadas, guacamole, and platanos.  The view is decent, but let's be real if you want a good view, Dolores Park or Twin Peaks is just a short drive away.
author: J L.

description: This place was incredible! The waitstaff was friendly, welcoming, and accommodating. I would come back in a heart beat! The tapas were great and I recommend the corn and empanadas. Insanely great and relatively good deals for San Fran.
author: Gabe C.

description: Awesome view, great food - go there!
author: Ed C.

description:
If you're waiting for tables and host ask you if you want to order drinks first.. They will charge you for a separate bill before you even get seated. So you pay for drinks AND tips just for damn drinks. Then you get call if your table is ready. You order your food and you pay the bills AND tips again. Wtf? I thought they would add both bills together but all they want is money from you. Way to make money for a crowded ass night that you can't see the sight when is everybody standing.

Food was mediocre. Better off somewhere else that has authentic Latin food. This is just very very bland for the price and portion. I don't even know I even had this bookmarks. Worst place I've ever been into. Worst than fuckin mcdonalds. I don't even know why there is so many good reviews about this place. It must be because people haven't seen the city on top of a roof before.  Service is just blah they want your money that's all.
author: H H.

description: Been here multiple times for boozy brunch.  The views are amazing.  On a warm day, this place is great, but even on a cold day it doesn't disappoint.  I've probably had everything on their menu so I won't list everything I've eaten.  Just plan on coming here and enjoy yourself.  I wouldn't recommend this for a date or quiet outing; it's definitely for those that want to have fun :)
author: Stephanie S.

description: They have great food and waiters are nice, but there's a lack of management in this place. They make you make the line even if your friends have a table and are waiting for you to order, doesn't make sense. The host is terrible and treated me so bad, like making me a favor getting me in. But was even worst,  we were 5 people in a table, and one more friend was coming up, and the host didn't get him sit just because the table wasn't for 6, and we were plenty of room for one more. He rather than let him sit preferred us to leave. It isn't because of the service, cause the utensils are in a can and they only have paper napkins, nothing formal. I can't believe this is happening in San Francisco. Please don't go to the place.
author: Oscar L.

description:
IF YOU'RE SEARCHING FOR SOME TASTY CHICHARRONES THEN LOOK NO FURTHER!! Though they come out with the order in lightning speed (always a potential red flag), the meat is of sure fire quality. And don't fret chicos and chicas because these bad boys are full of protein, hold the carbs (solid for those bi's and tri's).

The setup is pretty tight being that it's on a roof, but to be honest it's not the sickest area to view from above. Nonetheless, always a cool spot to check out if you haven't yet. Just don't forget the chicharrones
author: Eric N.

description: I really like this place on warm nights but line is always too long. We waited almost one hour outdoor before we were told we could leave the line and check in again later. Regular food, but the view of the city (w/out fog) is unbeatable!
author: Serena P.

description: I've come here many times for dates, meeting with clients, and business brunches . . . love the view and proximity to home!
author: Rob B.

description:
Happy Hour is a must at this place !

Excellent service our waiter was very attentive and was nice 
enough to box up all my leftovers. 

The carnitas are a must and also the great happy hour drinks like the pina colada ! 

I will definitely come back!

Keep in mind happy hour starts at about 5pm and by 6pm there was a long line downstairs 
outside .. I would not recommend coming in large groups unless you are willing to wait awhile.
author: T. C.

description:
Great date night spot! Cool rooftop bar in the Mission offering Latin-inspired tapas and drinks. Just the right place to unwind after a long week!

Started with the Ceviche de Camaron -- a fave appetizer made of lime, shrimp and cilantro! Followed it up with vegetable and shrimp chuzos -- perfectly grilled skewers! We also ordered a half-pound serving of chicharonnes de carne -- roasted and fried chunks of meat (no apologies -- it's date night!)  Topped it off with a pitcher of sangria with red wine and brandy -- oh happy happy day!
author: Dawne L.

description:
I came here on a sunny Monday afternoon and was seated right away. The chicharrones had a good flavor and are definitely a must have. You can share this plate but the flautas (2) is enough for one person. 

The drinks are good...definitely a good spot to check out in SF!
author: G H.

description:
El Techo does not accept reservations. If the weather is nice, it'll be pretty packed any day of the week, so get here early; if you to guarantee yourself a seat with an optimum view, best to get here when it opens. This rooftop venue is very pretty, and there are heat lamps for when it gets cold. 

I've tried most of the tapas. They're above average quality, each order easily shareable up to four people. I've been to some restaurants that like to make their tapas so fancy that I've no idea how to even eat the damn thing, but  El Techo keeps it pretty simple with a modern twist.

I was here on a busy Tuesday evening. Arrived at 5pm with a party of 4 and was seated immediately, though the seating was getting scarce, only an hour from opening. The place gets pretty loud, but despite the crowds, orders made it to our table in a timely manner, so no need to order everything en masse.

Any of the shareable drinks come in a carafe; they're refreshing, but if you're looking for better value and/or to at least get a light buzz on, order a bottle of wine.
author: Douglas Y.

description: I went to El Techo's happy hour earlier this week as recommended by a friend. The drinks were great, $18 for a pitcher of sangria ($7 off). There weren't many appetizers on the HH menu though. I noticed online they list 4 HH appetizers, but in the restaurant I only saw chips and salsa or guac.
author: Sarah K.

description: I love techo every time I come!  Best atmosphere lively funky and fun! Esquite corn will definitely be a game changer. We kept asking for seconds! The sangria pitcher wasn't so great but would love to try the Paloma or margs. Perfect spot for tapas to share and the rooftop vibes are epic!!! Not so hidden gem in the city. Go!
author: Em G.

description:
Ughhh so disappointing! We went here awhile back and the meat was out of this world! So good! 

Just came back again and it was awful. Meat was not flavorful at all. The beans tasted like a cigarette butt. 

Nice view but if there's a wait, I would not recommend wasting your time.
author: Brittany M.

description: This is an "edit" - had a rough experience with the hostess downstairs... however, once we got upstairs more than one person really made up for it. They apologized and we're super nice and gave us a dessert. Really excellent service. And the food was delicious with a really cool atmosphere. I will be back again soon
author: Sarah J.

description:
Wow! The view from the rooftop terrace is spectacular!  We came here on a Saturday at around 6:30 pm and the place was packed!  There was a group at the bar that was about to leave so we were lucky to grab their table.  
We ordered two pitchers of Sangria and a bunch of appetizers from the bar.  We ordered the platano maduro, mango, guacamole, flautas, chicharonnes and empanada.  My favorite by far was the chicharonnes de carne.  It was so tender and melt in your mouth with the perfect amount of spices.  It was not greasy at all and not your traditional chicharonnes.  The sangria tasted a little watered down but for the price of $25 a pitcher, it was good enough.  I would probably order a pound of chicharonnes all to myself on my next visit!
author: Cherry Ann W.

description:
This place is amazing! Not that many rooftop bars in SF, so coming here makes me cherish it that much more! 

We waited maybe 30 minutes at least on a Saturday night to get in. It was probably around 8? Nevertheless, it was worth the wait. 

Rooftop bars really have a special place in my heart. Being able to see the whole city far and wide from above, while drinking margaritas and having some super BOMB guacamole with chips = living the good life!  my cousins were literally ready to say it was like the best guac they've ever had. 

Heat lamps are so hot that you don't even need a jacket when you know it's actually cold out. Our waiter was the homie too. When you get there you don't have to order at the bar, the waiters come to you even though it's open seating and doesn't look organized - they WILL notice you and take your order! 

All I gotta say is MORE ROOFTOP BARS, SF!! Make it happen!
author: Monica B.

description:
Ok. I have been here twice now-- once towards the end of the brunch rush and once at peak dinner time on a Saturday night. I preferred my brunch experience because we were seated almost right away. The drinks were really great (particularly the La Paloma). And I am a sucker for good jalapeno corn bread. I was with a group of 6 and we arrived late afternoon (around 3pm) on a Saturday. There is a beautiful view of the city from this rooftop location. And the food and drinks live up to the quality of the view. 

The dinner experience, while still good, was a bit more of a production. The whole experience took about 3 hours. I came here with a girlfriend. First, we had to grab a spot to stand in the "bar" area. You are not allowed to order a drink at the bar but have to wait for a server to come to you. Good luck finding a table to sit at in this area-- you have to be pretty aggressive and vigilant (we got lucky about 30 minutes into our wait and found a high top for 2 people). We ended up waiting an hour and a half for a table. When we finally got seated we ordered 4 dishes: guacamole, fried chicken, street corn, and the ceviche. The street corn and the ceviche were my favorite dishes but everything was delicious. 

All in all the experience was pleasant. The food, drinks, and view were really great. Will probably wait a while to go back-- or go back during an off peak time. 3 hours for dinner is a real commitment.
author: Carson S.

description: I came here during happy hour and really enjoyed the venue. My relatively large group was able to get seated immediately. Of all the things we ordered, my favorites were the pina colada, chicarones, and guac. I was worried about being on the rooftop during the breezy SF summer night, but there were plenty of heat lamps around to keep people warm.
author: Alice S.

description: Great place to get some margaritas and great Mexican food with a bunch of friends. The rooftop bar has a great view of the city and even has heaters for the brisk SF nights. Fun place to take friends visiting.
author: Brady A.

description: It was so fun to stop at El Techo at the end of our girls day!! Jeremy was AMAZING and so fun and interactive.  He was always there with a drink and a laugh- will come back just to see him!!
author: Carrie M.

description: The perfect place to catch an amazing view, some sun and enjoy amazing food! One of the best rooftop restaurants in the Bay Area. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. Truly a must go to place in the heart of the mission!
author: Crystal R.

description: Maggie was so helpful. we weren't sure where to go, but she brought us in and added to the great experience we were already having!
author: Matt M.

description:
I just moved back from Los Angeles, home of trendy roof top bars (like Perch and The Standard) and I couldn't not compare those experiences to El Techo. Well, while this place also serves food (unlike those aforementioned bars), I still think this does place doesn't capture what a rooftop bar should entail. In other words, the views aren't that majestic and its way too crowded with tables/chairs/people. The point of having a rooftop joint is to enjoy whatever view it gives. There needs to be more space for standing and looking down at Mission St. Here, being up high is sort of pointless. You might as well just have a patio restaurant that's not on a roof.

At any rate, we ordered a few pitches of margaritas and a couple huge 32 oz. bottles of an El Salvadorian beer called Regia. They were all tasty but nothing to go crazy over. Overall, this place is OK. It might be hard getting a table during peak hours (trendy rooftop bar). They close the roof at 1:00AM.
author: Marlon T.
