description: Great for brunch. You may have a small wait, but it's worth it. You can't go wrong with the carnitas. Served with handmade tortillas and pickled vegetables. Delish! The chorizo Benedict is pretty good too, add a bloody Maria or michelada. Awesome rooftop view of the city.
author: Kelly M.

description: Good food overall and decent view. Inattentive service. Good bar feel. Would probably not go back on a visit.
author: Nilo K.

description:
I was here for Brunch last weekend and had a very memorable experience.  The food and drinks were delicious (get the Benedicto and Huarache) and very reasonable. 

Planning on returning for their happy hour!
author: Anoush Y.

description: We came here on a Saturday around 4. The line wasn't too bad, about a 15 minute wait. We had a group of 5 and ordered a ton of food and drinks: margarita pitchers, carne asada skewers, guac and chips, empanadas, and quesadillas. I got to try a little of everything and it was all good. What particularly stood out were the skewers. Perfectly grilled and marinated. A little pricey- ended up paying around 40 each after tax and tip but we did order a lot of food and had drinks. The view is nice but it was a bit chilly when we were there. The heaters were on but you couldn't feel it at all.
author: Samantha H.

description:
So glad to have discovered this place, one of the very few rooftop bars in San Francisco. 

The place:
Ok, so this place is actually the sister restaurant of Lolinda (which is located 2 doors down from El Techo), and is a little difficult to find in my opinion. You literally have to walk in this shady-looking hall way and take the elevator up to the restaurant. Nonetheless, the restaurant itself is very quaint, especially at night when they have all the lights on. Perfect location for a chill date as the atmosphere here isn't overly romantic, but the ambiance is still there :P

The eats:
My friends and I decided to try their ceviche, pork shoulders, and their fried plantains. All three dishes were really good but our favorite was definitely the ceviche. The ingredients El Techo used was extremely fresh, and the flavor was just perfect. The pork shoulder was a bit chewy, but their tortilla made up for it. Fried plantain was really good but not all that special imo... :\

The service:
Five stars for the service at El Techo. The staff here are always very willing to answer any questions. (: 

Overall, the restaurant is more on the pricey side given their portion sizes; nonetheless, I had a great dining experience.
author: Selina S.

description: This place is an awesome find! Sold food and margaritas with a killer view! We visited on a Sunday night around 7:30 and waited a short 25 min to be seated. We order the pound of pork carnitas, guac, and a pitcher of margaritas. Got out for less than $60 which is great for SF! The view is definitely worth it, especially at night. Totally recommend!
author: Shelby F.

description:
Still today, this continues to be one of my favorite bars in San Francisco. Coming from the East Coast, i love rooftops in the summer time and thus far this has been my favorite in SF. I am a sucker for views in general, and when I discovered el Techo I immediately fell For the view of the city  you can check out here. My favorite drink here is el Chilicano, which is a passion fruit cocktail..my favorite thing to dine in are the the pork tacos...fresh and yummy tortillas and super tender chicharron.

This is indeed the spot to be when the weather is nice and sunny in San Francisco. So, if it is warm out you can expect a bit of a wait so it is better to make a reservation or come in early so you can be seated quickly.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Really dig this place. Food is great, staff are friendly. The views of the city are amazing. We always take friends there when they visit the city. One of my fave places in SF for a casual dinner and Drinks.
author: L W.

description: If you love carnitas and dislike choices this place is for you. Also great and pretty strong margaritas. Fantastic atmosphere and views of the city.
author: Matthew E.

description: Our party of 2 showed up on a Tuesday evening at 7pm no reservations and happy to say there was no wait. El Techo had  beautiful views, good food and drinks. Good for an occasional night out we had 3 drinks and 3 dishes came to $80.00.
author: Susan S.

description:
Great place to catch a bite with friends before going out. The food and service is great, the drinks are also super tasty. I'm a fan of the Pina Colada there.

They have plenty of heat lamps and there's a glass barrier all the way around that blocks out the wind. 

I wish we had more rooftops like this in SF
author: Alan M.

description:
YUM!!!!!!!

So I came here for 500 Brunches (SF start up where you get matched up with people by interest and get brunch on the weekends). I had never heard of this place but I am definitely happy I came here. The restaurant has a patio where the brunch took place, there are heat lamps to remedy the cool weather and the view of SF is a definite bonus addition to the experience. 

I started with a bloody mary, yummm and ordered the vegetarian eggs benedict (the only difference from the regular is that on the side you get an assortment of veggies such as egg plant, zucchinis, etc). The food came out fairly quickly, or maybe the time was just passing by faster while people at the table were getting to know each other. Anyway sorry for the digression, the eggs benedict were freaking delicious, they used corn bread for the bread part and it is money. I highly recommend!
author: Katya O.

description: This place is very nice if you want to share nice cocktails with some friends. But service is very oppressive because you're always asked to order something else until you leave the place. I can understand a table with only drinks is not profitable enough compared to a complete dinner, but in this case don't allow it.
author: Sixtine F.

description:
This place is an amazing gem on Mission St. The atmosphere and the views really make this place feel like an experience. Since I work in the Mission, El Techo is a go-to post work happy hour spot. As long as you get there on the earlier side (before 6:30) you usually don't have to wait in line, and can find a nice place for everyone to sit down. 

The margaritas are delicious but be warned they are strong. The chips and quac are a solid sharing option. And their Malbec is delicious. 

This place only makes me wish San Francisco had more good rooftop bar options.
author: Ashley S.

description: Brunch and dinner here is AMAZING! Beautiful rooftop view of the city skyline. I've had only good times at El Techo. Delicious cocktails and food. I love the ceviche, beignets (during brunch!), empanadas, but the *must* order is the chicharrones! Absolutely delicious. The smallest order is quite enough for 3 to share if you're getting other dishes. It's very filling but oh so good!
author: Natassia S.

description: Our server, Mark E. Mark,  completely made our evening. His cheer and attentive service made us feel so welcome and all of his recommendations were perfect!
author: Ayaire C.

description: Best place to have drinks for happy hour or dinner!! Great atmosphere. The view is nice .  The staff was very attentive once our are  inside. The only downside was the wait, but if don't mind the wait it is well worth it. It was my first time and would wait again!! Food was amazing!!!
author: Carla C.

description: Come here on a nice 70+ degree day. Make your out of town guest believe you are the high life of society. This place is sure to please everyone with a soul. The food is great but really you come here for the view, and the experience. Its a touch of casual high society inbedded in the mission.
author: Robert gene R.

description:
Stars for each: Great concept. Great View. Great Food. Great service. 

Knock off a star only because i think they need to change the trays that they use to serve food in. Health issue, the tray is full of rust and though they cover it with sheets/banana leaves it only covers a portion n food end up touching or being placed on the rusty area. 

Other than the tray everything else is clean, tables, utensils, water/cups, bathroom. I will definetly be back, SOON! 

Price: decent/fair
Parking: park in the side streets, & a block and a half ( Valencia St) more meters n marking options.
author: Ledam O.

description:
the brunch?
impromptu

the elevator?
slow.

the vibe?
vivacious.

the crowd?
diverse.

the server?
fine.

the drinks?
tempting.

the guac?
bland.

the portions?
small.

the benedictos?
tasty.

the eggs?
overpoached.

the view?
gorgeous.

the landscaping?
impeccable.

the return?
sangria.
author: Amy C.

description: One of the coolest restaurant/bar I have visited when I was in SF. You wouldn't notice it when passing by the building but there are people queuing in front of it that gives you a cue. It is located on the rooftop and has a very nice view over the city. Cocktails and wine are nice. We first shared some chips and dips and then our friend recommended us to try the cevice. The menu is mainly Mexican with some South American dishes. We also got different quesadillas that we all shared. It was delicious. Even though these are simple dishes they were fine and tasty. I really loved it.I had a very nice evening and would definitely come back. Although Monday night, it was very crowded, the waiting can take a while.
author: Laura N.

description: Came here for a quick drink and appetizer. The chips and guac are DIVINE. The service is great when it's not so crowded, however when it starts to get busy, good luck grabbing the attention of your server. Fair price on drinks, I will be back.
author: Esther P.

description: I love this place. There really are no SF rooftop bars/restaurants. This place is great because of its rooftop, but also be prepared to wait a long time to sit on that rooftop. The cocktails are yummy. Margarita pitchers with a group is always a good idea. Get the Beef Empanadas. Some of my favorite in the city. Also love love love the chicharonnes de carne. The fried chunks of pork shoulder are so delicious. Highly recommend, but be prepared to wait. Definitely need to come back and try their brunch.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: El Techo is an amazing place for happy hour and dinner. Cozy, casual but fancy. Food and drinks are great. I recommend the Empanadas and the Quesadilla de Pibil. Margaritas and Paloma for drinks. The view of the city plus the heaters are just amazing.
author: Valeria W.

description: I think this place is great and the location will be five stars if they had more space. The upstairs roof top is a great view but it's not that spacious and the amount of people they add onto the location is too much. The waiters and waitresses are very nice though, and will tend to your needs promptly. The bathroom is unisex but their employees check the bathrooms regularly to make sure the bathroom stays clean. The food is priced very high for the little amount they give you FYI. You can easily spend $150 in one stop.
author: Luchita M.

description: Yummy! Came here for brunch for one of my friends bday and thus place did not disappoint! Good was so flavorful and delicious... We had almost everything on the menu since we like to eat family style. From start to finish we were happy and by the end we were stuffed. One of the best micheladas I've had in awhile. It's super busy so if you plan on visiting you should make reservation. Rooftop, great food & drinks! Two thumbs up from me!
author: Lin C.

description: Second time here. And only reason why I came because I wanted to give them a second chance. Today I experienced the same thing as two years ago. Too busy to function and aloof staff. Waited about 45 minutes before ordering. The view is okay, dirty windows. Food... I rather stop by mc Donald's before coming in to this place. They also need new speakers for their music.
author: Lizette S.

description:
One of my favorite roof top bar spots in the mission. Hipster and trendy but fun. Sunny and sheltered from the wind. Good service, attentive and friendly. Always has a line though on Friday and Saturday nights, FYI.
Good eats and tasty beverages.
The Chicharonnes de Carne is absolutely phenomenal. One of my favorites! Crispy but tender morsels of pork. Mmmmm mmmm!
Margaritas aren't too shabby either.
I love this place!
author: Kehaulani K.

description: Got seated within 10minutes, ordered everything our server (Mark) recommended. This restaurant exceeded my expectations. Thanks for a great overall dining experience!
author: D T.

description:
I've lived in SF for a couple months and had only been to the mission once when I was looking for housing, so last weekend I figured it was about time to explore the mission again. It was the perfect day--high 70s and not a cloud in the sky. A friend had recommended this place, and I'm SO glad she did! It was gorgeous! The staff was friendly, the place was clean, and it wasn't at all crowded for a ROOFTOP SF brunch on a beautiful day.

The food and drink wasn't particularly outstanding, but I'd come again for the view and overall experience.
author: Katie V.

description: I've been wanting to try El Techo de Lolinda for a while now and finally got to go for the first time last week. We made reservations for Sunday Brunch; so there wasn't a wait at all. I ordered an agua fresca mimosa. It was with watermelon, and it was pretty tasty. The food order was as follows: Ceviche de Camaron, Chicharrones, and the Benedictos. I'm not sure if I would order the ceviche again. It didn't have enough of a "kick" to it, but it wasn't completely without flavor. The Chicharrones were my favorite. They were so tender, and the tortillas and salsa that accompanied them made the dish even better. The Benedictos were good, but I wish there was more sauce on the dish. The view of this place is nice, and the service is pretty good too. I can't wait to go back for dinner and try a few items from that menu.
author: Jessika V.

description:
Chicharrones were AMAZING! JUICY and seasoned really well. 

Platanos maduros were good too! The crema they come with is spicy though. 

Quesadilla pibil was good. Perfect balance of oaxacan cheese and tender pork.

The Paloma cocktail was good! But kinda strong. We got the pitcher ...next time i want to try different drinks !,

AMAZING service. Our waitress lagged in the beginning but her team kept checking in on us. 

Good times! AWESOME views :)
author: Laura T.

description:
This was my first time going to Techo and I will be going back to it! The food was delicious. I had a Quesadilla Pibil which was good. My friend ordered the Ceviche and it was so freakin good! We ordered a Jicama salad and the huevos rancheros( which I did not try but was told by my friend they were delicious!) Our server was very friendly and on top of our order. Their cuisine is a variety of "Latin American" dishes from Argentina all the way up to Mexico.

Beautiful roof top view overlooking the city! 
Good place to go rain or shine!
author: SOPHIA V.

description:
This place is fun to say over and over... El Techo de Lolinda! (repeat x10)

Sounds cool and it is pretty cool because how many rooftop bars have you been to?!? I haven't been to many so I thought it was awesome. To get to the bar, you go through some dimly lit hallway and make your way to the elevator to get to the roof. There are signs that point you to the right way so you won't get lost, plus it's a short walk. I thought the entire thing was cool because it made me feel special or something, like I'm going to a secret party where I go through a secret way into the secret elevator like in the movies... but anyway it was just a different way to enter the bar/restaurant. 

The place isn't too big but there are plenty of tables. You also get a nice view of SF while drinking and eating. It has a nice chill vibe to it. You don't need to be extra fancy but it's also weird if you're super casual. They close pretty early, last call is at 12am and everyone has to be out by 1am since they sit on top of a residential building that pretty much forces them to clear out everyone to avoid noise violations. My group and I got there pretty late so we just got drinks. They have interesting drink concotions and I chose to get the Cuba Libre. I loved my drink! It was like a sour coke almost. The drink was lime, rum, and mexican coca cola! It was a nice refreshingly light drink and I drank it like it was water. I tried some of my friends drink and it was pretty good. A lot of sour/sweet combinations which I guess maybe is popular in latin american drinks? Not sure, but I enjoyed it. 

A great stop if you're in the mission!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Aldo was an exceptional waiter- he was so friendly and welcoming of our big group! We had an awesome time here and the food was exceptional as always!
author: Rhonda I.

description:
I've been here twice.  First time was the second night the rooftop bar was open, and I choice not to write a review until now since I know the first week can be hectic and unrepresentative of future nights.  But I recently came back and felt that not much had been improved upon.  We had to wait about 45 minutes to get a table, then another 20 minutes before the waiter even acknowledged us, and additional 30 minutes to get chips and guacamole.  Our waiter was super nice, and didn't bill us for the chips and guac because the wait was outrageous.  He told us the kitchen ran out of chips and apologized.  

So, there's a whole lot of waiting here, with one exception - drinks.  You can get a drink both with table service and in the bar area in about 10 minutes.  I would definitely go back for a drink, but probably not order food again.  Don't get me wrong, the food was great once we got it, but it just took forever to get.  The view is exquisite, and paired with an after work cocktail, is definitely worth a visit.

The only thing I would note for management is about adapting to demand.  We were chatting with our waiter and I was telling him how I had been there during opening week, and I expected them to have it together by now.  He agreed.  He told me that certain days of the week had been more crowded (we were there on a Wednesday and this was the case) and that management knew the previous Wednesdays had been crowded, yet no extra waiters or staff had been added to help with demand.
author: Stephanie V.

description:
Their chicharrones is pretty much the best mexican food I've ever had, and their drinks are pretty bomb as well. Seriously, so good. I loved their Pina Colada, and I usually NEVER like Pina Colada. It was super rich and delicious. Their hot chocolate is also great, but the thickness seems to vary from day to day. Still worth getting in my opinion.

Come with an empty stomach, because you'll want to fill up on everything they have to offer. Ambiance is also nicely set up, and it's a great place to chill out with your friends.
author: Linda K.

description: El Techo brings back very old memories of Medjool (same location) and it's always pretty awesome to enjoy your cocktails while overlooking the city. I was very thankful for the heaters and most of them seemed to be working. The Paloma cocktail is delicious, sangria is okay, and tequila shots are... still tequila shots but in taller shot glasses. We celebrated Zack's birthday here Friday night and it was a fun time! We ate dinner downstairs which was helpful since they walked us to the elevator without having to wait in line first. Thanks El Techo!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Absolutely love this place! This place is the s@!#%! Don't let the loud crowd deter you, it just means happy people and you are in the right place. 
  We had the chicharrones de carne and it was perfection. The black bean side ( slightly smokey) And the side is salsa that was a perfect compliment. The hand made corn tortillas were wonderful. 
  This place is over the top great!
  Oh and the view is awesome too.
  Oh and the service is awesome too.
  We will be back
author: Kenneth R.

description:
Awesome ambiance. 

You might be disappointed with the long wait to get in (We waited for 45 minutes before getting a table!). However the place wont disappoint you. Beautiful views of the city skyline on a clear day. They do not take reservation except for brunch over weekends.

Their sangria were perfect to start with along with Guacamole and chips. We had the Quesadilla de Acelga with was crunchy, delicious with a little extra butter/olive oil. We ordered the Elote (sweet corn) which was great. Good hospitality and energetic crowd. Worth a visit again.
author: Shiven G.

description: What bad things can you really say about a rooftop bar in San Francisco? Very trendy and upbeat environment. Definitely not the place to go if you're trying to have a romantic dinner date as it gets REALLY loud, especially during happy hour. Needless to say, it's an excellent experience and place for tapas and drinks. I opted for a pina colada over a margarita as I haven't had a pina colada in a really long time before going here. Beware, the drink is really strong! Like, I'm almost sure the drink was 70% rum. It had a hint of cinnamon in it, which some people may not like. I also had the plantain chips, ceviche, and carnitas. All were excellent. The half pound of carnitas is a lot though, but I'm not complaining. Service is fast if you manage to wave down a waiter.
author: Jennalyn L.

description: Great roof top bar in the Mission area of SF.  I ordered the pork shoulder quesadilla and shrimp ceviche.  The quesadilla was excellent.  They put a lot of TLC into making the dish and it really showed.  The shrimp ceviche contained juicy shrimp and was served with chips.  The beer specials during happy hour were pretty good and the margaritas and sangria were good.  We had a large group so it was a bit hard to seat everyone at first, but they did their best to accommodate us.
author: Richard L.

description: I recently had a company Happy Hour hosted at El Techo's roof top bar. The views and food were great, but the one thing that stood out to me was the superb service we received from our waiter Marky Mark. He made sure that we were always served food and drinks. He made the whole event worry-free on my end and made the night that much more enjoyable.  He deserves this shout out because any reputable business that is successful is mainly due to outstanding customer service  - which we were given that night.
author: Jannilyn M.

description: Worth standing in line! Hadn't been in awhile, brought my Canuk friends with plans for a few drinks and snacks. At first the line up was daunting but the hosts were very accommodating and the line moved quickly. GREAT service on the rooftop and excellent food! As someone who loves to cook, I am often less than impressed with dining out but tonight was just fabulous. Thank you El Techno for adding a giant cherry to our already great day!
author: Beth P.

description: This place was tight. The line out front was intimidating when our group of 3 first walked up. We absentmindedly joined it and overheard other people talking about whether they were eating or just drinking, so my friend went up to check with the hostess and told her we were hungry too. Somehow that allowed us to skip the line and take the elevator right up to a patio with great music and an amazing view. We quickly ordered a pitcher of margaritas and some appetizers to share. The fried plantains were delicious (if maybe served a little too hot) and the guacamole was good too. We were still a little hungry so we ordered a few more skewers of meat and another pitcher of margaritas. The margaritas never came, and when we asked our server about it, she said, "you never got your margaritas?" I'm not sure why she thought we'd ask about them if they HAD come, but eventually she brought out more. The place was packed though--so the confusion wasn't that surprising. Overall a great place to spend an afternoon in SF.
author: Morganne B.

description:
Came here during one of my recent trips to SF. After a morning of hiking, I came here with a couple of girl friends to grab some cocktails and snacks. It was a sunny day in the city, so it was nice to be outside on the rooftop enjoying our delicious drinks. We did have to wait in the line downstairs for about 15 minutes (we came around 3 pm on a Saturday). Our waiter was entertaining and attentive, which are always a good thing! We each ordered a couple of fruity cocktails and mock tails along with a snack to share:

Chilcano $10
huamani pisco, lime, passion fruit, ginger, bitters

La Paloma    $10
tequila, grapefruit, agave, lime, soda

Tres Amigos $10
ocho plata, victoria lager, house sangrita

Piña Colada $10
el techo rum blend, coconut cream, pineapple,
cinnamon-crushed ice

CHICHARRONES de CARNE (Half Pound) $14

Surprisingly, we enjoyed the pina colada the best. It's definitely not a common drink for us to order when we're out, but it was refreshing and not overly sweet. It hit the spot for the warm air and it made us feel like we were on Spring Break in Mexico! 

Will come back whenever I have a chance and try out more food choices on their menu.
author: Tracey W.

description: Good place to meet friends and get a great view of the City. Food is good and the staff is super friendly. The only reason I am giving a 4.5 instead of a 5 stars rating it is because the place is super loud, fun, but too loud to actually have any conversations at your table. It could just be the day we went there, beautiful sunny Saturday - a very precious combination for us! I will go back again and  will definitely recommend this place
author: Eloa S.

description: I can't say anything about the restaurant but the rooftop bar is really nice. Even in January it was comfortably warm because of all the heaters. There was a line about 20 minutes long to get in but I think that's pretty understandable for a Saturday night. Drinks were good and reasonably priced. It's worth going just for the view
author: Sarah W.

description: Best palomas ever. Nice view with rooftop bar. I loved the empanadas de carne from the small plates, the empanada had a very nice texture and delicious taste. Nice staff, Cozy environment. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Suzy R.

description:
I love love love love this place! Wish there were more rooftop bars like this in San Francisco.

Great selection of drinks. Spectacular view. Good food, good music. Can get a little crazy for weekend brunch or Thu/Fri/Sat nightlife. Great spot for happy hour.

I bring my out-of-town friends here all the time.
author: Barry B.

description:
I want to like this place, but they still have a few kinks to work out in the service department. I'll probably revisit in a few months.

The heavy duty tent-roof eliminates the wind/cold, but the resulting echo increases the decibel level by 15 points: be prepared to shout to your tablemates on a busy night unless you opt for the stools past the elevator (outside the heated zone but much quieter). 

We visited last Saturday. The host said we could wait on those stools while a table cleared. The waiter serving that area told us we'd need to close our tab if we moved because the new table wasn't in his section. However, we didn't get the drinks until about 20 minutes later, well after we moved and had another server check in. The new table was ~15 feet from the stools. 

We never saw the new server again, and the old one never closed out our tab as he said we needed to do. When we tried to order food the kitchen had been closed for 20 minutes-- about 30 minutes after we tried to get anyone's attention. 

The pleasantly redeeming part of the evening was the host, who checked in on us a couple of times since the table was right behind his podium and he saw our efforts to flag someone down. He also delivered a round of tequila shots on the house as an apology for what he admitted was us "getting lost in the shuffle." That's what brought this experience to 3 stars from 2. 

It might help if the servers had a uniform of some kind (all one color/style or whatever). The hardest part about having to flag someone down (besides having to flag someone down for service) was being unsure if they were a server or patron. In the hour we were there, we only had one round. The caipirinha was the winning drink of the evening but the others were OK.
author: Krista L.

description: Andy and Maggie were the most accommodating hostesses and the food and drinks are seriously amazing. On top of all of this is the fact this is a roof top bar and you now are looking at a view of the city, not very common in SF!
author: Sam W.

description:
The drinks we had were awesome, but the service was terrible. The service was super slow and we waited for over 10 minutes to put in our orders for our drinks, then another 10+ minutes for the drinks to arrive. Then when we wanted to get the check, the waitress never came back and we were in a rush. When I went up to the register area, I asked a different waitress if she could help us get the bill, and she rudely responded "Did I serve you?" No, she didn't, but did they want us to pay for our drinks or not?! 

The service aside, the drinks were really good and the view was enjoyable. However, the service was really a turn off and I would not plan to visit again.
author: Louisa M.

description: Venue was great and views are nice. This is a great place to drink. Initially would give 5 stars however one of the servers, Kat?, ruined it for us. While the other servers were very friendly and accommodating to our group of 10, she was unreasonably pushy and negative and  demanded us to order more food. Even though we had already racked up in excess of $500. In addition she was being difficult with opening a couple tabs, this should be expected with large bills to begin with. Her unfriendly attitude was unreasonable and surprising. Food was great but for a totally great experience , I feel my rating is fair and will recount our experience to other groups contemplating of having fun here.
author: Paul C.

description:
Fantastic view of the city, my first time at a rooftop bar in SF. 
The food was also delicious. My table ate family style and we decided to each order a plate and then pass it around and share, and a pitcher of margaritas. The food is DEFINITELY something you must experience, but the pricing was pretty meh. I expected to leave a lot more full than I did, for the price I paid. Maybe next time I'll come for just drinks, but I will most definitely be back here.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Very nice rooftop bar in the middle of the Mission. I liked the ambiance and heat lamps to ward off the mid-summer chill of San Francisco. The drinks were ok - not too strong. The pina colada wasn't as frozen as I would have liked it to be. We mainly stopped by for drinks; however, I did have the alfa jores and hot chocolate which was a nice light sweet snack. My friend says the food is good here.

For a Thursday night, it wasn't too crowded and had a nice casual crowd.
author: Trang H.

description: Great setting/view and the service is pretty good. The roasted pork is the only dish I can recommend, everything else I've had is very bland. The cocktails aren't impressive either. Basically it's a great place for modelos and chips and salsa on a sunny day.
author: Andrew P.

description:
This is a revised review: Added one star.

Unchanged from previous entry: Great attractive rooftop location, protected against the wind, close to BART. I love outdoor venues. I was there on a warm October afternoon for happy hour 4 PM. No problems getting a table in the bar section at that time. By the time we left at 6:30 PM, the place was packed with folks waiting for tables. Good bright place to meet friends.

Replacement paragraph: Previously I was upset with an unclear bill and a fraud alert from my credit card company. Restaurant management reached out to me and we came to an understanding. It was a very busy evening and billing got confused. Advise to others: ask for and review carefully the itemized bill.

I will go back to this place again.
author: Mark C.

description:
I have heard about this place, prior to coming and checking it out, mind you good things. 

Sunday afternoon, in the mission with my GF, looking for drinks, we stumble upon this place, take the elevator up and have a seat. Granted the place was pretty busy we found a seat almost right away. 5 minutes later, another party walks in, sits right next to us then flags a waiter for drinks. Anyway, we felt neglected. We had to wait about 20 minutes to order a drink and about 15 to receive. I had the Techo magarita (yuck) and she had the Polama (also yuck). 

Service was way too slow and the drinks were repulsive. The only amenity I see here is the roof top view.
author: Chris B.

description: mmmm I love this place.  Loved the fried chicken thighs and also love the chicharrones.  It might be just me though since i love fried foods and i also love meat.  There's a chance you might get unlucky and get a few dry pork pieces but if that happens just compensate it by eating a fatty piece all together.  What gives this place 5 stars is the view of course.  The rooftop make you feel happy all together unless its foggy and if its foggy then dont come here.
author: Vince L.

description:
Big fan of the food and the view here. One of the better restaurants I've been to in the city. 

Chips and guac is something you can get anywhere, so it's not something to really be talked about unless it's extraordinary. This place...definitely had some exemplary guac (sidenote: I really don't like when people say "guac" out loud because it's just like come on just say guacamole, but it's a lot to type so I apologize to anyone else that is not so keen on the word "guac"). Sharing it between 4 people was hard because, well, I wanted all of it. Moral of the story: start with the chips and guac.

Drinks, of number one importance obviously: 
We ordered a pitcher of La Paloma which was bomb, I couldn't even taste the tequila (which is great, also dangerous). Our server comped us a drink because he spilled a tiny bit on his way to us, which earned him brownie points. 

Food, the second most important part: 
Highly recommend the Quesadilla de Acelga if you're a fan of Kale + mushroom. I happen to be one, and I was thoroughly impressed with this quesadilla from the Gods. If I could marry a quesadilla, it would be this one. 

Another plate I recommend is the skewer combo, we did 3 - chicken, shrimp, and chorizo. All three were on point and it would break my heart to just choose one of the skewers, but if it was life-threatening, I would have to go with chorizo (for the people who just want one skewer and need to know which is the best one). 

We also ordered the empanadas, and the Quesadilla de Pibil - both good too, but are not staple recommendations like the prior two dishes I demand that you order. The 4 dishes in total made for a very good sized meal amongst the 4 of us. 

What made all of this an even greater experience was the rooftop view - it's beautiful. I haven't seen too many places like this in the city (I also don't venture out that much) but I'm very glad I made it to this spot.
author: Minal A.

description:
One of my fave bars in the bay! Rooftop locale and views are awesome. The servers are generally very friendly and prompt (no hovering by the bars trying to get the bartenders' attention here - THANK YOU). My top drink choices are:
Passion fruit mojito (sweet and sour and very refreshing)
Piña colada (creamy and sweet, but not overwhelming)
El scorpion (prickly pear fruity drink with a unique flavor... For you guys out there fooled by the masculine name, know it's hot pink in color ;)
Tres amigos (a beer, a shot of tequila, and a shot of spicy white sangria)
author: Nguyen P.

description:
AAHHMAZING VIEW!!!
Really good small dishes plates.the food was fresh and actually it got to our table fast.you do have to wait about an hour for a table or if you find a table at the bar you can just sit and order your food.The view is super pretty.the only reason I'm giving it a 4 and not a 5 it's because of the time you have to wait for a table(1-2hrs) but maybe it was because we got to the restaurant around 9pm.Def going back!
it's was something new and we can't wait to stop by for brunch.
author: Kenia L.

description: Can't afford a ticket to D.F. --  no worries, enjoy El Techo for amazing Margaritas, comida autentico and great service!  Orele!
author: Sandi V.

description:
We had a terrible experience at El Techo this morning.  We arrived at 10:30 am (1/2 hour before opening) and were first in line for non-reservation customers.  However, when it came time to seat our group, they informed us that we could only have a high table as all the lower tables were reserved.  We said "fine" since we knew we were being seated as walk-ins.  What they didn't inform us was that the high table was outside of the main dining area whose only view was of the new, ugly condominiums to the south and of the restrooms.   Besides being segregated from the main dining area by partitions, it was also in full sun with no shade.  They had not provided silverware when our food was brought so I had to get up and go take some from another table.  I twice requested that we be given a table in the main dining area, but were refused.  Why a view restaurant would offer a table with no view to its customers is a mystery which I can only attribute to greed.    The food was OK - the eggs benedict however was mostly bread.  There was also a disconnect with the check-in downstairs versus the check-in upstairs.  Although first in-line, some non-reservation customers got in the same elevator with us and since they entered last they got to exit first.  This may have cost us a table in the main restaurant.

The most depressing aspect was that when we arrived there was no line for walk-ins yet at Foreign Cinema, one of the best brunch restaurants in the city.  Recommend anyone thinking of dining at El Techo skip the meal and just go upstairs for cocktails and then dine elsewhere.
author: Joe T.

description: Amazing Brunch on Sunday morning. Great view on a sunny day in SF. Our server was very helpful and knowledgable about the menu and drink choices. Our drinks/food came out very fast even though all the tables were filled. Amazing overall experience!!
author: Yvonne H.

description: Best Margaritas in the best rooftop of the city! The appetizer are delicious and the staff is nice and friendly.
author: Viviana D.

description:
SO DAMN FAN-FREAKING-TASTIC

This is definitely one of the coolest spots i've been to since moving to SF.  Seriously, it's so different than anything else in the city.  What makes El Techo so great?

1.  ROOFTOP - hell yes!  Just being there made me feel like I was on vacation.  And not just any vacation, a seriously tropical getaway (ok the Pina Colada might have helped with this).  My super sweet date let me have the seat with the view, and what a view it was.  When there's a clear blue sky in the city, this is the place to be!

2.  COCKTAILS - I want to try every single one of them!  I opted for the Pina Colada first and the Caipirinha second, and then I was cut off.  It was so hard to choose from the list but I was more than satisfied with both my selections.  Refreshing and delicious, plus I got an umbrella!

3.  DELICIOUS EATS - get the chicharones - it's not what you think!  I can't remember what else we ordered but everything was great.  Next time I'd skip the skewers and get more chicharones - SO GOOD!

I cannot WAIT to come back here!
author: Lindsey G.

description:
One friend took me to this place and I recommend it to all my friends who want to relax and have fun in the heart of the Mission.

I enjoyed the breathtaking view drinking a special marguarita. Beef tacos were beautiful. 

The sensation is like being at a private party on the top of San Francisco :)
author: Sara C.

description:
This place is amazing! 

Pros:
1. You have to try the Chicharron and the Ceviche they are crazy good
2. They have a nice variety of alcoholic drinks
3. You are at a rooftop with a nice view of the city
4. The ambiance is just great! Music and all 

Cons: 
1. I had to wait about 30-45mins to get seated. I went on a Friday night.
author: Irving C.

description: Almost a 5 star if the wait was not so long. Waited over an hour to get a seat but once seated service was faster than I thought. Food was very good. Atmosphere was very trendy and beautiful skyline view. Must come on a clear sunny day. Would come again.
author: Michelle S.

description:
I absolutely LOVED this place! I wish I could give it 5 stars, but it just had something missing for that perfect review. I haven't found a lot of rooftop places in the city and this one was great. I loved the view, the atmosphere, the ambiance - everything about the look and feel of this place was great! I thought that it would be really cold in the evening on a chilly friday night, but they've managed their heating very well so that it's not too hot or cold even though the place gets relatively crowded.

I ordered the passion fruit and ginger drink because I asked the server to recommend a more sweet drink. It was good, but it wasn't great. A lot of people seemed to be enjoying the pitchers of margaritas, so maybe I'll try that next time I go. I also tried the sangria, which was also not the best sangria I've had - it was a little watery and tasteless. 

The food was pretty yummy! I love spanish corn and they served corn on the cob with sour cream, mexican cheese, and some spices. It was delicious! I also tried the guacamole and the vegetarian quesadilla - both of which were average. The guacamole tasted like any other guacamole I've had and the quesadilla had a little too much kale for my liking. 

Overall, I would recommend this place just because the ambiance and the feel of the place. There was nothing wrong with the drinks or the food, just not 5-star quality, unfortunately.
author: Malika R.

description: This is how you brunch! Beautiful rooftop with awesome food and incredible views. They only take reservations for brunch and it'd be advised to make one ahead of time to avoid a long wait.
author: Anna S.

description: Not sure what the hype is all about: mediocre food, incredibly loud on the rooftop - everybody is yelling, long line to get seated. You get the same view as you would see from Mission Dolores. Came here to experience it since always saw the crazy line but there's really nothing to be excited about
author: Vadim K.

description: Delicious food, cute rooftop bar, and fast service. Great place to hang out after work and have a light snack - we had some tacos and it was the perfect amount of food.
author: Farah E.

description: Great place to come have a few drinks. Good drinks, strong margaritas and a great view.
author: Courtney M.

description: I was delightfully surprised by this restaurant. My four friends and I were on the hunt for Mexican food when we stumbled upon this restaurant. Outside the host was kind of snarky to us and we actually did not think about going inside but decided we would give it a try. She told us to take the elevator up stairs and to have fun. We were not sure what to expect. When the doors opened we found ourselves at a very fun and hip rooftop bar. The rest of the staff was very polite and helpful unlike the hostess downstairs. The food was even better then the service and we were very happy with it. My vegetarian friend ordered the ensuite and was quite happy with it although the portion was small. My carnivorous friends and I ordered the ceviche de pescado, torta de pibil, tostadas de alambre and carnitas. All of the dishes were exquisite. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
author: Anonymous D.

description:
Finally made it to this joint after about 6 months of salivating over the menu and I have nothing but good things to say! 

You really can't beat the happy hour location on a nice sunny day. Margaritas anyone? Sure, I'll have 4 and transition to wine later. K thanks. ;) My bestie and I spent 3+ hours here and we left satisfied, but not stuffed, tipsy, but not shit housed. Perfect night.

Deets on the food: the chicharrones were my favs. They had a sweetness to them I really enjoyed. The empanadas were quite tasty as well. Out of the 3 skewers we had the chorizo won my heart.

Servers are awesome, cute, attentive. 

My only gripe was the lack of hot sauce/salsa. Tapatio is not the business. Some good spicy salsa would have really set that meal off. 

Looking forward to coming back for brunch.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Enjoyed catching up with friends here after work.  The view is great, and the atmosphere is relaxed.  I've only been here in the evenings, but I'm sure it's also very pretty in the daytime!!

The cocktails were solid - I had a caipirinha.  Unfortunately, the glass was cleared before I had finished it, and when I mentioned this to the waiter, he offered me another drink on the house!  Nice service. :)

We really enjoyed the food!  We ordered chicharrones de carne and a mixed plate of chuzos.  We also had pollo frito, but it wasn't memorable.  The chicharrones are the star here.
author: Beth V.

description:
3.5 stars.  I came here after work on a Tuesday and even though it was a chilly and windy day this place was packed.  After ordering drinks we had to wait forever for them to arrive which was annoying.  The drinks literally arrived at the same time as our food!  And after all that waiting the drinks weren't even good - all served with way too many melty ice cubes and the two mezcal-based cocktails lacked the flavor of that wonderful smoky spirit, overpowered by the other ingredients.

But although their service and cocktails were subpar, the food was actually good... just overpriced (as small plates tend to be).  I highly recommend the chicharrones de carne.  The pork shoulder was tender and flavorful, the deep fried pork rind contributed a great textural contrast, the corn tortillas were soft and homemade.  Finished with black beans and salsa, it was the perfect soft taco.  Our server told us that a half pound was a good portion for 2-3 people but personally I thought my group of 4 could have easily shared the full pound or even 1.5 lbs - that would've been much more economical too!  The fried chicken thigh was also well executed - crispy skin, spicy slaw.  We also ordered chips and salsa even though it wasn't on their menu and I do like the salsa - a tad sweet and not overwhelmingly onion-y.  Unfortunately the problem with small plates is that we each spent $25 for a drink and some food and left only half full.

So in summary - good food if you're into small plates, disappointing cocktails, and insanely windy despite all their attempts to provide some shelter.  I was one guy lose some cash because the wind blew it away!  This whole rooftop bar thing must be better during brunch but otherwise it's probably only a pleasant experience 4-5 evenings a year.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
One of the rare open rooftops in the city, pretty cool! 
There's nothing crazy about the food or the drinks, but as it's pretty hype, you usually have to deal with a line outside no matter what. 
it's usually very packed with loud crazy girls and hipsters but...we all come back anyways!
author: Carole P.

description:
Good food, drinks, and a great view! 

As a disclaimer, my reasoning for the low rating is our experience with the door man and in part with our table, which was the only one in the whole place not under the cover on a hot day. 
I made a reservation through open table for 6 on a Sunday about a month in advance. We were coming from out of town and my friends were coming from east bay and the Richmond district. When we arrived, I was told by the door guy that they had tried to call the previous day, but because I hadn't answered, our reservation wasn't certain. Kinda ridiculous because, yes I got an unknown call but without a voicemail I didn't pay any attention to the call. Anyhoo, after 5 minutes he came over and said we had a table, but chastised me that next time I should answer their call  or else my table would  be given away and that I really needed to call them back. I'm 33, and I don't need to be reprimanded by a doorman at a tapas restaurant in front of my friends. Especially when I had a reservation!  If you don't think making a reservation through open table is sufficient, please don't use it for your business. Or if you need additional confirmation, leave a voicemail or send an email.

Needless to say, there will not be a next time. Probably not  a loss because there were plenty of non reservation people waiting in front of us, but maybe they aren't chastised for NOT making a reservation.
author: Rhiannon C.

description:
Loved the atmosphere of this place. Taking the quiet elevator up to a jam-packed rooftop with a beautiful view was a great way to spend my dinner.

I came on a tuesday afternoon and it was packed. I'm guessing that's why the service wasn't superb. But the food made up for that.

We ordered ceviche and the chicaron which were both equally delicious. I don't normally eat pork, but I couldn't resist theirs. It was super soft, yet crispy around the edges. The flavor was sweet and amazing. To top it all off we had shots of tequila ;)
author: Coco C.

description: I went to this place for happy hour and sat up on the rooftop. Happy hour is legit! We had all of the happy hour items, chips & guac, Patacon, empanada (each $5) and then drinks which was also an awesome deal; 1 cerveza, shot of tequila and a shot of sangrita all for $6. Awesome deals and the food was so freaking delicious. I definitely want to go back for brunch or dinner to get that experience and to also have that amazing view.
author: Samantha J.

description:
The only redeeming things about this place are the rooftop view and the heat lamps. Maybe the food, too, but it's not worth coming back for due to my shitty experience. See below. 

I've only been here once, but the service was the WORST. The server came by to take our drink orders...20 minutes goes by and he comes back empty-handed...and takes our orders again! He didn't apologize for never putting our orders in and didn't even rush to have the drinks made. Dude was probably stoned or just too slow for a fast-paced work environment. 

It took us another 20 minutes to get two drinks. When another female server came by to hand us our drinks, she gave us an attitude because she couldn't find us, and asked us in an accusatory tone whether we had moved around even though we never left our table. It took us another 15 minutes to get the check, and only because I had to get up and ask for it at the cash register. Wasted almost an hour of my lazy Sunday here. #regrets
author: Ai N.

description: During the spring and summer the roof terrace at El Techo De Lolinda is exciting and refreshing. Though they do not have many vegetarian options, there are a few very good tapas (try the empanadas). The chips and dip are also super good; you'll be fighting over who gets them. If you're a tequila fan, they also have fancy sipping ones, but we would actually recommend their Sangria, which is so good you'll have two. It's a sweet romantic get-a-way but also a nice place for bigger groups (about 6). You can definitely rack up a bill here, but you'll have a very tasty time.
author: Thom And Vicky H.

description:
The view is beautiful, SF does not have that many rooftop places and this one is nice. I have come here a few times. The food is really just meh. 

Pork & Oaxacan cheese quesadilla- a little hard, salty, but not much unique flavor 

Chicharrones- Very disappointed in these, not very memorable, salty, limey taste that was not very well blended together. The sauces that accompanied the dish were pretty good. But even with the sauces on the meat they were meh. 

Their guac is also okay too, I think I can make better though, so... yea.

I'd come here just to get drinks and enjoy the view. No complaints there. The food is not worth it though, especially if there is a wait.
author: Jamie T.

description: Super yummy food the view from the roof top is great, the service can be a little better, grant it I did go on a Saturday night and it was busy. We did have to wait in line on the street for about 10-15 mins, but you can RSVP and you don't have to wait in the line. Over all I would recommend this place and will definitely go back.
author: Ana H.

description: El Techo de Lolinda is a hidden gem in an area I never thought would house such a treasure. Very secret looking location downstairs paves the way to a hip trendy rooftop food scene. I had the benedicto, which was seasoned perfectly and my boyfriend had the steak, which was also delicious. However, our server seemed to be preoccupied and hardly came by the table unless we flagged her down, which cut into some of our ambiance. When she was around though, she was very attentive and got everything we requested quickly.
author: Carol C.

description:
Just ok. Came here with some girlfriends and we enjoyed some margaritas and food. The margarita was delicious. I ordered the sopes and they were meh. My friends ordered the quesadillas, which I took a bite of and those were amazing.

I was really hesitant to add this part because I don't want to sound old .. BUT, the place was really crowded and SO loud, like we had to yell at each other in order to hear each other - loud. Overall, just ok.
author: Sandy V.

description: Can't complain about this outdoor rooftop space. Cocktails can come in pitcher options so this place is good for groups. It does get crowded and loud as they are always to capacity, but it's a fun time up there. You know this because you will most likely need to wait in line to get in. I've stuck around to order food too and was happy with it too. Who can't complain with guac, salsa, and chips and a good drink in my hand? Despite being crowded, the staff are friendly and the service is quick.  I usually order the Paloma (grapefruit-tequila based drink), but other drinks are just as pretty and good. Including one that is dragon fruit based.
author: Hazel F.

description: Waited in line for 25 minutes only to find a bigger crowd upstairs.  The nature of the glass panes makes this a VERY loud venue on a nice weekend evening.  Was able to get drinks and stand around, but jockeying for a table in the bar area was difficult.  Would also prefer a bar to walk up to versus waiting for the waitstaff to wade through the crowds.  It only gets 2 stars for the view, otherwise this was a 1-star experience.
author: Brian G.

description: The atmosphere is nice and so is the view! The food and drinks are very good and the servers are prompt and friendly. Would definitely go here again when I come back to San Francisco! P.s. The fried plantains are amazing!!
author: Sam N.

description: Simply amazing! A friend recommended this place while visiting San Fran. Food was finger licking good. We were a group of 8 and no one was disappointed. Loved it!!
author: Yary B.

description: Came here on a beautiful warm Sunday, early afternoon with a group of five. We were told there were about 20 names on the list ahead of us to get a table but the wait wasn't too bad - just long enough to go to a cafe across the street and chat over a drink. They texted me when the table was ready. Love the guac here. Also ordered huevos rancheros which were fab. Margaritas were not cheap at something like $13 a glass but we got pitchers nonetheless. Our table didn't have any shade, which was uncomfortable on a rooftop on such a hot day. Luckily, we had sun screen with us. The view is very nice. Would happily come back.
author: Kayla M.

description:
Loving the Rooftop view watching the sun glisten off the buildings while downing Sangrias! 
And the empenadas...ohhhh what deliciousness. Pollo Frito also superb! 
Staff is super attentive....every one of them.
Only complaint is that I wish the Sangria pitcher was bigger.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
The food is great, but the rooftop views are superb. My friends were in town, so we met here for a delightful brunch. 

The host was welcoming and friendly, and he sat our party right away. We started off with some guacamole and a heaping plate of chicharrones, which were the highlight of our meal. Get them. You will not regret it. We also ordered a pitcher of sangria, matambre, chorizo scramble and both of the quesadillas. 

Remember this is a rooftop, so you may want to bring a sweater or jacket. Luckily, there is a glass perimeter to break the wind and plenty of heat lamps to keep you toasty.

Enjoy your brunch and some stellar views!
author: Melissa W.

description:
First of we came without a reservation, it took less the 20 mins to get a table. The host was nice to text us and explained we had ten mins to respond and get our table. Finally got a table and Raul (I think that's his name) took great care of us. Always had a smile on, offer great service. The food was good a little pricy but what can I say your sitting on the rooftop looking out on the city. They have a a few selection of beer but I loved the fact it is from different countries. 
Negative: parking is an issues (it's SF), and the place is very loud, so bring some ear plugs if you aren't a fan of noise.
author: Veronica G.

description: It was waaayyyyy too crowded but that's to be expected at such a popular place. I have no idea how our waiter kept track of us, but he did and checked on us frequently. The food was amazing! Had quesadillas and cocktails were excellent as well. Definitely a great place...if you can squeeze in.
author: Nikki G.

description:
The food is actually quite good, so this one star rating is specifically for the service, and it makes me sad to give it.  

There needs to be a better system for communicating with, seating and servicing people.  I waited 20 minutes in a line on the sidewalk to get upstairs only to be asked to put my name on a waitlist.  I was invited to enjoy cocktails until my table was ready.  I waited over 30 minutes before I hunted for a server through the crowd  Another twenty minutes went by before the drinks actually came.  After checking with the host I come to find I wasn't actually put in the system.  

This is a reminder of my first visit when we left without ordering anything after being ignored by every staff member.

Go downstairs or someplace else.
author: Jimmie L.

description: Good Strong Margaritas.  Luck of being at a roof top bar in SF the one night it is nice enough to be at a roof top bar in SF.  friendly, but slow service.  Good food.  Nice happy hour prices.
author: Jennifer L.

description: What's more to say about this place that others haven't.  Great view... especially on a clear day.  Good drinks and decent food.  =)
author: Vicky T.

description: Good food but we had quite bad service the other night with them. They kept messing up on our order and we had to change our plans as we ended up being there more than we anticipated. The manager came around and did give us some discount which is appreciated but again....it really affected our whole night.
author: Suprita K.

description:
Four of us went on a Friday without reservations and we were seated right away, but we were seated far away from the heat lamps, so it was quite cold and we asked to move. The host was really nice and seated us inside the covered portion and closer to the heated lamps.

When our waitress greeted us she asked who had seated us and when we told her she made a comment about how he hadn't given us menus, which really wasn't an issue at all because we'd been seated for less than a minute anyways.

We eventually decided on warm cocktails for three of us, a caipirinha for another, skewers, a quesadilla, and plantains. The drinks and the food came out quickly and the drinks were very good. As for the food, I enjoyed the ceviche, but everything else was mediocre. 

 After we finished our cocktails we decided to order a pitcher of sangria and it was the worst sangria I've ever had. We asked the waitress to make sure we hadn't received a bad batch, but it turns out that's their regular recipe. So, I really think they should change their recipe ASAP. The waitress was really nice about it and said she would take it off our bill, she also told us about some other cocktails we might enjoy. We decided on a rum punch and that was delicious!

I think this is great place to go for a cocktail and small bite, but I definitely won't go back for a full dinner and sangria.
author: Natalie M.

description: Had a really solid brunch, the pound of carnitas was a fun and easy dish to share and the tortillas that came with it were hot and fresh.  everything was tasty and our server Felix was so great!
author: Lindsay N.

description: Get the chicharrones by the pound, they're amazing! !! The guacamole is really good too. They have really good prices on their Margarita and Sangria pitchers. The restaurant 's view is pretty awesome! Service is ok, have had both good and bad servers,  but we'll keep it positive & leave it as ok. P.S. Expect a line if you're only going to do cocktails.
author: Kendra H.

description: El techo de Lolinda is DEFINITELY worth it. First i walked about 2 miles from fishermen wharf to bart station on Embarcadero. Then walked about 1/4 mile from 24th mission st to this place. Then waited 50 min for a table. Definitely worth it all. I ordered the chicken thighs for appetizers AWESOME! !!!! then i had the empanda with carne  the crust was light and delicious.  I then ordered the chicarrones to die for!!!! The pork MELTED IN YOUR MOUTH!!!! Great vibe and AWESOME VIEWS and the staff was Grade A!!!!!
author: Rene R.

description: Amazing fresh mimosas with housemade agua frescas! Loved the vibe, view, mango salad, and doughnuts! Why 4 stars, our main course was good, but it came out a little cold and the hostess outside was not so nice. We still will definitely be back for another beautiful brunch!
author: Michelle N.

description: Their quesadilla de pibli is the best quesadilla I've ever had. It's about time restaurants start to take quesadillas off their appetizer menu because these bad boys deserve more respect.
author: Jim S.

description:
I've come here for brunch, lunch and evening drinks. It's one of my favorite, go-to places in SF! I am a huge fan of the atmosphere (fun, lively rooftop bar/restaurant). El techo = rooftop in Spanish.

The ceviche and roasted pork shoulder are both really delicious. I've come here multiple times and never get tired of these two items!
author: Lillian C.

description:
Delicious chicharrones and ceviche.  Loved the rooftop atmosphere. 

Drinks were strong and service was attentive.
author: C L.

description: Very nice rooftop view in the Mission - food's generally also very good.  The pork shoulder was tender and slightly sweet, the steak was delicious, and I enjoyed the chips and guacamole.  The sangria is not as fruity as I'd like, but drinkable.  It doesn't have the typical pancakes and french toast brunch options, but otherwise, a great brunch place in the Mission!
author: Lyn Y.

description: I came here on Sunday for the first time for some cocktails with a friend. The food,drinks and view are amazing! However, it was Felix that made my experience even better! He was super attentive and entertaining. He definitely had me laughing and smiling every time he came to check on us. I can say that was the best service I had in awhile. I will be back because of him!
author: Desiree C.

description:
Lovely little SF getaway. 
The view is gorgeous and makes me appreciate the neighborhood I grew up in. 

I had the tequila flight. Yummy.

The fried chicken from happy hour is DELICIOUS!!!!!

I'm definitely coming back!!!!
author: nina s.

description:
I came here with a group of people for dinner on Saturday night because it was recommended to me. Here's the breakdown: 

Pros
-Very nice views
-Heated with closed off clear tents which was nice since there was a lot of wind
-Steak sandwich was pretty good 
-Mojito (not on the menu) looks pretty 


Mediocre
-Guacamole was nothing to rave about. It was ok. Definitely needed salt.


Cons
-Shrimp skewer had an extremely strong fishy smell that penetrated the other meats on the platter. It also had the intestine line (aka poop line) still intact on a couple of the shrimps...disgusting much??? They also didn't taste fresh at all, hence the fishy taste/smell. We're lucky we didn't eat it after the first bite because we probably would've ended up sick.
-Steak skewer had no taste whatsoever (other than the fishy taste from the shrimp)
-Chicken skewer was an extremely odd texture and of course had the fishy taste as well
-Margarita pitcher tasted like medicine
-Mojito looks nice, but doesn't seem like it has any alcohol in it. And if it does, it's at very low quantities


Overall, this restaurant is lucky they have the views they do because their food is for sure not worth coming for. I typically would go back to a place if I like the view to have some drinks, but I can't do that for this place because they don't even have good drinks. Such a waste of a nice view, it's not worth sacrificing my taste buds and stomach.
author: Shabnam J.

description:
Love the energy whenever I come here. Even with the wind shields and roof, you can still enjoy the weather. I actually like that it's not directly in the sun. 

Pitchers of Palomas and chicharrones for happy hour is a great way to start the night.
author: Derrick V.

description: I may have gone on an off day, but my experience did not match the good reviews. It feels like this place exists only for folks to be "seen". I would take a pass unless you are a recent transplant to SF or tech-bro type who cares more about "looking like you are in" than enjoying a meal. Lackluster food, can't really see the view (too many tables packed into one spot to maximize profit), loud vibe, weirdly long wait for the elevator, disorganized door and reservation process, poor door guy didn't even get an umbrella stand on a hot day (literally, he was holding up his own umbrella for shade for hours), a bizarre number of calls to confirm the reservation (one I can see, but 5 was excessive), arguing with customers who wanted to send incorrect food back - just a whole lot of nope going on.
author: Leslie P.

description: Great vibes, panoramic city views and deliciously authentic Mexican bites (proper Mexican taste and generous portions!). One thing though: my margarita drink could have been a lot better/ fresher and the sangria lacked a tiny bit of zest. Brilliant venue overall, especially in the afternoon/ early evening.
author: Helene D.

description:
El Techo - where the Marina meets Hipsters and the Mission.  Food is ridiculously good - ALL items.  My faves?  Ceviche, chiccarones (excuse my spelling?) guac, and surprisingly, my least favorite items are the meat skewers.

Enjoy this rooftop venue on a beautiful day, clear night, or even if it's windy (they added higher wind protection measures when they took over from Medjool.)  You can even go when it rains if you'd like, because they do have covered seating with heat lamps.  One of my favorites in not just the Mission, but all of SF.
author: Brett B.

description:
staff- 5 stars
ambience - can get a little loud over the music, but cannot beat the views wow - 5 stars
food - 5 stars

everything has so much good flavor and carefully prepared. my best friend is allergic to a lot of foods that limit options for eating out to usually salads. Techo has recently renovated and even accommodates special frying machines for separating corn and flour products. (least I hope this is actually true) these added features allow for guests with severe allergies to have a beautiful view for a nice cocktail and light bites. 

pork quesadilla
carnitas
salads- hi can you DM the recipe for the jicama salad I can't get enough of that dressing!
guac 
skewers

have not gotten a dish I didn't love. thank you!
author: Chayne J.

description:
It was a sogy San Francisco afternoon and my parents, Mr. and Mrs.  Darling were in town.  

We had eaten, shopped, and even bus hopped, from North Beach to the Haight to the painted ladies and Hayes Valley.  We had done almost every darling thing there was to do, really.  It was  4:01pm and I was apprehending our next activity as we were not too hungry and the weather was a little grungy.  I remembered a friend's mention of this roof top rescue in the Mission and thought this was the proper opportunity to try a margarita or three.

The View:  babe like, gorgeous in the day-time, but absolutely gleams at night

The Heaters:  exist to keep you warm and wonderful in the cool face of San Francisco fog in outdoor seating

The Food: decent, but didn't steal my heart

Pitchers of Margaritas: Stole my heart and Mr.  Darling's too, as he ordered a second pitcher before the first was devoured 

Sidenote: Corralling your parents through the Mission after two pitchers or margaritas is just as difficult as it seems.
author: Allyson D.

description: Amazing and breathtaking view of SF. In the heart of the mission, this restaurant is the perfect location for drinks and food. I mean it is the mission..come on most restaurants in this area are usually bomb , right?. I was taken here by a friend and devoured the food. The view was just a plus since it was so beautiful n sunny out that day! We had the guac/chips, ceviche, elote, chicharron, chorizo sandwich (fucking bomb!!!), dulce de leche and ganache for dessert. I love the ambiance of this restaurant and service is excellent. I'll be back, I promise
author: Colette P.

description: Went with some friends and ablsolutly fell in love. The atmosphere was great and the service was attentive, friendly and entertaining. We spent about two hours and felt completely satisfied with our meals.
author: Emily B.

description: Came here for my 21st birthday and have been coming back ever since! Haven't tried the food, but the drinks are pretty good. I always get a pitcher of margarita. The ambiance is great. There are a lot of heat lamps to keep you warm on those cold SF nights. There is usually a line to get in, but usually moves pretty fast. Great place to come and hang out with friends with a great view.
author: Alice P.

description: The views are spectacular making this a must for happy hour! You definitely need to get here early though to get a good table that doesn't leave you sitting on another table's lap. Nice drink specials on the menu. I went with the tequila taste flight which was a perfect way to kick that Friday Happy Hour off right. Solid guacamole too!
author: Janette W.

description: So we came in right before kitchen closing and they let us order which was super nice of them because we really wanted to try it. Really neat place, our server Jeremy was very quick and attentive. After they were out of a dish we ordered and he didn't realize they were out he had something else comped for us. We pretty much ordered one of each thing off the menu and they were all amazing. The skewers were really good, and the chimichuri was fresh and so good we put it on everything. Beautiful view and delicious food and drinks. We will definitely be back! Awesome place all around.
author: Summer C.

description:
Food is decent. My group had the one pound (possibly 1.5 pounds) of the chicharrones, chicken and pork skewers. I personally didn't believe the food justified the price. 

Drinking on rooftop was my favorite part the night. Maybe this is why they charge the price they do!
author: Jessica T.

description: My brother took me here while I was visiting him and I really liked the ambiance.  You have a beautiful view, sheltered from the wind, heat lamps, and excellent staff.  I can't tell you what the food tasted like, all I know is it wasn't bad.  I'm giving this place 5 stars due to our great server and everyone else we encountered.
author: Susie K.

description:
I'm such a sucker for good mood and good food. I love hole in the wall joints too, but if a restaurant has good food AND it's pretty, I just fall in love.

So after a day of shopping with my buddy, we accidentally land at El Techo de Lolinda. I saw that they had a rooftop section so we go to try it out.

First a disclaimer - we went one a day that was raining in the morning so it was pretty empty. I talked to my friend about this place and he told me it is usually pretty packed. On that particular night though, my friend and I had the rooftop almost all to ourselves and it was beautiful.

We start off with drinks. I go with the Caipirinha and my friend with the margarita. Both are well made, delicious, and reasonably priced. We are still sitting wondering why this place isn't packed.

Then come the appetizer - a fresh Ceviche to share. It's a little bit too much juice, but it's really tangy and delicious.

Now for the main - Half pound of CHICHARRONES de CARNE ($13). This seems to be their signature dish, and rightfully so. These aren't the basic cracklins you get at the store. It's juicy with quite a bit of meat, with a crispy exterior, and a savory sweet flavor. I don't know what they do to the outside, but the hint of sweet really makes this dish. They also come with a side of pickled vegetables which go really well with the savory chicharrones. Half pound was more than enough for two girls. 

I thought the price was really reasonable considering the drinks we got and the deliciousness of the food. I'd like to come back on a clear warm day, but I am a bit scared everyone else would have the same idea :P
author: Julie K.

description:
This place was great! Definitely a long wait for dinner so me and a coworker just had some drinks at the bar next door.

I got the chicharrones which were very tasty. The service is what won me over. So friendly and warm. I think our server was Hayley. Go ahead and give that girl a raise! 

Will be coming back sober next time to enjoy the view.
author: Tony P.

description:
I was torn between a number of things on the menu... Which means I'll have to find my way back to try the rest, and soon!!

I had the Benedicto, which was awesome! I think the jalapeño corn bread was definitely the highlighting piece and runs neck and neck with some of my favorite Benedict's elsewhere!! The sausage on the plate had a unique seasoning blend, and I'm not usually a huge fan. I could have eaten more with this particular blend!

I also had a Bloody Mary which had a nice kick to it as well. 

Great view, great food, great service. Looking forward to my next trip...
author: Stevi B.

description: Came up here before our reservations to Lolinda steakhouse. The view was pretty and the food was good. Chicarones had a delicious flavor to it. Would love to come back on a Sunday afternoon.
author: Sarah Q.

description:
Love! Felix one of the hosts is so so nice. These peeps are great at service. Wish the folks at lolinda were as genuine. Perhaps they were just stressed or having a bad day. Anyhoo, love this place and the rooftop setting. Bring a sweater!! 

Piña colada is amazing!! Sangria is pretty good! Strong drinks! 

The sopes are amazing as well as the chorizo. The corn is so so good. Wait staff so nice. Love.
author: Bonnie E.

description:
Rooftop bar in the city?! SIGN ME UP.

Moving up to the bay from LA, I knew I was going to miss my rooftop bars and outdoor patios, but El Techo de Lolinda does not disappoint. Happy hour on the roof with the sun setting, AND heatlamps? Please and thank you.

The food and drinks are equally as amazing as the view. Chicharones, street corn, flan, and the passion fruit cocktail are must orders! (Sorry I forgot the actual dish names. I was too enamoured with the view I think.)
author: Breanne T.

description: amazing view of san fran! so hip! the ambiance is phenomenal! and if your into mexican food this is your spot!
author: Priscilla J.

description: First time at El Techo. Really good food and the drinks were bomb! Great customer service. Great view of San Francisco!
author: Alex C.

description: Brunch on a rooftop is never a bad idea. The mimosas were great and so was the view.  The food was good but very disappointed that my request for egg whites were denied by our snarky waiter because he said "we don't have egg whites" yet two people in my party received fired egg with their meals so clearly separating the egg white & yolk isn't impossible :-/. We also had a party of 20 people next to us that we're so loud and obnoxious. Our service was EXTREMELY slow due to this party and our waiter doing shots with them.
author: Erica D.

description: Fantastic views, which is what you pay for as the margaritas weren't 5-stars. Very unique bar though and is worth the visit if you're in the area. We didn't have any of the food but will next time I visit.
author: Francisco T.

description: Wow, I think this is a best kept secret because I didn't know this bar existed in the Mission until this past weekend! The view of the SF skyline is incredible and for those rare, warm SF nights, it is a real treat. Drinks and food (pork quesadilla was amazing!) are also good. Perfect for a great night out with friends or a date.
author: Mel G.

description:
Planning an event? Look no further! Ana is amazing. The event packages are super reasonable and Ana was so attentive throughout the whole process! The food was delicious and the open bar was a big hit. 

The day of the event, I got a call that there was an issue with a pipe of some sort and the rooftop patio where we were supposed to have our event might be un-usable! (cue panic) But Ana told me not to worry and in a matter of hours she had arranged a new location (in the Mezzanine of Lolinda) with the same food and drink package as we had originally ordered. The ambiance was fantastic, the staff was wonderful, and everyone had a great time! We'll definitely be returning for our next event (hopefully with the rooftop view this time)

We had about 30 people at the event, and after it was all said and done it turned out to be approx $80/person (that's 3 hours of an open bar and tons of appetizers), but could have been done much cheaper by limiting the types of alcohol.

(The only downside to this was the location :/ Our office is located in the Financial District and it took about 30 minutes to get here after work at rush hour)
author: Amanda S.

description:
Had a reservation for brunch for today.  Was seated in a low 2 person table crammed right between another table and the open kitchen. Plenty of other tables with views were available but having a reservation doesn't mean getting a good table. 

Bloody Maria was weak and the pickled veggies didn't mix well with the flavors. Definitely could have used more of a kick and more tequila. 

Ordered the Matambre and had been looking forward to trying this for the last week. Asked for my eggs to be over medium and when the dish arrived, the burnt to a crisp two eggs were just a hard disgusting brown circle. Removed it and placed on a separate plate until the server finally came back, which was about 15 minutes. The 6oz skirt steak was pre-sliced under the eggs, which was disappointing.
