The potatoes were babies and cooked well. All of this was swimming in the Chimichurri oily mess. Should have been put in a side dish to drizzle yourself. The best part of the entire dish was the brioche. That's pretty damn sad. Finally got the eggs i ordered and they again had the dark brown edge but at least the yolks were runny. 

Husband had the 1/2lb Chicharrones de carne. Lots of burnt to a crisp pieces that were inedible and the whole dish was lacking flavor. Salsa was weak and the beans were just plain.

Overall a very sad experience and wish it was a lot yummier. Lots of hipsters taking pics of their food all around you. Servers start out friendly and then just want you to leave. Won't recommend this to anyone.
author: Ayrn H.

description:
I've come to El Techo many times and spent plenty of money there. I love the cocktail menu, I love the food menu, and I love the service.

It's an excellent location to bring visitors to so they can see the skyline from the rooftop. The view never disappoints, even if it is foggy.

The only reason I'm giving it four stars is because of the doorman. I brought a friend with me tonight, anxious to share this special spot with him, and as we arrived at the door, the doorman told us they were at capacity and he asked us to wait behind the rope, which we did. While waiting, we watched approximately 10 people leave, and he never gave us the go-ahead to enter. We saw someone else come out of the bar and grab some people from the restaurant and take them back with him upstairs. The doorman didn't bother to explain, he just stared at us. Eventually we tired of waiting politely, and we walked away. 

If it wasn't for that doorman, I would have to give a five star rating. They would do so much better to have someone at the front door who is more customer centric.
author: Colton W.

description: Arrived on Friday night. No reservations and only waited 5 minutes for a table for two.  It was also around 6pm. Had the Chicken Flautas, Jicama Salad,Guacamole and Chips, and pulled pork Quesadilla.  Everything was yummy. It was fresh and presented well. The service was fast and courteous. Age group was 20- 60 years.  I will be back I loved the food and it was nice to be outside with a roof top view.
author: Susie S.

description:
amazing view!

great, lively, fun atmosphere

great cocktails- el escorpion(!)

very awesome staff
author: Evan W.

description:
A friend of mine mentioned that there's plenty of places to eat brunch at in the Mission so I decided to look for them on yelp. I found a few places I wanted to try out but El Techo de Lolinda stood out the most because it's on a roof unlike others. 

My friends and I came there with a reservation and was seated right away. My first impression was WOW! This place is amazing! There was music playing, and plenty of people having a good time! I definitely liked the vibe. 

The servers were friendly and the food was delicious! 
I'd definately recommend this to everyone!
author: Jenny J.

description:
Hola!  This review will be short as there isn't too much to say.  I went there this past weekend for brunch and was not too impressed.  The place is weird and quirky in that it's trying to be a Manhattan-style rooftop restaurant (in a city that doesn't have them for a reason..BRRRR) and yet maintain some casual tapas charm that the Mission is known for.  

Others have mentioned the drinks here and I have to tell you that they are not good.  The main reason is that they are all served in a big highball glass with tons of ice.  So if you were hoping to have some help removing the cobwebs, forgetting about your job or making the date you are with appear better looking, good luck.  It will take a bunch of these to make a difference.  I tried a caipirhina and it is definitely not authentic (agave was used, etc.)  I know this is being picky but it IS world cup season so you would think they would get this right.

On the other hand my meal was awesome...steak cooked perfectly and the egg was, well, a good egg on a good steak.  Again - not worth the elevator ride up.  (Did I mention the elevator???  Check it out..again, quirky.)

As far as the crowd goes - again kind of odd.  Imagine a Match.com crowd where only software coders and Europeans are filtered to form matches.  You get the idea.  

Go check it out yourself and maybe you will have a different opinion.  If not, there is a great bar downstairs where you can grab some liquid courage before going across the street to buy some cowboy hats and ostrich boots.

C.R.
author: Chim R.

description: Loved the rooftop, jicama salad was amazing. And the hot chocolate with cajeta cookies was delicious.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
I have only been here once upstairs. Nice lovely view, but yet to really check out during the day. Might go for a happy hour with coworkers or friends one of these days.

I do enjoy the drinks and the nice scenery. Definitely a good place to take a date.
author: Alex A.

description:
** Drink service only **

I suppose they close their kitchen at some point and the whole thing just becomes sort of a drinking area? Not too sure how that works but it was my first time here and I enjoyed my margarita on the roof quite a bit. The servers were lovely, especially the doorman who gave me compliments and told me where I should go try yoga next. 

Liked it, kinda wish they had a dance floor but that's probably just because cocktails and dancing go hand in hand for me.
author: Mariko M.

description: El Techo was good and the view can't hardly be beach for a restaurant in the city, but it wasn't really knock your socks off. Just that you have to wait in line so long is a bit of a turn off in itself.  The margaritas were nearly average and the pork that we split for the table was nicely flavored but not overly stupendous. The service was really quick, especially for how busy they were that night. From what I understood it's almost nearly that busy all the time so it is good and the service is up to it. Worth a stop if you want a nice night out with decent food for a decent price.
author: Jason W.

description:
So they don't open stairs and they regulate everything through the elevator, and even though your friend is there at the table, you have to wait in line like there's no reservation!

So food could be cool, I don't know. They have a logistical shit show that comes across as pretentious and insufferable. 

Good luck El Techo.

**edit: food was solid waitstaff was nice, but the logistics of getting there is annoying as hell. Enough to still turn me off from coming back.**
author: Ben P.

description: Great buzzing atmosphere at this rooftop restaurant! The food is sooo good! We had the guacamole very good. We ordered several dinner items. Although I must say the best part was the hot chocolate and cookies! Check them out!
author: Jamie S.

description:
City rooftop bars just steal my heart away. Beautiful views, especially if you come on a clear day or night. 

The bar tables fill up fast so if you come after normal working hours, you're likely to stand in the middle of everyone's way on the prowl for a table to clear. 

Pros:
This seems to be a hotspot for attractive business professionals. 
The happy hours deals are pretty sweet. 
City views. 

Cons: 
Seating can be frustrating.
Takes awhile to order more drinks.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Get the half pound of pork! If you are eating with a friend then get the pound and share it. Thats all I have to say.
author: Jake S.

description: Enjoyed the views and food.  Great drinks too! I have the Mojito ( excellent) and the Eggs Benedicto... so good I can't wait to go back.
author: anna r.

description:
Awesome atmosphere on this fun rooftop bar! Lively crowd, delicious cocktails (available by the pitcher) and amazing tequila selection. Lots of heat lamps to keep everyone comfortable. Only issue- it takes a long time to find a server and to get your drinks. 

Only came for drinks but will definitely be back to grab some munchies!
author: Allison N.

description: LOVED this spot!  Great view, vibrant vibe, delicious pitchers of Margs & you can't go wrong on their fun & tasty menu!  Went there for my bday celebration with some friends & as always, there was a line down the street.  We only had to wait 30 min, & it was easy to grab a drink/app elsewhere in the meanwhile & we were texted when our party was called. Maduros, guac, skewers... everything was on point!
author: Lindsey D.

description: Stopped here yesterday on a warm, sunny Sunday afternoon -- because we were late for lunch (2:30) there was no line - first time that's happened!   Grabbed a bar table and enjoyed the amazing city views!  Had to wait quite a while for a drink, but with that view who cares?  And the food...oh the food!  Big pitcher of Sangria, Mango in Harbanero Sauce, Guacamole, and Chicharonnes de Carne and we were set.  Couldn't have been happier -- what a great place to spend a warm afternoon -- reminds you once again why you love living in San Francisco so damn much!
author: Lisa W.

description:
I gave this place 4 stars, but i'm gonna be weird and write a pretty mixed review lol
Love the ambiance, rooftop is def the way to go, especially on a nice summer day in the Mission. Came here for happy hour with some co-workers, one being a huge fan of the spot and comes religiously for brunch. Luckily, we were able to get a 5 top table, it was pretty crowded for barely being about 4:30pm. 
Very hipster-ish...I can take um or leave um.
Happy Hour prices were good and the drinks were stiff and not tiny! Def plus lol
I had a Cuba Libre...YUM! They make a good one!
App's were pretty delicious. We had the guacamole, 2 thumbs up! Some empanadas, pretty good...but the best was their ceviche! I wanted to drink the juice left over! 
I want to come back for brunch and see if it was what I've been hearing about :)
author: Angela Z.

description: A very cool spot. Just remember to be courteous to the people living right below this joint (didn't even know about it but shared an elevator with a guy staying there). Probably should close earlier for their sake.
author: Chris T.

description: One word - chicharrones! The food here was great and I loved the rooftop view. Good spot for drinks and small plates or dinner. Bartenders were super cool and gave the best recommendations.I'll be back!
author: Janell M.

description:
Have you ever wanted to feel like you were VIP? Well if you have, or are just craving an escape from SF with some amazing food then you have arrived to the right place. Please let me show you the way.... get into the elevator and push the pent house level.... as the doors open you are greeted by awesome tabletops, hanging lights, music, an open bar, and did I mention this is all on a rooftop? Ah yes. Now this... this is VIP. And believe me you are going to love it. Sit at a table, order a refreshing drink, or heck get a pitcher with your friends and as you sip on your wonderful beverage your eyes gaze upon the delightful menu. And since you and your friends are adventurous you decide to order a little bit of this and a bit of that...
Steak Quesadillas - holy guacamole.. seriously the smoky flavor of meat with the cheese all squished between this amazing hand made tortilla and smoked salsa is killer.
Civiche - is a nice light bite with a lingering citrus after note.
Jicama Salad - refreshing and full of flavor.
Jalapeno Corn Bread with pepper jelly - will make your taste buds go wow!
Chicharrones - ya. this is a whole lot of meaty love. Who doesn't love tender meat that pulls apart with salt and spice?! The black bean paste, pickled veggies, and tortillas are absolutely to die for.
Yes. This is VIP and let me tell you something if you have not experienced it before you should because heck - VIP feels really good.
author: Allie P.

description: Awesome place to hang out when the weather is nice. It gets busy though, so it's best to go in early before the after-work rush and/or go with a smaller group. If you go during the rush, be prepared for a wait! The drinks and food were pretty good, although I honestly remember the view more than anything. Casual and fun vibe. Definitely can't wait to go back!
author: Bianca C.

description:
"WOW!" is what we said after leaving this restaurant. 

After reading the Yelp reviews, I brought my sister in law here (who is very opinionated) and she was blown away.  We had 10:15pm reservations, so we waited all evening to eat here and it was more than worth it. Upon walking into the place we were amazed. The outside was really vacant and we weren't sure if we were in the right place. But the inside featured beautiful decor. I ordered a drink at the bar while we waited and the staff was super friendly. The bartender looked like Anne Hathaway, and she made a mean drink. ("Mean" meaning really good lol) It was the one with Mexcal Tequila. 

We were checked on more than once by the hosts who reminded us that our table would be ready shortly. After being seated, we were introduced to Christopher. He was Ah-May-Zang. Very patient, attentive, and had personality. 

We ate: 
Salad with Lime dressing - 5 Stars the best thing I ate all night 
Ceviche Mixto - 5 Stars, 10 Stars for the fried corn....OMG delicious
Pulpo - 5 stars
Sea Bass - 5 Stars. We were saying "That Sea Bass Tho" all night
Short ribs - 2.5 stars. It was what i enjoyed the least. The meat was very fatty
Papas - 4 Stars...really good, but nothing tooooo special

I will go back again and again and again.
author: Jazmyn W.

description:
Had a terrific dinner here as part of a large group. Service was awesome! The venue offers a really enjoyable outdoor dining experience.

Wide selection of dishes, very well presented, tasted great and the margaritas went down well also!

Make a reservation if you plan on going as it seemed very popular.
author: Chris P.

description: I've been here countless times and originally had never been so hooked by a restaurant! Until as of late sadly :( Besides the gorgeous view, the rooftop sold chicharrones which were one of the best things I've ever had!!! I'm not even a pork lover but these were legendary, everyone I took here to try these were immediately obsessed. Then we all noticed in the past couple months that they swapped them out for carnitas, which are still good but not anywhere close to the level of the chicharrones. Everyone I know and myself have agreed not to return until they bring them back, this was their star dish, their bread and butter, what they were known for and they removed it from their menu for something less. Without a doubt I'd give them a 5 star if they brought this staple back!
author: Ashley H.

description:
I found my spot! It's an upscale, Argentinean bar-b-que pit on the penthouse level of A Random Building. Dine al fresco, with lovely views up and down gritty Mission Street, and all the way out to the sea.

So the space is delicious; the food is quite good (if also quite overpriced - the halved-cotija corn triplet runs $7!), and folks tend to dress to impress. The skewers are the main attraction, and the star, surprisingly, is the chicken (beef and shrimp, secondarily). You'll probably rack up a hefty bill here, since it's pleasant to stay, and there's a small beer menu, and a larger, South American-inspired cocktail list, not to mention the aforementioned elote, plus a yummy selection of impulse-order ceviches and quesadillas.
author: Liz C.

description: Love this place! Great vibe, great music, friendly staff, delicious food (empanadas are my fave), yummy drinks, and a great view of the city! Guaranteed good time! Can't wait to come back!
author: Shakira C.

description: Unfortunately, my friend (from out of town) and I did not get to experience the restaurant and their so called beautiful city views, due to the unprofessional greeting we received from the door tenant. Will not be returning!
author: Nicki H.

description:
So San Francisco doesn't have the tallest buildings in the land. That's probably why there aren't much rooftop bars in the city. I've certainly never been to any until I went to El Techo. I went there with some friends just as the sun was beginning to set. The view was enchanting -- purple orange sunset, wind whipping in your hair while the heat lamps keeping you warm. It was a Sunday and the city had never looked so beautiful and still.

We had just finished loading up on tacos and margs at Tacolicious, so we didn't get to sample the food. I wasn't really feeling the Margarita del Techo, which used mezcal. I don't really like my margaritas with the smoky flavor that mezcal has. After one order of that, I switched to the regular margarita which I loved. Margaritas make me happy. And they did it right, which made me even happier. 

It was a pretty chilly night (thank heavens for those heat lamps!), so I can only imagine how awesome it would be on one of those magical evenings when the weather is perfect. I hope this place is successful and I hope it encourages others to open up more roof decks. Surveying your beloved San Francisco from on high with a delicious cocktail in your hand -- life doesn't get much better than that.
author: Racquel N.

description:
Warm evenings in this very foggy city are few and far between, but on such warm evenings I am not sure if there is a better place in the city to hang out with a group of friends. The food and drink are top notch here, and that wow, that rooftop view! It's nice to escape from the hustle and bustle of the Mission and enjoy the scenery and city skyline.

But first, getting a seat here is admittedly a bit of an ordeal, especially on a nicer day. You get in line on the sidewalk to be let into the building, then you put your name down for a table, hang out at the bar area, and hope to be eventually seated. The wait is a bit hit or miss - sometimes the line does go down the block. I will say that the few times I have been here, the wait for a table once I got inside was not too bad (they've quoted me an hour or hour and a half wait, but then I get a seat within 10 or 15 minutes). And the cocktails here are top notch and will keep you company while you wait.

In terms of the food, the guac and chips, empanadas, and fried chicken are all solid options, but it's all about the pork shoulder here. Sooo tender and juicy (and fatty), the pork shoulder is served with beans, veggies, salsa, and tortillas. I think you would be forgiven here if the only food you ordered was the pork shoulder, it's that good.
author: Sidney L.

description:
Great time at El Techo last night! Our server was great (really great and the main reason for the 4 stars) Drinks were great. Rooftop scene was busy and great. Being in an open area kept the noise down. Food was definitely good enough - I'd say above average. Nothing complicated which is the way I like it. These things didn't disappoint.

However, as someone who never (almost never?) writes bad reviews it's somewhat unique that I have something bad to say here. El Techo starts your experience with a feeling of "organized dining" by forming a line prior to getting into an elevator, *being called up by the host*, and then again when waiting for a table. Great - they have a process! All the more reason for them to expect me to ask about my friend who is waiting for me and has given his name to the host (he had) and clearly stated that I was outside in line. The host, as far as I can tell, was standing there looking at people coming off the elevator (but not inviting interaction with them!), not really doing anything much because he didn't have to - the line was outside keeping people from overwhelming him. I confirmed this throughout the night by looking over to see that he was doing nothing most of the time.

His answer to my question about my friend? "I don't have the time to remember everyone's name here tonight". Not sure what that was all about, but way out of line for someone who is first in line as the "face of the company" and with such a simple job. My friend and I continued to note that others there, "bus boys", were unprofessional. They seemed to have trouble understanding the simple and *very short* conversation we would initiate (where's a good place to sit? for instance). I was left wondering if perhaps there was a sign I missed stating "Please don't speak to the help!".

Again our server was great - very pleasant and I wish I could remember her name. The rest ... many of these are people that seem to be over-valuing their importance as "help" and seem to think it's appropriate to take their problems out of paying customers. It wasn't cheap, so don't act cheaply!

I'll go back, but next time with the understanding that there's no point in paying any attention to anyone but the server.
author: John A.

description:
Been meaning to try this place but I'm so glad I held out until it was a nice day in SF because GODDAMNNNN.

Soon as those elevator doors open you're reminded why you love living in California. Their menu is simple, something for everyone and definitely fairly priced. As busy as it was we were able to get seated right away. This is a must try if you haven't been, especially since spring/summer is right around the corner.
author: Av A.

description:
Great rooftop bar! Good vibes and not overly crowded (which is what I prefer).

We came here on a Saturday evening after dinner in the Mission. On a warm summer night, these types of places are hands down the best. We were able to snag a seat, grab a beer, and just relax. 

Recommended for a fun hangout spot!
author: Jason T.

description: I was visiting from Maine with my 5 best friends for the weekend and after 20 mins we asked the girl at the front how long the wait would be. It was only 10:15pm. She said "does it matter", and I responded "well we've been waiting for a bit so I would like to know how long the wait is." She rudely told me I hadn't been waiting for 20 minutes and rolled her eyes at me. She proceeded to give me attitude with her explanation. I heard such great things, but I've never been treated so poorly. Really a shame. We left immediately.
author: Kathryn R.

description:
As a newcomer to SF from sunny southern california - there's two things that really stand out about this spot - beautiful skyline views and HEAT LAMPS. Not being accustomed to the cold, it was a nice first place to visit after moving into the city.

Chicharrones de carne was the big winner here - super tender chunks of pork shoulder, chicharrones super crispy...so tasty it made my roommate want to "punch something it was so good".

Service was a little slow, and the place is a little on the pricey side - but definitely a spot I'll be bringing my friends to in the future.
author: Anthony L.

description: With so few rooftop restaurants/bars/anything in SF, this place is a gem.  All their food is good (I usually order a variation of the skewers, elote and guac) and if you like mezcal, their El Techo marg is decent.  It's a super fun environment, especially for a warm day/night.  Beware that it gets pretty crowded so it's best to go for an early dinner and/or with just one or two friends.  I've only ever gone as a pair, which helps me bypass the long line.  Have fun!
author: Jessica C.

description:
As much as I like Lolinda, I like this rooftop bar!
Although I haven't had their food here yet, it is a wonderful place to hang out with your friends and your partner.
Who doesn't like this bar with beautiful views of the city and its cool vibe?

The entrance is a bit hard to figure out, which is a few doors away from Lolinda.
When we came here last Friday, they told me to wait for 10-15 minutes at the entrance because they reached the maximum numbers of customers, but luckily my friend had a table up there, so they let me in.
It could be very crowded since there are not many rooftop bars in SF, but it is worth a try.

The night in SF is quite chilly and I was afraid of it, but no worries, girls.  They have heaters:)  
We went down to Lolinda after a couple of drinks, which also is a great option!
author: Tomomi K.

description:
Rooftop! 

A great place to get drinks (or eat.)  You'll notice it because there's a line and they slowly let you in. 

There are some clear tents and heat lamps with a good view of the city lights. 

Was able to find a table and enjoyed some sangrias.
author: Anya R.

description:
A rooftop restaurant in the Mission with a beautiful view of the city! What can get better than this?!  I came here for dinner this past Friday. I got here around 7:45/8pm and didn't have to wait a second to get seated (short wait may have been due to the rain). Since it was raining, the restaurant had a cover to protect us from the winter elements without totally obstructing our view of the city. Before coming I was worried that I was going to get cold, but the cover really kept in all the heat. 

Food: We ordered the Ceviche de Camaron, the Quesadilla de Pibil, and the One Pound of the Chicharrones de Carne. This was way too much food for two people, especially considering we both had eaten a little something before hand. We would have been fine with just the Ceviche and Half a Pound of the Chicharrones de Carne or the Ceviche and the Quesadilla. All three of the items that we ordered were delicious! My favorite was probably the ceviche. I'm not much of seafood person, but I really enjoyed this dish. The acidity was just right, and I love having larger chunks of all the ingredients in the bowl rather than having the ingredients minced.

Drinks: We ordered a pitcher of Sangria and two glasses of La Paloma. The Sangria was good, but it was nice ending the meal with the La Paloma. The La Paloma is a drink comprised of tequila, grapefruit, agave, lime, and soda. It was my first time having it, and I was not disappointed!

Service: Our waitress was really friendly and very attentive, which are my two favorite things that a waiter can be. She was constantly aware of our glasses of Sangria and water and was always refilling them when they were getting low. She also helped us out with whatever questions we had.

I would definitely go again!
author: Kevin Joseph A.

description: This place is awesome. Great vibe, scenery, Our waitress Hayley was funny and talkative. Amazing food. My phone is dying but this review was crucial. Great place. Go here.
author: Fernando S.

description: This is my favorite place for great food and great drinks! Love the chilcano drink it's delicious
author: Glenda P.

description:
Tapas? Yes. Roof top bar? Yes. What more could you want. 

Went here with a group this past weekend and was not disappointed. Ascetically pleasing decor and a more casual atmosphere than Lolinda. We tried the elotes, meat empanadas, chicharones, three skewers (chicken, carne, and chorizo), and ceviche.Oh, and of course, wine, beer, tequila, and sangria.  

They were severely short staffed the night we were there, which was understandable but definitely frustrating when it took half an hour to get our drinks. We made the quick decision to order all our food and drinks in one shot so we didn't have to wait too long to indulge. All in all, the service was friendly.

I didn't get to try the alfojores with hot chocolate at Lolinda so I was on a mission to try these at El Techo. They are probably my favorite thing on this menu and from here on out, I don't think I can go without indulging in these amazing cookies. It took an insanely long time to get out cookies and milk at the table, but it was definitely worth the wait. 

Overall, this is a great little spot with a great ambiance. Definitely worth a try.
author: Parker B.

description: If the service was better than I wouldn't mind paying for a little more but the food really isn't that great. Ok place if you like crowds and just want to pay lots for drinks and a view.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Fear not - the rooftop is covered, so you're warm, but with clear covering, so you can still see the bay bridge.

Sangria and margs are good. 
So is the pork carne plate. For a table of six we got a pound of pork carne, 4 chicken skewers, chips and guac and chips and salsa + a pitcher each of sangria and marg. I think we were all stuffed, though we made it to dandelion chocolates for dessert 8)
author: Sonya Z.

description:
I remember when this spot was Medjool... and it's still just as nice.

Chicharones and ceviche shots is all you need to know.
author: Terrance M.

description:
The location of the places nice as well as being the roof however I really did not enjoy the drinks. We decided to try this place after having dinner at their restaurant. 

They are known with their sangaria. If you are looking for a strong sangaria this is the best place to go. I personally enjoy sweeter. 

Server was great. It is a very casual place. Elevator takes a long time to come up or go down. Plan to wait for a while.
author: Irem G.

description: This place is pretty cool! I can just sit and stare at the view of the city all day. But most importantly, the food is delicious! -1 star because I feel like the prices can be a tad cheaper. But other than that, great atmosphere, good service, yummy food and nice view!
author: Nicole D.

description:
Great spot to hang with friends on a sunny day! Gets very crowded and often has a line to get in. Often hard to have a conversation due to so many people and the noise.

Food was fantastic, quesadilla & sopes are favorites. Ceviche was very tasty, my friend even drank the liquid like ceviche soup. Amazing flavors and very fresh tasting.

Drinks are excellent!

I can't wait to try their brunch which so many friends have raved about.
author: Stephanie A.

description: Good food, good beer, good atmosphere, gorgeous environment, nice people, trendy as hell; highly recommend.
author: Amy J.

description:
I LOVE ROOFTOPS! So when I came here I was amazed by the views and the cute setup they have! 

It gets pretty crowded and loud but hey, what do you expect. 
The weather was perfect with clear skies so it made the view even more worth it! Since you are in the city, it does get a bit chilly but they have tons of heaters to keep you warm!
The food was awesome, took a little long to come out but this place gets so busy its understandable! 
Didn't have any alcoholic beverages but I shall be back to try!
It seems like a cool place to chill, have a bite to eat and a few drinks to make you feel good! If you just want to meet new people I'm sure it'll be fairly easy since everyone seemed very friendly and talkative!

Either way.. whatever you come here for, the view of the city is spectacular!
author: Jenn T.

description:
Oh.... do you like an epic view of San Francisco from a rooftop bar? Do you also enjoy cocktails made with freshly squeezed juices? This is YOUR PLACE.
Granted this is not my favorite neighborhood but taking the elevator to the top floor and taking that first sip of a fresh margarita in my mouth while scanning a 360 view of the city is pricless. We didn't get to try any of the food but find the time to make it here and take a load off.
author: Nathan B.

description: Oy, not worth the cost.  Get some real food elsewhere. The guacamole was plain, the platanos were too hard and bland.  The pork was good, but that's an easy find in other places and it'll be half the cost. Sure the view is nice, but this isn't the real Mission. Next time I'm going to a taqueria.
author: Caro R.

description: Moved to the area recently and my sister brought me here to try their food. It was a cute spot on the rooftop. Great spot. The food we ordered was all amazing. We ordered the carne and shrimp skewers, pulled pork quesadilla and the ceviche. The food was great but the service the day we went was shitty. Had to flag down a busser for help.
author: Fancy N.

description: Food is pretty good, but the wait was long and we were ultimately not thrilled with the experience. We were really chilly throughout the entire meal (more heat lamps please!), we had waited way too long for a table (granted it was a Friday night...) and the waitress didn't guide us on how much food to order. We completely over-ordered (it was the hanger talking!) and normally in that situation, I would expect the waiter/waitress to advise on typical # of dishes ordered per party and/or size of dishes. It was a fun night overall, but I'm not sprinting back.
author: Caroline B.

description:
Location, location, location. It's the name of the game, and this place has an amazing one. 

Being one of the few legitimate rooftop bars in the city gives El Techo some serious power. Power to charge $30 for a pitcher of ice with margarita peppered between the cubes - the pitcher comes with a side of glasses full of, you guessed it, ICE! At least it was good ice. The margarita also tasted like someone had ground fresh pepper into it, which though unique, was not at all what any of us had expected.

In addition to this outrageous price for what was mostly...ice, me and my friends decided to get some chips/guacamole. The guacamole was crazy delicious: limey, smooth, little chunks of avocado, suffice to say, I WAS IN LOVE WITH THIS GUAC. But every yin has it's yang, and at El Techo that yang was that I was given 8 CHIPS. 8 CHIPS, 3 PEOPLE, A BOWL OF GUAC. It all ads up to 3 sad people. 

We were eyeing some of the other menu items, but were so dissapointed with all items thus far that we cut our time short with El Tech. Without a doubt the experience on the rooftop was incredible, the service was great, but the food and drink was a total rip. Next time I'll make my own margaritas, guac and get a WHOLE BAG OF TORTILLA CHIPS and climb up on a friends rooftop.
author: Devin A.

description: I went here for brunch with friends. I enjoyed it. We got a pitcher of sangria, which was a little small. My only complaint, is I wish there was more sangria. I got the corn cake which was really unique, at least for me, since I usually have poached eggs. I'd like to go back and try their eggs. The rooftop can't be beat, there are gorgeous views and its super cute! The waiter was a little sassy. I'd really like to come back though!
author: Queen B.

description: Amaaaaazing ceviche and crazy cool views of SF. Nothing beats a rooftop restaurant in a heat wave.
author: Allie L.

description:
This is a great place to hang out and chill out with friends. The restaurant/bar is located on the rooftop and you get a nice view of the San Francisco skyline. There are heatlamps that keep customers warm at their tables.

The food and snacks are delicious. Try their chicharrones (pork shoulder with tortillas), yummy! Chips and guacamole were fresh. Their pina colada rocked! It was smooth and creamy. Margaritas were good.

There's also a happy hour menu.
author: Ali F.

description:
As clandestine a place like this, who wants to notify others of el techo? 

I plead the fifth! I guess I'm breaking bread by certifying this place as simply the most romantic rooftop shindig in the mission. Perfect for romantic dates, photo-ops, double-, triple-, or even quadruple- dating...(aka too large of a crowd) would knock your chonis off. 

Give it a try. They close at 1:00am, so you can still make it to that after party...inebriated...just don't forget to tap your uber app! Or, for the frisky kind, mossy on over to the tickle my pink thing app, and say the magic words...:)
author: Elidia C.

description:
El Techno de Lolinda is a study in controlled chaos surrounded by beautiful views and rather decent and authentic mexican (this is, after all, the Mission).    

Views, on a warm and still fall evening, are stunning, and worth the PITA factors of getting in.   I met some friends here recently, and found it to be not only convivial and a great venue to hang with the buds, but also a tad on the romantic side too.   

The food is excellent.   Try the carnitas - a full pound is not enough.   The Shrimp Ceviche was watery and left a bit to be desired.   

The Sangria is lame - tasted like Boone's Farms gone bad.  Avoid it.  

Service was wacky but actually consistent.  I got held up down on the sidewalk while friends had to have "Felix" call down to the doorman to let me in.   Lame and inefficient.   Lines get long after 7 on a weekend, so get ready to work the Felix angle.

Someone said that Google and Facebook buses let out near the Mission / 16th St intersection, which would explain the massive throng of youngsters near one side.  

Otherwise, a terrific experience.
author: Max K.

description:
Awesome food and awesome view of the Mission Block from above by getting into an elevator for a restaurant. Actually that was my first time eating at a cute little skyline pad. The drinks were bomb, I had a bomb ass mimosa and it felt so bubbly. The food was the best! It beat's going to an average Mexican cuisine that don't have any style or flavor. Empenadas and the cerviche was chainless... 

The atmosphere was excellent in vibes, good energy, and good people. The staff and the waitress were outstanding in their attendance to great service.
author: Ahrmon R.

description: Delicious food and ambiance.  went on a Saturday morning to try for the first time and the outdoor patio offers great views of the city.
author: Nelli H.

description:
The rooftop bar is next to the restaurant. We got here with 3 minutes to spare for happy hour and our server was gracious enough to still put our food and drinks on the HH menu! They have only three items on HH I believe, the guacamole, the plaintains, and the empanadas. My girlfriend and I ordered all three and I got the sangria. Sangria was a bit too sweet for my liking but the food was super delicious! Their guacamole is the best I've had and the plantains come with this lime dipping sauce that was so tart and yummy. 

It is a nice place to chill with a group of friends but can get crowded so don't go with too big of a group. Love the view and they have plastic screens to keep out the wind.
author: Elizabeth V.

description:
People need to stop complaining, get there early and get a table & bring a jacket.  Service was prompt and casual...what do you expect - it's a rooftop bar.  

Guacamole was divine.  Kale quesadilla, genius.  Margaritas, refreshing.

Mixed crowd, although on that particular Thurs evening there seemed to be a Marina Migration movement.

I'll be back.
author: Tina T.

description:
Rooftop. Capirinhas. Skewers. ALL SO GOOD. 

The steak, chicken, and shrimp skewers are all so tasty. The margaritas are excellent. The view is phenomenal. Get there early to nab a table, and you'll have exquisite attention and service.
author: Sylvie C.

description:
Beautiful view. The food is fresh and delicious. It was packed when we arrived for dinner but we were seated right away. The pork on top of potato cakes was the fav. Splurge and get the guacamole! Enjoyed the apple cider beer. 
Side note- Service was slow but we came after pride and apparently so did everyone else!
author: Meleah L.

description: Great setting with great food and awesome views of SF. They don't take reservations so be careful about what time you plan on eating.
author: Robert G.

description: The greatest place for a happy hour! Went on a Tuesday, weather was incredible so therefore the view was to die for! I'd recommend coming at the early part of happy hour to get a good table.
author: B S.

description:
Food, BOMB
Service, SUCKED.

As a New Yorker and former service industry professional, service means a lot to me. I don't need my water to be filled up every time I take a sip, but I do want to place at least a drink order when the 3rd waiter approaches the table. It kind of felt like they didn't really feel like getting us anything and that taking our order was some sort of daunting chore.

-Brought (and charged) us for 3 skewers instead of 2 like we ordered.
-no desert per closed kitchen at 10:10.
-Chicharon was DELICIOUS.
-fried rice crisp thing was pretty tasty too.

Again, good food, but poor service. I will go back.
author: Booky C.

description:
We were lucky to snag a rooftop table on this foggy July 4th and were rewarded with super happy smiles all evening long, so much so that we very nearly missed the fireworks show, fogged in as it was. 

The host and waitstaff are all friendly and attentive folk and we were called for our table surprisingly quickly. Starts included a pitcher of margaritas which only added to the smiles. We sampled tapas plates of Patacón, Ceviche de Camaron, Sopes de Pibil, and Chicharrones de Carne. Tops on our list were the ceviche and the chicharrones, which are roasted and fried chunks of pork-shoulder instead of the usual pork cracklins. We'll definitely be back for some more of those tasty treats.

As you might imagine, the rooftop setting is a quite nice option in the mission. Glass walls knock off most of the wind and clear tents come down to help even more as the night cools off. So come, bring some friends, and enjoy the view.
author: Norman G.

description: This place is awesome! Love the rooftop atmosphere and they have a great selection of drinks. The carnitas and other apps are so delicious. Great place to go to start off the night, grab some drinks and food, and share with friends. The waitstaff was also very friendly and accommodating!
author: Gabriella R.

description: Love, love this place. Obsessed with the chicharrones de carne; the meat just melts in your mouth. My favorite drink here is the La Paloma.
author: Camille T.

description: The Chicano is deliciousssss
author: Vivian H.

description: Tried it the first time because I seen it had good ratings and wanted to try it with my girl. I loved it, the quesadilla de pebil, I enjoyed that. Had a beer as well. Would come here again.
author: Sabas H.

description:
I love this place! The food is yummerz!! It's not really typically mexican, it's more of a mix of latin flavors, latin tapas basically. delicious!! so far i have had quesadilla pibil (OMG!!!!! nom nom nom nom), ceviche, chicharrones (LOOOOOVE!!!), patacon, and guacamole. Everything has been da bomb! Rico, rico, rico!! The drinks are great! The dessert was also ridiculous! I had the alfajores with the hot chocolate... yes please!!! delish!! i love this place, it's great! and it feels authentic to me, i don't feel like i'm in SF, i feel like i'm somewhere abroad. i like it a lot. 
and for chilly nights they have heaters and plastic walls which protect you from the wind so it's still nice! i was just there on wednesday and it was cold outside, but we went to check it out just in case, and we weren't cold at all. they really thought it out. 
big fan.
author: Ilovelife Z.

description:
We arrived for Sunday brunch right at 11:00am, when the restaurant opens.  There was no line (unlike at Foreign Cinema next door) and we had our pick of the rooftop tables.  There's a wonderful view, and heat lamps to ward off the San Francisco chill.

I had the Clara Scramble and it was absolutely delicious.  It's a perfect combination of ingredients and flavors, and also tons of food.  I did not love my mimosa (should have just gone for Cava and skipped the orange, which did not taste at all like fresh squeezed orange juice), but shared some guacamole with friends and it was truly fabulous. I'm a bit of a guacamole snob, and this was the real deal. I'd like to go back and try the beignets, as well.

I'd come here again for brunch, absolutely.
author: Erin L.

description:
Really excited to see that Lolinda has a roof deck. SF really needs more outdoorsy places and rooftop bars for the amazing views the city has to offer. Definitely worth going around sunset time. 

The rooftop is pretty awesome. Lots of heat lamps, plenty of dining space area and high tables. The menu is different from Lolinda offering cocktails, beers, tapas and desserts. Every time I take out-of-towners, they absolutely love it.

I recommend to drink margarita pitchers, Variety of Latin American beers, palomas. The beers are $5 and the cocktails are $8-12. As for the food, I highly recommend the carne skewers, cicharrones, quesadilla de pibil, empanadas de carne, ceviche, guac and patacon. As for dessert, you must try the tres leches! Being from Nicaragua, I was impressed with the variety of latin fusion their menu has to offer and hope to see more the next time I go.

El Techo de Lolinda will guarantee to have a fun great crowd, a beautiful panorama view, excellent food and tasty cocktails. Vaya, pruebalo!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
5 stars for the view.

The workers wear head sets with mouth pieces. The place seems kinda small IMO for douchey headsets like that but I guess they need them just in case.. The guys downstairs kept asking if we were going to eat, then once out of the elevator the headset guys kept asking if we were going to eat. They really want you to eat here.

You can't order from the bar. We had the ceviche that came with a basket of chips. It was ok.. The waitress came to remove our food quite a number of times. We weren't finished and the place was only half filled, annoying.

We finished the small basket of chips that came with the ceviche and a waiter asked if we wanted more, we shrugged and said sure. 

BEWARE: THEY CHARGE FOR THE CHIPS!
author: Lou Z.

description: Rude host, we have a table but wouldn't let us go in, worst customer service ever! I don't care how good the drink or food are.
author: Hunter S.

description: Delicious, delicious food. The carnitas are right on, my favorite is the fried chicken. But I would skip the quesadillas. Only down side is that there could be a long line waiting to go upstairs, and it could be super crowded so it's hard to find a place to drink and eat.
author: Critic X.

description: Bunuelos are a must.  Ordered 5 different things and didnt have anything bad. Sooo good.
author: Steven 7.

description:
Went to El Techo the second day it was open to the public. I'm a sucker for rooftops where I can soak up the sometime- SF sun like a lizard. That's enough for 3 stars. While I agree with other early reviewers that it's lame that you can't order right from the bar (they should change that), and that they ask you 3498574395 questions when you get to the top, and that they are NOT set up for scale given that the elevator takes forever to go up and down, I found 4 stars in one single element. I cannot possibly go below 4 stars because I ORDERED THE CHICHARRONES BY THE POUND.

Now, for those of you who think chicharrones are those fatty crackers that kind of weirdly melt in your mouth, THINK AGAIN. Chunks of fatty, meaty, delicious pork shoulder, braised, then fried, probably fried again, and then rolled in SUGAR, served with DELICIOUS black beans and tangy salsa and housemade tortillas. My heart and soul delighted from this treasure in my mouth, I couldn't care less that they still had many many details to work out. 

My best suggestion is to allow it to really behave like a Latin bar... let people sit where they want, order what they wish, regardless of eat or drink... even if it means replacing some of the low tables with more bar tables. Unbutton a few buttons, put on some cumbia, and serve those chicharrones like there's no tomorrow. Make it sexy without being pretentious. It's not like you're not going to make money.

By the way, the guacamole (expensive) was delicious, as were the chips (though those could stand to be cheaper as well). Shrimp skewer= yum. Beef sandwich=skip it and get more chicharrones.
author: Licinia I.

description: Food is good here, and they have a nice view of the city, but the management of this place and the service makes it look much worse than it is. It is always super overcrowded, and the guys/girls working there are not helpful at all. First they will tell you to wait 15-20 minutes to get a table at the rooftop, but that's just the beginning. You won't get a full table, you'll just get a standing desk where you can order some drinks. From there, you will still wait up to 30 minutes to get a real table where you can order some food. Totally overpriced for what you get.
author: Igor P.

description: Met up with my sister on a Saturday night.  My first drink took over 30 mins to arrive. WTH. Every drink after took about 20 mins.  It is a pretty view, but can you call it a roof top with the plastic walls and ceiling? Think I'll skip out on this place next time I'm in town.
author: Veronica R.

description: This place is amazing! The roof, that view, the food...presentation is excellent and it tastes good too. Our server was so nice and made us feel very comfortable. We will definitely be back now that we live in the mission.
author: Patricia H.

description: Fabio and Luis are the best!!!!!! Such good food and the greatest service. Seriously Fabio is so accommodating, best host and service ever.
author: Haley P.

description: This is by far the best rooftop bar in sf. The service was great, margaritas are strong and they have cava! Don't be alarmed if there's a line, it moves fast to get in.
author: Ross S.

description: Went for a company event. Good food & drinks, decent view given the area.
author: Jeff A.

description: Delicious Mexican/modern food. Also can't complain about the setting! It certainly gets crowded here, so try to come at an off-peak time.
author: Eric H.

description:
My favorite restaurant in SF. Amazing views, phenomenal food and great people! You have to order the pork shoulder that comes with 'build it yourself' tortillas, beans, and salsa- honestly tastes like nothing you have had before. Most unique & mind blowing flavors. 

El Techo is the FIRST place I take anyone that is visiting from out of town.
author: melina d.

description: Went here for drinks&apps last Sun. It was a beautiful, warm, sunny afternoon. How better to celebrate such good weather than fried plantains, pork shoulder quesadillas, a pina colada, outdoor seating, and a rooftop view? It was pretty sweet. Food was really good, but I do recommend skipping the regular margarita (blah) and going for the margarita del techo or any of the other cocktails.
author: Riz W.

description:
My first impression was: Wow, the best rooftop in SF! 
I went to El Techo de Lolinda for the first time with my co-workers for a happy hour. It was great. The view is amazing, the food and cocktails (Sangria) are very good (delicious empanadas, gacamaole, stewers, etc...). I went a second time and tried a great caipirina! The service was great and staff very friendly!
author: Emilie A.

description:
rooftop bars in SF are rare!

I love the views, the pitchers of sangrias, and the food! Guacamole and chips and the chicharrons are delish. We ordered I think 1/2 pound and it was enough for me and my gf. 

Will be coming back here on gorgeous SF days!
author: Christine W.

description:
5 stars because of the view (super clear city night) , service and most importantly the food was amazing! Only bad thing I could ever say about this place is that their food was so dangerous it drove us into a major intense food coma  LOL it was seriously that good & we couldn't stop eating it lmao . 


So Enjoy & happy eating!
author: Philana C.

description: We went with my family on Sat for brunch, we had an excellent expience, for a party of 5 we were sat really fast, and our server was delightful. The food was to die for the chicharron was so tender and the buñuelos amazing. My dad and my Mom really enjoyed this placed and is somewhat hard to please they loved the whole experience, great job guys, keep up the great job.
author: Harold M.

description:
The roof is awesome, we get that, don't forget what this place is supposed to be everyone. Food and drinks, that is why you're there. Things are not in order and their kitchen is slow and not efficient. The food is starch, starch and more starch. 

It was not a busy brunch either, there were maybe 15 people eating and drinking. I think their management needs a change or Mr. Gordon Ramsey needs to get in that kitchen. Our waitress was bubbly and sweet until we made a tiny complaint. We are in a city full of foodies, get over it, we know what we like and we know whats good. Wa, I sound like a bitch. I guess I'm just disappointed. I wanted this to be great, not below the standard amazing mission brunch experience. 

I say go - try it, the rooftop is cool but you wont be going back for the food. Stick to foreign cinema, eat your brunch there and THEN head next door for a drink on the roof.
author: Mandee J.

description:
What a great space!
Service: lack of attentiveness (due to the level of business, but understandable)
Space: awesome view, fun crowd, uppity
Food: delicious small plates, order a lot-all at once (because it might take a while to order again)
Drinks: get a couple pitchers of margaritas
Overall: super happy, go here!
author: Tom T.

description: Really cool place, got there at 4 on a Thursday and it was packed by 430. Amazing view and service was prime. Definitely a diverse crowd too which is always a plus. Happy hour had decent prices for SF, otherwise the menu was a little steep. Check it out
author: Mark M.

description:
Really good spot to hang out with friends for after hours.

the fried chicken was freaking good.
author: Nayila A.

description: Highly recommended. Get a pound of the taco's...omg died so good.
author: Julian S.

description: When we travel, we always ask locals for their favorite place.   This was recommended by a man in Coit Tower.   The food and drinks were amazing, the service was outstanding.  The roof top location was really cool.   It is a lively bustling place.   Highly recommended
author: Anne E.

description: Went to El Techo on recommendation from my 22 year old son. Felt too old for sure! Got the el techo margarita. Was surprised at how smokey it was. Never had a margarita like that before! Waiter forgot our Negro Midelos. The ceviche was outstanding. The guacamole was ok. Each bite tasted different as if it wasn't mixed enough. Interesting though. The 1/2 lb chicharrones were good. The meat had some fat and chewiness and some tender melt in your mouth pieces. The habanero salsa was delicious. Definitely an energetic young person's hot spot! View was beautiful. Glad we went.
author: Cindy W.

description: The food and drinks are amazing. Not to mention the place. It's always been my favorite spot. This place is enjoyable whether summer or winter, day or night. Besides sometimes the line downstairs is a little long wait, but its worth it.
author: Jennt C.

description: Fun atmosphere and a great rooftop bar.  They have Margaritas and also Pina Coladas!  Super cool!
author: keith g.

description: Who would have known there was a place like this in the Mission! My friend mentioned this secret place and man I know why it's a secret place... hope this place doesn't get too popular because it is that awesome of a location. The bar/restaurant is located on the roof which makes seeing the city that more enjoyable. The food isn't bad, ordered the mango ceviche and the skewers. It is wintertime and they had the tent up so you can't quite see the city as clear, but in the summer this place would be an awesome place to take a date or your SO. I will certainly come back.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Given that SF has such few rooftop bars it was only a matter of when they were going to reopen this one. Medjool used to have a decent one- but this is the new and improved version. We came here last week when its been especially nice out in SF. 

Since it wasn't really lunch time for us we snacked on some guac (pretty darn good), ceviche de camarones and mango and some chicarones. the food was pretty good. Their drinks are always great. The only issue was the service was a little slow- but they're likely working out the kinks given its only been open about a week
author: Komal B.

description:
We came here for my husband's birthday on a Saturday night. We arrived at 7p and for a table of 6 people, we waited 1.5 hours. This place was super busy and it never let down throughout the night. But the wait wasn't bad because we just ordered a couple of pitchers of margaritas and hung out in their lounge area.

For dinner - we ordered a 1.5 lb order of the chicharrones de carne, the empanadas, the quesadilla de pibil, and the skewers. Every single item we ordered were delicious!!! The wait was definitely worth it. The table favorite were the chicharrones though.

We will definitely be coming back! I would suggest to make sure you get there early if you want to avoid a super long wait. The lounge can get pretty crowded, but if you put your name down for a table, they will text you when your table is ready. So it makes it convenient to leave and not worry about missing your name being called.
author: Abby M.

description: Don't get scared by the line. El Techo has a great system of taking down your phone number and texting you when a table on the heated, 360 degree rooftop bar opens up. (In the meantime, help yourself to a little pregame at the neighboring bars.)
author: Auburn S.

description:
Great place to get food and drinks on a warm evening. There's a line, but it moves quickly - make sure to get a table so you can enjoy your chips and guac and drinks comfortably.

Favorite dishes = guac (amazing!) and ceviche. Everything is reasonably priced and easy to share, including the strong margarita pitchers. The view is great and when it starts getting dark, they provide candles and heat lamps to take you through the night. 

It can be a bit of an effort to bring in friends who arrive later than you - befriend the waitstaff early so they'll radio in your friends, VIP-style. Kind of a hassle, but still worth it.
author: Shikha K.

description: Chorizo is bomb! Oh man and the potatoes are soooooooo amazing! Drinks were also great. Lane the bartender was super amazing! Friendly and funny. Recommend place !
author: Nikki G.

description: I just went for the first time.  View was amazing but surprisingly the food was super delicious.  Usually it is one or the other but this place has it all and you can get away with eating healthy with the tasty skewers.  We had a problem with one dish and they comped our entire meal!  Totally not necessary but how is that for some amazing customer service.  I will be going back....often.  Thanks for a great experience.
author: Dottie L.

description:
Great place with fantastic view and hype crowd.
LOVED the Jack Foley cocktail and the Chicharrones de carne.
author: Eleni D.

description: I was there this past weekend. The food, specially the Vigaron (pork belly) The carnitas (the best) and the corn on the cob are out of this world!!!! Expect to wait a looooooooooooong time for drinks and service. We weren't impressed with the margaritas. Too tar and no salt on the rim. I must say, the bartenders and staff were working their butts off and they tried very hard to make everyone happy. Hey, they just opened two weeks ago so it is understandable. Definitely, bring a jacket; it gets chilly past 6:00pm
author: Moy V.

description: Cool ambiance and radical view. Food and drinks are legitimate. Service is interesting.
author: David L.

description:
On a beautiful sunny day in SF, this is the PERFECT brunch spot. I went this past Sunday and the weather couldn't have been better, the view was gorgeous, and the food was yummy.

I did make a reservation but walk-ins are welcome. The place is obviously small, probably fitting about 150 people capacity. If your party is 12+, reservations I believe are required. The restaurant is located on the 5th floor - roof top. The views are gorgeous. They have heat lamps for the more chilly days and plastic canopy for the rain days, but if sunny the space is open.

We were greeted and seated right away. the staff was off the bat super nice.

Food: We had bunuelos and mimosas to start the morning off. Those were so DELICIOUS! Unfortunately there is no bottomless mimosas or pitchers, they are served by the glass for $8 bucks. I ordered Benedictos, one word Amazing! I couldn't get enough of that jalapeno cornbread. My boyfriend got the Techo Rancheros and he absolutely loved them. Plate was clean. We also order a pitcher of sangria $25/pitcher. It was good and refreshing, not bitter or heavy. A single Sangria glass is about $7. It can add up with drinks being a bit pricey.

I'd definitely come back for brunch.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Had a pleasant date night with my hubby. Kind of loud place if you don't like noise but we loved it. We've had dinner at the restaurant and enjoyed it but I think the techo is the place for us. Relaxing, drinking and sharing food. We tried several items and our favorite was the quesadilla with cochinita pibil and the fried chicken bites. Next time I'm going to order the chicharones which looked amazing when being delivered to the table next to us. This is definitely the spot for a casual night out.
author: Karla B.

description: The location is great:  rooftop, in the Mission, San Francisco lit up on all sides...the food is fine, the drinks very nice.  But the service is just terrible.  I had to grab napkins, silverware, etc., from other tables, and, after asking 3 different waiters for tortillas, finally resorted to going to the kitchen and asking for them.  It's not that big, and it wasn't that busy.  I just don't get why the servers are so utterly clueless.  And where exactly do they disappear to?  We had fun despite the awful service...
author: Keith J.

description:
This place needs to make some serious changes.

Yes, the location is great, and it is wonderful to have a rooftop bar in the city. They are few and far between; for that, I must express my appreciation. 

However... I do not think I will be back here. 

There was a line to get in, which wasn't a big deal; it moved quickly enough. Once we got upstairs though, things felt chaotic. First, you can't order from the bar. Which would be fine if there were enough servers to actually serve everyone, or if there were some kind of organization. But we waited for about 20 minutes with no sighting of a server. I made my way over to the forbidden bar area, found a server, and ordered a pitcher of margaritas. I headed back over to my friends, and we waited about 15 more minutes before I walked back over to the bar, and found our server again. She promised the pitcher was coming - we finally got it about 5 minutes later. I don't like to write negative reviews, but really - 40 minutes for a drink is too long.

The pitcher was rather small for $30, but it packed a punch. If there are three of you, you'll each get a small glass plus a little extra; if there are four of you, I wouldn't recommend getting the pitcher. For the same price per person, I'd recommend getting one of their cocktails.

We'd asked two or three times for someone to turn the heat lamp on, but nobody did. We weren't the only ones who were getting chilly; a couple of people came over to try and light it up. We never saw our server again, so we asked someone else (manager?) for our check. It came around 10 minutes later. The server got snappy and defensive when my friend mentioned the long wait and the lack of attention to the heat lamp.

Maybe on a colder day with less of a crowd, the service wouldn't be so disorganized and neglectful. But who would want to come to a rooftop bar anyway on a cold day anyway? Most likely you'll come here when the weather is nice, so I must say - prepare for a long wait, be ready to have to hunt for your servers, and try to be patient.
author: Ashley M.

description:
I honestly can't remember the last time I actually wrote a Yelp review but El Techo deserves 5 stars for the amazing service we had for my friends birthday party last night.  We were a group of 12 people and were able to be seated super fast (they are typically pretty busy so we were super surprised).  The waitress was amazing and so helpful and friendly.  

The food here is just awesome as well.  The pork shoulder, salsa, sopes de pibil, fried chicken, all of it so so yummy!  

Thank you guys again, it was such a fun night and we will most definitely be coming back very soon!
author: Camille D.

description: Food is super good but I have to agree with my fellow yelpers about the service quality. I know it gets busy, all the servers are super nice and working very hard but the service is a bit slow during HH times. But who cares, ambiance is great - just enjoy the view while waiting for your order!
author: Tammy K.

description:
I must say that this place has a great concept - rooftop, Latin American tapas restaurant/hangout. However, not going to lie, really miss the old Medjools up there. The atmosphere is significantly different. So I thought I break this review down into four major points:

1) The Drinks: I recommend not ordering one of the specialty drinks - just call your own drink. I tried the margarita and it definitely not the best I tasted (tastes like lime drink with pepper). Maybe some of their other drinks might taste better, but my rule is if you can't nail the margarita drink, any thing more sophisticated will probably not taste as good. 

2) The Food: This is a tapas place so if you want a full meal - go downstairs. The food is pretty good but its tapas - can't really mess up tapas unless you really suck at what you do. Nonetheless, if you are looking for something to munch on while you slug down some drinks, their food is relatively edible and actually delicious.

3) Location: Its on a rooftop therefore by definition its incredible.

4) The individuals: pretty diverse crowd and lots of room to stand and sit (but be WARNED there is usually a wait bc this is a hip spot to be)

To conclude: great place to go on a Thursday or Friday night. Food good but drinks are just ok. 

Have at it!
author: Pablo P.

description: Great bunch spot, rooftop on a 3 or 4 story building in Mission district. Reasonably priced, very good food-- I had a hard time choosing but went with poached eggs on jalapeño corn bread with chorizo... After an order of guac of course, which was also very solid
author: Jonathan H.

description:
Not quite as empty as the old Medjool roof deck used to be in the afternoons, which is too bad, but the drinks are dramatically better - nice fancy cocktails now! - and the food is seriously good. We were just up for drinks, so only got the guac and the pulled pork quesadilla, but it was amazing. A thick, hearty hand-made tortilla wrapped around a seriously obscene amount of cheese and incredibly rich, delicious porky goodness. Wow. So good.
Great salsa too.

The new plexiglass barriers do a lot to help keep the wind down, and there is a lot more tent coverage than there used to be also, and heat lamps, making it a more reliably inviting environment.

One thing to be aware of - about 70% of the space is table seating for the restaurant aspect, and you can't just sit down for drinks. The bar space makes up the remaining area, and is mostly standing-room only, along with a few stools. So don't expect to be able to sit unless you're planning on eating.
author: Don H.

description: This is a great place to have dinner and enjoy views of the city. My group had the pollo frito and the quesadillas which were all great. Drinks are reasonably priced too and delicious. The service here however is pretty bad; I understand that it gets busy on Saturday nights, but if you don't mind waiting around then I guess it's not so bad.
author: Christian A.

description: I have to say this place was quite a surprise for us. We tried it after reading the reviews and had to make it in there to make our own judgement. It was a really cool atmosphere up on a rooftop with awesome street food. We had the ceviche, shrimp skewers, salsa/chips and the chocolate dessert with cayenne pepper. It was interesting because when we first got the skewers, they smelled horrible and I did not find the smell welcoming at all. However, once I tried them, I was like "OH MY GAW" they were delicious. The dessert was even better. Too good to type about it, you must try it.  This place is a must. I can't wait to visit again especially during the summer.
author: Hector C.

description: Perfect for a sunny day after a long day of work! Came here with a friend for drinks and small bites -- overall a great experience (except that our waiter was MIA a lot of the times). Nonetheless, would come again!
author: Siv L.

description: I had my company event here and Marky Mark took care of everyone and everything. We had about ~30 people and Marky got everyone's orders  seamlessly and never left us wondering or second guessing. He made sure we had a great time and was absolutely personable! People like Marky will have us coming back to el techo for our company events more often.
author: sandra m.

description:
A rooftop in the mission.. view, heated lamps, and a cover during the winter to protect you from the rain...you can not go wrong in Summer or Winter. Not to mention they have valet - which I guess they have to make up for not accepting reservations =\ 

I have been here a couple of times - the ambience is always great. Its good for a date or group. Even came here once before when it was Medjol. WAY BETTER now. The host downstairs is a real cool dude. When you get upstairs, you will feel like you are in a completely different place. I have been lucky enough to be seated in the middle which means constant attention from the waiter/ess. What does suck is that the tables are tiny. One time it was a little difficult for us to fit all of our food on the table for 4 people. Try the pork shoulder, the skewers are great, I enjoyed the sopa de tortilla, and the ceviche is okay. I definitely recommend you try the Arreglado. 

My over all suggestion: Food 3.5-4 stars, I'm not saying that it is bad, its pretty good. But it doesn't have that extra flavor kick that Limon Restaurant packs. If you have never been El Techo or Limon, I would suggest coming here first, then trying Limon on a later day. I wish I would have done it the other way to enjoy this place just a little more.
author: Leonel B.

description: One of my favorite spots in the city, the chicharrones are super tasty and flavorful. I also like the fried chicken and guacamole appetizer. The place gets pretty packed but it moves along quickly. Great spot to start before a night out in the mission
author: Robert L.

description: Great view from the rooftop.  Great place for afterhours drinks and mini bites.  We shared everything family style.  We really enjoyed the sangria (a tad too sweet) as well as the grilled foods.  Fresh guac was fairly tasty.  We ordered a platter of mixed BBQ to share and everything was incredibly flavorful.  Portions were generous.  The value could be a little better compared to other things in the area.
author: David C.

description: Great drinks and food. Tried the empanadas, all the skewers and the quesadillas. Everything excellent and attentive wait staff was on their game. Get there early as the wait can be brutal but totally worth it.
author: J R.

description:
4 stars for the view. Come on, when it's summer in winter, do you really care about anything else.

The drinks are fine. I'm not going here for a full dinner. Just snacks and drinks. And that, they executed very well.

You'll love it.
author: Shanee B.

description: Can't beat a rooftop bar with amazing margaritas!  Also very friendly staff.  I have yet to try their actual food menu (other than tortilla chips and guac, and the plantain chips, which were good), so I do not know if they accommodate gluten free. But, the bar is great.  Go early because it gets packed!
author: SinGlu V.

description: We stood in line there yesterday at 1 pm. The hostess needs training in customer service. She was very rude!  With all the restaurant in San Francisco, i guess they can afford to pick and choose their customers. We went around the corner to Lolo and received great customer service with our meal.
author: Debra I.

description: I love this place in Summer. I know some people might say it gets crowded, you cannot make a reservation, etc, etc. But I can't help it. It must be the combination of an outdoor terrace - quite unique in the indoors centered US restaurant scene - great Mexican/Latin themed menu, original space arrangement and a relaxed atmosphere. It's like instant vacation, once you're there you can feel detached from the city buzz, looking onto the rooftops and sipping one of their spicy, zesty drinks or huge prosecco glasses. Almost everything I had there was high quality and very well seasoned, though rather not for the dieting type. My preference goes to the chicharrones by weight plate, guacamole and their perfect ceviche with rounds of crunchy radish and a lot of lime. You can't go wrong with their food ($7 - $14) and drinks ($7 - $12).
author: Aga K.

description: Yum and beautiful spot. Must go! It's a little on the pricey side but the food is incredible and drinks are killer.
author: lucy c.

description:
Bad drinks, good food. 


Went for a friends' 21st birthday but was disappointed...


Good dessert.
author: Aimee R.

description:
I tried to like this place. I love the mixture of drinks and outdoor seating, especially at the rooftop.

However, the service here was extremely slow and the sangria sucked! Although the location was fancy, the koolaid that was served reminded me that I was in the ghetto. It took forever for the chips and guac to come out, i mean damn - do you got to slow cook that or something?? 

Anyways, we left and went to el farolito for some bomb ass burritos.
author: Dorian T.

description:
I'm just going to start out with my biggest complaint and get my rant over with. El Techo, I know the rooftop thing is new and everyone is flocking there. I understand that the servers are doing their best. But come on, get yourself organized. Things would be a lot smoother up there if you just had a better system going on. There is just too much confusion. The servers can't find their customers. The customers can't find their servers.  The servers don't know who is serving who. 

So, after waiting over 30 minutes and then finally getting our drinks, I will say that the drinks were pretty good.  We were going to order food but realized that if it takes 30 minutes to get a drink, we didn't want to know how long we would be sitting there hungry.
author: Jenny S.

description: Good food but the wine list didn't impress and it felt a little pricey overall for what we ultimately ordered. Also, way too noisy for my taste, making it tough to hear my dining companion.
author: Erin W.

description: Picky eater here : tacos were not only safe, but delicious!!!! Braised pork was to die for, thick corn shells, flavorful salsa with no big tomato or onion peices, and beans that were well pureed and flavorful- and all of this was in seperate containers so you can put together yourself! Excellent mimosa, and the view cannot be beat! What a great brunch spot!!!!
author: Meghan D.

description:
I've been coming here for the past couple of years and although I think the food is 'mehh' --- the atmosphere makes it worth coming back for me.

Atmosphere: 4-star
Even with a long line at their hostess table on the ground floor (sidewalk), you are bound to make it up to the terrace  in no time. Today (a Wednesday) we showed up around 6:45 pm and waited for ~20 minutes for the 'drinks & appetizers' seating (as oppose to formal dinning). When you go up to the terrace on a clear day the views to downtown SF are breathtaking. Add market lights and heating lamps, and you have your perfect hang out spot. On the down side, when the plastic walls of their tent come down the noise level increases exponentially. I came to Techo for a BIRTHDAY dinner once---  horrible idea. It was so rowdy that it was impossible to carry a conversation. It felt like we were having dinner inside a club. 

Food: 1-star
With Techo being more and more popular, I could assume that their food quality would drop, but today was an extra low.

- The guacamole ($7) was literally just smashed avocados. It lacked salt, tomatoes, cilantro, onions, garlic---all ingredients that I expect to get with my already marked-up guacamole. 
- The ceviche ($12) was all water. Not impressed by the dainty serving size and the lack of lemon. There were shrimp, tiny pieces of tomato, cilantro, and onion---but it needed flavor! 
- Jicama salad ($12) was just as bland as the two above. It had a salad dressing that looked promising but in the end tasted like water and avocado. Small pieces of jicama, thinly sliced radish, squares of avocado.
- No salsa with our appetizers. How can it be a Mexican tapas place with no side of salsa to add some spice/flavor to our already bland food? 
+ The only food order that I've had on other occasions that was filling, authentic, and well-seasoned was the pibil (seasoned pork). I'd order this over any appetizer, especially after today!
+ The drinks are handcrafted, really strong, and all together tasty. I mean, they hold the salt to the rim by using real grapefruits! 
+ Get a pitcher!!!! Individual drinks are around $12 so you are better off getting a pitcher ($21-34/pitcher) for ~ 5 people 


Conclusion: Good for drinks. Skip the appetizers!!
author: Marissa P.

description: So the wait staff is phenomenal but the table situation is ridiculously bogus. We came with a party of 11 girls. We tried to make a reservation and they said no. Why?!? Then my girlfriend was in line in plenty of time but we couldn't sit until everyone was there. Totally fine. I completely understand. But when we were all here they sat is at this freezing table where 4 of us had to stand. There were empty tables the ENTIRE TIME we were there!!!! Food was good, drinks were good, service was good, but making a reservation was totally bogus. Wtf.
author: Kristen L.

description: This place is great! The drinks and food are great! If you are looking for a place to get drinks with friends or a date in the mission, techo is where it's at. And the view is awesome.
author: Jesse A.

description:
One of my favorites in SF, cicharones de carne are the best!!! The corn tortillas and mole sauce are the subtle additions to a simple pork plate.

Food to share, marg pitchers for yourself (it's that good!)
author: Ezra T.

description:
Amazing drinks, amazing food, amazing venue.

Spotty service and douchey crowd (I say this as a non-douche of course.)
author: Cersei L.

description: Tasty food with a beautiful rooftop view, in the heart of the mission district. Perfect spot to enjoy a Sunday Funday..
author: Vanessa C.

description: I went here with 5 other friends while we were visiting friends who recently moved to San Francisco. We had many tasty margaritas, some guacamole and 5 of the total 6 split a pound of the chicharrones de carne, the ceviche and quesadilla de pibil. It was all delicious and accompanied by a wonderful view. Our service was great too! The first person we spoke to when looking for a table was clearly put off by the size of our group (not all of us where there right away either), but the rest of the servers and staff more than made up for any initial issues! We had an amazing time!
author: Sophia B.

description:
Pricey, but your happiness is worth it. 

The Chilcano (huamani pisco, lime, passion fruit, ginger, bitters; $10) was so delicious it made us swoon -- not because of the alcoholic content, mind you, although it was a satisfyingly stiff drink. The beignet with dulce de leche (~$14) made us want to throw flowers from the rooftop in celebration of humanity and desserts.
