Crowd was of the first date & trying hard to impress variety, but the atmosphere itself is relaxing. Fast, friendly service.
author: Abban L.

description: Great spot for drinks, inside or out. Rooftop has a fantastic view of downtown. Pitcher of sangria made for a great evening after biking through the city.
author: Charles H.

description:
The only thing I complained about was the lack of lighting! Thank God there was a full moon or else it would have been DARK on the rooftop! 

Split a bunch of skewers if you come with a group! I preferred the shrimp skewers but the chicken and chorizo ones were still very succulent and flavorful.

The ceviche is one of the best. period. Fresh and tangy! They give you chips to eat with it. 

Elote con queso was more like lollipops drenched in ecstacy for my taste buds! Even after I ate all the kernels, I still wanted to suck on the cob because the lime juice drenched on the cob was so intense. A MUST. 

Definitely make reservations and you will have an amazing time. Shout out to the heat lamps!
author: Adlyn S.

description: This was my first experience with El Techo and I was really excited as they had very high marks for food. We come just a little too late for brunch so we decided we had to stay and have a drink and admire the view. I ordered the La Paloma which was very tasty. I really like grapefruit flavor. Gerald my buddy had the Sangria. I'm not going to lie, there was nothing to it. No fruit no wine, no flavor.  I don't know it seemed like they had made it early in the day and it was left sitting and all the ice melted and they just added more to it.But we're not going to get that discourage us from coming back. I'm looking forward to go back with weekend for brunch and another la Paloma. Just have to convince Gerald that Sangria may not be the best choice for him.
author: AHodgee H.

description: Love this place. Great rooftop brunch location, with nice views of the city from the Mission. Nice bar bites, small plates and brunch options. Highly recommend the Quesadilla de Pibil or the Techo Rancheros! This place is typically packed on a warm, weekend brunch, but you can get a table pretty easily (not too much wait) and the crowd brings a lot of life to this great location.
author: David B.

description:
So I went in expecting to hate this place especially all the reviews, but I was surprised that the food was really good and the drinks were strong. I had the Chicharrones, the Shrimp skewers, the Jicama salad, and the Elotes. The Chicharrones were amazing, although they were different from what people in this City might be expecting but were amazing. The Shrimp skewers were amazing, we ordered one to start and it was so good we ordered a second. The Jicama salad, was the only one that wasn't very good. It was boring, but I normally hate Jicama so its just not my thing. The Elotes were very good although I do love Elotes when it's off the cob. Looking forward to trying other things on the menu, but the one thing I will always get from here on out is the Chicharrones which are amazing!

The Margarita Pitcher we got was very strong which I'm always a fan of. So no complaints on that front, and of course the view is one of the best in the City. I will be back soon!
author: Patrick H.

description:
Just did a little happy hour on the roof. It was excellent. Good food, nice drinks, fast service...and our waitress with the bunny shirt was muy buena. 
They had heaters running so good climate for outdoor sf restaurant...overall, definitely a step up from what medjool used to offer. def a pillar of the mission.
author: Roy N.

description: The best place ever! It had a great scenery and the food was amazing!!!! Probably better than my mom home cooked meal. And have hayley as you're server
author: James D.

description: Such good piña coladas and a nice view.
author: Kira G.

description: I've been here twice and am dying to go again.  First time as with a bachelorette party and we were able to be a little silly.  We had great drinks and took lots of pics of the view and the atmosphere.  Second time I went with my husband on a Saturday around 5 and it was just starting to get full.  We had great drinks again, but this time we had the Tortilla soup and the squash quesadilla and they were both fantastic.  Service was excellent.  Nice crowd.  Give it a shot.  You won't be sorry.  Bring a jacket just in case.
author: Jean C.

description: There was nothing that really stood out for me to make a point about. The food and drinks were ok, nothing to go crazy about. The service was a little bit slow. The two stars are for the outstanding view of the city.
author: Tommy M.

description: Nothing to get too excited about here. I concur with the reviews about the spotty service. I was expecting a lot more from this venue...
author: Alexandra F.

description: Great place to go and it has a great view.  Their portions are alright if you aren't going in such a big group.  It usually gets pretty crowded once it opens then the lines start going on for days.  The chips and guacamole are very delicious but there needs to be more chips to accommodate for their delicious guacamole.
author: Danny C.

description:
Rooftop restaurant bar? Cool. Good views of the SF urban skyline? Cool... Chorizo and chicharrónes? Now, we're talking!

This place has its ups and downs (not just in the elevator), but if you come here for the food, everything else will likely fall into place. It can get packed during certain hours (night and day!), so it's good to be a local boy. Never have been here for just a short time -- expect to stick around at least a few hours with some friends. Certain cocktails are pretty good, too -- even a pitcher of their Piña Colada is excellent.
author: Garett T.

description: cute place, love the roof. we did appetizers and drinks, will have to try out more main courses next time!
author: Nazee M.

description:
This place is bomb. We came here on a Tuesday evening at 6pm with a party of 5. It was crowded, but the staff here is incredibly accommodating and makes the area feel less overwhelming. Their cocktails are reasonably priced for the quality (I got the Margarita El Techo). 

Get the Carioca cocktail!! My friend got it so I tried a sip and it is amazing. Refreshing and full of flavor. He told me the avua amburana cachaça liquor in it is a Brazilian rum.
author: Harmony P.

description:
Great food , atmosphere and view,
Not long in the queue waiting and enjoyed a drink in their nearby bar prior to being text by the door person.
author: Graeme M.

description: Made a reservation the day before and when we showed up, they had no record of our reservation.  The hostess was most cordial and genuinely tried to help but could not give us a definitive time that we could be seated.  We waited over half an hour and finally got tired of waiting around so we walked down the street & found another place that seated us immediately.  Overall a very disappointing experience!
author: Steve W.

description:
+ Rooftop restaurant, perfect for a sunny day
+ Friendly service
+ Ceviche de mango
+ Lively atmosphere

It gets windy so bring a sweater.
author: K V.

description: This place was great. I went there on a first date, originally just for drinks but we ended up sitting down and eating as well. The food was awesome and our waitress was super accommodating. Drinking were reasonably priced and delicious. Rooftop is obviously great, mostly because it's one of the few in the city. Only problem is that I haven't heard back from the date!
author: Michael T.

description: Expect to wait in a long line, that will take you to a set of elevators to a great roof top bar. Enclosed with clear plastic walls and heaters, this place offers a great view of the city and some great food and drinks. You must try the chicharrones! The meat is melt in your mouth goodness and the tortillas are so fresh the must be made in house. I had the Paloma margarita which was very good and refreshing. We went here twice on our 1 week visit to sf
author: Lorraine R.

description: good for drinks and food... nice view of the city very pricey though for a good time haha... but thier drinks are good actually thier great the margaritas are smooth... we ordered abunch of food for everyone to share the carnitas tacos were bomb good flavor on the meat i give them props i didnt expect it to be so good honestly lol...the hueves rancheros were bomb
author: Rigoberto C.

description: This place is your typical hipster hangout but standing in line for 20 minutes just to get in is totally worth it. Once you get upstairs to the rooftop the view is amazing but I have never once been there when it is not packed. The best part of this place, aside from the view, is the food. Their guacamole is the best I have EVER had (and I am from So Cal). All of their appetizers are pretty affordable during happy hour and my favorite is the Quesadilla de Acelga- corn tortilla with oaxaca cheese and a ton of veggies and the Platano Maduro-  the most delicious fried plantains I have ever had . It's like an explosion of flavor in your mouth! This place gets extremely busy so I recommend reserving a table for dinner during happy hour so you can sit and enjoy your food.
author: Monica M.

description: This review is for the guacamole and the sangria only!  Both were amazing!  The best guac ever!  Love the rooftop vibe!
author: Kim J.

description: The service and drinks were good, and it has a great view. However if you plan on eating then you should go beforehand. They serve small dishes which is not a bad thing but they were not flavorful or worth the money in my opinion (save yourself some money).
author: Latavia K.

description: My friends and I had a lovely time tonight at El Techo. The kale and mushroom quesadillas are amazing! Our server Dean was so kind. He stopped be chatted with us whenever he had the opportunity. He was so gracious and so fun. It really made San Francisco feel like a small town. Thanks, Dean!
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Excellent chicken skewers and corn tapas. Tortilla soup a bit salty.

Pricey.

Great service.

Loud on a Thursday night.
author: Inigo M.

description:
For a place with good drinks, it can sure leave a bad taste in your mouth.  The menu advertises pitchers of margaritas for $31.  The waiter gives you a choice of 3 variations (not shown on menu).  When your bill comes, you fine that the Mezcal variation you agreed to was priced $45 (not shown on menu).  Come on, guys... no one likes to be misled.  If you want to be a great spot, you've got to be better than this.

Great rooftop, with effective heaters (whew!), and has a great vibe.  Good looking crowd.  Not too loud, but great activity and I dig the mix of gay, straight, couples, and groups of friends who were passing the evening.  

I'll be back, but the trust is broken, El Techo.  The drinks (and cash) will no longer flow so easily.
author: Drew C.

description:
Love the view! Warning - during "happy hour" there's standing room only if you get here around 6 or later and you're not having dinner. Service is also slow in the "happy hour" area. (I place quotations around "happy hour" because they don't have one where they cut prices - it's just their normal menu with normal prices and with snacks.)

Update: I went there again with my friends and we told the servers we wants "drinks and snacks." There was only one small table available in the happy hour area, too small for our party of four. We went back to the servers and told them we would have dinner. They seated us in the open area next to the happy hour high tables (not as much of a view, but a lot more room), and gave us the same menu as the happy hour area. So, essentially, if you're going to eat something - be it guacamole and ceviche or their pork - you can tell them you're there for dinner and have a lager table.
author: S O.

description: Last night I waited an hour and a half for a table here, but it's always worth it. Amazing view of the city, great outdoor atmosphere and awesome food. It's best if you order a few things for the table, and a pitcher!
author: Laura M.

description:
El Techo de Lolinda has a phenomenal view of San Francisco, and its distinction as the city's only rooftop bar make it worth a visit. However, at the end of the day is the view really better than what you'd get for free from Dolores Park? The ambience here is trendy, trendy, trendy. If you're young and in the SF tech industry, you'll see a lot of your friends here!

Food here is decent, with a good selection of tacos, quesadillas, kababs, and other snacks. If you're looking for a full meal to write home about, though, be sure to check out the real Lolinda restaurant downstairs. Service is somewhat slow, even for a rooftop bar. Drinks are on the pricey side ($10 for a margarita, $7 for most beers). But I guess the trendy rooftop ambience is really what you're paying for. In all, this is a great spot for groups and especially for folks who are new to the Mission or San Francisco generally. I wouldn't recommend this place to locals, though, simply because of the higher price point and slower service.
author: David P.

description: This place was awesome. Long wait on a Saturday night and they don't take reservations but the wait was worth it! Awesome food, friendly staff, great ambiance, and beautiful views of the city especially at sundown. Highly recommend!
author: Becca S.

description: A fun way to spend a Friday night. Good drinks on a rooftop with views of the best city. The vibe was really cool and fun. I didn't try any food while I was there but let me tell you, if you're looking for a dessert, the Dulce de Leche Flan was perfect!! It's a smaller serving than I expected but it is rich and bursting with flavor. Totally worth it!!
author: Kelley H.

description: We've stopped by this place a few times for dinner and drinks. We have never had to wait longer than 15 minutes to be seated, so that's always good in my book. The rooftop is a nice feature to have while enjoying the meal. The fried chicken is so good! Best thing on the menu, in my opinion. Will be back again, for sure!
author: R T.

description: Good food, our waitress went on break halfway through getting our order, and they forgot our 4th persons meal. Go for their margaritas at happy hour and view!
author: Evan D.

description:
Very Google. Standing room only. Great view.

But if I'm just here for drinks why can't I walk up to the bar and order?
author: martin l.

description:
I've been here probably about 10 times so far. It's just an easy place to walk in and grab dinner (even when packed to the gills) and the food/drinks are wonderful and not super expensive.

The chicken skewers, shrimp ceviche and elote are all terrific. Hot chocolate is great, as is their shaved ice dessert. Oh, and the tortilla soup is really good too. So are the chips and guacamole. You really can't go wrong in this place.

I get cold very easily and am not hugely into Mexican food, so a rooftop bar that serves Mexican food isn't something I'd normally want to do. I have gone here multiple times in a single week. Sometimes two days in a row. It's that good. As others have noted, the rooftop location is beautiful and rare in SF.
author: Zika R.

description: Love this place! Came here with my favorite people for brunch. Wonderful rooftop bar!
author: Lisa H.

description: The extremely rude service and absurd wait here has inspired me to leave my first review. They were "at capacity" but didn't tell anyone waiting outside for over an hour. They let in random people off the street instead of the people in line. 100 people left the establishment, but no one from line got to go inside. Apparently, they have good drinks, but I or the 50 other people in line won't find out tonight.
author: Gordon D.

description: Ideal. Came here for 4 friends on a Saturday night. We ordered two pitchers of La Paloma's and one pound of chicharrones - which was one of the best things I have ever eaten in my entire life. Incredible! The atmosphere was beautiful, and the rooftop views were even more stunning.. especially as we got there just in time to see the pink sunset. The music was light, it was packed but it was a great experience. I will absolutely go back next time I'm in SF!
author: Nikki S.

description: I have been to this place twice for dinner. The view on the city is fantastic. Half of the roof is for bar/drinks area and the other is for seated dinner. They have heat lamps for the cold or windy evening which was definitely greatly appreciated. The food and drinks are very good as well. The only thing is that they do not accept reservations for dinner so you gotta go earlier if you are with a group!
author: Romain D.

description: This is the first rooftop bar I've been to in SF and the views are awesome! We really enjoyed the Pina Coladas as well as the chips and guacamole! The service was perfect.
author: H K.

description: LOVED this place!!! Love it. The food is unbelievable- the pork is falling off the bone (a little fatty though). The desserts are incredible- I recommend a shot of good whiskey in your hot chocolate:). Everything we had was delicious and we sampled a lot. Get your name on the list to eat on the rooftop!! It's heated for those "warm" San Francisco evenings! Great city view.
author: Liza S.

description:
I loved it!!! Came here with 2 girlfriends for a chill dinner and was surprise by how excellent the food was. Everything was flavorful and perfectly cooked. Definitely get the chuzos (beef skewers) and the chicarrones de carne (tortillas, fried pork shoulder, beans and salsa). Sangria was just okay.. I like cha cha cha's better

A rooftop restaurant was a new and unique experience and there are heated lamps so don't have to worry about being cold. 

I wish there was better street parking available but there is a parking structure a block and half away so not too bad. $4/hr after 6pm.

Service was efficient and friendly. We got seated right away around 645pm (only a few tables left at that time) which was lucky because it got packed quickly after. 

Pricing is a bit higher than expected for Mexican food but I was so satisfied with the food that I didn't care. Portions were fairly big and we all left stuffed and happy!
author: A. Z.

description: Great views, great food, great margaritas, and even better during a Giants game because there is no wait!
author: Jackie M.

description:
The ceviche gave me food poisoning. I had a miserable two days after visiting this place. I won't get into the graphic details, but let's just say it was a traumatic experience.

Otherwise the service was standard and the view is amazing. However, I value my life, so I will not be going back.
author: Kevin K.

description:
Went here for drinks with the lady after a nice dinner. After reading a few other reviews I am deferring to more in depth articles on the vibe except for my waiter review! 

Loved my waiter felix, who was smooth and fun at the same time- big points on the service. 

Cheers
author: grant W.

description: Pretentious place that won't let you meet your friend unless they tell the host. That doesn't work if your friend's phone died. Obnoxious policy.
author: victoria s.

description: Best carnitas I've ever had! Melt-in-your-mouth incredible. Fantastic view, atmosphere, and service. Highly recommend.
author: Lauren L.

description: Long line, subpar food and service would not recommend. The view was nice but not amazing.
author: Alfonso G.

description: Got seated right away, everyone was so pleasant the entire time. Great prices on happy hour margaritas and got the pork shoulder that literally fell apart (in the best way) overall could not have asked for a better experience. The view was to die for. So Shoutout to the waiters suggestions that were both delicious and affordable will definitely be back soon!
author: Britney E.

description:
on first look we saw the restaurant downstairs and were convinced this place was too fancy for us, then we realized- alas! the upstairs is different!  thankfully on a wednesday at 7pm there was no line but we managed to snag one of the last tables on the rooftop- the views were beautiful, the margaritas made them better.

we tried the pork shoulder quesadilla, the guacamole (holy moly!), the chorizo sandwich with chimichurri sauce and a couple of other dishes.  everything was amazing, although the meat empanadas were just ok.  margs were pretty good but nothing spectacular.

came back later for just drinks but couldn't get served since it was SO crowded. this is definitely a hotspot but a great place to take people who are visiting since it has great views of the city. also ask my friend george about doc's clocks across the street.
author: Reyana F.

description: How did I not know about this place ? I recently went here with some fellow co-workers after work. Easy to get to but also easy to miss if you didn't know about it. I ordered a piña colada and chips n guac . The piña colada was awesome !! I actually ended up asking for salsa which was so tasty! The rooftop bar is great with an amazing view of the city. I gotta visit here soon again !
author: Rosa V.

description: Great happy hour, you can't beat a rooftop bar on a nice day in SF. I only had appetizers, but tables around us were having meals and they looked good. Margaritas are strong and delicious. Had guacamole and chips too, those were great to share and tie us over until dinner. We got there pretty early, and it filled up as happy hour progressed, so I'd recommend getting there earlier if you have a larger group.
author: Theresa M.

description: Came here based on the recommendation of a host at Foreign Cinema.  We didn't know what to expect but decided to give it a go.  It was a Tuesday night around 730pm and they were busy!  Open seating but we got really lucky with a table with an amazing view of the city and Mission district!  The servers were friendly, attentive and their recommendations were on point: ceviche, chicken tenders, carnitas tacos, and mixed drinks... so good.  We had so much fun here that we didn't even notice the place had an open rooftop until midway through our dinner.  Great place to take a date.  I highly recommend it here.
author: Randy N.

description: The margaritas are STRONG! And for 31 bucks a pitcher they very well should be. We came in with a group of 7 on a Friday night so waited over an hour for a table. Luckily we were able to get started at a standup only table to order appetizers and drinks. The guacamole is to die for. You can't go wrong in ordering any of the appetizers. We tried them all.  Plus the lovely view gives this place the extra magic touch.
author: Lizette M.

description: This place is too crowded and chaotic but it is indeed one of the best Mexican food in California.  Decent prices and good portion size. The line is always long but moves quick.  Finding a place to sit is another matter.
author: Gus K.

description: One of my top favorite places in the city! You can go just for drinks, which are soooo delicious, or go there sit down eat and drink! The food is also on point! The chicharrones are a must... Overall an excellent.
author: meli f.

description: I've been here twice and each time the bouncer has let groups go in before me while I wait and wait. This last time, our group got seated by the staff and what I assumed to be the floor manager at the time asked us to get up because the table was not for us... Rude. We got lucky and found another table and had to move our own chairs over because no one was helpful enough to do so. It then took about 15 minutes before anyone came to take our order and when we did order, the only hungry person in our group never got her sandwich because they didn't put the order in and they wouldn't do anything about it since the kitchen was closed... An hour before closing at 11pm. The server made it up to her by offering a free drink but when the bill came, there was an extra order of empanadas that nobody ordered. All in all it was a petty horrible experience. Would not recommend.
author: Benny T.

description: Drinks are generally  better than the food, but what you really come for is the atmosphere and the views. Pretty solid all around, neither outstanding nor particularly disappointing, although even with the heat lamps it can get pretty chilly at night (go figure). Service can be spotty, especially when it's busy, and it's not cheap, but still solid enough to be one of my go-to bars in the hood.
author: Rebecca L.

description: Went to El Techo de Lolinda for a Saturday brunch yesterday.  This place is awesome.  The location is killer -- rooftop with amazing SF views.  They provide awnings so you aren't stuck in the sun.  There were 3 of us and we started with the guacamole and chips, which were DELICIOUS.  The guacamole had quite a bit of lime juice in it, which was refreshing and wonderful -- very very very very good.  The chips were fresh made and perfect in every way -- just the right consistency and tons of flavor.  We had the matambre (fabulous steak) and the pork and vegetarian quesadillas.  They called the quesadillas "small plates" but wow, they were huge and DELICIOUS.  Again, full of flavor.  I love it when a restaurant focuses on flavor.  This is a new favorite and I can't wait to go back.  This is a very fun place -- great hip vibe.
author: Thomas M.

description:
Unfortunately the view wasn't as stellar as it could have been, because I was here on a dreary day. If the sun would have been out I might have rated this place higher.

The food was better than average, but it didn't blow me away. We ordered the Ceviche de Camaron, which was light and refreshing. The shrimps were cut into pretty big chunks. Personally, I prefer them in smaller pieces, so they're easier to eat on a tortilla chip, but it was still pretty good. We also got the Empanada de Alambre, but that, sadly, was a bit underwhelming. It just lacked personality, and the flavor was kind of flat. We capped off the order with the Carne, Pollo, and Chorizo skewers. The best of the bunch was the beef skewer. The meat was tender and juicy, and full of flavor. A bit on the small side, but tasty. The chicken was next. Also, tender and flavorful. The chorizo, on the other hand, had a sort of a strange flavor and was a little on the dry side. 

Points for having Pacifico on tap. And like I said, if you're here on a clear, warm day, the patio will probably be awesome. I'd say it's probably only worth it on nice days. Just make sure you arrive before the dinner rush, because even on the dreary day I was here, it got very crowded not long after we were seated.
author: Don W.

description:
pros:
we got some watermelon mimosas!! their cornbread is perfect!
the poached eggs as well! we also got the chicharrones; not bad!

cons:
super small tables (it was 2 of us)
seats were uncomfortable
author: Karla ..

description: Great rooftop bar in the Mission! Heat lamps are a major plus. Drinks & food were all really great - the quesadilla was great, and you can't go wrong with guacamole/chips.
author: Sheena S.

description:
Awesome spot! 

First, I want to say that the host, Felix, is the best. He is kind, accommodating, and very funny! I look forward to seeing him every time I go to Techo.

Now... The menu is killer, and you can't beat the view. It could even be freezing outside and you'd never know it because of the tenting and heaters they have set up

As far as the menu goes, you have to order a Caparena to drink - they are amazing. I wouldn't discourage you from ordering anything on the menu - you can't go wrong! The must-have items to order are: ceviche, any of the skewers, and chicharrones de carne.  The only reason i didn't give it 5 stars is because the most recent time we went, the chicharrones de carne was more fatty than normal, and you pay by the pound, so it was a little bit of a waste of money.
author: Hannah C.

description: If you're a roof top bar fan like me then you will love this place! The food is decent and the drinks of course are delicious. It is a little on the expensive side but you get an amazing view of the San Fran skyline provided that it's a nice night out. There really is no need to come here for a full fledged meal, I honestly think it's better to come here for a couple drinks absorb the view then head out to the mission for the rest of the night. If there are other awesome roof top bars please let me know because this is the only one I know of.
author: Gautam T.

description: BEST FRIED CHICKEN EVER! Amazing chicharron (which is more like carnitas)  Great drinks. Great service. AMAZING view. Good for any weather. It's very noisy, so be prepared to yell conversations. Haha! And extremely reasonably priced! Our go-to hang out spot!
author: Priscila A.

description:
El Techo came as a highly recommended place to have dinner - we went as a small group on a Tuesday night and we not disappointed - we were sat right away - the view of the city can not be explained - the night lights, Bay bridge - Priceless - we had the quasadilla pibil, guacamole, chicharones de carne and finished with alfadores and hot chocolate
Our waitress was Great!! Busboy could use a "manners" class  
We will recommend to our family & friends and return again to eat
author: Aida C.

description: Great views of the city!! Great to take visitors to watch the sunset and have some grapefruit margaritas. Service is ok nothing spectacular and the desserts are a skip. The tacos are very very good and the quesadilla was bomb.
author: Z W.

description: Rooftop bar is awesome! It's hard to find a nice outside spot like this with such great views where you're not freezing your ass off. They have heat lamps and plastic tents which is nice.
author: Laura M.

description: This place is a find, the carnitas are awesome and I love the roof top dining area, but it is very busy. The margaritas are also awesome along with the many versions of eggs benedicto with spicy sauces. I thought the service was also excellent and I don't usually give five stars but this place deserves it for sure. By the looks and quality of the food you would think you are in the heart of Mexico CIty. Wow I was Wowed!
author: Peter A.

description: One of my favorite bars in the mission. Drinks are good and so is service, but this place is all about the views! Haven't tried any of the food or small plates yet.
author: Ronnie S.

description: Partially biased but theres something about unseasoned pork that bothers me and the salsa was sweet Ive been in mexico and flavor profile there or in south america (i an from Ecuador) is more on the salty side and Ive tried dominican puerto rican versions for chicharron so the food was FLAT I dont plan to come back bc more than views and waiters I go for food .. if you are into well seasoned food avoid this place!
author: Estefania S.

description:
sf has been in dire need of a rooftop bar! It has heat lamps and tents so don't let the weather scare you! They have great sangria and a pretty view of downtown.

Order the Sangria Pitcher! so yummy!
Not too fancy but not too casual attire.
author: Yas G.

description: Best brunch in the city ever!! I love brunch and I have to say El Techo is by far one of my favorites. Everything we ordered was amazingly delicious including the drinks. We went to El Techo on a sunny afternoon and the view was gorgeous. The service was fantastic also. I really want to come back for happy hour oneday!
author: Poonam P.

description: The food is just ok but you're here for the view. Sometimes it is such a pain to get into. The bouncer told us about a 20 minute wait for what turned out to be an hour and a half. I much prefer to come here at odd times, drink the sangria and enjoy the sun but then try elsewhere for dinner.
author: Christine H.

description: Wonderful spot for an evening drink and/or dinner. Great view of the SF skyline and fantastic food. Minus one star because it took our waitress 15 minutes to come over to our table, but after that everything was excellente.
author: Kaitlyn H.

description: Great food and drinks with an amazing view! I would recommend El Techo to anyone visiting San Francisco, or really anyone who wants to enjoy happy hour with a stunning sunset view of the city. Service can be a little slow at times, but the staff is very friendly.
author: Telmo D.

description: Worst bar experience ever! My friend was visiting from out of town and this place was suggested to us for her to see a great view of the city. After waiting in line we finally got upstairs excited to try a paloma. We tried to get waitress's attention several time and she completely ignored us. Then after about 20mins of waiting she comes and takes the order of the people next to us who arrived about 15 mins after us. I waited to see if she would then take our order and finally she asked if she could get us anything. I said we're gonna leave and she says, "good." Ridiculous! Worst customer service ever. Will never come back here!
author: Cammie W.

description: Great view and great selection of drinks! Go here to relax and enjoy a beer in the sun! It does get a bit cold if there is heavy wind, so bring an extra sweater!
author: Jens G.

description:
The food was good and the view was nice, but the line was absurd.

The chicharones was very good and more pork shoulder than fat/skin. This was the best item on the menu I sampled. The margarita with the mescal was also good if you like your drink smoky. All the small plates I tried were decent, but none of these rocked my world or 're-defined' Mexican food for me. There are other places that serve similar quality food that I would give 4 stars to because they don't have the line.
author: Keith S.

description:
Food was good. Got the pork shoulder, beignet, empanadas, and steak. Pork shoulder had a lot of fatty parts but came with delicious sauces and tortilla. Beignets were so fluffy. Empanadas were just ok. Steak was tender. Steak came with fried eggs and little potatoes. Eggs were too cooked. I like the yolk runny but this was well cooked. Little potatoes were yummy. 

Cool hip spot with nice views of downtown. But man this place is super loud. So strange that the dining is on the roof of the building yet the noise level is so high. Maybe sound bounces off the see thru tents.
author: Gir G.

description: Love love  love  this place...   best  (chicharones)  really carnitas I've had in a long time... busy on Tuesday but got fast service.  Flautas a small plate made only for me but I shared, were done perfect.  I will be coming back more often even though I'm at Parkmerced area to try the rest.
author: Oscar V.

description: I enjoyed how much of the city you are able to see. Restaurant was good but customer service needs work. It started when I ordered a margarita with gold tequila, and the bartender drearily responded with a snide "Sir, this is a bus, get off or I'm calling the police". Food was good.
author: Mark W.

description: Besides the fact that my car window got smashed the night I came here and the time before that a man in the Mission showed off his "package" in broad daylight on my way to El Techo for drinks. Ahh the Mission. Nevertheless, the food and drinks are great. I LOVE the rooftop especially on beautiful summer days, the food is from the same Chef as Lolinda downstairs and it is AMAZING. I'm obsessed with the empanadas!
author: Ennie L.

description:
Service: attentive, friendly, unobtrusive.

Setting/ambience: beautiful spot, great view, semi-communal seating at some tables which is fine for me, might not be for everyone.

Food/drinks: I tried the ceviche, guacamole and the clara scramble and had a la paloma cocktail. Great flavours, chunky-limey-delicious guacamole, ceviche not the greatest I've had but fresh, clara scramble egg whites a bit greasy but rest of the plate made up for it by far - firm veggies, outstanding hot sauce (and I am very fussy about eggs). Great cocktail.

Recommend highly and would go back.
author: Odette L.

description:
I will preface this review with - in all the 3 decades of my existence, tonight was my first NYE event and boy, what an epic let down. The event was featured in sosh and a dear friend suggested we scope the venue out. With zero expectations, how can anything go wrong, right?

The venue itself, beautiful. You have a view of the Bay Bridge and the awesome fireworks show. We paid $100 for unlimited apps and drinks featured on their menu for the night. Get this, although unlimited, you really need to consider how many platters and how often they actually serve these hors devours. Same goes for the drinks. After 12:15, no server was seen in sight. You practically had to beg for a drink, come to find that the only alcohol available was champagne. I'm definitely not a fan of the brut. The flyer featured the event to go from 9PM to 1AM. Lastly, the music. God, the awful music. I've never felt so inclined to write a review because of bad music at 0342 New Years Day! DJ Just time? Just thyme? I am no DJ by all means, but I know a good DJ has the crowd dancing hard halfway into his set and all the way to closing time. A DJ should also have social skills - he should be able to look up and see what vibe the crowd is giving off when dishing out the jams. The hardest song the crowd banged its dancing feet to was Beyonce's Partition; 1 of maybe 4 mainstream songs the whole night! His favorite featured song of all time - no one knew, no one cheered, and the dancing floor crowd was consistently not dancing. And the cherry on top, he was the only DJ for the night! What?! Who booked this fool anyway? This guy was off the stage by 12:40. 

Utterly disappointed. No thanks El Techo. You have my $$; I'm not coming back. Lolinda itself is a different story. We were home well before 1. 

Make the best of 2015 Yelp world! Happy New Year!
author: Denise N.

description: Possibly the best view in the Mission. Good food and drinks. Great happy hour place. Get there EARLY, because there will be a line if it's even slightly nice out.
author: Mike F.

description:
Just stopped in for brunch today, and had an amazing experience!  Best meal Ive had all week!  We ordered the jicama salad (what dressing is that?  so good!), ceviche, chicharrones, kale quesadilla, and chimichurri potatoes.  Everyone was really happy with the food, and the potatoes were salty garlic deliciousness!  

It was a saturday afternoon so obvi the place was packed, but we made reservations so we were sat immediately.  Service was great, and so was the music.  Between the food and the view, this is my new favorite brunch spot!

There was a huge line outside, so def. make reservations in advance!
author: CC C.

description: The carnitas are amazing! Good drinks and good food. The rooftop atmosphere is always a good time. Plus you get a nice view of the city.
author: Ramon R.

description:
3 words: GO EAT HERE! aside from beautiful views, lively atmosphere, and great service, you'll have delicious food! Wifey and I decided to try this place out since we wanted something different for a Friday night and was were blown away!
For starters, you'll enter a building and wait for an elevator like waiting for a ride at Disneyland (measles free Disneyland) ;)
After taking a short ride upstairs, you'll start to hear the lively crowds like entering a award show minus the red carpet treatment
The wait for 2 people on a Friday night wasn't bad so getting a table was semi-quick (we went at 6:30pm) i know when we left (8pm) it was packed like sardines in a tin-can
My wife ordered a Margarita and I had the "Tres Amigos" consisting of a shot, chaser, and a beer which to me was awesome sauce! 
After looking at their small menu, we decided to get the following items:
1. Ceviche - 5 stars (shrimp was fresh and acidity was on point) comes with fresh chips to dip
2. Fried chicken thighs with sauce to dip - 5 stars (I do not know what that concoction "crack" sauce is, but it was "ohmygodletmehavesomemoreplease" sauce)
3. Pork Chicharron - 10 stars (5 stars is the limit, but this blew our mind!) when Chicharron comes to mind, it just fried skins, but this was far from it granted it did have some fried skins, but it had pork that makes you wanna slap you mama. Man, it was good! To accompany it with fresh, hot tortillas, black beans and killer salsa, you got yourself the best taco in this open world! 
4. To top it off, we got the cookies, and hot chocolate - 5 stars (we don't often get dessert, but the food was so good we needed to try another dish) cookies was divine  and dangerous. The hot chocolate (Mexican dark) was so effin good! That dessert was perfect to cap our dinner

If we had a 3rd stomach, we would've tried everything in my opinion ;) so if you are looking to have great food + great atmosphere + great drinks + great views, this is the place to be! 

YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED!!
author: Sophana T.

description:
First, this review is for their BRUNCH (as opposed to dinner/tapas, which I hear is good but I've never tried myself). 

With that preface, this is definitely a great find! Not many places have rooftop restaurants with cool views, sunshine and a vibrant mood -- not to mention the good food. This place makes me feel like I'm on vacation - colorful tiles, open air bars, cocktails by the pitcher and sunshine in the Mission. What more could you ask for!? The food is yummy -- kind of a unique Mexican inspired take on brunch. Benedicts made with jalapeño cornbread, huevos rancheros, and really good guacamole. I came away a big fan and have been back twice since. The bloody mary wasn't my fave, but the other cocktails like the Paloma and Margarita, both of which are available by pitcher, are great! There is a lot of really great food in the mission, and I don't know if I can say it is THE best, but it is really solid and the environment is unbeatable. Overall, awesome place. Great for anyone wanting a fun brunch in the Mission, and perfect for breakfast with out of town guests to show off the city!
author: Katherine D.

description:
What's the point of a rooftop restaurant that has all the seating areas completely tented in even though the weather is beautiful? What little view we might have had was completely distorted by thick poly sheeting.

The food was pretty good, I'll give it that. The chicharonnes were amazing, and the corn on the cob was no slouch either.

Service was OK too.

My big complaint? It was incredibly loud. This has more to do with the timing of our visit (8:30pm on a Thursday), but the place was packed with shrill early 20's girls all trying to out-shriek each other. My throat hurts from having to yell across the tiny table my wife and I were sitting at. 

If we had the time we'd try again earlier in the evening on a Tuesday or something...
author: Mister S.

description: I love rooftops bars and El Techo de Lolindas has one of the best of SF. If you were walking by on the streets, you would never know it's there unless someone told you about it. Tapas were good and server was on point. I can't wait to go back.
author: Tone P.

description: Don't come here. Awesome view.... But drink and eat before you come here. Servers are extremely snobby and inconsiderate. Came here and it took 20 minutes for my groups waitress to take our order, and another 35 to actually receive our order. Very disappointed, the staff didn't seem at all concerned and when I voiced my complaint they snickered at us.
author: Vanessa A.

description:
While the food service is a bit slow (even at a late hour), I really liked the food.  In my party there were two former Texans who know good Mexican food.  We both approved...

I would recommend the ceviches, quesadillas, and the tortas.  Not a poor dish in the house.

Views to downtown are not as good as expected as windows are either too translucent or not cleaned to provide the degree of view the restaurant could have. 

Parking is a mess.  

Nevertheless, I will unquestionably be back.
author: Anon M.

description: This place is really nice on a rooftop. The ambiance is so chill and a perfect place to have dinner. Me and my girls enjoyed the drinks and the shrimp. You wont regret coming here. The ceviche is super good as well.
author: Evelyn H.

description: We had just gotten off an early morning flight and our hosts took us to El Techo for brunch. I loved that the restaurant has an open air roof top to take advantage of the mid-November beautiful weather. We started with a pitcher of margaritas and some fresh guacamole. I ordered the Techo Rancheros. The pork was so delicious and the dish was not greasy - everything tasted fresh and it was such a nice atmosphere eating in the open air.
author: Annette U.

description: Delicious appetizer small plates croquetas and spinach empanadas were amazing. Pork chop wasn't my favorite, but get the churros to make up for anything you didn't like. They are the best.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
I don't write reviews often, but Felix (the host) was so great that our table unanimously decided to rave on Yelp. Came here for the first time last week and the food and views are amazing. Will definitely come back!

PS. This was a great place for vegetarians and carnivores alike. We felt like there were lots of options for everyone.
author: Sarah W.

description: Great view, music and atmosphere. The la palombo pitcher did not really contain much alcohol. The food looked pretty ok. Perfect place to relax in a Sunday afternoon.
author: Chris S.

description:
I don't know if I was just really hungry or slightly tipsy from the pre-dinner marg, but this meal sticks out in my mind as one of the most enjoyable I've had in in the city.

We ordered the chicharrones--perfectly cooked and seasoned, came with a delicious black bean sauce and the best corn tortillas I've ever had (the only corn tortilla I think I could eat by itself). Half a pound was enough for two people but I could eat those little meat nuggets for hours.

We also got the pork shoulder quesadilla, which was good but a little bland. 

The fried plantain was delicious and covered in the perfect mixture of salt and sugar. 

For dessert, we had the alfajores (which are little cookie sandwiches of dulce de leche that came with hot chocolate). The cookies were perfect and the hot chocolate was literally just melted chocolate and milk, but I thought it was a little unnecessary at the end of a filling meal.

We had great service--everyone was super friendly and our food came out quickly. It is definitely frustrating to have to wait in line and then wait to get seated at an actual table, but in my opinion the ambiance and the food are worth it.
author: Julia T.

description: My boyfriend and I came here on a rainy SF night, and it was a beautiful view. The food was great, we had pork tacos (?) or something of the like... very tasty. We also had a pitcher of a tequila drink, I think it was called  "Paloma" - all in all, it was a good experience, and I would definitely return!
author: Cris C.

description: A very nice Rooftop for a nice view on the city. Good cocktails and original food. The price is correct, according to the prestation. Don't worry you can go when it's cold as there is some heaters.
author: Mathieu F.

description: Stopped here on a visit to San Fransisco for brunch with my family and we were very pleased. We made a reservation for 1 pm and we definitely needed it. It was a beautiful day and the rooftop quickly got crowded after we sat down. As someone from out of town the view from the rooftop was awesome! A very unique experience. We were starving so we started with the chícharron, empanadas, quesadilla de Pibil And the mango jicama salad. All were good. The chícharron was very different than what we were thinking we could get, crispy, but not very, and they were very meaty, a pleasant surprise.  The empanadas and The quesadilla were both a bit too greasy. For my entree I ordered the techo rancheros, lolindas take on huevos rancheros and it was good, again very different. The meat was flavorful and the tortilla crispy but they used navy beans instead of black or pinto beans which I was expecting. But it was good. One complaint I had was that I saw my dish sitting out for a bit before I was served so it wasn't warm, which was disappointing. For drinks I ordered the Bersa 95; pisco, dolin blanc, pineapple, lemon, sparkling rose which was amazing!!! One of my favorite drinks over ever had not too sweet and a little tart. Highly recommended! I also got the michealada which was okay it could have been more flavorful. Overall this place is worth a stop, for the views, unique food and great drinks.
author: Carolina B.

description: Delicious food!! Great ambiance, beautiful view of the city from the top! Make sure to make reservation first before going because it tends to get really crowded. I went for lunch, I will def be going for dinner time :)
author: J ..

description: Good food. Nice view. Long lines and they don't take reservations over phone. But fun overall if you have time and arrive early.
author: R V.

description: Came to El Techo de Lolinda for dinner and drinks on a Tuesday night at 7pm. The roof was filling up but was no wait for a table for two. The rooftop atmosphere was perfect (great music, lively but not too loud, incredible views) and the heat lamps kept us warm on a chilly SF evening. The server explained the menu and answered all of our questions and provided great recommendations for dinner. My date and I ended up sharing a pitcher of sangria, guacamole, and three skewers of chuzos (carne, camarones, and pollo). At the servers suggestion, we got the tortillas, lime, and salsa to turn our chuzos into build-your-own tacos. It was a perfect amount of food for two people. I will definitely be back to El Techo de Lolinda.
author: Angela C.

description: Friend: "techo is roof".....WAIT, the roof of Lolinda the restaurant! I get it! It took me awhile for the stars to align but the name is pretty cute and catchy. This rooftop bar is located above the restaurant Lolinda. We came to this bar after dinner at Foreign Cinema. There was a bit of a wait outside to get in on a Saturday night. After about 15-20 mins, we finally got in. No cover; yay I love how chill SF bars are. You take this elevator up to the "Pent House" area, which is essentially the rooftop bar. To the left looked like more tables/seats for a sit-down meal. To the right looked more like just the bar area; so we walked toward the right and found a table. We waited for a waiter to come and take our order. We ordered the El Techo Margarita pitcher; that stuff was strong and almost tasted like roasted chipotle pepper. It was odd and quite difficult to down for a few of us in the group. Bad choice of drink and also pricey as heck. With tax that one pitcher cost us $55. Ridiculous! I wouldn't come back here when there are much better dive bars and cutesy hipster lounges scattered all over SF.
author: Angela H.

description: This was our second visit and it definitely warranted for a 5star review! No reservations on a Sunday morning for brunch in SF worried me, but we were seated promptly with a view of the street. Coffee was good and food was even better! We both ordered the techo rancheros, one veg and one techo. We were both very happy with our decision, and our waitress, Katrina was so cute and attentive! She was prompt when we needed something but not overbearing or pushy like most brunch on a Sunday morning. Thanks Katrina!
author: Bryan H.

description: Love the rooftop/patio set up with decent view. There are seatings with a covered IR heating and there are some that are just open with outdoor heaters. The kitchen was closed by the time we got there so we ended up having beers. The cocktails menu looks pretty good too so I'd come back to try it.
author: Kristina K.

description:
Visited this spot while in town from LA. Food is meh. Music so-so...couldn't really hear it though. Rooftop is cool.  Parking is a NIGHTMARE! There's valet, but it was full...finally found parking on mid 21st street up the block in a parking garage. The only reason this place gets two stars instead of one is because of FELIX at the door! FELIX is the BEST part of El Techo de Lolinda!

FELIX...you are amazing! Enjoyed chatting with you...definitely the best part of el techo and you weren't even on el techo haha :) besos.
author: Selena S.

description: The view was incredible! It would be awesome on a nice day. The food was great! I went with 4 friends and we got guacamole, ceviche, one and a half pounds of chicarrones de carne, the margarita pitcher, Paloma pitcher, and the sangria pitcher. It was enough to fill everyone up :). The service was a little off, but it was a great experience over all. This is definitely a great hangout spot for the view and great food.
author: Jen C.

description: Came here with my brother and we ordered 6 kabobs of chicken and steak. After about 30 mins of waiting they brought back shrimp in stead of chicken. Then it took them another 30 mins to finally bring out the correct order. About 1 hour waiting!.. Service was horrible... And I honestly think the waiter  took down my credit card information because about couple days after, fraud transactions were made on my card. I never use my card and don't have any monthly payments for anything. I just use it for amazon purchases mostly. Only this one time I used it because I was in the city. Maybe the waiter got pissed because we didn't get what we want and it made it hard for him?!!? Can't trust this place.
author: Behzod T.

description: This place is great. It has everything, good happy hour, drinks, food and best of all great rooftop view. Definitely recommend it for a date or getting together with friends.
author: a f.

description:
Hallelujah!  Finally, a rooftop bar for the rare occasion when it's above 70 in SF.  Takes me back to the Medjool days minus the techno/house music.  

Overall:  Won't go running back, but good (and maybe only) rooftop bar for a nice day.  The rooftop has panels and umbrellas that block the wind.  Smart!    

Ambiance: Good ambiance for happy hour.  Loud, but not in an obnoxious way. 

Crowd:  Trendy hipsters mixed with club goers/glam squad sporting 5 inch heels.   

Drinks: Didn't have any of the fancy drinks, but they seemed like they had a decent selection of margaritas, etc.  We had Negra Modelos.  

Food: Food was OK.  We had the chicharrones, which were tasty. In general, the mains seemed better than the small plates.  The shrimp ceviche, veggie quesadillas and guac were just meh!  I did see the water walk buy with the chuzo (skewers) and sanguches (sandwiches) and they looked promising.  

Service:  Servers were friendly and attentive, despite the crowd.  

Tip:  Get there before 7pm on a Friday night to avoid the crowds.
author: Wendy S.

description: My friend and I went to brunch here over the weekend and it was my first time coming here. Felix was our server and he was AWESOME! He made our experience that much better - so kind, funny, & attentive. It is servers like him that make you want to come back. I will definitely be coming back and requesting Felix as our server again. The food, the view, Felix - 5 STARS!!
author: Chloe N.

description: The roof bar is an excellent choice for the night! It has great dishes for drink companions and the view is great (with a clean sky). Totally recommended!
author: Mike Y.

description: I met a friend here yesterday and we mainly went there because it was close to where we were.  However, we got more than convenience, we were blessed with great food and a beautiful view.  It did get really cold when the fog rolled in but we toughed it out.  Great view, service and food.  This is a cool place to dine alone, with friends or even meet for business.  The view, service and food were all 5 star.
author: Tiki P.

description: Decent enough food with quick and polite service. Obviously the best thing about this place is the view. It really can't be beat, especially on a beautiful day. Would go back a million times over just for that view.
author: Victoria W.

description: Cool rooftop with a great view. Awesome drinks and decent food, but our chicken skewers were way undercooked - no bueno. It's also suuuuppperrr loud, so be prepared to communicate with your waiter using some combination of shouting and sign language.
author: Allison P.

description:
BEWARE!!!! I ate here last night and we ordered chicken skewers and I ate the first bite off the skewer and thought the texture was off so looked at the next chicken cube and noticed they were not cooked at all! They served us a plate of RAW CHICKEN!!

Some other ppl in my group ate some as well. Worts part is i'm 9 months pregnant and not only is this super dangerous for me but also my baby. That kind of negligence is not acceptable. 

The server was very apologetic and said he would take care of me and make sure me and the baby were ok, but really if I did/do get sick from this there is nothing he could do. Also, they didn't even discount the bill or comp the raw chicken skewers. I WOULD NEVER GO HERE AGAIN!
author: Tammy R.

description:
First time at this place a few weeks ago on Valentine's Day and it was amazing.  The views (on clear days) plus the amazing food made for a great time.  We got there at 3pm and turns out the kitchen closes for an hour to transition from the brunch menu to the dinner menu.  We were pretty hungry and were pleased that we were at least able to order chips & guacamole, and the guacamole is amazing!  Once the kitchen re-opened, we split the chicharones, mushroom quesadilla, and a small salad, all of which was more than the 2 of us could finish.

Aside from the place itself and its food, I've removed a star due to the service.  We had to go up to our waitress several times since she wouldn't come check in with us for periods of at least 20 minutes, we even had to ask another waiter for our check since we couldn't even find our waitress.  In any case, I'm hoping they were just short-staffed that day and that it's not the norm because I definitely plan on coming back here.
author: Eric M.

description: Ill start backwards. View is amazing. Food is great, I mean really, really great. Even what we didn't get to try also looked/smelled wonderful. Small mix up when we accepted the offer to have our name put on both lists (cocktail and dinner lists) but it was very nice of the girl to offer us an opportunity to get service asap. We started at the stand up cocktail area, but when we were paged to the table(via text) we had already given our credit card to the cocktail server. Our new server at dinner seemed somewhat frustrated by this, but was able to figure it out(got our card from the other server) Right away she went on break though, and we finished before she got back....and had to wait on her to return to get our card back. She was very pleasant and so was the other server, though they did have the typical overworked restaurant employee vibe. The only negative part was the girl at the front door (when we arrived)seemed very "take it or leave it" if you will, about getting in. She said she couldnt estimate the wait, and that was frustrating. I expressed my frustration and she became extremely pleasant(great job, not easy)Once we made it to the rooftop though we understood why she was being like that at first. With a view and food like they have, it is really a gem. I can't believe the line wasn't around the block, but I would guess it is sometimes. Totally would go back. I think it will be more fun with experience and expectation.
author: Eric H.

description: Great rooftop bar and atmosphere.  Friendly wait staff and great guacamole!  Awesome happy hour menu if you're int he mission and need to get high...literally.
author: Nicholas A.

description:
What a shame, really, what a shame. This place has such a great patio and such a great view but it really needs work in a couple areas. We came by just for a drink and maybe chips & guacamole. It took forever just to place our order and this was at 4:00pm on Sunday, i don't want to know what it is like at prime time. So we order and we are waiting and our food arrives...great...where are the drinks? Naturally the person who delivered the food was not our waiter and had no idea where the drinks were. So we kept eating and eating, and pretty much finished the entire dish before our drinks arrived---NOT cool. At one point we couldn't even locate a server in the entire dining area. 
Secondly, how many times have you ever ordered Guacamole and ran out of chips NOT guacamole? I know, right? Never. Well we did. Very chincey on the chip portion. We didn't even bother to order more because we didn't have an hour to wait for the refill. Oh, forgot to mention, two single bathrooms, unisex with constant lines. 

When will these restaurants get it? They can make more money if they improve their service. We were planning on having 1 or more drinks and spend some time hanging out. Instead we ordered one drink each and left. I really hope the restaurant looks at this review because it has so much potential. Provide some basic customer service and stop being so chincey. Yes i know, it is SOOO ironic that you served a bowl of Guacamole with five chips.
author: Ben K.

description:
We take most of our out of town visitors to El Techo de Lolinda - in part for the view and in part for the outstanding chicharrones and ceviche! We've come so often, we don't even need to look at the menu anymore. Our go-to's are the chicharrones, the shrimp ceviche, the guacamole, and a few skewers on the side. Whatever you do, don't skimp on the chicharrones!

Other notes: Definitely bring a jacket if you're inclined to by chilly, and I don't recommend El Techo as an exclusive drinking location since their cocktails aren't the best and you can find better beer and wine menus elsewhere.
author: Susan P.

description: Great view from the rooftop bar. Good happy hour place for sunset drinks. Good Mexican food but not great. Service wasn't the best either.
author: Livia M.

description:
Went here with a few friends for brunch mainly because of the rooftop view we had heard good things about. The atmosphere is fun but the service is the worst I've ever had. I was the first person to arrive in my party and the first one to place a food order. Our waiter brought everyone else's food out and 45 minutes later my food finally came out, once everyone else was finished! The whole experience was like the server was pulled from the street without even the slightest knowledge of the restaurant business. They were out of it! 

When it came time to pay I paid with cash and was given incorrect change, which took a whole extra 20 minutes to sort out. 

The place wasn't even busy! 

Food was mediocre but because of the service, I will not be coming back.
author: Ashley S.

description: Came back this weekend and had another great time! I ordered the usual but this time I got the La Paloma pitcher! I have to this was the best La Paloma I've had. i had the chance to meet the GM.. i forgot his name but he was really friendly and very accomodating! we set reservations at 12pm.. but ran 30 min late coming from sacramento.. they ended still holding our table! I cant wait to come back!
author: Christian D.

description: Absolutely loved this place. The view of San Francisco was beautiful!! The food was delicious & the drinks were awsome!!!! The atmosphere was fun & the staff was very friendly. We will definitely be back!
author: Norma M.

description: Had a private event for my company here last night and had such a great experience. The food was delicious, the drinks were fantastic and the service was exceptional- Jeff was the best! They do a great layout for private events- there is a lot of open space with a few seats off to the side. This open layout was perfect for my team who wanted to mingle around and chat with each other. There is a food table and a drink table set up both of which were a bit hit- never ending margaritas and sangria??!?! Yes please! Great experience!
author: Kristen L.

description: Had a great brunch on roofdeck with friends. Food, drinks, service and atmosphere all were excellent. Slight snootiness from door people out front when trying to get in with larger group. But if you make reservations, no problem.
author: Joe A.

description: This place is amazing!  Service, food, atmosphere, rooftop views!!  We stopped by here while visiting family.  Not having any reservations, we were immediately seated and greeted by the manager, who quickly brought us our drinks and made a few menu recommendations.  The serving staff was quick and friendly.  We had a pitcher of margaritas, chips and guac, plantains, mango plate and some grilled skewers.  Presentation was great, and the taste was fabulous!  Definitely a frequent dining/drinks must see every time we are in town.  MUST EAT HERE!!
author: Chelsey Y.

description: I only came here for drinks -- the experience was wonderful with a great view, drinks, and service. Those heat lamps are really nice too.
author: Orien W.

description: Came here for the eve of my 21st birthday and was in heaven! Somehow I managed to stroll in with 12 people and get seated right when we got to the rooftop because a large party had just left- call it a birthday miracle. The views and ambiance are spectacular and the drinks are pretty good too! Perfect place to be surrounded by good people, and the vibe this place brings cant help but put you in a fantastic mood. Don't let the lines and the wait scare you- this place is a must.try
author: Kim S.

description: We went here for drinks after eating at Foreign Cinema next door, and wished we have spent the evening at El Techo! I loved this place -- amazing views of the city, delicious margaritas and sangria (reasonably priced). The heat lamp was a total bonus, I'll be back!
author: Alyssa T.

description: Great food and drinks!! The chips and guacamole could use more flavor, but otherwise perfect for brunch and dinner! Cant wait to be back.
author: Togi M.

description: My girlfriend brought me here for my birthday brunch. I had heard of Lolinda before but I didn't realize this was a thing. It's a brunch spot on the rooftop. It was really something I didn't expect when I was riding the elevator because my girl decided to keep the brunch spot a secret until we arrived. The place is set up like a rooftop cantina with heatlamps and tents to keep warm on cold days which it was really windy. The heat lamp helped but you needed to have a jacket the morning we went. So bring one just in case if you decide to dine here. It was sunny when I went but still windy and cold so any other day in the city will probably be foggy and cold. We ordered the beignets with dulce de leche sauce which was fried well but didn't have much powdered sugar on it. Even when dipping the sauce on it which was pretty tasty but lacked sweetness, you felt like something was missing. We then got to our entrees I ordered a egg scramble which came with potatoes on the side which were all excellent. The scramble had fresh ingredients and it all worked well together. The potatoes were cooked well and weren't burnt or too greasy. It was a great filling breakfast of eggs, sausage and veggies. My girl got the chicarones which comes in a taco kit so you make your own tacos out of them. The smallest portion was large enough for her and it would probably be good for me but you can elect to get more. It came with black beans and salsa with the meat which was fried well and tender. I also ordered a cuba libre with mexican coke which was tasty but just a rum and coke and the girl got a agua fresca pineapple which was very very good but for the amount you get, not worth the price. All in all a lovely experience because of the rooftop setting, the good food but the service could use some work.
author: Jeromy G.

description: New. Favorite. Bar. This place is really cool. I am such a sucker for a rooftop bar and El Techo didn't disappoint.  We waited in line briefly while the host radioed up to see if there was space. You go down this long hallway, take the elevator up to the top floor then exit to an area with tons of tables under a clear plastic tent. It was a gorgeously warm evening when we went, but there are lots of heat lamps and tall windows to block the wind in case its cold. It took 20 minutes to get drinks, but they were delicious once we finally got them. The view is gorgeous. You are in the mission so you get a great view of downtown San Francisco. It was a really great experience.
author: Kari G.

description: Went here with my husbands co-workers after work. Great place to chill, have a few drinks, and enjoy the great sf views from the rooftop. Just FYI we went on a Wed around 7 and it was packed! Fun place :)
author: Sara K.

description: What view is everyone raving about?! There is no view! The rooftop is only on the fourth floor and you are over looking some shabby lookn buildings and streets! I did like the raw feel of the place and the service was good. Food and drinks were fine too, but you can't really go wrong with shots of tequila and guacamole!
author: Sue J.

description: Four stars! This place is a little gem. The service was impeccable, and the food was good. It's on a rooftop which is rate for sf. I was surprised at what a limited menu they had. I went with a group for brunch on. Sunday morning and did not have a wait! I would definitely recommend this spot.
author: Nicky L.

description: Casual, yet kinda romantic spot, which can be nice to make a good impression on a date. The best things about this place are the view, and the chuzos. 2 stars for the view and 1 star for the chuzos, I would have given 2 stars for the chuzos, but they were really expensive for what they were. Drinks are overpriced and weak, and if you like sangria, DO NOT waste your money on the Sangria here, it tastes worse than the sangria you can buy in a bottle at the liquor store. It can get cold up there, so dress warm. It can be nice to chill for a little while and enjoy a few small bites, then go cruise the mission for more reasonable and stronger drinks.
author: J H.

description: Great place to eat and hang out. I always like to bring out of town visitors to this location to enjoy their trademark chicharrones and skewers. If you're unsure about where to go on a Friday night, come to El Techo. You won't be disappointed by their drinks or the great view of the city.
author: Ignacio A.

description:
WOW! how was I unaware a glorious place such as this existed in San Francisco, and in the Mission, no less?!

you can choose to put your name in for a table (heads up they DO NOT take reservations, except for brunch on the weekends), or wait in line to go upstairs just for drinks.  either way, yes, you are going to have to wait a long time to get in, but it is definitely worth it!  that being said, you'll have a much better time if you and your group made a plan to go here (and a plan on getting there EARLIER in the night), rather than just casually stopping by one night to see how long the line is - we learned that the hard way the first time, ended up checking out other local options after waiting in line for 30+ minutes with no movement at all. granted, we didn't show up to the line until probably around 10 or so.  the second time we went was around 7:30 on a Saturday for dinner, we put our names in and decided to wait in the drinks only line until our table was ready.  about half an hour later we reached the front of the line and got to go up, and literally as we stepped off the elevator our table was ready!

I am not sure what I was expecting when I stepped off that elevator, but the view/ambiance exceeded my expectations for sure. tables were a bit cramped together, and some tables were too low to see much of the view while you were eating, but it made everything feel warm (although the space heaters/overhead awning may have had a bit to do with that) and more inviting.  our waitress was very attentive and helpful in answering our questions about the menu.   

the food and drinks were delightful, and if you're feeling dessert ORDER THE ALFAJORES (basically dulce de leche shortbread cookies that come with some of the best tasting hot chocolate I've ever had in my life).

overall my friends and I had a wonderful time.  I'll definitely be coming back in the near future to try their brunch.
author: Alyssa L.

description:
(+): awesome views, ambience. it's the best (and possibly only, 620 jones does NOT count) rooftop bar in SF. i bring my out of town friends here as it's a really nice spot to be as the sun goes down. great drinks. fried chicken is DOOooppe

(-): the wait. the service sometimes. the prices. inconvenience of not being able to order at the bar. fighting for bar stools when it's crowded, cuz you can't sit if you are only drinking. most of the other food here is meh.

(0): my favorite spot in SF, el techo always makes me feel like i'm a classy piece of shit.
author: Siva M.

description: My favorite restaurant in the Mission.  Here and State Bird are my two favorite restaurants.  It has the coolest roof top view of the City's skyline.  They have a great selection of cocktails and a small menu.  I always order the chicken wings (so delicious) and the chicharones.  Sometimes I think about the fresh warm tortillas, black beans with queso fresco and those delicious crispy pork carnita and my mouth waters.  I'm not even exagerating, they know how to season the food here and its delicious.  The price you pay is the most reasonable too.  I'm out of there for $55 and very satisfied and a slight buzz too.
author: Patrick B.

description:
Okay, lets start with the view amazing!! The best in San Francisco.
Food, very good I'm Mexican and i can tell when something taste good
Drinks if you really know your stuff you will enjoy this place.
author: Luz S.

description:
A friend recommended El Techo de Lolinda for its amazing rooftop views and good food. I'm a poor graduate student and don't usually splurge on fancy places like this, but I decided to take my friends since I was moving soon.

Service was incredible! Though I was the only one in my party to arrive on the busy weekday, they sat me right next to the window with the perfect view of Downtown San Francisco while I waited for everyone to arrive. I asked the waiter questions about the food and she gave me personal recommendations based on my tastes and food allergies. The servers were prompt and gave us food as we ordered each dish throughout the night.

Food was great, albeit overpriced. I tried the ceviche, the chicken skewers, fried plantain, margarita pitcher, and the cookie dessert. Every bite was delicious and I recommend them all except the plantain, which wasn't anything special. I only wonder how much of the food cost is actually going to paying for the atmosphere and view instead of the food itself. For a place that calls itself "street food," it sure was several times more expensive than what you would easily find on the street.

Granted, I can't complain. El Techo de Lolinda serves a certain demographic not anything like the original Mission District downstairs. If I wanted real street food, I could just walk downstairs and skip the gentrified rooftop restaurant all together. But the experience was something I won't forget.
author: Darryl Y.

description: Are you kidding me... This place has the most amazing pulled pork I have ever had. It's sweet and salty and tasty and soft all at the same time. The elote is also great and the mole and sides the pulled pork comes with are perfection. There's a great view to check out while you eat. The drinks looked pretty, but I didn't try for myself. Goodness gracious just get me back to SF so I can eat here again.
author: Lauryn L.

description: The Piña colada is yummy and the view is amazing!
author: Javier Adan R.

description: This spot is a sweet hidden hipster oasis with some seriously stellar waitstaff as well as outrageously tasty treats and some sumptuous drinks on the menu... If you're going for happy hour be sure to get there early as it tends to get packed after 5... All in all a real gem!
author: Francesca H.

description: Sunny day, roof deck, drinks and snacks, what's not to like?
author: Dilly M.

description: Romantic place.. beautiful view, good drinks. I just love this place, can't stop going there. Celebrated my birthday there and it was nice.
author: Deepa P.

description: This place was amazing, in large part due to our awesome server Felix (or "Tequilix" as he liked to be called).  Not only was he friendly and attentive, but he was also very knowledgable about everything on the menu, especially the drinks.  After some deliberation, he was able to help my friends and me choose the perfect cocktails based on our own preferences, and boy were those good!  As for the food, delicious.  And the view?  Stunning (including that super cute waitress with the short, curly hair).  A perfect place for a night out after work, especially if you get the best server in the world like us!
author: Rudy C.

description: The pitchers are a RIP OFF!  The 30 dollar pitcher could not even fill four glasses.  I think they hope the damn ice will melt fast enough to accomplish that.   OLD TRICK!  You're better off ordering single glasses at 8 bucks a piece.  This place will benefit initially from the buzz and the people who tend to follow that crowd, but if they don't improve some stuff, the space will die out before the year.
author: Demanding T.

description: I really want to love this place but the service is always slow and sloppy. Getting a table for dinner can be a hair-pull, which is usually the number one reason I choose to go else where. The food, atmosphere and prices are all great!
author: Ashley B.

description:
Excellent place!
I absolutely recommend this two cocktails: The Paloma and the Margaritas!! We shared the Guacamole (great balanced taste!), the Chicharron was out of this world, the Ceviche, the Empanadas were amazing, and the Choripan!

For dessert, the hot chocolate with alfajores was sublime!!!

The staff is super friendly and helpful! Definitely will go back!
author: Florencia L.

description: Awesome rooftop spot, fun atmosphere... Legit heating lamps for those who get cold! The drinks are good, especially the pisco with passion fruit, I didn't like the fried plantain dish but the quesadilla de acelga was really good! My friends shared like 4 small plates and raved about them all except the plantain!
author: Steph K.

description: We stopped by on a Saturday afternoon for a couple of drinks before our dinner reservation. It was labor day weekend and so the space wasn't overly crowded and we were able to find a spot by the side with good view of the mission. Drinks are reasonably priced and the waiters good a very good care of us. Would def go there again- a good summer hangout.
author: Haruka H.

description: Really fun and nice rooftop bar in the heart of the mission. Outside patio is very cutely lit up with heating lamps- with an amazing view of the city.
author: Alex M.

description:
After a stint at Wild Hare followed by passing out in Dolores Park mid day, my group of friends and I ended up here for what we thought would be a margarita and a snack. Luckily we arrived at about five minutes past five, when they first opened, and only had to wait twenty minutes. (Yeah, seriously.
