We were there five minutes after opening and had to wait twenty minutes. No joke - get here at opening.) However, I understood once we were there why there was such a long wait.
The rooftop has a beautiful view of the city and is a great place to take family/friends from out of town. Ambiance is casual with the deck being covered in a white tent and the tables basically being patio tables, but somehow the place still seemed sophisticated. 
This is not your run of the mill Mexican place. You won't find chips & salsa waiting for you when you arrive. It is a tapas place, and as such, can be a little expensive, but myself and my friends all found it to be well worth the price tag. We found all the food to be quite appetizing and before we knew it we had ordered more than just "a snack." My personal best was the pork shoulder tacos. My husband's was the pork quesadilla, and another's was the guacamole. We also shared a pitcher of house margaritas which was loved by the others. I personally thought they had too much lime in them (something I thought I would never say!)
Service was slow, but in a place with a view and food this good, I can overlook it. You'll want to kick back and enjoy anyway.
This place is now on our short list of places to take people when they come in to town.
author: Rachel B.

description: My boyfriend and I heard of this Rooftop bar/restaurant and attempted to go once but it was closed due to a private event. We tried again today and it totally made our week! Yes the food is good, yes the rooftop is spectacular (surprisingly uncommon in SF). Above all however, our waitress Christy was a breath of fresh air here in this city! Ive have the worst service in SF than any other city I've been too. Lived here now almost two yrs and seriously considering giving up on the place but we felt better about giving it another chance after visiting this establishment. Going back soon with many friends and will spread the word.
author: Natasha M.

description: When they check you in at the entrance, you feel as if you are entering a secret club. We took the elevator up and were immediately impressed by the rooftop view of the SF skyline - at that point, I'm not sure it really mattered what they served us! I was afraid it would be tough to get a seat for Sunday brunch, but we were quickly seated at a great table with a perfect view. The service was just fine, and the food was better than expected. I had the quesadillas, and sangria , my daughter loved her ceviche. As I said, the food wasn't the point, but it was surprisingly good - I would definitely return to soak in some more of the sunny vibe and lovely vista!
author: Nancy V.

description:
this place was great in certain ways, but the drawbacks sort of came as the night went on. we got there on a saturday night and waited in a line but only briefly. when we got up to the roof, we were offered any of the open tables or the standing section - we chose to stand. we waited about 10 minutes to be helped (you can't go up to the bar) and then another 10-15 for them to come back with drinks. cocktails are $10-12 and I'm not sure if you can order off the menu -- my friend's boyfriend tried ordering a vodka redbull and a long island and they couldn't make either. my other friend and I ordered girly drinks and if i'd had my flask they would've been great. last thing that bothered us was the service fee and the automatic 20$ tip they added... 

bottom line: great view, good ambiance, weakish drinks, annoying fees
author: Annie D.

description:
rooftop bar / restaurant! 

beautiful view & delicious food!

I highly recommend the chicarrones & the quesadilla de pibil.

and the host was rude. 

GET THERE EARLY!!!
author: Jazeleene G.

description: If you want to stand in line forever and treated like cattle go ahead. Slow service, not really into this scene, very pretentious.
author: Amber M.

description:
Let's start with the best part: the chicarrones are ungodly good. Divine, delectable, delicious. Melt in your mouth good and worth any price tag. Do. Not. Miss.

Otherwise, it was a mediocre experience. View is overrated, service was competent but paralytically slow, margarita del techo was overpriced (for $13 I expect more than pretty good) and got watery very quickly. The caipirinha was strong and tasty.

The only thing that would tempt me to return are the chicarrones; if I could get them to go, I would.
author: Justin M.

description: El Techo de Lolinda is a wonderful rooftop spot. A secret hide-away with tasty food and an assortment of cocktails with a solid beer list. Our server was attentive yet chill. And the view from the roof is incredible.
author: Molly C.

description:
worst service in the city .. great view .. but the service was just awful .. and they pack way way too many people up in that space .. i know everyone wants the view .. but srsly foks , have some decency !!
and pitches of margaritas were 45$ !!! and it was a half sized pitcher ..
author: Micah W.

description:
i'm a super fan of the location. i mean you really can't beat a rooftop dining experience on a sunny day. 

for food, i started with the shrimp ceviche which went perfectly with the 70 degree weather and my pisco cocktail. my main dish was the clara egg white scramble. i liked it but i didn't love it...could've used more flavor. next time i plan to order a quesadilla...and a few more cocktails.

love the vibe...will definitely come back.
author: Mayra S.

description: The rooftop bar is the best spot in the city on a sunny day. Great service, good drinks and a view that can't be beat...
author: Matthew S.

description: I mean... how many rooftop bars are there in the City?  The views alone are worth it!
author: Olivia D.

description: Arrived around 1:30pm on Sunday for brunch and we were seated right away.  Food, service, VIEW were all terrific.  Don't miss the Buelos donut things and the brunch quesadillas.
author: Troy S.

description: Went there last night for my birthday and there was a wait however it was only 15 minutes. The restaurant is packed and I know why, food was amazing and so was the view. Would def go again.
author: Dee M.

description: Came here with some friends and had a pitcher of their margaritas, it was a beautiful evening and the staff was very friendly. next time I will try some food
author: Rebecca S.

description: The El Techo margarita was good, with the mescal. We also had the piña colada, guac and chips, plantain chips, flautas, empanada, and the pork sandwich (with fried egg). I liked the sandwich the best, but was not blown away with the others. The rooftop location is definitely the draw here. I had hoped they got a better elevator since taking it over from Medjool, but no such luck--it's still the world's slowest elevator.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Food is meh. Eating the minimal soopy water like eggs on what tasted like an over cooked burnt hard shell tortilla. The menu is unappealing and you just end up ordering whatever. Then when you eat the little bit on your plate that seems eatable your pretty much just eating to eating and little enjoyment.
author: Casey G.

description: Awesome view of the city, friendly staff, and a great place to spend your Sat and Sun afternoon! Great day date place!
author: Lisa N.

description: WTF they needed to check that I am "sober" before I order food?!?'!!   Um.... I am over 40 and they treat my table like we are under 21?!??
author: Lady K.

description: Made reservation for Sat brunch. Easy access via control agent at sidewalk entry.  Rooftop dining is rare in SF, and this view and ambiance were very special.  It is noisy, but just lean in to talk.  Bloody Marys were very good.  Guacamole was good but needed more kick -salt/pepper helped but we were looking for something with more heat.  The Chicharronas de Carne was the best thing we had - half pound for three people isn't too much.  Quesadilla de Pibil and Ceviche de Cameron were both good, but not special.  Server (Katrina) was very friendly and helpful.  In sum: this is a good place to go for some drinks, decent food and great atmosphere.
author: B Y.

description: I'm a huge fan of daytime drinking and this place totally supports that. I came here for happy hour yesterday on the rooftop. It was great! The view and the weather were amazing. We had margaritas, sangria and chips/guacamole. We loooved loooved our cocktails. The staff here is really friendly and have great service.
author: Natalie F.

description: Excellent brunch experience. Shared the Tostada Francesa, but ordered the Benedictos for the main event. Delicious! The drinks were really good too. Had a Mimosa, then a Pisco Sour. The view is spectacular from the roof. And we had a great server, Luis A., who delivered expert service. It was quite pleasant and relaxing, and will return soon.
author: Elizabeth Q.

description: El Techo has great food and I love the pork, plus the tres amigos drink combo, although the service is not that great. It is worth the wait for that amazing view and the food, but I feel like unless you keep checking with the host, they eventually forget about you. And if you make your way to the bar for a drink, don't even bother thinking your party will be seated - expect to stay at the bar. I like the space heaters for cold nights but wish they occupied more of the rooftop space to accommodate more guests.
author: Lauren F.

description: Went there for the first time just for some apps and a drink and was definitely impressed. The place was packed but we got sat quickly, sangria was delicious, ceviche was awesome, and kale taco was clean and filling. And being on the roof is fun- my only complaint was how loud it was, but it was a fun atmosphere so I'm not complaining.
author: Morgan C.

description: I came here for my birthday after I had dinner, got a few drinks and just wanted to try something new.. The roof top bar was nice especially if it's a nice nite out u can see all of downtown. I had their "Paloma" mixed drink with tequila,like,grapefruit,soda. This was bomb. One of the better ones I've had anywhere! We had some carnitas they were "ok" but with the what seemed to be handmade corn tortilla and salsa. Man it was a good combination! So overall I liked it and would def come back when I'm in the city!
author: Ken R.

description: The location of this restaurant is awesome. Rooftop bar, hello! However, the food left something to be desired. Costly overall. The tortilla soup tasted suspiciously of chicken noodle of the campbells variety. The ceviche was good, not great. The sangria was watered down and expensive. Service is....odd. Would probably go back to try something else on the menu, but not holding my breath for a different result.
author: B L.

description: Worst restaurant experience ever.  We waited 20 minutes for somebody to take our order. The waitress dropped a couple cocktails on my friend leaving her soaking wet. Then, after one of our plates came, we were informed that the kitchen would be closing. We told several servers that we were still waiting for the rest of our order. Then, another 20 minutes later, we were informed that the kitchen had dropped our food on the floor, and we could wait another 15 minutes to get our food, on the house. No thank you. Maybe I will come back in six months when they get their act together.
author: Aimee F.

description:
Meh.  Can't walk up to the bar to order a drink - you can only order it from a server.  But then it takes a long time to get your drink.  The tent takes up a lot of space and not a lot of tables.  Not crazy about the crowd; it's much older.

Feels a little pretentious that they have people at the door on the floor level that announce you as you go up.  Then they have people greeting you on the rooftop but they're all up in your business - are you going to eat, are you meeting people, just drinks, etc.  Um...I haven't decided if I'm going to be ordering food so can you just chill?  Geez.

The three stars are for their homemade tortillas.  YUM.  Otherwise, it doesn't feel THAT much different from the rooftop when it was Medjool.
author: Claire C.

description: This is a very cute spot that you would absolutely fall in love with if you are a sucker for pretty views of the city. Make sure to pick a clear night and don't worry if it's a little chilly, they have plenty of heaters. Where else can you enjoy dinner or some nice snacks on a roof? It can't get better than that. My friend and I only went for some desserts, which we found to be a little too sweet for out taste. But we will definitely be back to try some of their savory dishes next time ;)
author: Amimee D.

description: My brother in law brought us here for dinner.  We were blown away by the chicharones and the home made chorizo.  We came early enough where we didn't have to wait and the service was great.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Mitra W.

description: After 5 years of being curious about the roof-top bar, I went to El Techo for lunch today.  Overall, the experience was underwhelming.  They do not take reservations so you're at the mercy of the wait list, and this is a wait list with no estimated wait times.  As a result you wait not knowing if you're likely to be there 10 minutes (all fine and dandy) or 2 hours (totally not okay).  The wait list checker would only tell people that there were only a couple of groups in front of you, thus making it seem like there wasn't really much of a wait.  However, after 45 minutes of being told that there's only a couple of parties ahead of you, you start to question this. Once on the wait list, they will text you to say that your table is ready, so after getting wise to the "only a couple of groups ahead of you" some people went into Laszlo to get a drink and wait it out there.  Once up to the roof top bar, things aren't much better in terms of service.  We waited 20 minutes just to get some tap water, the server then proceeded to lose the ticket with our order on, was generally unavailable when we needed something, and took 25 minutes to bring the check at the end of the meal.  The view was good, but not worth the wait and mediocre service that a lot of these excessively popular SF spots seem to be able to get away with.
author: Rebecca N.

description: Came to the Techo for a Saturday brunch with my office. The weather was gorgeous, the sangria and margaritas were flowing...fantastic time! We were brought lots of yummy tidbits, the empanadas, the plantains w black beans, a few different kinds of skewers, and a few other things I can't remember (sangria was flowing remember?). Everything was really good. Staff was great, the bathrooms were immaculate. Definitely will return on my own dime!
author: Maritza D.

description:
4 stars for the ambiance; the view; the service; the vibe. 
3.5 stars for the food - flavor is decent - good portions - some things are priced too spendy others are Ok. 

This most recent visit I had the mango ceviche which was really refreshing and flavorful - mango - jicama - cucumber - lime - chili powder or cayenne - good portion - nice spin on a fruit salad. 

Also had the vegetarian eggs benedict. Good portion - needed a little more flavor. I wish they had more fish or vegetarian savory options but hey it's not all about me. 

I'll be back.  I always have a good time- satiated - just not blown away by the food.
author: Carson R.

description:
Excellent service, ambiance and view! 

Food was great. I ordered the chips and guac. It was fresh, well made, and tasty. Drinks were delicious and unique. 

This is a great place to kick back, catch the SF skyline and have a drink. 

*heat lamps
**outdoor, rooftop seating with lamps
**great vibe
author: Noora T.

description: good food, great location,  nice views
author: John P.

description: The skewers were amazing, and the atmosphere was great.  The margarita was decent, but not the best I had. The guacomole was really good as well.  Being one of the only SF rooftop restaurants, I can't really complain, it was a lot of fun!  They put up plastic sheets to block the wind.  It was quite noisy from the amount of people there, but I like it better that way.
author: Leanne C.

description: El Techo is one of the few places in SF with a rooftop bar. Super fun for Happy Hour and as a place to start your weekend nights since it closes at midnight. If you want a table, I'd recommend getting there on the earlier side since there tends to be a line, even on weeknights. On the weekends you definitely want to get there no later than 9 to avoid the long line.
author: Cat A.

description: Very tasty pork shoulder served with black bean paste, salsa and tortillas for make-your-own tacos.
author: Alice W.

description:
Took my guy here for his birthday a few weeks ago and it was great. It was opening week and we had a wonderful time! We were greeted as soon as we got off the elevator and on to the rooftop by the manager who was very nice and helped us find a seat with a view.
But seriously...  Drinks and Elote! Who can go wrong? 
The drinks were yummy the service was great! There was a bit of a wait which we understood as it was only the second day they were open but our waitress was nice and communicated with us every step of the way. 
As we left I could not find my favorite lipstick, which they do not make anymore, and asked the manager if they had a lost and found. He let me know they hadn't had anything turn up yet but handed me his card and let me know that if I gave him a call the next day he would be able to help me and if it comes up he will hold on to it for me. I REALLY appreciated that! He felt genuinly concerned with my lipstick which made me like this place even more! I will definitely be back!
author: Dorian R.

description:
earned ourselves to the top five flights up. rare beautiful view of san francisco. happy hour including sangria for about $20 a pitcher. chicharrones de carne was on point. guac & chips were really good too. everything was pretty good esp the empanada's and i'm a big fan of empanada's. 

I suggest you arrive a lil before they open which is 4pm.. happy hour ends at 6pm. Street parking is cool. A definite hidden gem in the la mission. 

Btw the service was chill and consistant. Will def make it back here sometime soon. And if you feeling tipsy during happy hour don't worry there's bathroom on the rooftop as well.
author: Illa C V.

description:
So the good - outdoor seating, heat lamps so it's never too cold, reallyyyy good empanadas, gorgeous views of the city. 

The bad - they charge different prices for the sangria pitchers at the tables, versus at the bar/cocktail bar area ($18 v. $25 not sure why), the rooftop is much smaller than when it was medjool's and you HAVE to order food if you sit at a table..even when it's 11p and you really just want to sit and have a drink, the food is MUCH better in the restaurant downstairs, the pitcher of sangria was WEAK. 

I'd go here for A drink, and then keep it movin...
author: Megha A.

description: The view, the food, the happy hour, and the servers were all fantastic! It was a warm San Francisco day and this was just the place to be. Arrive early as a line forms quickly on the ground floor. Order the plaintains, the chicharrones, pork shoulder tacos and margheritas.. You will not be disappointed!
author: Psusennes R.

description: Fun rooftop great view and the skyline is nice. Food is decent but u pay for ambiance Definitely recommend
author: John L.

description: El techno for brunch has great views of the city, but the food and service were sincerely disappointing. Went there on a Sunday at 11:15 with a reservation and waited 30 mins before we were even asked for a dink order. Everything was bland and oily, especially the Benedicto. Guac was decent, but for the price and wait time, we expected much better. Honestly felt like they thought they could make things "look good" presentation-wise, but didn't care much about the follow thought. Take my review for what you will, but I am rarely compelled to leave one at all, so that should say something.
author: Sarah W.

description: The novelty of a rooftop bar is enticing, and San Francisco can be a beautiful city, but the view from the Mission District is so-so urban.  No beach landscapes here.  The caipirinha was typically pricey ($9), but was really weak and watered down.  Any new rooftop bar deserves a couple stars, but the drink was disappointing and food didn't look that appetizing.  We grabbed dinner elsewhere.
author: Gregory N.

description: Their drinks are great and the SF rooftop views are beautiful and totally worth the wait. The staff are lovely and it's a great place to chill. The food, however, needs some flavor-certainly NOT the best Latin American food in the Mission. All of their salsas are mild, even the habanero is bland, and be careful: their chicharrones are not chicharrones-they're carnitas. The drinks, view and atmosphere, though: worth it.
author: Alexandra L.

description: Consistently amazing food and atmosphere! Highly recommended- the RIB EYE, pork short ribs, and mushroom sides. I would also order again: vegetable grilled skewers, spinach empanadas, and the Pulpo grill baby octopus. Drinks were well made too!
author: Mark C.

description: Great rooftop deck in San Francisco! Definitely the one with the best view... Food is good and the drinks are great! The only knock is the long wait and the time you have to wait for drinks, but that's because the place is packed, so not the fault of the staff...
author: Scott H.

description: This place is bad bad bad, service is just non existent, waited nearly 40 mins to get our drinks, food is good but overpriced.
author: Andrew B.

description: Best place in the mission to enjoy a sunny day in the city. World class view, goods happy hour, tasty food. Ell techo margarita is delicious.
author: Carl P.

description: Nice view venue and food! I usually don't eat taco kind of stuff but this is gooood. Meats cooked just right.
author: Mary J.

description: Just wanted to update that I came here for brunch and it was, again, fabulous food! Very happy about it. Still better than the downstairs Lolinda and a great atmosphere.
author: Annette D.

description: Great view and ambiance, the service was on point both of the times I have been here. The margaritas were really great as well as their food. This place is a great place to go with a group. No reservations, but we didn't have to wait too long to get seated.
author: Julie S.

description: Great outdoor patio, fab food - all excellent salsas, friendly service, a great view of the city!
author: Vicki L.

description: Ceviche was great - we actually tried both the Mango and the shrimp ceviche and they were tasty. We did a few other appetizers, none was super memorable but I'm still dreaming about the ceviche. More than anything, the view was great. The drinks were just OK (nothing special). Great environment, i'd say check it out. I wanted to give this place 3.5 stars, but I think "A-OK" is pretty good!
author: Ed P.

description: Don't waste your time coming here . Horrible service and disorganized seating system. Save your money and time .
author: Natalia G.

description: Get there early. Put your name on and grab a yummy drink from Jay at the restaurant bar first. Must get the chicharones and jicama salad. Boom!
author: Jennifer B.

description: Soooooo much better than Medjool.  I only had a couple drinks here on the rooftop, but they've done a wonderful job with the place.
author: Stephanie F.

description: Extremely disappointed . I'm from Mexico City where having GOOD chicharrones is kind of a big deal. Came here with my wife for dinner expecting to have some legit chicharrones but instead we got pork shoulder that had a sweet taste to it , wtf?!!?, oh and it was extremely overpriced .  I would not recommend this place to anyone that has some knowledge of what authentic mexican food tastes alike..
author: Alan L.

description: To be honest, there's not much of a view from the Mission, but I'll take what I can get. It's nice to be on a roof, especially during the one mild hour of the night. They have heat lamps here, so that's a plus. The margaritas I've had were mostly ice, but I had a good Paloma, and the food's good. Service is usually excellent.
author: Kent L.

description: Insane line to get up to what? Unfriendly service and ok, overpriced food. Definitely not a place I want to go back to.
author: Gordon G.

description: service is excellent...food is good...why not 5 stars...cause I'm stingy with my stars...but will surly come back !
author: Martin C.

description:
Awesome atmosphere--really cool view and vibe for a date or weekend afternoon with the crew. 

But agree with the review below that mentions the pathetic bouncer who struggles to handle his job and treats people  badly. 

I thought the food was fine--again, you go here for the vibe. The service is not great....the waiters are sort of bad at their jobs and I assume think they are going to be actors or something.
author: James R.

description: The rooftop is definitely a fun place to have cocktails.  The view was great, however, I agree with other yelpers, a little close.  Also a little noisy, but to be expected with all the great energy surrounding you.  Our waiter was very attentive and the food was delicious!
author: Beth W.

description: Looking for a terrace bar to sip some cool cocktails, nibble yummy snacks, small plates with a nice view of sf skyline then el techo de lolinda is what you're looking for. Get your jacket, go up on the roof and have a good time in the mission.
author: Beril Y.

description: Love this place - beautiful views of the city and the food and drinks were excellent. :)
author: Aline H.

description: El Techo was really fun!  It was cold, but if you can grab a seat under the heat lamps you get both an amazing view and warmth.  There is also an area enclosed in plastic, which does block the wind, but unfortunately restricts the view.  I tried the Mexican Firing Squad cocktail, which was a little bit too delicious, and the Margarita del Techo. The second drink was also great, and had an interesting, smoky flavor from the mezcal.  To eat, we shared the chips and guacamole (amazing, very lime-y), the shrimp ceviche, and the skewers - one steak, one chorizo, and one pollo.  Everything was excellent, and I especially enjoyed the kick of the shrimp ceviche.  The portions are on the large side for tapas, so we actually ended up having a bit too much food.
author: Rachel A.

description: This place is yummy. We went there on a week night and apart from it being a little cold which is typical for SF, we had a great time. My favorites are the skewers, pickled vegetables and chicharones! so tasty! and friendly staff too!
author: Charles L.

description:
This place is definitely 4 stars, I don't know why it's 3.5 currently. 
Service was good, the location was very cool(rooftop) and food was spectacular.

Chicharrones is a must have, Mixed drinks are strong. Everything we ordered was really good
author: Nick B.

description: I didn't try the food but it looked good.  The drinks were nothing special, unfortunately.  The only thing that would bring me back is the roof.
author: Gabriela H.

description: The food was delicious and the servers really knew the menu. They suggested the perfect dishes for my palette when I asked what was good and the food didn't take too long to arrive. So far so good Lolinda, keep it coming.
author: Sarah T.

description: My favorite place in the city to bring guests from out of town.  Can be a little loud, but the view provides an excellent distraction.  Get there early to avoid a lengthy wait.
author: Mark M.

description:
Patio is AMAZING! Food is the same. We ordered several things and had absolutely no disappointments!  You cannot go wrong with any of the skewered items.  As for the alcohol, we ordered a couple of pitchers of margaritas, and they are not shy with the tequila! 

The only thing is the service is kinda all over the place-there didn't seem to be any assigned sections so we were constantly being approached with servers asking if we needed anything, and then it was slow to receive.  Didn't really bother us because they were all cool, so I will definitely be coming back often!
author: Heather D.

description: drinks and view is nice .  they even had a high chair which was surprising to me.  but the food was TERRIBLE - everything was really salty and left us with stomach-aches for hours.
author: Dana Y.

description: Noise level is a little high, but that shouldn't stop you from experiencing a taste of greatness!
author: Amir A.

description: I would've given this place 4 stars, but the service was horrible.  Had "Dean M." as a waiter.  He took our order and disappeared.  Would I have liked another drink...yes.  Would I have liked extra salsa...yes.  Would I have liked the cecviche I ordered that NEVER showed up...yes.  I never got these things because after our food was dropped off by someone else, Dean never followed up.  Chicharrones and view were great.  Wish I could've tried the ceviche, but again it never showed up.  I would've had a better experience, if I wasn't constantly looking over my shoulder and waving my arms trying to get the waiter's attention.  Dean did an excellent job at dropped off our check though.
author: anita a.

description: I have been here for dinner and also for just drink with a larger group.  Both times I have been impressed.  The drinks are good and strong, food is delish, flavorful, tender.  Finished with the alfajores and the cookie filling was amazing paired with the hot chocolate.  I was worries about being cold when I heard it was on a roof, but it is completely sheltered from the wind and they have heaters for when it's especially chilly.  Definitely will be back.
author: Melissa B.

description:
After having dinner at Lolinda last night, my friend and I went to El Techo just before midnight to get drinks. Upon entry we asked the hostess when they were going to close. The hostess mentioned they were doing the last calls for drinks, but they were going to close at 1 AM, and we could stay there till 1 AM. My friend and I ordered our drinks and started chatting. Around 12:40 AM, our waitress told us that we were the only ppl there and it was up to the manager if we could continue to sit there till 1 AM or not. She also pointed to 2-3 girls at another table, and said that girl over there used to work here, in fact she still works here, that's why she's allowed to stay with her friends. 
Shortly after, a guy from the kitchen came and turned off our gas heater w/o saying anything to us-rude. 
I've been to Lolinda and El Techo a lot ! never experienced such inappropriate/unfriendly treatment before.
author: Monica R B.

description: Here it's all about the view...  We had dinner on the roof and watched the sun set and The City Skyline was magnificent.  Food was good Service was also good
author: Richard N.

description: Had a great friday night. It was on, food and drink were suoer tasty serive was awesome. Must do in SF
author: Daniel S.

description: Best rooftop bar in SF and great tapas too. Had the Platano Maduro (fried ripe plantain, sour cream, chili, lime) and the Quesadilla de Acelga (dino kale, crimini mushroom, oaxaca, salsa verde) and both were very good.
author: John G.

description:
Came here for lunch yesterday (Saturday) and overall, they need to work out some kinks but it has potential. 

Service: shotty and slow. No one brought menus and needed to ask someone to bring menus even though the servers looked like they were doing nothing. Also, our server messed up andbrought my husband the Benedictos instead of the Techo Rancheros.  Clearly human error inputting the order as our bill didn't have Techo Rancheros on it. Anyway, husband decided not to send it back because the poached egg looked good...bad decision 

Food:
Benedictos: that poached egg was clearly cooked for too long as the yolk was not runny. Our friend also ordered the Benedictos and his eggs were also overcooked. 

Clara scramble: this is what I ordered. Not bad but not memorable. Also, I would have preferred the guacamole on the side vs dumped on top. The soft consistency of the scramble and the guacamole didn't jive for me. The potatoes were tasty but oily.  Also, I think I would have preferred tortilla or their cornbread  instead of the brioche. 

Jalapeño cornbread: best thing. Really good. 

Guacamole and chips:  To me, the guacamole was tasteless but I still ate because I was hungry. 

Anyway, if they step up their service and the food, the place could be great. One of the few rooftops in SF.
author: Crystal L.

description: Awesome! Very beautiful, unique spot on the rooftop of Lolinda.  We had a rare clear day in SF so we had such an amazing view of the city.  I love the style of this place, so worth going just for the view and the ambiance--- but also the drinks and food were excellent.  I had a delicious caipirhina and I only tried one of the steak skewers but it was delicious, perfectly grilled and tasty veggies and meat with chimichurri (my fave!) Our next trip to the City will definitely include a visit back! Oh and they have heaters which makes it really nice as it cools off.
author: Jen W.

description: love this place. have been for dinner & brunch. carnitas are amazing, the whole menu is really tasty. ask for Raul's section, super sweet, attentive.
author: Ernest S.

description:
I would have given this place a five star rating because of the great food, drinks, and view/vibe; however, the waitress and customer service experience was horrible.

Our drinks were brought out very quickly, and our food a little after. We requested 3 extra tortillas to finish off the rest of the beef. We waited 30 min then asked the waitress again. she said she would check on them. 15 min later, we still didn't have them so our friend requested them from the chef. 1 hour waiting for 3 corn tortillas, and our food was now cold. 

Waiting for the check was also a very timely experience.
author: Tyler W.

description: Space is really cool and most of the people work there are nice. But our shrimp  ceviche only came truly with 3 small shrimp. When I asked the guy that dropped it off he told me to deal with it
author: irene h.

description: it was good. el chicharron de chancho is delicioso.. yum.me
author: Nadia B.

description: Great spot! They have delicious food and great drinks. Nice rooftop bar in the mission that overlooks the city
author: Nicole L.

description: I've been here a few times and el techo never disappoints. Pork shoulder is amazing, ambience is great, waitstaff is so friendly and their drinks good :) my personal favorite is the grapefruit one (although it might be girlie, but who cares it's yummy)
author: Ranna K.

description: Had some delicious rooftop brunch. I went on a weekend afternoon and you needed reservations to sit at the tables but they had plenty of high tables that had no wait which were basically the same.
author: Ojus P.

description: Nice rooftop bar/restaurant, but this was a bad experience and I would have appreciated some reasonable help. My jacket was stolen while I went to the bathroom. They said they have cameras all over, but wouldn't check to see who took my jacket. I've called to follow-up and no response. Sketchy and disappointing.
author: Yvette B.

description: The view is the first reason to come. Great rooftop, crowded, but enough seats. Their pina colada even has cinnamon on it! Service is ok, but who cares when the views and drinks are so good!
author: Becca K.

description: Besides the last call being at 12 am, the waitresses have a lot to learn in regards to being well mannered. I have never felt so unwelcome by servers before - they actually told me that if i was not happy with their service that i should just leave. what kind of waitress says such a thing? this place was really fun, but i honestly cannot accept the behavior of the staff. i was glared at as i left and i am just still in complete shock at the behavior of the waitresses. honestly, go here but leave before midnight because after that it is a complete bore.
author: Grant C.

description: I like this place so much better than the old place Medjool.The rooftop now has a wind barrier and lots of umbrellas.The view of the city is spectacular.The food is excellent and the drink menu interesting. We had the pork shoulder quesadilla, guacamole, and alfajores. Everything was good.
author: Alexa S.

description: This has quickly become our go-to spot for brunch on Sundays.  The atmosphere is great, the view is amazing, the staff is really friendly, and the margaritas and bloody mary's are awesome!  Great selections for vegetarians!  Recommend making reservations or getting there early.
author: Jesse W.

description:
The views are great, there's no doubt about it. Unfortunately, the rest of our short experience was not. 
We were a party of 7, who arrived as 5 while our other 2 (in a separate car) looked for parking. We put our name in, went upstairs right away, and checked in with the second host upstairs. He told us to wait in the cocktail area but to not go to the bar, "because they'll come to you." Okay, I understand that...it seemed to be getting a bit busy, and they didn't want to have the bar packed. Too bad that after over 20 minutes, no one ever came around.
Still, wouldn't have minded that so much if it hadn't been for their seating policies. When the last 2 in our group arrived, they called me down to vouch that they were in our party and let them up. I went, and after going in the super slow elevator, I got down and the doorman said I had to let the host upstairs know. Okay. I went back up to let him know, and he said our 2 friends had to wait downstairs until we were all seated, and that he didn't make the rules, he just enforced them. He couldn't let more people in because he "didn't want people to have to wait 30 minutes for a drink in the cocktail area" Wait...wasn't that what we just did, without ever being acknowledged by anyone?
Still, ok... I could maybe understand this, it's cool, but could he perhaps give us a ROUGH estimate of the wait time so we could let our friends know, or go down and wait with them? Nope, sorry, "people like to camp out here, so I can't tell you at all how long it will be." Sooooo..... we're supposed to wait, with NO idea how long it'll be (5 minutes? 2 hours?), without our friends, in a bar area that won't serve us? No thanks. We went and found another great place to hang out on Valencia.

Too bad...this place is in a great location with a nice view of the city. Poor service policies, though, means we won't return. I only gave the extra star for the view. Too bad it's not a different restaurant with this location.
author: Marie W.

description: This place does not live up to the hype. Long wait to get in, then an undersized table without enough chairs, heat lamps not turned on, and food that is sub par. The chicken was fatty, the beef was chewy, and the margaritas were overly sweet with no salt.  The menu was small, and the place is understaffed. Not worth a second visit.
author: Kim C.

description: Had brunch on the rooftop patio on the most beautiful SF day of the year. The sangria was delicious and the chicharonnes really stole the show for me. Service is decent for how constantly busy they are. We were in no rush and enjoyed the whole afternoon. Thank you for a memorable day!
author: Lindsay M.

description: This place was amazing for brunch. It was a sunny, beautiful day and I loved the views of the city. I almost felt like I was in LA. The drinks were great- especially enjoyed their mojitos. I had the huevos rancheros style dish and that was very tasty. Overall great experience, but I would have liked the music to be louder.
author: Reena P.

description: going there on a sunny day was quite an awesome experience for me. margaritas, guac, sun, and the view... what else do you need to have a good time
author: Derek W.

description: The views from this cool joint are amazing. The food is delicious and fresh.  Try the homemade chips and guacamole and the chicharrones.   Christy is a wonderful server--ask to sit in her section, her recommendations were spot-on and she was a total joy.
author: Jenni C.

description: Sooo about this place.. Food is pretty darn good. As a Texan I was all kinds of surprised that they did not have queso on the menu of appetizers.. After a survey of my friends that are from here, I determined queso is a Texan thing..Any who. The food is good here I would not call it authentic, but tasty mexican, spanish fusion type food I guess. The white Sangria is um yes!!  One of my qualms about this place was the absence of Happy Hour!! What kind of spanish restaurant bar doesn't have happy hour?? And then most importantly, be wary if you are coming in a party of 6 or more, be advised that they charge you 23% on top of tax and your actual bill amount. Highway robbery. We each were charged an additional $7. That's some bullcorn...They write it real cutely in tiny little baby print at the bottom of their menus...Although I enjoyed my food and if I return it will not be with a big group!! That $7 is the cost of my BART ride there ugh....
author: Char I.

description: Table service was very good but we were seated 15' after reservation time and we'd arrived 15' early.  Food is also very good but each plate was barely a single h'ordeuvre per person at a table seating 4.  I.e. One 6" square plate came with 4 meatballs each sized a tad smaller than a golf ball.  Flank steak was delicious but came with 1 slice of French bread...why? Seriously, we split that little 4" x 1/2" wide slice into 4 pcs. Ceviche was a little more generous except for 1 small carrot that just begged for someone to eat it but but no one wanted to be the only one with the carrot and nobody wanted to try and cut a 3" carrot piece into 4 pcs.  The prawns on the kebab were not deveined..ick.  We spent $130.00 with no alcohol and left a little hungry.  The food is overall very good but the presentation for portions was chintzy and even worse, you can't have a conversation, It was like dining on an airplane runway.  Dining out for us is a social experience nit enjoyable when you have to scream at each other.
author: Yumm Y.

description: Came here last night to celebrate my birthday with a group of about 8. Came here on a reccomendation from a friend who had never been but heard good things. Got there around 9, no wait for a table really. Awesome view even though it was covered due to the cold (there's heat lamps too so it's nice and warm even in the middle of december). Awesome food. We tried the ceviche, skewers, elotes, empanadas, quesadilla and of course margaritas. Everything was delicious and everybody was impressed and really liked it. We had great, fast and friendly service. Not the cheapest place but I felt everything was worth it. Somebody else complained about the pitchers being watered down and too much ice, but ours were just right and a better deal than us all ordering individual drinks. I would definitely like to come back on a beautiful summer day to soak up some sun & I really liked the margarita with grapefruit. Can't wait to come back although it'll probably be a while since I'm from LA.
author: Christina C.

description: Yum and yum. This is my third time here and the food and drinks are consistently great. Defiantly get the ceviche and the quesadilla with pork. The servers are super nice as well. Don't worry about it being chilly they have heat lamps!
author: Whitney G.

description: a synergistic compilation of hipsters, bougilites and tourists. what can i say? im a sucker for rooftops. viva el techo!
author: Pvn V.

description: Great find! The chicharrones de carne are phenomenal! The drinks were great. Tried the one with chipotle and it was good, but very different. Very smokey flavor. Tortillas are delcious too. The view of the city is awesome. Definitely a popular spot among the hipsters...but if you can get past that, it reminds me a little bit of New York.
author: Shirin A.

description: Not bad for a quick night out on a rainy weeknight evening. The service was great and attentive. We ordered skewers and guacamole, which were all quite mediocre. The drink was also unimpressive...it appeared and tasted as if sweet & sour mix was used instead of the traditional lime and sugar common in caipirinhas. Overall, hubby liked the joint, but I really wasn't a fan.
author: Catherine C.

description: Love this spot.Beautiful view, tasty snacks, great margaritas.  Went with a group on my birthday and things got pretty roudy. Srvice was great.  We need more outdoor drinking spots in SF!
author: S. V.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the city. They have amazing drinks, amazing views, and good food! Great place for brunch also!
author: Eric K.

description: I love this place!  On a clear and balmy summer evening, the rooftop location can't be beat.  We ordered a tasty pitcher of sangria and noshed on chips with guacamole all while watching the most attractive collection of young San Franciscans I've seen assembled in a long while.   I also order the pork chicharrones which were more akin to what I would normally consider carnitas, but Tomayto Tomahto....THEY WERE AWESOME. I honestly cannot wait to go back to this place and try some of their other menu items. Very hip.  They do have plastic tenting and heaters for the cooler nights and, of course in SF that means 350 days out of the year.  It remains to be seen whether the allure persists when the moist chill and foggy gray skies return to our City by the Bay.
author: Jon R.

description: Love this spot! Came here for a late lunch. Gret view and vibe!
author: Ashley B.

description: this bar is great! the outdoor is heated with lamps and there is seating and standing area. the staff is really nice and helpful. we ordered the margaritas and they were delicious! different mixes of tequila with a mandarin mixer and lime juice. I will definitely be going back to eat - the food looked really delicious!
author: Ida Z.
